[You]401-you do [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ’s work , and [he]99-mr. crimsworth gives [you]401-you wages — shabby wages they are , too . ” [I]99-mr. crimsworth was silent . [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s language now bordered on the impertinent , still [his]109-hunsden manner did not offend [me]99-mr. crimsworth in the least — it only piqued [my]99-mr. crimsworth curiosity ; [I]99-mr. crimsworth wanted [him]109-hunsden to go on , which [he]109-hunsden did in a little while . “[99-mr. crimsworth] [This world]423-this world is an absurd one , ” said [he]109-hunsden . “[99-mr. crimsworth] Why so , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ? ” “[109-hunsden] [I]0-i wonder [you]109-hunsden should ask : [you]109-hunsden are [yourself]109-hunsden a strong proof of the absurdity [I]0-i allude to . ” [I]109-hunsden was determined [he]109-hunsden should explain [himself]109-hunsden of [his]109-hunsden own accord , without [my]109-hunsden pressing [him]109-hunsden so to do — so [I]109-hunsden resumed [my]109-hunsden silence . “[109-hunsden] Is it [your]109-hunsden intention to become [a tradesman]302-a tradesman ? ” [he]109-hunsden inquired presently . “[109-hunsden] It was [my]0-i serious intention three months ago . ” “[0-i] Humph ! the more fool [you]109-hunsden — [you]109-hunsden look like [a tradesman]302-a tradesman ! What a practical business - like face [you]109-hunsden have ! ” “[0-i] [My]0-i face is as [the Lord]426-the lord made it , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden . ” “[426-the lord] [The Lord]426-the lord never made either [your]109-hunsden face or head for X — — What good can [your]109-hunsden bumps of ideality , comparison , self - esteem , conscientiousness , do [you]109-hunsden here ? But if [you]109-hunsden like [Bigben Close]5-bigben close , stay there ; it ’s [your]109-hunsden own affair , not [mine]0-i . ” “[0-i] Perhaps [I]0-i have no choice . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i care nought about it — it will make little difference to [me]0-i what [you]109-hunsden do or where [you]109-hunsden go ; but [I]0-i ’m cool now — [I]0-i want to dance again ; and [I]0-i see such [a fine girl]428-a fine girl sitting in the corner of the sofa there by [[her]428-a fine girl mamma]429-her mamma ; see if [I]0-i do n’t get [her]428-a fine girl for [a partner in a jiffy]430-a partner in a jiffy ! There ’s [Waddy]111-waddy — [Sam Waddy]111-waddy making up to [her]428-a fine girl ; wo n’t [I]0-i cut [him]431-him out ? ” And [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden strode away . [I]0-i watched [him]109-hunsden through the open folding - doors ; [he]109-hunsden outstripped [Waddy]111-waddy , applied for the hand of [the fine girl]2039-the fine girl , and led [her]2039-the fine girl off triumphant . [She]2039-the fine girl was [a tall , well - made , full - formed , dashingly - dressed young woman , much in the style of [Mrs. E. Crimsworth]112-mrs. e. crimsworth]2040-a tall , well - made , full - formed , dashingly - dressed young woman , much in the style of mrs. e. crimsworth ; [Hunsden]109-hunsden whirled [her]2039-the fine girl through the waltz with spirit ; [he]109-hunsden kept at [her]2039-the fine girl side during the remainder of the evening , and [I]0-i read in [her]2039-the fine girl animated and gratified countenance that [he]109-hunsden succeeded in making [himself]109-hunsden perfectly agreeable . [The mamma]2041-the mamma too ( [a stout person in a turban]2042-a stout person in a turban — [Mrs. Lupton]113-mrs. lupton by name ) looked well pleased ; prophetic visions probably flattered [her]2041-the mamma inward eye . [The Hunsdens]114-the hunsdens were of an old stem ; and scornful as [Yorke]115-yorke ( such was [[my]0-i late interlocutor]2043-my late interlocutor ’s name ) professed to be of the advantages of birth , in [his]115-yorke secret heart [he]115-yorke well knew and fully appreciated the distinction [his]115-yorke ancient , if not high lineage conferred on [him]115-yorke in a mushroom - place like X — — , concerning whose inhabitants it was proverbially said , that [not one in a thousand]2044-not one in a thousand knew [[his]115-yorke own grandfather]2045-his own grandfather . Moreover [the Hunsdens]114-the hunsdens , once rich , were still independent ; and report affirmed that [Yorke]115-yorke bade fair , by [his]115-yorke success in business , to restore to pristine prosperity the partially decayed fortunes of [[his]115-yorke house]2046-his house . These circumstances considered , [Mrs. Lupton]113-mrs. lupton ’s broad face might well wear a smile of complacency as [she]113-mrs. lupton contemplated [the heir of [Hunsden Wood]82-hunsden wood occupied in paying assiduous court to [[her]113-mrs. lupton darling]2048-her darling [Sarah Martha]95-sarah]2047-the heir of hunsden wood occupied in paying assiduous court to her darling sarah martha . [I]0-i , however , whose observations being less anxious , were likely to be more accurate , soon saw that the grounds for maternal self - congratulation were slight indeed ; [the gentleman]360-the gentleman appeared to [me]0-i much more desirous of making , than susceptible of receiving an impression . [I]0-i know not what it was in [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden that , as [I]0-i watched [him]109-hunsden ( [I]0-i had nothing better to do ) , suggested to [me]0-i , every now and then , the idea of [a foreigner]2050-a foreigner . In form and features [he]109-hunsden might be pronounced English , though even there one caught a dash of something Gallic ; but [he]109-hunsden had no English shyness : [he]109-hunsden had learnt somewhere , somehow , the art of setting [himself]109-hunsden quite at [his]109-hunsden ease , and of allowing no insular timidity to intervene as a barrier between [him]109-hunsden and [his]109-hunsden convenience or pleasure . Refinement [he]109-hunsden did not affect , yet vulgar [he]109-hunsden could not be called ; [he]109-hunsden was not odd — [no quiz]2051-no quiz — yet [he]109-hunsden resembled [no one else]2052-no one else [I]0-i had ever seen before ; [his]109-hunsden general bearing intimated complete , sovereign satisfaction with [himself]109-hunsden ; yet , at times , an indescribable shade passed like an eclipse over [his]109-hunsden countenance , and seemed to [me]0-i like the sign of a sudden and strong inward doubt of [himself]109-hunsden , [his]109-hunsden words and actions an energetic discontent at [his]109-hunsden life or [his]109-hunsden social position , [his]109-hunsden future prospects or [his]109-hunsden mental attainments — [I]0-i know not which ; perhaps after all it might only be a bilious caprice . [No man]1919-no man likes to acknowledge that [he]1919-no man has made a mistake in the choice of [his]1919-no man profession , and [every man , worthy of the name]2054-every man , worthy of the name , will row long against wind and tide before [he]1919-no man allows [himself]1919-no man to cry out , “[0-i] [I]0-i am baffled ! ” and submits to be floated passively back to [land]2055-land . From the first week of [my]0-i residence in [X]7-x — — [I]0-i felt [my]0-i occupation irksome . The thing itself — the work of copying and translating business - letters — was a dry and tedious task enough , but had that been all , [I]0-i should long have borne with the nuisance ; [I]0-i am not of an impatient nature , and influenced by the double desire of getting [my]0-i living and justifying to [myself]0-i and [others]2056-others the resolution [I]0-i had taken to become [a tradesman]302-a tradesman , [I]0-i should have endured in silence the rust and cramp of [my]0-i best faculties ; [I]0-i should not have whispered , even inwardly , that [I]0-i longed for liberty ; [I]0-i should have pent in every sigh by which [my]0-i heart might have ventured to intimate its distress under the closeness , smoke , monotony and joyless tumult of Bigben Close , and its panting desire for freer and fresher scenes ; [I]0-i should have set up the image of Duty , the fetish of Perseverance , in [[my]0-i small bedroom]2058-my small bedroom at [[Mrs. King]117-mrs. king ’s lodgings]2059-mrs. king ’s lodgings , and they two should have been [[my]0-i household gods , from which [[my]0-i darling]2061-my darling , [my]0-i cherished - in - secret , Imagination]2060-my household gods , from which my darling , my cherished - in - secret , imagination , the tender and the mighty , should never , either by softness or strength , have severed [me]0-i . But this was not all ; the antipathy which had sprung up between [myself]0-i and [[my]0-i employer]2062-my employer striking deeper root and spreading denser shade daily , excluded [me]0-i from every glimpse of the sunshine of life ; and [I]0-i began to feel like a plant growing in humid darkness out of the slimy walls of [a well]2063-a well . Antipathy is the only word which can express the feeling [Edward Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth had for [me]0-i — a feeling , in a great measure , involuntary , and which was liable to be excited by every , the most trifling movement , look , or word of [mine]0-i . [My]0-i southern accent annoyed [him]99-mr. crimsworth ; the degree of education evinced in [my]0-i language irritated [him]99-mr. crimsworth ; [my]0-i punctuality , industry , and accuracy , fixed [his]99-mr. crimsworth dislike , and gave it the high flavour and poignant relish of envy ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth feared that [I]0-i too should one day make [a successful tradesman]2064-a successful tradesman . Had [I]0-i been in anything inferior to [him]99-mr. crimsworth , [he]99-mr. crimsworth would not have hated [me]0-i so thoroughly , but [I]0-i knew all that [he]99-mr. crimsworth knew , and , what was worse , [he]99-mr. crimsworth suspected that [I]0-i kept the padlock of silence on mental wealth in which [he]99-mr. crimsworth was [no sharer]2065-no sharer . If [he]99-mr. crimsworth could have once placed [me]0-i in a ridiculous or mortifying position , [he]99-mr. crimsworth would have forgiven [me]0-i much , but [I]0-i was guarded by three faculties — Caution , Tact , Observation ; and prowling and prying as was [Edward]99-mr. crimsworth ’s malignity , it could never baffle the lynx - eyes of these , [[my]0-i natural sentinels]2066-my natural sentinels . Day by day did [his]99-mr. crimsworth malice watch [my]0-i tact , hoping [it]99-mr. crimsworth would sleep , and prepared to steal snake - like on its slumber ; but tact , if it be genuine , never sleeps . [I]0-i had received [my]0-i first quarter ’s wages , and was returning to [[my]0-i lodgings]2067-my lodgings , possessed heart and soul with the pleasant feeling that [the master who had paid [me]0-i grudged every penny of that hard - earned pittance—(I]2068-the master who had paid me grudged every penny of that hard - earned pittance—(i had long ceased to regard [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth as [[my]0-i brother]1895-my brother — [he]99-mr. crimsworth was [a hard , grinding master]2070-a hard , grinding master ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth wished to be [an inexorable tyrant]2071-an inexorable tyrant : that was all ) . Thoughts , not varied but strong , occupied [my]0-i mind ; two voices spoke within [me]0-i ; again and again [they]2072-they uttered the same monotonous phrases . [One]1983-one said : “[0-i] [William]101-william , [your]101-william life is intolerable . ” [The other]2074-the other : “[101-william] What can [you]101-william do to alter it ? ” [I]101-william walked fast , for it was a cold , frosty night in January ; as [I]101-william approached [[my]101-william lodgings]2067-my lodgings , [I]101-william turned from a general view of [my]101-william affairs to the particular speculation as to whether [my]101-william fire would be out ; looking towards the window of [[my]101-william sitting - room]2076-my sitting - room , [I]101-william saw no cheering red gleam . “[101-william] [That slut of [a servant]367-a servant]432-that slut of a servant has neglected it as usual , ” said [I]367-a servant , “[367-a servant] and [I]0-i shall see nothing but pale ashes if [I]0-i go in ; it is a fine starlight night — [I]0-i will walk a little farther . ” It was a fine night , and [the streets]2077-the streets were dry and even clean for [X]7-x — — ; there was a crescent curve of moonlight to be seen by [the parish church tower]2078-the parish church tower , and hundreds of stars shone keenly bright in all quarters of the sky . Unconsciously [I]0-i steered [my]0-i course towards [the country]334-the country ; [I]0-i had got into [Grove - street]2080-grove - street , and began to feel the pleasure of seeing dim trees at the extremity , round [a suburban house]2081-a suburban house , when a person leaning over the iron gate of [one of [the small gardens which front the neat dwelling - houses in [this street]2084-this street]2083-the small gardens which front the neat dwelling - houses in this street]2082-one of the small gardens which front the neat dwelling - houses in this street , addressed [me]0-i as [I]0-i was hurrying with quick stride past . “[0-i] What [the deuce]434-the deuce is the hurry ? Just so must [Lot]118-lot have left [Sodom]9-sodom , when [he]118-lot expected fire to pour down upon it , out of burning brass clouds . ” [I]435-you stopped short , and looked towards [the speaker]2085-the speaker . [I]435-you smelt the fragrance , and saw the red spark of a cigar ; the dusk outline of [a man]353-a man , too , bent towards [me]435-you over the wicket . “[435-you] [You]435-you see [I]0-i am meditating in [the field]436-the field at eventide , ” continued [this shade]2087-this shade . “[0-i] [God]119-god knows it ’s cool work ! especially as instead of [Rebecca]120-rebecca on a camel ’s hump , with bracelets on [her]120-rebecca arms and a ring in [her]120-rebecca nose , [Fate]121-fate sends [me]0-i only [a counting - house clerk]437-a counting - house clerk , in a grey tweed wrapper . ” The voice was familiar to [me]121-fate — its second utterance enabled [me]121-fate to seize [the speaker]2085-the speaker ’s identity . “[121-fate] [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ! good evening . ” “[109-hunsden] Good evening , indeed ! yes , but [you]435-you would have passed [me]0-i without recognition if [I]0-i had not been so civil as to speak first . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did not know [you]435-you . ” “[435-you] A famous excuse ! [You]435-you ought to have known [me]0-i ; [I]0-i knew [you]435-you , though [you]435-you were going ahead like a steam - engine . Are [the police]438-the police after [you]435-you ? ” “[438-the police] It would n’t be worth [their]438-the police while ; [I]0-i ’m not of consequence enough to attract [them]438-the police . ” “[0-i] Alas , [poor shepherd]439-poor shepherd ! [Alack]122-alack and well - a - day ! What a theme for regret , and how down in the mouth [you]435-you must be , judging from the sound of [your]435-you voice ! But since [you]435-you ’re not running from [the police]438-the police , from whom are [you]435-you running ? [the devil]441-the devil ? ” “[441-the devil] On the contrary , [I]0-i am going post to [him]441-the devil . ” “[0-i] That is well — [you’re]435-you just in luck : this is Tuesday evening ; there are scores of market gigs and [carts]442-carts returning to [Dinneford]10-dinneford to - night ; and [he]441-the devil , or [some of [his]441-the devil]443-some of his , have a seat in all regularly ; so , if [you]435-you ’ll step in and sit half - an - hour in [[[my]0-i bachelor]444-my bachelor ’s parlour]445-my bachelor ’s parlour , [you]435-you may catch [him]441-the devil as [he]441-the devil passes without much trouble . [I]0-i think though [you]435-you ’d better let [him]441-the devil alone to - night , [he]441-the devil ’ll have so many [customers to serve]446-customers to serve ; Tuesday is [his]441-the devil busy day in [X]7-x — — and [Dinneford]10-dinneford ; come in at all events . ” [He]441-the devil swung the wicket open as [he]441-the devil spoke . “[441-the devil] Do [you]441-the devil really wish [me]0-i to go in ? ” [I]441-the devil asked . “[441-the devil] As [you]441-the devil please — [I’m]0-i alone ; [your]441-the devil company for an hour or two would be agreeable to [me]0-i ; but , if [you]441-the devil do n’t choose to favour [me]0-i so far , [I]0-i ’ll not press the point . [I]0-i hate to bore [any one]447-any one . ” It suited [me]0-i to accept the invitation as it suited [Hunsden]109-hunsden to give it . [I]0-i passed through the gate , and followed [him]441-the devil to the front door , which [he]441-the devil opened ; thence [we]2089-we traversed [a passage]2090-a passage , and entered [[his]441-the devil parlour]2091-his parlour ; the door being shut , [he]441-the devil pointed [me]0-i to an arm - chair by the hearth ; [I]0-i sat down , and glanced round [me]0-i . It was [a comfortable room]2092-a comfortable room , at once snug and handsome ; [the bright grate]2093-the bright grate was filled with a genuine — — shire fire , red , clear , and generous , no penurious South - of - [England]11-england embers heaped in the corner of a grate . On the table a shaded lamp diffused around a soft , pleasant , and equal light ; the furniture was almost luxurious for [a young bachelor]2094-a young bachelor , comprising a couch and two very easy chairs ; bookshelves filled the recesses on each side of the mantelpiece ; they were well - furnished , and arranged with perfect order . The neatness of [the room]1922-the room suited [my]0-i taste ; [I]0-i hate irregular and slovenly habits . From what [I]0-i saw [I]0-i concluded that [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s ideas on that point corresponded with [my]0-i own . While [he]441-the devil removed from the centre - table to the side - board a few pamphlets and periodicals , [I]0-i ran [my]0-i eye along the shelves of the book - case nearest [me]0-i . French and German works predominated , [the old French dramatists]2096-the old french dramatists , [sundry modern authors]2097-sundry modern authors , [Thiers]123-thiers , [Villemain]12-villemain , [Paul de Kock]124-paul de kock , [George Sand]125-george sand , [Eugene Sue]126-eugene sue ; in German — [Goethe]127-goethe , [Schiller]128-schiller , Zschokke , [Jean Paul Richter]129-jean paul richter ; in English there were works on Political Economy . [I]0-i examined no further , for [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden [himself]109-hunsden recalled [my]0-i attention . “[0-i] [You]448-you shall have something , ” said [he]109-hunsden , “[448-you] for [you]448-you ought to feel disposed for refreshment after walking [nobody]449-nobody knows how far on such a Canadian night as this ; but it shall not be brandy - and - water , and it shall not be a bottle of port , nor ditto of sherry . [I]0-i keep no such poison . [I]0-i have Rhein - wein for [my]0-i own drinking , and [you]448-you may choose between that and coffee . ” Here again [Hunsden]109-hunsden suited [me]109-hunsden : if there was one generally received practice [I]109-hunsden abhorred more than another , it was the habitual imbibing of spirits and strong wines . [I]109-hunsden had , however , no fancy for [his]109-hunsden acid German nectar , but [I]109-hunsden liked coffee , so [I]109-hunsden responded — “[109-hunsden] Give [me]0-i some coffee , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden . ” [I]109-hunsden perceived [my]109-hunsden answer pleased [him]109-hunsden ; [he]109-hunsden had doubtless expected to see a chilling effect produced by [his]109-hunsden steady announcement that [he]109-hunsden would give [me]109-hunsden neither wine nor spirits ; [he]109-hunsden just shot one searching glance at [my]109-hunsden face to ascertain whether [my]109-hunsden cordiality was genuine or a mere feint of politeness . [I]109-hunsden smiled , because [I]109-hunsden quite understood [him]109-hunsden ; and , while [I]109-hunsden honoured [his]109-hunsden conscientious firmness , [I]109-hunsden was amused at [his]109-hunsden mistrust ; [he]109-hunsden seemed satisfied , rang the bell , and ordered coffee , which was presently brought ; for [himself]109-hunsden , a bunch of grapes and half a pint of something sour sufficed . [My]109-hunsden coffee was excellent ; [I]109-hunsden told [him]109-hunsden so , and expressed the shuddering pity with which [his]109-hunsden anchorite fare inspired [me]109-hunsden . [He]109-hunsden did not answer , and [I]109-hunsden scarcely think heard [my]109-hunsden remark . At that moment one of those momentary eclipses [I]109-hunsden before alluded to had come over [his]109-hunsden face , extinguishing [his]109-hunsden smile , and replacing , by an abstracted and alienated look , the customarily shrewd , bantering glance of [his]109-hunsden eye . [I]109-hunsden employed the interval of silence in a rapid scrutiny of [his]109-hunsden physiognomy . [I]109-hunsden had never observed [him]109-hunsden closely before ; and , as [my]109-hunsden sight is very short , [I]109-hunsden had gathered only a vague , general idea of [his]109-hunsden appearance ; [I]109-hunsden was surprised now , on examination , to perceive how small , and even feminine , were [his]109-hunsden lineaments ; [his]109-hunsden tall figure , long and dark locks , [his]109-hunsden voice and general bearing , had impressed [me]109-hunsden with the notion of something powerful and massive ; not at all:—my own features were cast in a harsher and squarer mould than [his]109-hunsden . [I]109-hunsden discerned that there would be contrasts between [his]109-hunsden inward and outward man ; contentions , too ; for [I]109-hunsden suspected [his]109-hunsden soul had more of will and ambition than [his]109-hunsden body had of fibre and muscle . Perhaps , in these incompatibilities of the “[109-hunsden] physique ” with the “[109-hunsden] morale , ” lay the secret of that fitful gloom ; [he]109-hunsden would but could not , and the athletic mind scowled scorn on its more fragile companion . As to [his]109-hunsden good looks , [I]101-william should have liked to have [a woman]2098-a woman ’s opinion on that subject ; it seemed to [me]101-william that [his]109-hunsden face might produce the same effect on [a lady that a very piquant and interesting , though scarcely pretty , female face]2099-a lady that a very piquant and interesting , though scarcely pretty , female face would on [a man]353-a man . [I]101-william have mentioned [his]109-hunsden dark locks — they were brushed sideways above a white and sufficiently expansive forehead ; [his]109-hunsden cheek had a rather hectic freshness ; [his]109-hunsden features might have done well on canvas , but indifferently in marble : they were plastic ; [character]2101-character had set a stamp upon each ; expression re - cast them at [her]2098-a woman pleasure , and strange metamorphoses [she]2098-a woman wrought , giving [him]109-hunsden now the mien of a morose bull , and anon that of [an arch and mischievous girl]2102-an arch and mischievous girl ; more frequently , the two semblances were blent , and a queer , composite countenance [they]2103-they made . Starting from [his]109-hunsden silent fit , [he]109-hunsden began : — “[101-william] [William]101-william ! what [a fool]304-a fool [you]101-william are to live in [those dismal lodgings of [Mrs. King]117-mrs. king ’s]451-those dismal lodgings of mrs. king ’s , when [you]101-william might take rooms here in [Grove Street]13-grove street , and have [a garden like [me]0-i]452-a garden like me ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should be too far from [the mill]1973-the mill . ” “[0-i] What of that ? It would do [you]101-william good to walk there and back two or three times a day ; besides , are [you]101-william such a fossil that [you]101-william never wish to see a flower or a green leaf ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am no fossil . ” “[0-i] What are [you]101-william then ? [You]101-william sit at that desk in [[Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ’s counting - house]454-crimsworth ’s counting - house day by day and week by week , scraping with a pen on paper , just like [an automaton]455-an automaton ; [you]101-william never get up ; [you]101-william never say [you]101-william are tired ; [you]101-william never ask for a holiday ; [you]101-william never take change or relaxation ; [you]101-william give way to no excess of an evening ; [you]101-william neither keep wild company , nor indulge in strong drink . ” “[101-william] Do [you]101-william , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ? ” “[101-william] Do n’t think to pose [me]0-i with short questions ; [your]101-william case and [mine]0-i are diametrically different , and it is nonsense attempting to draw a parallel . [I]0-i say , that when [a man]353-a man endures patiently what ought to be unendurable , [he]353-a man is a fossil . ” “[353-a man] Whence do [you]101-william acquire the knowledge of [my]0-i patience ? ” “[101-william] Why , [man]457-man , do [you]101-william suppose [you]101-william are a mystery ? The other night [you]101-william seemed surprised at [my]0-i knowing to what family [you]101-william belonged ; now [you]101-william find subject for wonderment in [my]0-i calling [you]101-william patient . What do [you]101-william think [I]0-i do with [my]0-i eyes and ears ? [I]0-i ’ve been in [[your]101-william counting - house]458-your counting - house more than once when [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth has treated [you]101-william like a dog ; called for a book , for instance , and when [you]101-william gave [him]99-mr. crimsworth the wrong one , or what [he]99-mr. crimsworth chose to consider the wrong one , flung it back almost in [your]101-william face ; desired [you]101-william to shut or open the door as if [you]101-william had been [[his]99-mr. crimsworth flunkey]459-his flunkey ; to say nothing of [your]101-william position at the party about a month ago , where [you]101-william had neither place nor [partner]460-partner , but hovered about like [a poor , shabby hanger - on]461-a poor , shabby hanger - on ; and how patient [you]101-william were under each and all of these circumstances ! ” “[109-hunsden] Well , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , what then ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can hardly tell [you]101-william what then ; the conclusion to be drawn as to [your]101-william character depends upon the nature of the motives which guide [your]101-william conduct ; if [you]101-william are patient because [you]101-william expect to make something eventually out of [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth , notwithstanding [his]99-mr. crimsworth tyranny , or perhaps by means of it , [you]101-william are what [the world]1872-the world calls [an interested and mercenary]463-an interested and mercenary , but may be [a very wise fellow]464-a very wise fellow ; if [you]101-william are patient because [you]101-william think it a duty to meet insult with submission , [you]101-william are [an essential sap]465-an essential sap , and in no shape [the man for [my]0-i money]466-the man for my money ; if [you]101-william are patient because [your]101-william nature is phlegmatic , flat , inexcitable , and that [you]101-william can not get up to the pitch of resistance , why , [God]119-god made [you]101-william to be crushed ; and lie down by all means , and lie flat , and let [Juggernaut]130-juggernaut ride well over [you]101-william . ” [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s eloquence was not , it will be perceived , of the smooth and oily order . As [he]109-hunsden spoke , [he]109-hunsden pleased [me]130-juggernaut ill . [I]130-juggernaut seem to recognize in [him]109-hunsden one of [those characters who , sensitive enough [themselves]2104-those characters who , sensitive enough themselves , are selfishly relentless towards the sensitiveness of others , are selfishly relentless towards the sensitiveness of [others]2056-others]2104-those characters who , sensitive enough themselves , are selfishly relentless towards the sensitiveness of others . Moreover , though [he]109-hunsden was neither like [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth nor [Lord Tynedale]92-lord tynedale , yet [he]109-hunsden was acrid , and , [I]130-juggernaut suspected , overbearing in [his]109-hunsden way : there was a tone of despotism in the urgency of the very reproaches by which [he]109-hunsden aimed at goading [the oppressed]2106-the oppressed into rebellion against [the oppressor]2107-the oppressor . Looking at [him]109-hunsden still more fixedly than [I]130-juggernaut had yet done , [I]130-juggernaut saw written in [his]109-hunsden eye and mien a resolution to arrogate to [himself]109-hunsden a freedom so unlimited that it might often trench on the just liberty of [[his]109-hunsden neighbours]2108-his neighbours . [I]130-juggernaut rapidly ran over these thoughts , and then [I]130-juggernaut laughed a low and involuntary laugh , moved thereto by a slight inward revelation of the inconsistency of [man]457-man . It was as [I]130-juggernaut thought : [Hunsden]109-hunsden had expected [me]130-juggernaut to take with calm [his]109-hunsden incorrect and offensive surmises , [his]109-hunsden bitter and haughty taunts ; and [himself]109-hunsden was chafed by a laugh , scarce louder than a whisper . [His]109-hunsden brow darkened , [his]109-hunsden thin nostril dilated a little . “[130-juggernaut] Yes , ” [he]109-hunsden began , “[130-juggernaut] [I]0-i told [you]467-i that [you]467-i were [an aristocrat]468-an aristocrat , and who but [an aristocrat]468-an aristocrat would laugh such a laugh as that , and look such a look ? A laugh frigidly jeering ; a look lazily mutinous ; gentlemanlike irony , patrician resentment . What [a nobleman]470-a nobleman [you]467-i would have made , [William Crimsworth]103-william ! [You]467-i are cut out for one ; pity [Fortune]131-fortune has baulked Nature ! Look at the features , figure , even to the hands — distinction all over — ugly distinction ! Now , if [you]467-i ’d only [an estate]471-an estate and [a mansion]472-a mansion , and [a park]473-a park , and a title , how [you]467-i could play the exclusive , maintain the rights of [[your]467-i class]474-your class , train [[your]467-i tenantry]475-your tenantry in habits of respect to the peerage , oppose at every step the advancing power of [the people]476-the people , support [your]467-i rotten order , and be ready for its sake to wade knee - deep in churls ’ blood ; as it is , [you]467-i ’ve no power ; [you]467-i can do nothing ; [you]467-i ’re wrecked and stranded on [the shores of commerce]477-the shores of commerce ; forced into collision with [practical men]478-practical men , with whom [you]467-i can not cope , for [you]467-i ’ll never be [a tradesman]302-a tradesman . ” The first part of [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s speech moved [me]467-i not at all , or , if it did , it was only to wonder at the perversion into which prejudice had twisted [his]109-hunsden judgment of [my]467-i character ; the concluding sentence , however , not only moved , but shook [me]467-i ; the blow it gave was a severe one , because [Truth]132-truth wielded the weapon . If [I]467-i smiled now , it , was only in disdain of [myself]467-i . [Hunsden]109-hunsden saw [his]109-hunsden advantage ; [he]109-hunsden followed it up . “[467-i] [You]467-i ’ll make nothing by trade , ” continued [he]109-hunsden ; “[467-i] nothing more than the crust of dry bread and the draught of fair water on which [you]467-i now live ; [your]467-i only chance of getting a competency lies in marrying [a rich widow]480-a rich widow , or running away with [an heiress]481-an heiress . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i leave such shifts to be put in practice by [those who devise them]482-those who devise them , ” said [I]482-those who devise them , rising . “[482-those who devise them] And even that is hopeless , ” [he]109-hunsden went on coolly . “[483-what widow] [What widow]483-what widow would have [you]467-i ? Much less , [what heiress]484-what heiress ? [You]467-i ’re not bold and venturesome enough for [the one]485-the one , nor handsome and fascinating enough for the other . [You]467-i think perhaps [you]467-i look intelligent and polished ; carry [your]467-i intellect and refinement to market , and tell [me]0-i in a private note what price is bid for [them]486-them . ” [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden had taken [his]109-hunsden tone for the night ; the string [he]109-hunsden struck was out of tune , [he]109-hunsden would finger [no other]2110-no other . Averse to discord , of which [I]467-i had enough every day and all day long , [I]467-i concluded , at last , that silence and solitude were preferable to jarring converse ; [I]467-i bade [him]467-i good - night . “[467-i] What ! Are [you]467-i going , [lad]487-lad ? Well , good - night : [you]467-i ’ll find the door . ” And [he]467-i sat still in front of the fire , while [I]467-i left [the room]1922-the room and [the house]1897-the house . [I]467-i had got a good way on [my]467-i return to [[my]467-i lodgings]2067-my lodgings before [I]467-i found out that [I]467-i was walking very fast , and breathing very hard , and that [my]467-i nails were almost stuck into the palms of [my]467-i clenched hands , and that [my]467-i teeth were set fast ; on making this discovery , [I]467-i relaxed both [my]467-i pace , fists , and jaws , but [I]467-i could not so soon cause the regrets rushing rapidly through [my]467-i mind to slacken their tide . Why did [I]467-i make [myself]467-i [a tradesman]302-a tradesman ? Why did [I]467-i enter [[Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s house]2115-hunsden ’s house this evening ? Why , at dawn to - morrow , must [I]467-i repair to [[Crimsworth]103-william ’s mill]2116-crimsworth ’s mill ? All that night did [I]467-i ask [myself]467-i these questions , and all that night fiercely demanded of [my]467-i soul an answer . [I]467-i got no sleep ; [my]467-i head burned , [my]467-i feet froze ; at last the factory bells rang , and [I]467-i sprang from [my]467-i bed with [other slaves]2117-other slaves . THERE is a climax to everything , to every state of feeling as well as to every position in life . [I]467-i turned this truism over in [my]467-i mind as , in the frosty dawn of a January morning , [I]467-i hurried down [the steep and now icy street]2118-the steep and now icy street which descended from [Mrs. King ’s]117-mrs. king to [the Close]1914-the close . [The factory workpeople]2120-the factory workpeople had preceded [me]467-i by nearly an hour , and [the mill]1973-the mill was all lighted up and in full operation when [I]467-i reached [it]1973-the mill . [I]467-i repaired to [[my]467-i post]2122-my post in [the counting - house]1913-the counting - house as usual ; the fire there , but just lit , as yet only smoked ; [Steighton]105-steighton had not yet arrived . [I]467-i shut the door and sat down at the desk ; [my]467-i hands , recently washed in half - frozen water , were still numb ; [I]467-i could not write till they had regained vitality , so [I]467-i went on thinking , and still the theme of [my]467-i thoughts was the “[467-i] climax . ” Self - dissatisfaction troubled exceedingly the current of [my]467-i meditations . “[467-i] Come , [William Crimsworth]103-william , ” said [my]103-william conscience , or whatever it is that within [ourselves]2124-ourselves takes [ourselves]2124-ourselves to task—“come[103-william] , get a clear notion of what [you]488-you would have , or what [you]488-you would not have . [You]488-you talk of a climax ; pray has [your]488-you endurance reached its climax ? It is not four months old . What a fine resolute fellow [you]488-you imagined [yourself]488-you to be when [you]488-you told [Tynedale]92-lord tynedale [you]488-you would tread in [[your]488-you father]489-your father ’s steps , and a pretty treading [you]488-you are likely to make of it ! How well [you]488-you like X — — ! Just at this moment how redolent of pleasant associations are [[its]490-its streets]491-its streets , [its shops]492-its shops , [its warehouses]493-its warehouses , [[its]490-its factories]494-its factories ! How the prospect of this day cheers [you]488-you ! Letter - copying till noon , solitary dinner at [[your]488-you lodgings]495-your lodgings , letter - copying till evening , solitude ; for [you]488-you neither find pleasure in [Brown]133-mr. brown ’s , nor [Smith]134-smith ’s , nor [Nicholl]135-nicholl ’s , nor [Eccle]136-eccle ’s company ; and as to [Hunsden]109-hunsden , [you]488-you fancied there was pleasure to be derived from [his]109-hunsden society — [he]109-hunsden ! [he]109-hunsden ! how did [you]488-you like the taste [you]488-you had of [him]109-hunsden last night ? was it sweet ? Yet [he]109-hunsden is a talented , [an original - minded man]496-an original - minded man , and even [he]109-hunsden does not like [you]488-you ; [your]488-you self - respect defies [you]488-you to like [him]109-hunsden ; [he]109-hunsden has always seen [you]488-you to disadvantage ; [he]109-hunsden always will see [you]488-you to disadvantage ; [your]488-you positions are unequal , and were they on the same level [your]488-you minds could not assimilate ; never hope , then , to gather the honey of friendship out of that thorn - guarded plant . Hello , [Crimsworth]103-william ! where are [your]488-you thoughts tending ? [You]488-you leave the recollection of [Hunsden]109-hunsden as a bee would [a rock]497-a rock , as a bird [a desert]498-a desert ; and [your]488-you aspirations spread eager wings towards [a land of visions]499-a land of visions where , now in advancing daylight — in X — — daylight — [you]488-you dare to dream of congeniality , repose , union . Those three [you]488-you will never meet in [this world]423-this world ; [they]501-they are [angels]502-angels . The souls of [just men made perfect]503-just men made perfect may encounter [them]501-they in [heaven]504-heaven , but [your]488-you soul will never be made perfect . Eight o’clock strikes ! [your]488-you hands are thawed , get to work ! ” “[488-you] Work ? why should [I]0-i work ? ” said [I]0-i sullenly : “[0-i] [I]0-i can not please though [I]0-i toil like [a slave]1957-a slave . ” “[0-i] Work , work ! ” reiterated the inward voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i may work , it will do no good , ” [I]0-i growled ; but nevertheless [I]0-i drew out a packet of letters and commenced [my]0-i task — task thankless and bitter as that of [the Israelite crawling over [the sun - baked fields of [Egypt]15-egypt]2126-the sun - baked fields of egypt]2125-the israelite crawling over the sun - baked fields of egypt in search of straw and stubble wherewith to accomplish [his]2125-the israelite crawling over the sun - baked fields of egypt tale of bricks . About ten o’clock [I]0-i heard [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ’s gig turn into [the yard]2127-the yard , and in a minute or two [he]99-mr. crimsworth entered [the counting - house]1913-the counting - house . It was [his]99-mr. crimsworth custom to glance [his]99-mr. crimsworth eye at [Steighton]105-steighton and [myself]0-i , to hang up [his]99-mr. crimsworth mackintosh , stand a minute with [his]99-mr. crimsworth back to the fire , and then walk out . Today [he]99-mr. crimsworth did not deviate from [his]99-mr. crimsworth usual habits ; the only difference was that when [he]99-mr. crimsworth looked at [me]0-i , [his]99-mr. crimsworth brow , instead of being merely hard , was surly ; [his]99-mr. crimsworth eye , instead of being cold , was fierce . [He]99-mr. crimsworth studied [me]0-i a minute or two longer than usual , but went out in silence . Twelve o’clock arrived ; the bell rang for a suspension of labour ; [the workpeople]2129-the workpeople went off to [[their]2129-the workpeople dinners]2130-their dinners ; [Steighton]105-steighton , too , departed , desiring [me]0-i to lock [the counting - house]1913-the counting - house door , and take the key with [me]0-i . [I]0-i was tying up a bundle of papers , and putting them in [their]2129-the workpeople place , preparatory to closing [my]0-i desk , when [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth reappeared at the door , and entering closed it behind [him]99-mr. crimsworth . “[0-i] [You]506-you ’ll stay [here]398-here a minute , ” said [he]99-mr. crimsworth , in a deep , brutal voice , while [his]99-mr. crimsworth nostrils distended and [his]99-mr. crimsworth eye shot a spark of sinister fire . Alone with [Edward]99-mr. crimsworth [I]506-you remembered [our]2132-our relationship , and remembering that forgot the difference of position ; [I]506-you put away deference and careful forms of speech ; [I]506-you answered with simple brevity . “[506-you] It is time to go [home]1905-home , ” [I]506-you said , turning the key in [my]506-you desk . “[506-you] [You]506-you ’ll stay here ! ” [he]99-mr. crimsworth reiterated . “[506-you] And take [your]506-you hand off that key ! leave it in the lock ! ” “[506-you] Why ? ” asked [I.]506-you “[506-you] What cause is there for changing [my]0-i usual plans ? ” “[0-i] Do as [I]0-i order , ” was the answer , “[0-i] and no questions ! [You]506-you are [[my]0-i servant]509-my servant , obey [me]0-i ! What have [you]506-you been about — ? ” [He]99-mr. crimsworth was going on in the same breath , when an abrupt pause announced that rage had for the moment got the better of articulation . “[506-you] [You]506-you may look , if [you]506-you wish to know , ” [I]506-you replied . “[506-you] There is the open desk , there are the papers . ” “[506-you] Confound [your]506-you insolence ! What have [you]506-you been about ? ” “[506-you] [Your]506-you work , and have done it well . ” “[506-you] [Hypocrite and twaddler]510-hypocrite and twaddler ! [Smooth - faced , snivelling greasehorn]511-smooth - faced , snivelling greasehorn ! ” ( This last term is , [I]511-smooth - faced , snivelling greasehorn believe , purely — — shire , and alludes to the horn of black , rancid whale - oil , usually to be seen suspended to cart - wheels , and employed for greasing the same . ) “[511-smooth - faced , snivelling greasehorn] Come , [Edward Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth , enough of this . It is time [you]99-mr. crimsworth and [I]0-i wound up accounts . [I]0-i have now given [your]99-mr. crimsworth service three months ’ trial , and [I]0-i find it the most nauseous slavery under the sun . Seek [another clerk]512-another clerk . [I]0-i stay no longer . ” “[512-another clerk] What ! do [you]506-you dare to give [me]0-i notice ? Stop at least for [your]99-mr. crimsworth wages . ” [He]99-mr. crimsworth took down the heavy gig whip hanging beside [his]99-mr. crimsworth mackintosh . [I]0-i permitted [myself]0-i to laugh with a degree of scorn [I]0-i took no pains to temper or hide . [His]99-mr. crimsworth fury boiled up , and when [he]99-mr. crimsworth had sworn half - a - dozen vulgar , impious oaths , without , however , venturing to lift the whip , [he]99-mr. crimsworth continued : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve found [you]99-mr. crimsworth out and know [you]99-mr. crimsworth thoroughly , [you]99-mr. crimsworth mean , whining lickspittle ! What have [you]99-mr. crimsworth been saying all over X — — about [me]0-i ? answer [me]0-i that ! ” “[99-mr. crimsworth] [You]99-mr. crimsworth ? [I]0-i have neither inclination nor temptation to talk about [you]99-mr. crimsworth . ” “[99-mr. crimsworth] [You]99-mr. crimsworth lie ! It is [your]99-mr. crimsworth practice to talk about [me]0-i ; it is [your]99-mr. crimsworth constant habit to make public complaint of the treatment [you]99-mr. crimsworth receive at [my]0-i hands . [You]99-mr. crimsworth have gone and told it far and near that [I]0-i give [you]99-mr. crimsworth low wages and knock [you]99-mr. crimsworth about like a dog . [I]0-i wish [you]99-mr. crimsworth were a dog ! [I]0-i ’d set - to this minute , and never stir from the spot till [I]0-i ’d cut every strip of flesh from [your]99-mr. crimsworth bones with this whip . ” [He]2133-he flourished [his]2133-he tool . The end of the lash just touched [my]0-i forehead . A warm excited thrill ran through [my]0-i veins , [my]0-i blood seemed to give a bound , and then raced fast and hot along its channels . [I]0-i got up nimbly , came round to where [he]2133-he stood , and faced [him]2133-he . “[0-i] Down with [your]0-i whip ! ” said [I]0-i , “[0-i] and explain this instant what [you]0-i mean . ” “[137-sirrah] [Sirrah]137-sirrah ! to whom are [you]0-i speaking ? ” “[137-sirrah] To [you]137-sirrah . There is [no one else present]513-no one else present , [I]0-i think . [You]99-mr. crimsworth say [I]0-i have been calumniating [you]99-mr. crimsworth — complaining of [your]99-mr. crimsworth low wages and bad treatment . Give [your]99-mr. crimsworth grounds for these assertions . ” [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth had no dignity , and when [I]99-mr. crimsworth sternly demanded an explanation , [he]99-mr. crimsworth gave one in a loud , scolding voice . “[99-mr. crimsworth] Grounds ! [you]99-mr. crimsworth shall have them ; and turn to the light that [I]0-i may see [your]99-mr. crimsworth brazen face blush black , when [you]99-mr. crimsworth hear [yourself]99-mr. crimsworth proved to be [a liar]514-a liar and [a hypocrite]515-a hypocrite . At a public meeting in [the Town - hall]516-the town - hall yesterday , [I]0-i had the pleasure of hearing [myself]0-i insulted by [the speaker opposed to [me]0-i in the question under discussion , by allusions to [my]0-i private affairs]517-the speaker opposed to me in the question under discussion , by allusions to my private affairs ; by ca nt about monsters without natural affection , [family despots]518-family despots , and such trash ; and when [I]0-i rose to answer , [I]0-i was met by a shout from [the filthy mob]519-the filthy mob , where the mention of [your]99-mr. crimsworth name enabled [me]0-i at once to detect the quarter in which this base attack had originated . When [I]0-i looked round , [I]0-i saw [that treacherous villain]520-that treacherous villain , [Hunsden]109-hunsden acting as [fugleman]521-fugleman . [I]0-i detected [you]99-mr. crimsworth in close conversation with [Hunsden]109-hunsden at [[my]0-i house]292-my house a month ago , and [I]0-i know that [you]99-mr. crimsworth were at [[Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s rooms]523-hunsden ’s rooms last night . Deny it if [you]99-mr. crimsworth dare . ” “[99-mr. crimsworth] Oh , [I]0-i shall not deny it ! And if [Hunsden]109-hunsden hounded on [the people]476-the people to hiss [you]99-mr. crimsworth , [he]109-hunsden did quite right . [You]99-mr. crimsworth deserve popular execration ; for [a worse man]525-a worse man , [a harder master]526-a harder master , [a more brutal brother]527-a more brutal brother than [you]99-mr. crimsworth are has seldom existed . ” “[137-sirrah] [Sirrah]137-sirrah ! [sirrah]528-sirrah ! ” reiterated [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ; and to complete [his]99-mr. crimsworth apostrophe , [he]99-mr. crimsworth cracked the whip straight over [my]137-sirrah head . A minute sufficed to wrest it from [him]99-mr. crimsworth , break it in two pieces , and throw it under the grate . [He]99-mr. crimsworth made a headlong rush at [me]137-sirrah , which [I]137-sirrah evaded , and said — “[137-sirrah] Touch [me]0-i , and [I]0-i ’ll have [you]99-mr. crimsworth up before [the nearest magistrate]529-the nearest magistrate . ” [Men like [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth]2134-men like crimsworth , if firmly and calmly resisted , always abate something of [their]2134-men like crimsworth exorbitant insolence ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth had no mind to be brought before [a magistrate]2135-a magistrate , and [I]0-i suppose [he]99-mr. crimsworth saw [I]0-i meant what [I]0-i said . After an odd and long stare at [me]0-i , at once bull - like and amazed , [he]99-mr. crimsworth seemed to bethink [himself]99-mr. crimsworth that , after all , [his]99-mr. crimsworth money gave [him]99-mr. crimsworth sufficient superiority over [a beggar like [me]0-i]2136-a beggar like me , and that [he]99-mr. crimsworth had in [his]99-mr. crimsworth hands a surer and more dignified mode of revenge than the somewhat hazardous one of personal chastisement . “[0-i] Take [your]99-mr. crimsworth hat , ” said [he]99-mr. crimsworth . “[0-i] Take what belongs to [you]99-mr. crimsworth , and go out at that door ; get away to [[your]99-mr. crimsworth parish]530-your parish , [[you]99-mr. crimsworth pauper]531-you pauper : beg , steal , starve , get transported , do what [you]99-mr. crimsworth like ; but at [your]99-mr. crimsworth peril venture again into [my]0-i sight ! If ever [I]0-i hear of [your]99-mr. crimsworth setting foot on an inch of ground belonging to [me]0-i , [I]0-i ’ll hire [a man]353-a man to cane [you]99-mr. crimsworth . ” “[353-a man] It is not likely [you]99-mr. crimsworth ’ll have the chance ; once off [[your]99-mr. crimsworth premises]533-your premises , what temptation can [I]0-i have to return to [them]533-your premises ? [I]0-i leave [a prison]534-a prison , [I]0-i leave [a tyrant]535-a tyrant ; [I]0-i leave what is worse than the worst that can lie before [me]0-i , so no fear of [my]0-i coming back . ” “[0-i] Go , or [I]0-i ’ll make [you]99-mr. crimsworth ! ” exclaimed [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth . [I]0-i walked deliberately to [my]0-i desk , took out such of its contents as were [my]0-i own property , put them in [my]0-i pocket , locked the desk , and placed the key on the top . “[0-i] What are [you]99-mr. crimsworth abstracting from that desk ? ” demanded [the millowner]2011-the millowner . “[99-mr. crimsworth] Leave all behind in its place , or [I]0-i ’ll send for [a policeman]536-a policeman to search [you]99-mr. crimsworth . ” “[536-a policeman] Look sharp about it , then , ” said [I]536-a policeman , and [I]536-a policeman took down [my]536-a policeman hat , drew on [my]536-a policeman gloves , and walked leisurely out of [the counting - house]1913-the counting - house — walked out of [it]1913-the counting - house to enter [it]1913-the counting - house no more . [I]536-a policeman recollect that when the mill - bell rang the dinner hour , before [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth entered , and the scene above related took place , [I]536-a policeman had had rather a sharp appetite , and had been waiting somewhat impatiently to hear the signal of feeding time . [I]536-a policeman forgot it now , however ; the images of potatoes and roast mutton were effaced from [my]536-a policeman mind by the stir and tumult which the transaction of the last half - hour had there excited . [I]536-a policeman only thought of walking , that the action of [my]536-a policeman muscles might harmonize with the action of [my]536-a policeman nerves ; and walk [I]536-a policeman did , fast and far . How could [I]536-a policeman do otherwise ? A load was lifted off [my]536-a policeman heart ; [I]536-a policeman felt light and liberated . [I]536-a policeman had got away from [Bigben Close]5-bigben close without a breach of resolution ; without injury to [my]536-a policeman self - respect . [I]536-a policeman had not forced circumstances ; circumstances had freed [me]536-a policeman . Life was again open to [me]536-a policeman ; no longer was its horizon limited by the high black wall surrounding [[Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ’s mill]2116-crimsworth ’s mill . Two hours had elapsed before [my]536-a policeman sensations had so far subsided as to leave [me]536-a policeman calm enough to remark for what wider and clearer boundaries [I]536-a policeman had exchanged that sooty girdle . When [I]536-a policeman did look up , [lo]2140-lo ! straight before [me]536-a policeman lay [Grovetown]16-grovetown , [a village of villas about five miles out of [X——.]8-x——.]2141-a village of villas about five miles out of x——. The short winter day , as [I]536-a policeman perceived from the far - declined sun , was already approaching its close ; a chill frost - mist was rising from [the river on which X — — stands , and along whose banks [the road]1962-the road [I]536-a policeman had taken]2142-the river on which x — — stands , and along whose banks the road i had taken lay ; it dimmed [the earth]2144-the earth , but did not obscure the clear icy blue of the January sky . There was a great stillness near and far ; the time of the day favoured tranquillity , as [the people]476-the people were all employed within - doors , the hour of evening release from [the factories]2146-the factories not being yet arrived ; a sound of full - flowing water alone pervaded the air , for [the river]1941-the river was deep and abundant , swelled by the melting of a late snow . [I]536-a policeman stood awhile , leaning over a wall ; and looking down at the current : [I]536-a policeman watched the rapid rush of its waves . [I]536-a policeman desired memory to take a clear and permanent impression of the scene , and treasure it for future years . [Grovetown church]17-grovetown church clock struck four ; looking up , [I]536-a policeman beheld the last of that day ’s sun , glinting red through the leafless boughs of some very old oak trees surrounding [the church]286-the church — [its]8-x——. light coloured and characterized the picture as [I]536-a policeman wished . [I]536-a policeman paused yet a moment , till the sweet , slow sound of the bell had quite died out of the air ; then ear , eye and feeling satisfied , [I]536-a policeman quitted the wall and once more turned [my]536-a policeman face towards X——. [I]536-a policeman RE - ENTERED [the town]2149-the town [a hungry man]2150-a hungry man ; the dinner [I]536-a policeman had forgotten recurred seductively to [my]536-a policeman recollection ; and it was with a quick step and sharp appetite [I]536-a policeman ascended [the narrow street leading to [[my]536-a policeman lodgings]2067-my lodgings]2151-the narrow street leading to my lodgings . It was dark when [I]536-a policeman opened the front door and walked into [the house]1897-the house . [I]536-a policeman wondered how [my]536-a policeman fire would be ; the night was cold , and [I]536-a policeman shuddered at the prospect of a grate full of sparkless cinders . To [my]536-a policeman joyful surprise , [I]536-a policeman found , on entering [[my]536-a policeman sitting - room]2076-my sitting - room , a good fire and a clean hearth . [I]536-a policeman had hardly noticed this phenomenon , when [I]536-a policeman became aware of another subject for wonderment ; the chair [I]536-a policeman usually occupied near the hearth was already filled ; [a person]1980-a person sat there with [his]1980-a person arms folded on [his]1980-a person chest , and [his]1980-a person legs stretched out on the rug . Short - sighted as [I]536-a policeman am , doubtful as was the gleam of the firelight , a moment ’s examination enabled [me]536-a policeman to recognize in [this person]2156-this person [my]536-a policeman acquaintance , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden . [I]536-a policeman could not of course be much pleased to see [him]2156-this person , considering the manner in which [I]536-a policeman had parted from [him]2156-this person the night before , and as [I]536-a policeman walked to the hearth , stirred the fire , and said coolly , “[536-a policeman] Good evening , ” [my]537-i demeanour evinced as little cordiality as [I]537-i felt ; yet [I]537-i wondered in [my]537-i own mind what had brought [him]2156-this person [there]1998-there ; and [I]537-i wondered , also , what motives had induced [him]2156-this person to interfere so actively between [me]537-i and [Edward]99-mr. crimsworth ; it was to [him]2156-this person , it appeared , that [I]537-i owed [my]537-i welcome dismissal ; still [I]537-i could not bring [myself]537-i to ask [him]2156-this person questions , to show any eagerness of curiosity ; if [he]2156-this person chose to explain , [he]2156-this person might , but the explanation should be a perfectly voluntary one on [his]2156-this person part ; [I]537-i thought [he]2156-this person was entering upon it . “[537-i] [You]537-i owe [me]0-i a debt of gratitude , ” were [his]2156-this person first words . “[0-i] Do [I]0-i ? ” said [I]0-i ; “[0-i] [I]0-i hope it is not a large one , for [I]0-i am much too poor to charge [myself]0-i with heavy liabilities of any kind . ” “[537-i] Then declare [yourself]537-i bankrupt at once , for this liability is a ton weight at least . When [I]0-i came in [I]0-i found [your]537-i fire out , and [I]0-i had it lit again , and made that sulky drab of [a servant]367-a servant stay and blow at it with the bellows till it had burnt up properly ; now , say ‘ Thank [you]537-i ! ’ ” “[537-i] Not till [I]0-i have had something to eat ; [I]0-i can thank [nobody]449-nobody while [I]0-i am so famished . ” [I]0-i rang the bell and ordered tea and some cold meat . “[0-i] Cold meat ! ” exclaimed [Hunsden]109-hunsden , as [the servant]2158-the servant closed the door , “[0-i] what a glutton [you]0-i are ; [man]457-man ! Meat with tea ! [you]0-i ’ll die of eating too much . ” “[109-hunsden] No , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , [I]0-i shall not . ” [I]109-hunsden felt a necessity for contradicting [him]109-hunsden ; [I]109-hunsden was irritated with hunger , and irritated at seeing [him]109-hunsden [there]1998-there , and irritated at the continued roughness of [his]109-hunsden manner . “[109-hunsden] It is over - eating that makes [you]0-i so ill - tempered , ” said [he]109-hunsden . “[109-hunsden] How do [you]109-hunsden know ? ” [I]109-hunsden demanded . “[109-hunsden] It is like [you]0-i to give a pragmatical opinion without being acquainted with any of the circumstances of the case ; [I]0-i have had no dinner . ” What [I]0-i said was petulant and snappish enough , and [Hunsden]109-hunsden only replied by looking in [my]0-i face and laughing . “[0-i] Poor thing ! ” [he]109-hunsden whined , after a pause . “[0-i] [It]541-it has had no dinner , has it ? What ! [I]0-i suppose [its master]542-its master would not let [it]541-it come [home]1905-home . Did [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth order [you]0-i to fast by way of punishment , [William]103-william ! ” “[99-mr. crimsworth] No , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden . ” Fortunately at this sulky juncture , tea , was brought in , and [I]109-hunsden fell to upon some bread and butter and cold beef directly . Having cleared a plateful , [I]109-hunsden became so far humanized as to intimate to [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden that [he]109-hunsden need not sit there staring , but might come to the table and do as [I]109-hunsden did , if [he]109-hunsden liked . “[109-hunsden] But [I]0-i do n’t like in the least , ” said [he]109-hunsden , and therewith [he]109-hunsden summoned [the servant]2158-the servant by a fresh pull of the bell - rope , and intimated a desire to have a glass of toast - and - water . “[0-i] And some more coal , ” [he]109-hunsden added ; “[0-i] [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth shall keep a good fire while [I]0-i stay . ” [His]109-hunsden orders being executed , [he]109-hunsden wheeled [his]109-hunsden chair round to the table , so as to be opposite [me]99-mr. crimsworth . “[99-mr. crimsworth] Well , ” [he]109-hunsden proceeded . “[99-mr. crimsworth] [You]103-william are out of work , [I]0-i suppose . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [I]0-i ; and not disposed to show the satisfaction [I]0-i felt on this point , [I]0-i , yielding to the whim of the moment , took up the subject as though [I]0-i considered [myself]0-i aggrieved rather than benefited by what had been done . “[0-i] Yes — thanks to [you]103-william , [I]0-i am . [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth turned [me]0-i off at a minute ’s notice , owing to some interference of [yours]103-william at a public meeting , [I]0-i understand . ” “[99-mr. crimsworth] Ah ! what ! [The Hunsdens]114-the hunsdens were always unrivalled at tracking [a rascal]548-a rascal ; [a downright , dishonourable villain]549-a downright , dishonourable villain is [their]114-the hunsdens natural prey — [they]114-the hunsdens could not keep off [him]549-a downright , dishonourable villain wherever [they]114-the hunsdens met [him]549-a downright , dishonourable villain ; [you]550-you used the word pragmatical just now — that word is the property of [[our]551-we family]552-our family ; it has been applied to [us]551-we from generation to generation ; [we]551-we have fine noses for abuses ; [we]551-we scent [a scoundrel]553-a scoundrel a mile off ; [we]551-we are [reformers born]554-reformers born , [radical reformers]555-radical reformers ; and it was impossible for [me]0-i to live in [the same town]556-the same town with [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth , to come into weekly contact with [him]99-mr. crimsworth , to witness some of [his]99-mr. crimsworth conduct to [you]550-you ( for whom personally [I]0-i care nothing ; [I]0-i only consider the brutal injustice with which [he]99-mr. crimsworth violated [your]550-you natural claim to equality)—I say it was impossible for [me]0-i to be thus situated and not feel [the angel]557-the angel or the demon of [[my]0-i race]558-my race at work within [me]0-i . [I]0-i followed [my]0-i instinct , opposed [a tyrant]535-a tyrant , and broke a chain . ” Now this speech interested [me]0-i much , both because it brought out [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s character , and because it explained [his]109-hunsden motives ; it interested [me]0-i so much that [I]0-i forgot to reply to it , and sat silent , pondering over a throng of ideas it had suggested . “[0-i] Are [you]550-you grateful to [me]0-i ? ” [he]109-hunsden asked , presently . In fact [I]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp was grateful , or almost so , and [I]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp believe [I]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp half liked [him]109-hunsden at the moment , notwithstanding [his]109-hunsden proviso that what [he]109-hunsden had done was not out of regard for [me]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp . But human nature is perverse . Impossible to answer [his]109-hunsden blunt question in the affirmative , so [I]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp disclaimed all tendency to gratitude , and advised [him]109-hunsden if [he]109-hunsden expected any reward for [his]109-hunsden championship , to look for it in a better world , as [he]109-hunsden was not likely to meet with it here . In reply [he]109-hunsden termed [me]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp “[560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp] [a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp , ” whereupon [I]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp again charged [him]109-hunsden with having taken the bread out of [my]560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp mouth . “[560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp] [Your]561-you bread was dirty , [man]457-man ! ” cried [Hunsden—“dirty]138-hunsden—“dirty[560-a dry - hearted aristocratic scamp] and unwholesome ! [I]0-i think better of [you]561-you for looking steadily to the needful . ” “[561-you] Looking steadily to the needful ! How can [I]0-i do otherwise ? [I]0-i ’ll pack [my]0-i portmanteau before [I]0-i go to bed . ” The house clock struck seven . “[616-the lad] [The lad]616-the lad is [a heathen]617-a heathen , ” said [Hunsden]109-hunsden , and taking [his]109-hunsden hat from a sideboard , [he]109-hunsden left [the room]1922-the room , laughing to [himself]109-hunsden . [I]616-the lad had half an inclination to follow [him]109-hunsden : [I]616-the lad really intended to leave [X]7-x — — the next morning , and should certainly not have another opportunity of bidding [him]616-the lad good - bye . The front door banged to . “[616-the lad] Let [him]616-the lad go , ” said [I]616-the lad , “[616-the lad] [we]618-we shall meet again some day . ” [READER]141-reader , perhaps [you]141-reader were never in [Belgium]21-belgium ? Haply [you]141-reader do n’t know the physiognomy of [the country]334-the country ? [You]141-reader have not its lineaments defined upon [your]141-reader memory , as [I]616-the lad have them on [mine]616-the lad ? Three — nay four — pictures line [the four - walled cell where are stored for [me]616-the lad the records of the past]2164-the four - walled cell where are stored for me the records of the past . First , [Eton]1-eton . All in that picture is in far perspective , receding , diminutive ; but freshly coloured , green , dewy , with a spring sky , piled with glittering yet showery clouds ; for [my]616-the lad childhood was not all sunshine — [it]2165-it had [its]2165-it overcast , its cold , its stormy hours . Second , X — — , huge , dingy ; the canvas cracked and smoked ; a yellow sky , sooty clouds ; no sun , no azure ; the verdure of [the suburbs]2166-the suburbs blighted and sullied — a very dreary scene . Third , [Belgium]21-belgium ; and [I]616-the lad will pause before [this landscape]2167-this landscape . As to the fourth , a curtain covers [it]2167-this landscape , which [I]616-the lad may hereafter withdraw , or may not , as suits [my]616-the lad convenience and capacity . At any rate , for the present it must hang undisturbed . [Belgium]21-belgium ! name unromantic and unpoetic , yet name that whenever uttered has in [my]616-the lad ear a sound , in [my]616-the lad heart an echo , such as no other assemblage of syllables , however sweet or classic , can produce . [Belgium]21-belgium ! [I]616-the lad repeat the word , now as [I]616-the lad sit alone near midnight . It stirs [my]616-the lad world of the past like a summons to resurrection ; the graves unclose , the dead are raised ; thoughts , feelings , memories that slept , are seen by [me]616-the lad ascending from the clouds — haloed most of them — but while [I]616-the lad gaze on their vapoury forms , and strive to ascertain definitely [their]2167-this landscape outline , the sound which wakened [them]2167-this landscape dies , and [they]2167-this landscape sink , each and all , like a light wreath of mist , absorbed in the mould , recalled to urns , resealed in monuments . Farewell , luminous phantoms ! This is [Belgium]21-belgium , [reader]2168-reader . Look ! do n’t call the picture a flat or a dull one — it was neither flat nor dull to [me]616-the lad when [I]616-the lad first beheld it . When [I]616-the lad left [Ostend]22-ostend on a mild February morning , and found [myself]616-the lad on [the road to [Brussels]18-brussels]2169-the road to brussels , nothing could look vapid to [me]616-the lad . [My]616-the lad sense of enjoyment possessed an edge whetted to the finest , untouched , keen , exquisite . [I]616-the lad was young ; [I]616-the lad had good health ; pleasure and [I]616-the lad had never met ; no indulgence of [hers]2170-hers had enervated or sated one faculty of [my]616-the lad nature . [Liberty]142-liberty [I]616-the lad clasped in [my]616-the lad arms for the first time , and the influence of [her]2170-hers smile and embrace revived [my]616-the lad life like the sun and the west wind . Yes , at that epoch [I]616-the lad felt like [a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill [he]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise is ascending [he]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise shall behold a glorious sunrise]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise ; what if the track be strait , steep , and stony ? [he]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise sees it not ; [his]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise eyes are fixed on [that summit]2172-that summit , flushed already , flushed and gilded , and having gained it [he]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise is certain of the scene beyond . [He]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise knows that the sun will face [him]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise , that [[his]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise chariot]2173-his chariot is even now coming over the eastern horizon , and that the herald breeze [he]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise feels on [his]2171-a morning traveller who doubts not that from the hill he is ascending he shall behold a glorious sunrise cheek is opening for [the god]2174-the god ’s career a clear , vast path of azure , amidst clouds soft as pearl and warm as flame . Difficulty and toil were to be [my]616-the lad lot , but sustained by energy , drawn on by hopes as bright as vague , [I]616-the lad deemed such a lot no hardship . [I]616-the lad mounted now [the hill]2175-the hill in shade ; there were pebbles , inequalities , briars in [my]616-the lad path , but [my]616-the lad eyes were fixed on the crimson peak above ; [my]616-the lad imagination was with the refulgent firmament beyond , and [I]616-the lad thought nothing of the stones turning under [my]616-the lad feet , or of the thorns scratching [my]616-the lad face and hands . [I]616-the lad gazed often , and always with delight , from the window of the diligence ( these , be it remembered , were not the days of [trains]2176-trains and [railroads]329-railroads ) . Well ! and what did [I]616-the lad see ? [I]616-the lad will tell [you]2178-you faithfully . [Green , reedy swamps]2179-green , reedy swamps ; fields fertile but flat , cultivated in patches that made [them]2180-them look like magnified [kitchen - gardens]2181-kitchen - gardens ; belts of cut trees , formal as pollard willows , skirting the horizon ; [narrow canals]2182-narrow canals , gliding slow by [the road - side]2183-the road - side ; [painted Flemish farmhouses]2184-painted flemish farmhouses ; [some very dirty hovels]2185-some very dirty hovels ; a gray , dead sky ; [wet road]2186-wet road , [wet fields]2187-wet fields , wet [house - tops]2188-house - tops : not a beautiful , scarcely a picturesque object met [my]616-the lad eye along the whole route ; yet to [me]616-the lad , all was beautiful , all was more than picturesque . It continued fair so long as daylight lasted , though the moisture of many preceding damp days had sodden [the whole country]2189-the whole country ; as it grew dark , however , the rain recommenced , and it was through streaming and starless darkness [my]616-the lad eye caught the first gleam of the lights of [Brussels]18-brussels . [I]616-the lad saw little of [the city]2190-the city but [its]2190-the city lights that night . Having alighted from the diligence , [a fiacre]2191-a fiacre conveyed [me]616-the lad to [the Hotel de — —]2192-the hotel de — — , where [I]616-the lad had been advised by [a fellow - traveller to put up]2193-a fellow - traveller to put up ; having eaten a [traveller]2194-traveller ’s supper , [I]616-the lad retired to bed , and slept a [traveller]2194-traveller ’s sleep . Next morning [I]616-the lad awoke from prolonged and sound repose with the impression that [I]616-the lad was yet in X — — , and perceiving it to be broad daylight [I]616-the lad started up , imagining that [I]616-the lad had overslept [myself]616-the lad and should be behind time at [the counting - house]1913-the counting - house . The momentary and painful sense of restraint vanished before the revived and reviving consciousness of freedom , as , throwing back the white curtains of [my]616-the lad bed , [I]616-the lad looked forth into [a wide , lofty foreign chamber]2197-a wide , lofty foreign chamber ; how different from the small and dingy , though not uncomfortable , apartment [I]616-the lad had occupied for a night or two at [a respectable inn in [London]19-london]2198-a respectable inn in london while waiting for the sailing of [the packet]2199-the packet ! Yet far be it from [me]616-the lad to profane the memory of [that little dingy room]2200-that little dingy room ! It , too , is dear to [my]616-the lad soul ; for there , as [I]616-the lad lay in quiet and darkness , [I]616-the lad first heard the great bell of [St. Paul]23-st. paul ’s telling [London]19-london it was midnight , and well do [I]616-the lad recall the deep , deliberate tones , so full charged with colossal phlegm and force . From the small , narrow window of [that room]2201-that room , [I]616-the lad first saw the dome , looming through a [London]19-london mist . [I]616-the lad suppose the sensations , stirred by those first sounds , first sights , are felt but once ; treasure them , Memory ; seal them in urns , and keep them in safe niches ! Well — [I]616-the lad rose . Travellers talk of [the apartments in [foreign dwellings]2203-foreign dwellings]2202-the apartments in foreign dwellings being bare and uncomfortable ; [I]616-the lad thought [[my]616-the lad chamber]369-my chamber looked stately and cheerful . [It]369-my chamber had such large windows — croisées that opened like doors , with such broad , clear panes of glass ; such a great looking - glass stood on [my]616-the lad dressing - table — such a fine mirror glittered over the mantelpiece — the painted floor looked so clean and glossy ; when [I]616-the lad had dressed and was descending the stairs , the broad marble steps almost awed [me]616-the lad , and so did [the lofty hall into which [they]2206-they conducted]2205-the lofty hall into which they conducted . On [the first landing]2207-the first landing [I]616-the lad met [a Flemish housemaid]2208-a flemish housemaid : [she]2208-a flemish housemaid had wooden shoes , a short red petticoat , a printed cotton bedgown , [her]2208-a flemish housemaid face was broad , [her]2208-a flemish housemaid physiognomy eminently stupid ; when [I]616-the lad spoke to [her]2208-a flemish housemaid in French , [she]2208-a flemish housemaid answered [me]616-the lad in Flemish , with an air the reverse of civil ; yet [I]616-the lad thought [her]2208-a flemish housemaid charming ; if [she]2208-a flemish housemaid was not pretty or polite , [she]2208-a flemish housemaid was , [I]616-the lad conceived , very picturesque ; [she]2208-a flemish housemaid reminded [me]616-the lad of the female figures in certain Dutch paintings [I]616-the lad had seen in other years at [Seacombe Hall]24-seacombe hall . [I]616-the lad repaired to [the public room]2209-the public room ; that , too , was very large and very lofty , and warmed by a stove ; the floor was black , and the stove was black , and most of the furniture was black : yet [I]616-the lad never experienced a freer sense of exhilaration than when [I]616-the lad sat down at a very long , black table ( covered , however , in part by a white cloth ) , and , having ordered breakfast , began to pour out [my]616-the lad coffee from a little black coffee - pot . The stove might be dismal - looking to some eyes , not to [mine]616-the lad , but it was indisputably very warm , and there were [two gentlemen seated by it]2210-two gentlemen seated by it talking in French ; impossible to follow [their]2210-two gentlemen seated by it rapid utterance , or comprehend much of the purport of what [they]2210-two gentlemen seated by it said — yet French , in the mouths of [Frenchmen]2211-frenchmen , or [Belgians]2212-belgians ( [I]616-the lad was not then sensible of the horrors of the Belgian accent ) was as music to [my]616-the lad ears . [One of [these gentlemen]2214-these gentlemen]2213-one of these gentlemen presently discerned [me]616-the lad to be [an Englishman]2215-an englishman — no doubt from the fashion in which [I]616-the lad addressed [the waiter]2216-the waiter ; for [I]616-the lad would persist in speaking French in [[my]616-the lad execrable South - of - [England]11-england]2217-my execrable south - of - england style , though [the man]2218-the man understood English . [The gentleman]360-the gentleman , after looking towards [me]616-the lad once or twice , politely accosted [me]616-the lad in very good English ; [I]616-the lad remember [I]616-the lad wished to [God]119-god that [I]616-the lad could speak French as well ; [his]360-the gentleman fluency and correct pronunciation impressed [me]616-the lad for the first time with a due notion of the cosmopolitan character of [the capital [I]616-the lad was in]2220-the capital i was in ; it was [my]616-the lad first experience of that skill in living languages [I]616-the lad afterwards found to be so general in [Brussels]18-brussels . [I]616-the lad lingered over [my]616-the lad breakfast as long as [I]616-the lad could ; while it was there on the table , and while [that stranger]2221-that stranger continued talking to [me]616-the lad , [I]616-the lad was [a free , independent traveller]2222-a free , independent traveller ; but at last the things were removed , [the two gentlemen]2223-the two gentlemen left [the room]1922-the room ; suddenly the illusion ceased , reality and business came back . [I]616-the lad , [a bondsman just released from the yoke]2225-a bondsman just released from the yoke , freed for one week from twenty - one years of constraint , must , of necessity , resume the fetters of dependency . Hardly had [I]616-the lad tasted the delight of being without [a master]2226-a master when duty issued [her]2226-a master stern mandate : “[616-the lad] Go forth and seek another service . ” [I]133-mr. brown never linger over a painful and necessary task ; [I]133-mr. brown never take pleasure before business , it is not in [my]133-mr. brown nature to do so ; impossible to enjoy a leisurely walk over [the city]2190-the city , though [I]133-mr. brown perceived the morning was very fine , until [I]133-mr. brown had first presented [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s letter of introduction , and got fairly on to the track of a new situation . It was a fine day , but [I]133-mr. brown would not look at the blue sky or at [the stately houses round [me]133-mr. brown]2230-the stately houses round me ; [my]133-mr. brown mind was bent on one thing , finding out “[133-mr. brown] [Mr. Brown]133-mr. brown , Numero — , [Rue Royale]28-the rue royale , ” for so [my]133-mr. brown letter was addressed . Being shown into [a small breakfast - room]2231-a small breakfast - room , [I]133-mr. brown found [myself]133-mr. brown in the presence of [an elderly gentleman]2232-an elderly gentleman — very grave , business - like , and respectable - looking . After a little desultory conversation [he]109-hunsden asked [me]133-mr. brown if there was anything in which [his]109-hunsden advice or experience could be of use . [I]133-mr. brown said , “[133-mr. brown] Yes , ” and then proceeded to tell [him]109-hunsden that [I]619-clerk was not [a gentleman of fortune , travelling for pleasure]2233-a gentleman of fortune , travelling for pleasure , but [an ex - counting - house clerk , who wanted employment of some kind]2234-an ex - counting - house clerk , who wanted employment of some kind , and that immediately too .
