[I]622-you could also read it well , and write it decently . “[622-you] Then , ” pursued [Mr. Brown]133-mr. brown , “[622-you] [I]0-i think [I]0-i can promise [you]622-you the place , for [Monsieur Pelet]143-monsieur pelet will not refuse [a professor recommended by [me]0-i]627-a professor recommended by me ; but come here again at five o’clock this afternoon , and [I]0-i will introduce [you]622-you to [him]627-a professor recommended by me . ” The word “[628-professor] [professor]628-professor ” struck [me]0-i . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a professor]629-a professor , ” said [I.]0-i “[0-i] Oh , ” returned [Mr. Brown]133-mr. brown , “[628-professor] [professor]628-professor , here in [Belgium]21-belgium , means [a teacher]631-a teacher , that is all . ” [My]631-a teacher conscience thus quieted , [I]631-a teacher thanked [Mr. Brown]133-mr. brown , and , for the present , withdrew . This time [I]631-a teacher stepped out into [the street]2240-the street with a relieved heart ; the task [I]631-a teacher had imposed on [myself]631-a teacher for that day was executed . [I]631-a teacher might now take some hours of holiday . [I]631-a teacher felt free to look up . Pelet]146-m. pelet , [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ; [Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth , [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , ” a bow on each side finished the ceremony . [I]146-m. pelet do n’t know what sort of a bow [I]146-m. pelet made ; an ordinary one , [I]146-m. pelet suppose , for [I]146-m. pelet was in a tranquil , commonplace frame of mind ; [I]146-m. pelet felt none of the agitation which had troubled [my]146-m. pelet first interview with [Edward Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth . [He]146-m. pelet did , and expressed in flattering terms [his]146-m. pelet satisfaction at [my]147-le respectable m. brown answers . The subject of salary next came on ; it was fixed at one thousand francs per annum , besides board and lodging . “[147-le respectable m. brown] And in addition , ” suggested [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , “[146-m. pelet] as there will be some hours in each day during which [your]632-your services will not be required in [[my]0-i establishment]633-my establishment , [you]632-your may , in time , obtain employment in [other seminaries]634-other seminaries , and thus turn [your]632-your vacant moments to profitable account . ” [I]147-le respectable m. brown thought this very kind , and indeed [I]147-le respectable m. brown found afterwards that the terms on which [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet and [I]147-le respectable m. brown parted . Well , and what was [he]146-m. pelet like ? and what were [my]147-le respectable m. brown impressions concerning [him]146-m. pelet ? [He]146-m. pelet was [a man of about forty years of age , of middle size , and rather emaciated figure]2260-a man of about forty years of age , of middle size , and rather emaciated figure ; [his]146-m. pelet face was pale , [his]146-m. pelet cheeks were sunk , and [his]146-m. pelet eyes hollow ; [his]146-m. pelet features were pleasing and regular , they had a French turn ( for [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet was [no Fleming]2261-no fleming , but [a Frenchman]2239-a frenchman both by birth and parentage ) , yet the degree of harshness inseparable from Gallic lineaments was , in [his]146-m. pelet case , softened by a mild blue eye , and a melancholy , almost suffering , expression of countenance ; [his]146-m. pelet physiognomy was “[147-le respectable m. brown] fine et spirituelle . ” [I]147-le respectable m. brown use two French words because they define better than any English terms the species of intelligence with which [his]146-m. pelet features were imbued . [He]146-m. pelet was altogether [an interesting and prepossessing personage]2263-an interesting and prepossessing personage . [I]147-le respectable m. brown wondered only at the utter absence of all the ordinary characteristics of [his]146-m. pelet profession , and almost feared [he]146-m. pelet could not be stern and resolute enough for [a schoolmaster]2264-a schoolmaster . Externally at least [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet presented an absolute contrast to [[my]147-le respectable m. brown late master]2265-my late master , [Edward Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth . Influenced by the impression [I]147-le respectable m. brown had received of [his]146-m. pelet gentleness , [I]147-le respectable m. brown was a good deal surprised when , on arriving the next day at [[[my]147-le respectable m. brown new employer]2266-my new employer ’s house]2267-my new employer ’s house , and being admitted to a first view of what was to be the sphere of [my]147-le respectable m. brown future labours , namely [the large , lofty , and well - lighted schoolrooms]2268-the large , lofty , and well - lighted schoolrooms , [I]147-le respectable m. brown beheld a numerous assemblage of [pupils]2269-pupils , [boys of course , whose collective appearance showed all the signs of a full , flourishing , and well - disciplined seminary]2270-boys of course , whose collective appearance showed all the signs of a full , flourishing , and well - disciplined seminary . As [I]147-le respectable m. brown traversed the classes in company with [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , a profound silence reigned on all sides , and if by chance a murmur or a whisper arose , one glance from the pensive eye of [this most gentle pedagogue]2271-this most gentle pedagogue stilled it instantly . It was astonishing , [I]147-le respectable m. brown thought , how so mild a check could prove so effectual . When [I]147-le respectable m. brown had perambulated the length and breadth of [the classes]2272-the classes , [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet turned and said to [me]147-le respectable m. brown — “[147-le respectable m. brown] Would [you]635-you object to taking [the boys]636-the boys as [they]636-the boys are , and testing [their]636-the boys proficiency in English ? ” The proposal was unexpected . [I]637-messieurs had thought [I]637-messieurs should have been allowed at least three days to prepare ; but it is a bad omen to commence any career by hesitation , so [I]637-messieurs just stepped to [the professor]2273-the professor ’s desk near which [we]2274-we stood , and faced [the circle of [[my]637-messieurs pupils]2276-my pupils]2275-the circle of my pupils . [I]637-messieurs took a moment to collect [my]637-messieurs thoughts , and likewise to frame in French the sentence by which [I]637-messieurs proposed to open business . [I]637-messieurs made it as short as possible : — “[637-messieurs] [Messieurs]637-messieurs , prenez vos livres de lecture . ” “[637-messieurs] Anglais ou Francais , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ” demanded [a thickset , moon - faced young Flamand in a blouse]2277-a thickset , moon - faced young flamand in a blouse . The answer was fortunately easy : — “[638-monsieur] Anglais . ” [I]638-monsieur determined to give [myself]638-monsieur as little trouble as possible in this lesson ; it would not do yet to trust [my]638-monsieur unpractised tongue with the delivery of explanations ; [my]638-monsieur accent and idiom would be too open to the criticisms of [the young gentlemen before [me]638-monsieur]2278-the young gentlemen before me , relative to whom [I]638-monsieur felt already it would be necessary at once to take up an advantageous position , and [I]638-monsieur proceeded to employ means accordingly . “[638-monsieur] Commencez ! ” cried [I]638-monsieur , when [they]2278-the young gentlemen before me had all produced [their]2278-the young gentlemen before me books . [The moon - faced youth]2279-the moon - faced youth ( by name [Jules Vanderkelkov]149-jules vanderkelkov , as [I]638-monsieur afterwards learnt ) took the first sentence . The “[638-monsieur] livre de lecture ” was the “[637-messieurs] Vicar of [Wakefield]29-wakefield , ” much used in [foreign schools]2280-foreign schools because it is supposed to contain prime samples of conversational English ; it might , however , have been a Runic scroll for any resemblance the words , as enunciated by [Jules]149-jules vanderkelkov , bore to the language in ordinary use amongst [the natives of [Great Britain]30-great britain]2281-the natives of great britain . [[My]637-messieurs God]2282-my god ! how [he]2279-the moon - faced youth did snuffle , snort , and wheeze ! All [he]2279-the moon - faced youth said was said in [his]2279-the moon - faced youth throat and nose , for it is thus [the Flamands]150-the flamands speak , but [I]637-messieurs heard [him]2279-the moon - faced youth to the end of [his]2279-the moon - faced youth paragraph without proffering a word of correction , whereat [he]2279-the moon - faced youth looked vastly self - complacent , convinced , no doubt , that [he]2279-the moon - faced youth had acquitted [himself]2279-the moon - faced youth like [a real born and bred “[637-messieurs] Anglais]2283-a real born and bred “ anglais . ” In the same unmoved silence [I]637-messieurs listened to a dozen in rotation , and when the twelfth had concluded with splutter , hiss , and mumble , [I]637-messieurs solemnly laid down the book . “[637-messieurs] Arretez ! ” said [I.]637-messieurs There was a pause , during which [I]637-messieurs regarded [them]2284-they all with a steady and somewhat stern gaze ; [a dog , if stared at hard enough and long enough]2285-a dog , if stared at hard enough and long enough , will show symptoms of embarrassment , and so at length did [my]637-messieurs bench of [Belgians]151-belgians . Perceiving that [some of the faces before [me]637-messieurs]2286-some of the faces before me were beginning to look sullen , and [others]2056-others ashamed , [I]637-messieurs slowly joined [my]637-messieurs hands , and ejaculated in a deep “[637-messieurs] voix de poitrine ” — “[637-messieurs] Comme c’est affreux ! ” [They]2284-they looked at [each other]283-each other , pouted , coloured , swung [their]2284-they heels ; [they]2284-they were not pleased , [I]637-messieurs saw , but [they]2284-they were impressed , and in the way [I]637-messieurs wished [them]2284-they to be . Having thus taken [them]2284-they down a peg in [their]2284-they self - conceit , the next step was to raise [myself]637-messieurs in [their]2284-they estimation ; not a very easy thing , considering that [I]637-messieurs hardly dared to speak for fear of betraying [my]637-messieurs own deficiencies . “[637-messieurs] Ecoutez , [messieurs]637-messieurs ! ” said [I]637-messieurs , and [I]637-messieurs endeavoured to throw into [my]637-messieurs accents the compassionate tone of [a superior being , who , touched by the extremity of the helplessness]2289-a superior being , who , touched by the extremity of the helplessness , which at first only excited [his]2289-a superior being , who , touched by the extremity of the helplessness scorn , deigns at length to bestow aid . [I]637-messieurs then began at the very beginning of the “[637-messieurs] Vicar of [Wakefield]29-wakefield , ” and read , in a slow , distinct voice , some twenty pages , [they]2284-they all the while sitting mute and listening with fixed attention ; by the time [I]637-messieurs had done nearly an hour had elapsed . [I]637-messieurs then rose and said : — “[637-messieurs] C’est assez pour aujourd’hui , [messieurs]637-messieurs ; demain nous recommencerons , et j’espere que tout ira bien . ” With this oracular sentence [I]637-messieurs bowed , and in company with [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet quitted [the school - room]2290-the school - room . “[637-messieurs] C’est bien ! c’est tres bien ! ” said [[my]637-messieurs principal]2291-my principal as [we]2292-we entered [[his]2291-my principal parlour]2091-his parlour . “[637-messieurs] Je vois que [monsieur]638-monsieur a de l’adresse ; cela , [me]0-i plait , car , dans l’instruction , l’adresse fait tout autant que le savoir . ” From [the parlour]2294-the parlour [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet conducted [me]637-messieurs to [[my]637-messieurs apartment]2295-my apartment , [[my]637-messieurs “[637-messieurs] chambre]2296-my “ chambre , ” as [Monsieur]2297-monsieur said with a certain air of complacency . It was [a very small room]2298-a very small room , with an excessively small bed , but [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet gave [me]637-messieurs to understand that [I]637-messieurs was to occupy [it]2298-a very small room quite alone , which was of course a great comfort . Yet , though so limited in dimensions , [it]2298-a very small room had two windows . Light not being taxed in [Belgium]21-belgium , [the people]476-the people never grudge [its]2298-a very small room admission into [[their]476-the people houses]2300-their houses ; just here , however , this observation is not very a propos , for one of these windows was boarded up ; the open windows looked into [[the boys]636-the boys ’ playground]2302-the boys ’ playground . [I]637-messieurs glanced at the other , as wondering what aspect it would present if disencumbered of the boards . [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet read , [I]637-messieurs suppose , the expression of [my]637-messieurs eye ; [he]146-m. pelet explained : — “[637-messieurs] La fenêtre fermée donne sur [un jardin appartenant à un pensionnat de demoiselles]642-un jardin appartenant à un pensionnat de demoiselles , ” said [he]146-m. pelet , “[637-messieurs] et les convenances exigent — enfin , vous comprenez — n’est - ce pas , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ” “[638-monsieur] Oui , oui , ” was [my]638-monsieur reply , and [I]638-monsieur looked of course quite satisfied ; but when [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet had retired and closed the door after [him]146-m. pelet , the first thing [I]638-monsieur did was to scrutinize closely the nailed boards , hoping to find some chink or crevice which [I]638-monsieur might enlarge , and so get a peep at the consecrated ground . [My]638-monsieur researches were vain , for the boards were well joined and strongly nailed . It is astonishing how disappointed [I]638-monsieur felt . [I]638-monsieur thought it would have been so pleasant to have looked out upon [a garden planted with flowers and trees]2303-a garden planted with flowers and trees , so amusing to have watched [the demoiselles]2249-the demoiselles at [their]2249-the demoiselles play ; to have studied female character in a variety of phases , [myself]638-monsieur the while sheltered from view by a modest muslin curtain , whereas , owing doubtless to the absurd scruples of [some old duenna of [a directress]2306-a directress]2305-some old duenna of a directress , [I]638-monsieur had now only the option of looking at [a bare gravelled court]2307-a bare gravelled court , with [an enormous “[638-monsieur] pas de geant ”]2308-an enormous “ pas de geant ” in the middle , and the monotonous walls and windows of [[a boys]2309-a boys ’ school - house]2310-a boys ’ school - house round . Not only then , but many a time after , especially in moments of weariness and low spirits , did [I]644-the boy look with dissatisfied eyes on that most tantalizing board , longing to tear it away and get a glimpse of the green region which [I]644-the boy imagined to lie beyond . [I]644-the boy knew a tree grew close up to the window , for though there were as yet no leaves to rustle , [I]644-the boy often heard at night the tapping of branches against the panes . In the daytime , when [I]644-the boy listened attentively , [I]644-the boy could hear , even through the boards , the voices of [the demoiselles]2249-the demoiselles in [their]2249-the demoiselles hours of recreation , and , to speak the honest truth , [my]644-the boy sentimental reflections were occasionally a trifle disarranged by the not quite silvery , in fact the too often brazen sounds , which , rising from the unseen paradise below , penetrated clamorously into [my]644-the boy solitude . Not to mince matters , it really seemed to [me]644-the boy a doubtful case whether the lungs of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [[Reuter]152-mdlle ’s girls]2312-reuter ’s girls or [those of [[M. Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s boys]2314-m. pelet ’s boys]2313-those of m. pelet ’s boys were the strongest , and when it came to shrieking [the girls]2315-the girls indisputably beat [the boys]636-the boys hollow . [I]644-the boy forgot to say , by - the - by , that [Reuter]152-mdlle was the name of [the old lady who had had [my]644-the boy window bearded up]2317-the old lady who had had my window bearded up . [I]644-the boy say old , for such [I]644-the boy , of course , concluded [her]2317-the old lady who had had my window bearded up to be , judging from [her]2317-the old lady who had had my window bearded up cautious , chaperon - like proceedings ; besides , [nobody]449-nobody ever spoke of [her]2317-the old lady who had had my window bearded up as young . [I]644-the boy remember [I]644-the boy was very much amused when [I]644-the boy first heard [her]2317-the old lady who had had my window bearded up Christian name ; it was [Zoraide]153-zoraide — [Mademoiselle Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide . But [the continental nations]2319-the continental nations do allow [themselves]2319-the continental nations vagaries in the choice of names , such as [we]2320-we sober English never run into . [I]644-the boy think , indeed , [we]2320-we have too limited a list to choose from . Meantime [my]644-the boy path was gradually growing smooth before [me]644-the boy . [I]644-the boy , in a few weeks , conquered the teasing difficulties inseparable from the commencement of almost every career . Ere long [I]644-the boy had acquired as much facility in speaking French as set [me]644-the boy at [my]644-the boy ease with [[my]644-the boy pupils]2276-my pupils ; and as [I]644-the boy had encountered [them]2276-my pupils on a right footing at the very beginning , and continued tenaciously to retain the advantage [I]644-the boy had early gained , [they]2276-my pupils never attempted mutiny , which circumstance , [all who are in any degree acquainted with the ongoings of [Belgian schools]2323-belgian schools]2322-all who are in any degree acquainted with the ongoings of belgian schools , and who know the relation in which [professors]2324-professors and [pupils]2269-pupils too frequently stand towards each other in [those establishments]2326-those establishments , will consider an important and uncommon one . Before concluding this chapter [I]644-the boy will say a word on the system [I]644-the boy pursued with regard to [[my]644-the boy classes]2327-my classes : [my]644-the boy experience may possibly be of use to [others]2056-others . It did not require very keen observation to detect the character of [the youth of [Brabant]31-brabant]2329-the youth of brabant , but it needed a certain degree of tact to adopt one ’s measures to [their]2329-the youth of brabant capacity . [Their]2329-the youth of brabant intellectual faculties were generally weak , [their]2329-the youth of brabant animal propensities strong ; thus there was at once an impotence and a kind of inert force in [their]2329-the youth of brabant natures ; [they]2329-the youth of brabant were dull , but [they]2329-the youth of brabant were also singularly stubborn , heavy as lead and , like lead , most difficult to move . Such being the case , it would have been truly absurd to exact from [them]2329-the youth of brabant much in the way of mental exertion ; having short memories , dense intelligence , feeble reflective powers , [they]2329-the youth of brabant recoiled with repugnance from any occupation that demanded close study or deep thought . Had the abhorred effort been extorted from [them]2329-the youth of brabant by injudicious and arbitrary measures on the part of [the Professor]2273-the professor , [they]2329-the youth of brabant would have resisted as obstinately , as clamorously , as [desperate swine]2331-desperate swine ; and though not brave singly , [they]2329-the youth of brabant were relentless acting en masse . [I]644-the boy understood that before [my]644-the boy arrival in [[M. Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s establishment]2332-m. pelet ’s establishment , the combined insubordination of [the pupils]2333-the pupils had effected the dismissal of more than [one English master]2334-one english master . It was necessary then to exact only the most moderate application from natures so little qualified to apply — to assist , in every practicable way , understandings so opaque and contracted — to be ever gentle , considerate , yielding even , to a certain point , with dispositions so irrationally perverse ; but , having reached that culminating point of indulgence , [you]2335-you must fix [your]2335-you foot , plant it , root it in rock — become immutable as [the towers of [Ste . Gudule]33-ste . gudule]2336-the towers of ste . gudule ; for a step — but half a step farther , and [you]2335-you would plunge headlong into [the gulf of imbecility]2337-the gulf of imbecility ; there lodged , [you]2335-you would speedily receive proofs of Flemish gratitude and magnanimity in showers of [Brabant]31-brabant saliva and handfuls of Low Country mud . [You]2335-you might smooth to the utmost the path of learning , remove every pebble from the track ; but then [you]2335-you must finally insist with decision on [the pupil]2338-the pupil taking [your]2335-you arm and allowing [himself]2338-the pupil to be led quietly along [the prepared road]2339-the prepared road . When [I]644-the boy had brought down [my]644-the boy lesson to the lowest level of [[my]644-the boy dullest pupil]2340-my dullest pupil ’s capacity — when [I]644-the boy had shown [myself]644-the boy the mildest , the most tolerant of [masters]2341-masters — a word of impertinence , a movement of disobedience , changed [me]644-the boy at once into [a despot]2342-a despot . [I]644-the boy offered then but one alternative — submission and acknowledgment of error , or ignominious expulsion . This system answered , and [my]644-the boy influence , by degrees , became established on a firm basis . “[644-the boy] [The boy]644-the boy is [father]645-father to [the man]2218-the man , ” it is said ; and so [I]644-the boy often thought when looked at [[my]644-the boy boys]2343-my boys and remembered the political history of [[their]2343-my boys ancestors]2344-their ancestors . [[Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s school]2345-pelet ’s school was merely an epitome of [the Belgian nation]2346-the belgian nation . AND [Pelet]146-m. pelet [himself]146-m. pelet ? How did [I]644-the boy continue to like [him]146-m. pelet ? Oh , extremely well ! Nothing could be more smooth , gentlemanlike , and even friendly , than [his]146-m. pelet demeanour to [me]644-the boy . [I]644-the boy had to endure from [him]146-m. pelet neither cold neglect , irritating interference , nor pretentious assumption of superiority . [I]644-the boy fear , however , [two poor , hard - worked Belgian ushers in [the establishment]2348-the establishment]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment could not have said as much ; to [them]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment [the director]2349-the director ’s manner was invariably dry , stern , and cool . [I]644-the boy believe [he]2349-the director perceived once or twice that [I]644-the boy was a little shocked at the difference [he]2349-the director made between [them]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment and [me]644-the boy , and accounted for it by saying , with a quiet sarcastic smile — “[644-the boy] Ce ne sont que des [Flamands]150-the flamands — allez ! ” And then [he]2349-the director took [his]2349-the director cigar gently from [his]2349-the director lips and spat on the painted floor of [the room in which [we]2351-we were sitting]2350-the room in which we were sitting . [Flamands]150-the flamands certainly [they]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment were , and both had the true Flamand physiognomy , where intellectual inferiority is marked in lines none can mistake ; still [they]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment were [men]1921-men , and , in the main , [honest men]2353-honest men ; and [I]644-the boy could not see why [their]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment being aboriginals of the flat , dull soil should serve as a pretext for treating [them]2347-two poor , hard - worked belgian ushers in the establishment with perpetual severity and contempt . This idea , of injustice somewhat poisoned the pleasure [I]644-the boy might otherwise have derived from [Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s soft affable manner to [myself]644-the boy . Certainly it was agreeable , when the day ’s work was over , to find [[one]1983-one ’s employer]2355-one ’s employer [an intelligent and cheerful companion]2356-an intelligent and cheerful companion ; and if [he]2349-the director was sometimes a little sarcastic and sometimes a little too insinuating , and if [I]644-the boy did discover that [his]2349-the director mildness was more a matter of appearance than of reality — if [I]644-the boy did occasionally suspect the existence of flint or steel under an external covering of velvet — still [we]2351-we are none of [us]2351-we perfect ; and weary as [I]644-the boy was of the atmosphere of brutality and insolence in which [I]644-the boy had constantly lived at X — — , [I]644-the boy had no inclination now , on casting anchor in [calmer regions]2357-calmer regions , to institute at once a prying search after defects that were scrupulously withdrawn and carefully veiled from [my]644-the boy view . [I]644-the boy was willing to take [Pelet]146-m. pelet for what [he]146-m. pelet seemed — to believe [him]146-m. pelet benevolent and friendly until some untoward event should prove [him]146-m. pelet otherwise . [He]146-m. pelet was not married , and [I]644-the boy soon perceived [he]146-m. pelet had [all a Frenchman]2358-all a frenchman ’s , all [a Parisian]2359-a parisian ’s notions about matrimony and [women]2360-women . [I]644-the boy suspected a degree of laxity in [his]146-m. pelet code of morals , there was something so cold and blasé in [his]146-m. pelet tone whenever [he]146-m. pelet alluded to what [he]146-m. pelet called “[644-the boy] le beau sexe ; ” but [he]146-m. pelet was too gentlemanlike to intrude topics [I]644-the boy did not invite , and as [he]146-m. pelet was really intelligent and really fond of intellectual subjects of discourse , [he]146-m. pelet and [I]644-the boy always found enough to talk about , without seeking themes in the mire . [I]644-the boy hated [his]146-m. pelet fashion of mentioning love ; [I]644-the boy abhorred , from [my]644-the boy soul , mere licentiousness . [He]146-m. pelet felt the difference of [our]2361-our notions , and , by mutual consent , [we]2361-our kept off ground debateable . [[Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s house]2362-pelet ’s house was kept and [[his]146-m. pelet kitchen]2363-his kitchen managed by [[his]146-m. pelet mother]409-his mother , [a real old Frenchwoman]2365-a real old frenchwoman ; [she]409-his mother had been handsome — at least [she]409-his mother told [me]644-the boy so , and [I]644-the boy strove to believe [her]409-his mother ; [she]409-his mother was now ugly , as only [continental old women]2366-continental old women can be ; perhaps , though , [her]409-his mother style of dress made [her]409-his mother look uglier than [she]409-his mother really was . Indoors [she]409-his mother would go about without cap , [her]409-his mother grey hair strangely dishevelled ; then , when at [home]1905-home , [she]409-his mother seldom wore a gown — only a shabby cotton camisole ; shoes , too , were strangers to [her]409-his mother feet , and in lieu of them [she]409-his mother sported roomy slippers , trodden down at the heels . On the other hand , whenever it was [her]409-his mother pleasure to appear abroad , as on Sundays and fete - days , [she]409-his mother would put on some very brilliant - coloured dress , usually of thin texture , a silk bonnet with a wreath of flowers , and a very fine shawl . [She]409-his mother was not , in the main , [an ill - natured old woman]2368-an ill - natured old woman , but [an incessant and most indiscreet talker]2369-an incessant and most indiscreet talker ; [she]409-his mother kept chiefly in and about [the kitchen]2370-the kitchen , and seemed rather to avoid [[her]409-his mother son]2371-her son ’s august presence ; of [him]2371-her son , indeed , [she]409-his mother evidently stood in awe . When [he]2371-her son reproved [her]409-his mother , [his]2371-her son reproofs were bitter and unsparing ; but [he]2371-her son seldom gave [himself]2371-her son that trouble . [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet had [[her]154-madame pelet own society]2372-her own society , [[her]154-madame pelet own circle of chosen visitors]2373-her own circle of chosen visitors , whom , however , [I]644-the boy seldom saw , as [she]154-madame pelet generally entertained [them]2373-her own circle of chosen visitors in what [she]154-madame pelet called [[her]154-madame pelet “[644-the boy] cabinet]2374-her “ cabinet , ” [a small den of a place adjoining [the kitchen]2370-the kitchen]2375-a small den of a place adjoining the kitchen , and descending into [it]2374-her “ cabinet by one or two steps . On these steps , by - the - by , [I]648-the gouter have not unfrequently seen [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet seated with a trencher on [her]154-madame pelet knee , engaged in the threefold employment of eating [her]154-madame pelet dinner , gossiping with [[her]154-madame pelet favourite servant]2377-her favourite servant , [the housemaid]2378-the housemaid , and scolding [[her]154-madame pelet antagonist]2379-her antagonist , [the cook]2380-the cook ; [she]154-madame pelet never dined , and seldom indeed took any meal with [[her]154-madame pelet son]2371-her son ; and as to showing [her]154-madame pelet face at [the boys]636-the boys ’ table , that was quite out of the question . These details will sound very odd in English ears , but [Belgium]21-belgium is not [England]11-england , and [its]21-belgium ways are not [our]2383-our ways . [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet ’s habits of life , then , being taken into consideration , [I]648-the gouter was a good deal surprised when , one Thursday evening ( Thursday was always a half - holiday ) , as [I]648-the gouter was sitting all alone in [[my]648-the gouter apartment]2295-my apartment , correcting a huge pile of English and Latin exercises , [a servant]367-a servant tapped at the door , and , on its being opened , presented [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet ’s compliments , and [she]154-madame pelet would be happy to see [me]648-the gouter to take [my]648-the gouter “[648-the gouter] gouter ” ( a meal which answers to [our]2383-our English “[648-the gouter] tea ” ) with [her]154-madame pelet in [the dining - room]1925-the dining - room . “[648-the gouter] Plait - il ? ” said [I]648-the gouter , for [I]648-the gouter thought [I]648-the gouter must have misunderstood , the message and invitation were so unusual ; the same words were repeated . [I]648-the gouter accepted , of course , and as [I]648-the gouter descended the stairs , [I]648-the gouter wondered what whim had entered [the old lady]2387-the old lady ’s brain ; [[her]2387-the old lady son]2371-her son was out — gone to pass the evening at the Salle of the Grande Harmonie or [some other club of which [he]2371-her son was a member]2389-some other club of which he was a member . Just as [I]648-the gouter laid [my]648-the gouter hand on the handle of the dining - room door , a queer idea glanced across [my]648-the gouter mind . “[648-the gouter] Surely [she]647-she ’s not going to make love to [me]0-i , ” said [I.]648-the gouter “[647-she] [I]0-i ’ve heard of [old Frenchwomen]155-old frenchwomen doing odd things in that line ; and [the gouter]648-the gouter ? [They]155-old frenchwomen generally begin such affairs with eating and drinking , [I]0-i believe . ” There was a fearful dismay in this suggestion of [my]0-i excited imagination , and if [I]0-i had allowed [myself]0-i time to dwell upon it , [I]0-i should no doubt have cut there and then , rushed back to [[my]0-i chamber]369-my chamber , and bolted [myself]0-i in ; but whenever a danger or a horror is veiled with uncertainty , the primary wish of the mind is to ascertain first the naked truth , reserving the expedient of flight for the moment when its dread anticipation shall be realized . [I]0-i turned the door - handle , and in an instant had crossed the fatal threshold , closed the door behind [me]0-i , and stood in the presence of [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet . Gracious heavens ! The first view of [her]154-madame pelet seemed to confirm [my]0-i worst apprehensions . There [she]154-madame pelet sat , dressed out in a light green muslin gown , on [her]154-madame pelet head a lace cap with flourishing red roses in the frill ; [her]154-madame pelet table was carefully spread ; there were fruit , cakes , and coffee , with a bottle of something — [I]0-i did not know what . Already the cold sweat started on [my]0-i brow , already [I]0-i glanced back over [my]0-i shoulder at the closed door , when , to [my]0-i unspeakable relief , [my]0-i eye , wandering mildly in the direction of the stove , rested upon a second figure , seated in a large fauteuil beside it . This was [a woman]2098-a woman , too , and , moreover , [an old woman]2392-an old woman , and as fat and as rubicund as [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet was meagre and yellow ; [her]154-madame pelet attire was likewise very fine , and spring flowers of different hues circled in a bright wreath the crown of [her]154-madame pelet violet - coloured velvet bonnet . [I]0-i had only time to make these general observations when [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet , coming forward with what [she]154-madame pelet intended should be a graceful and elastic step , thus accosted [me]0-i : “[0-i] [Monsieur]649-monsieur is indeed most obliging to quit [his]649-monsieur books , [his]649-monsieur studies , at the request of [an insignificant person like [me]0-i]650-an insignificant person like me — will [Monsieur]651-monsieur complete [his]649-monsieur kindness by allowing [me]0-i to present [him]649-monsieur to [[my]0-i dear friend]652-my dear friend [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet , who resides in [the neighbouring house]653-the neighbouring house — [[the young ladies]654-the young ladies ’ school]655-the young ladies ’ school . ” “[154-madame pelet] Ah ! ” thought [I]154-madame pelet , “[154-madame pelet] [I]0-i knew [she]154-madame pelet was old , ” and [I]154-madame pelet bowed and took [my]154-madame pelet seat . [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet placed [herself]154-madame pelet at the table opposite to [me]154-madame pelet . “[154-madame pelet] How do [you]651-monsieur like [Belgium]21-belgium , [Monsieur]656-monsieur ? ” asked [she]154-madame pelet , in an accent of the broadest Bruxellois . [I]656-monsieur could now well distinguish the difference between the fine and pure Parisian utterance of [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , for instance , and the guttural enunciation of [the Flamands]150-the flamands . [I]656-monsieur answered politely , and then wondered how so coarse and clumsy [an old woman as [the one before [me]656-monsieur]2394-the one before me should be at the head of [[a ladies]2395-a ladies ’ seminary]2396-a ladies ’ seminary , which [I]656-monsieur had always heard spoken of in terms of high commendation]2393-an old woman as the one before me should be at the head of a ladies ’ seminary , which i had always heard spoken of in terms of high commendation . In truth there was something to wonder at . [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet looked more like [a joyous , free - living old Flemish fermiere]2397-a joyous , free - living old flemish fermiere , or even [a maitresse d’auberge]2398-a maitresse d’auberge , than [a staid , grave , rigid directrice de pensionnat]2399-a staid , grave , rigid directrice de pensionnat . In general [the continental]2400-the continental , or at least [the Belgian old women]2401-the belgian old women permit [themselves]2401-the belgian old women a licence of manners , speech , and aspect , such as [[our]2402-our venerable granddames]2403-our venerable granddames would recoil from as absolutely disreputable , and [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet ’s jolly face bore evidence that [she]154-madame pelet was no exception to the rule of [[her]154-madame pelet country]2404-her country ; there was a twinkle and leer in [her]154-madame pelet left eye ; [her]154-madame pelet right [she]154-madame pelet kept habitually half shut , which [I]656-monsieur thought very odd indeed . After several vain attempts to comprehend the motives of [these two droll old creatures]2405-these two droll old creatures for inviting [me]656-monsieur to join [them]2405-these two droll old creatures at [[their]2405-these two droll old creatures gouter]2406-their gouter , [I]656-monsieur at last fairly gave it up , and resigning [myself]656-monsieur to inevitable mystification , [I]656-monsieur sat and looked first at one , then at the other , taking care meantime to do justice to the confitures , cakes , and coffee , with which [they]2405-these two droll old creatures amply supplied [me]656-monsieur . [They]2405-these two droll old creatures , too , ate , and that with no delicate appetite , and having demolished a large portion of the solids , [they]2405-these two droll old creatures proposed a “[656-monsieur] petit verre . ” [I]656-monsieur declined . Not so [Mesdames Pelet]156-mesdames pelet and [Reuter]154-madame pelet ; each mixed [herself]154-madame pelet what [I]656-monsieur thought rather a stiff tumbler of punch , and placing it on a stand near the stove , [they]2405-these two droll old creatures drew up [their]2405-these two droll old creatures chairs to that convenience , and invited [me]656-monsieur to do the same . [I]656-monsieur obeyed ; and being seated fairly between [them]2405-these two droll old creatures , [I]656-monsieur was thus addressed first by [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet , then by [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet . “[656-monsieur] [We]657-my will now speak of business , ” said [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet , and [she]154-madame pelet went on to make an elaborate speech , which , being interpreted , was to the effect that [she]154-madame pelet had asked for the pleasure of [my]657-my company that evening in order to give [[her]154-madame pelet friend]2407-her friend [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet an opportunity of broaching an important proposal , which might turn out greatly to [my]657-my advantage . “[657-my] Pourvu que vous soyez sage , ” said [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet , “[657-my] et a vrai dire , vous en avez bien l’air . Take one drop of the punch ” ( or ponche , as [she]154-madame pelet pronounced it ) ; “[657-my] it is an agreeable and wholesome beverage after a full meal . ” [I]0-i bowed , but again declined it . [She]154-madame pelet went on : “[0-i] [I]0-i feel , ” said [she]154-madame pelet , after a solemn sip—“I[0-i] feel profoundly the importance of the commission with which [[my]0-i dear daughter]658-my dear daughter has entrusted [me]0-i , for [you]659-you are aware , [Monsieur]638-monsieur , that it is [[my]0-i daughter]661-my daughter who directs the establishment in [the next house]662-the next house ? ” “[661-my daughter] Ah ! [I]0-i thought it was [yourself]0-i , [madame]663-madame . ” Though , indeed , at that moment [I]0-i recollected that it was called [Mademoiselle]153-zoraide , not [[Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet ’s pensionnat]2408-madame reuter ’s pensionnat . “[0-i] [I]0-i ! Oh , no ! [I]0-i manage [the house]1897-the house and look after [the servants]665-the servants , as [[my]0-i friend]666-my friend [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet does for [Monsieur]667-monsieur [[her]154-madame pelet son]2371-her son — nothing more . Ah ! [you]0-i thought [I]0-i gave lessons in class — did [you]0-i ? ” And [she]154-madame pelet laughed loud and long , as though the idea tickled [her]154-madame pelet fancy amazingly . “[0-i] [Madame]154-madame pelet is in the wrong to laugh , ” [I]154-madame pelet observed ; “[154-madame pelet] if [she]154-madame pelet does not give lessons , [I]0-i am sure it is not because [she]154-madame pelet can not ; ” and [I]154-madame pelet whipped out a white pocket - handkerchief and wafted it , with a French grace , past [my]154-madame pelet nose , bowing at the same time . “[154-madame pelet] Quel charmant jeune homme ! ” murmured [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet in a low voice . [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet , being less sentimental , as [she]154-madame pelet was [Flamand]157-flamand and not French , only laughed again . “[154-madame pelet] [You]0-i are [a dangerous person]669-a dangerous person , [I]0-i fear , ” said [she]0-i ; “[0-i] if [you]0-i can forge compliments at that rate , [Zoraide]153-zoraide will positively be afraid of [you]0-i ; but if [you]0-i are good , [I]0-i will keep [your]0-i secret , and not tell [her]153-zoraide how well [you]0-i can flatter . Now , listen what sort of a proposal [she]153-zoraide makes to [you]0-i . [She]153-zoraide has heard that [you]0-i are [an excellent professor]670-an excellent professor , and as [she]153-zoraide wishes to get the very best masters for [[her]153-zoraide school]671-her school ( car Zoraide fait tout comme une reine , c’est une veritable maitresse - femme ) , [she]153-zoraide has commissioned [me]0-i to step over this afternoon , and sound [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet as to the possibility of engaging [you]0-i . [Zoraide]153-zoraide is [a wary general]672-a wary general ; [she]153-zoraide never advances without first examining well [her]153-zoraide ground . [I]0-i do n’t think [she]153-zoraide would be pleased if [she]153-zoraide knew [I]0-i had already disclosed [her]153-zoraide intentions to [you]0-i ; [she]153-zoraide did not order [me]0-i to go so far , but [I]0-i thought there would be no harm in letting [you]0-i into the secret , and [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet was of the same opinion . Take care , however , [you]0-i do n’t betray either of [us]673-our to [Zoraide]153-zoraide — to [[my]0-i daughter]661-my daughter , [I]0-i mean ; [she]153-zoraide is so discreet and circumspect [herself]153-zoraide , [she]153-zoraide can not understand that [one]1983-one should find a pleasure in gossiping a little — ” “[153-zoraide] C’est absolument comme mon fils ! ” cried [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet . “[153-zoraide] All [the world]1872-the world is so changed since [our]673-our girlhood ! ” rejoined [the other]2074-the other : “[153-zoraide] [young people]677-young people have such old heads now . But to return , [Monsieur]678-monsieur . [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet will mention the subject of [your]0-i giving lessons in [[[my]0-i daughter]661-my daughter ’s establishment]680-my daughter ’s establishment to [[her]661-my daughter son]2371-her son , and [he]2371-her son will speak to [you]0-i ; and then to - morrow , [you]0-i will step over to [[our]673-our house]325-our house , and ask to see [[my]0-i daughter]661-my daughter , and [you]0-i will introduce the subject as if the first intimation of it had reached [you]0-i from [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet [himself]146-m. pelet , and be sure [you]0-i never mention [my]0-i name , for [I]0-i would not displease [Zoraide]153-zoraide on any account . ” “[0-i] Bien ! bien ! ” interrupted [I]0-i — for all this chatter and circumlocution began to bore [me]0-i very much ; “[0-i] [I]0-i will consult [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , and the thing shall be settled as [you]0-i desire . Good evening , [mesdames]684-mesdames — [I]0-i am infinitely obliged to [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] Comment ! vous vous en allez deja ? ” exclaimed [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet . “[663-madame] Prenez encore quelquechose , [monsieur]638-monsieur ; une pomme cuite , des biscuits , encore une tasse de cafe ? ” “[686-merci] Merci , [merci]686-merci , [madame]663-madame — au revoir . ” And [I]686-merci backed at last out of [the apartment]2410-the apartment . Having regained [[my]686-merci own room]2411-my own room , [I]686-merci set [myself]686-merci to turn over in [my]686-merci mind the incident of the evening . It seemed a queer affair altogether , and queerly managed ; [the two old women]2412-the two old women had made quite a little intricate mess of it ; still [I]686-merci found that the uppermost feeling in [my]686-merci mind on the subject was one of satisfaction . In the first place it would be a change to give lessons in [another seminary]2413-another seminary , and then to teach [young ladies]2414-young ladies would be an occupation so interesting — to be admitted at all into [[a ladies]2395-a ladies ’ boarding - school]2416-a ladies ’ boarding - school would be an incident so new in [my]686-merci life . Besides , thought [I]686-merci , as [I]686-merci glanced at the boarded window , “[686-merci] [I]0-i shall now at last see [the mysterious garden]688-the mysterious garden : [I]0-i shall gaze both on the angels and [their]689-their [Eden]34-eden . ” [M. PELET]146-m. pelet could not of course object to the proposal made by [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ; permission to accept such additional employment , should it offer , having formed an article of the terms on which [he]2417-he had engaged [me]686-merci . It was , therefore , arranged in the course of next day that [I]686-merci should be at liberty to give lessons in [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s establishment four afternoons in every week . When evening came [I]686-merci prepared to step over in order to seek a conference with [Mademoiselle]153-zoraide [herself]153-zoraide on the subject ; [I]686-merci had not had time to pay the visit before , having been all day closely occupied in class . [I]686-merci remember very well that before quitting [[my]686-merci chamber]369-my chamber , [I]686-merci held a brief debate with [myself]686-merci as to whether [I]686-merci should change [my]686-merci ordinary attire for something smarter . At last [I]686-merci concluded it would be a waste of labour . “[686-merci] Doubtless , ” thought [I]686-merci , “[686-merci] [she]690-she is [some stiff old maid]691-some stiff old maid ; for though [the daughter of [Madame Reuter]154-madame pelet]692-the daughter of madame reuter , [she]690-she may well number upwards of forty winters ; besides , if it were otherwise , if [she]690-she be both young and pretty , [I]0-i am not handsome , and no dressing can make [me]0-i so , therefore [I]0-i ’ll go as [I]0-i am . ” And off [I]159-monsieur creemsvort started , cursorily glancing sideways as [I]159-monsieur creemsvort passed the toilet - table , surmounted by a looking - glass : a thin irregular face [I]159-monsieur creemsvort saw , with sunk , dark eyes under a large , square forehead , complexion destitute of bloom or attraction ; something young , but not youthful , no object to win [a lady]347-a lady ’s love , no butt for the shafts of [Cupid]158-cupid . [I]159-monsieur creemsvort was soon at the entrance of [the pensionnat]2420-the pensionnat , in a moment [I]159-monsieur creemsvort had pulled the bell ; in another moment the door was opened , and within appeared [a passage paved alternately with black and white marble]2421-a passage paved alternately with black and white marble ; the walls were painted in imitation of marble also ; and at the far end opened a glass door , through which [I]159-monsieur creemsvort saw shrubs and a grass - plat , looking pleasant in the sunshine of the mild spring evening — for it was now the middle of April . This , then , was [my]159-monsieur creemsvort first glimpse of [the garden]2422-the garden ; but [I]159-monsieur creemsvort had not time to look long , [the portress]2423-the portress , after having answered in the affirmative [my]159-monsieur creemsvort question as to whether [[her]2423-the portress mistress]2424-her mistress was at [home]1905-home , opened the folding - doors of [a room to the left]2426-a room to the left , and having ushered [me]159-monsieur creemsvort in , closed them behind [me]159-monsieur creemsvort . [I]159-monsieur creemsvort found [myself]159-monsieur creemsvort in [a salon with a very well - painted , highly varnished floor]2427-a salon with a very well - painted , highly varnished floor ; chairs and sofas covered with white draperies , a green porcelain stove , walls hung with pictures in gilt frames , a gilt pendule and other ornaments on the mantelpiece , a large lustre pendent from the centre of the ceiling , mirrors , consoles , muslin curtains , and a handsome centre table completed the inventory of furniture . All looked extremely clean and glittering , but the general effect would have been somewhat chilling had not a second large pair of folding - doors , standing wide open , and disclosing [another and smaller salon]2428-another and smaller salon , more snugly furnished , offered some relief to the eye . [This room]2429-this room was carpeted , and therein was a piano , a couch , a chiffonniere — above all , [it]2429-this room contained a lofty window with a crimson curtain , which , being undrawn , afforded another glimpse of [the garden]2422-the garden , through the large , clear panes , round which some leaves of ivy , some tendrils of vine were trained . “[159-monsieur creemsvort] [Monsieur Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort , n’est ce pas ? ” said a voice behind [me]159-monsieur creemsvort ; and , starting involuntarily , [I]159-monsieur creemsvort turned . [I]159-monsieur creemsvort had been so taken up with the contemplation of [the pretty little salon]2431-the pretty little salon that [I]159-monsieur creemsvort had not noticed the entrance of [a person]1980-a person into [the larger room]2433-the larger room . It was , however , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle who now addressed [me]159-monsieur creemsvort , and stood close beside [me]159-monsieur creemsvort ; and when [I]159-monsieur creemsvort had bowed with instantaneously recovered sang - froid — for [I]159-monsieur creemsvort am not easily embarrassed — [I]159-monsieur creemsvort commenced the conversation by remarking on the pleasant aspect of [[her]0-i little cabinet]2434-her little cabinet , and the advantage [she]0-i had over [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet in possessing [a garden]2435-a garden . “[159-monsieur creemsvort] Yes , ” [she]0-i said , “[693-she] [she]693-she often thought so ; ” and added , “[693-she] it is [[my]0-i garden]694-my garden , [monsieur]638-monsieur , which makes [me]0-i retain [this house]2024-this house , otherwise [I]0-i should probably have removed to [larger and more commodious premises]697-larger and more commodious premises long since ; but [you]638-monsieur see [I]0-i could not take [[my]0-i garden]694-my garden with [me]0-i , and [I]0-i should scarcely find one so large and pleasant anywhere else in [town]699-town . ” [I]638-monsieur approved [her]0-i judgment . “[638-monsieur] But [you]638-monsieur have not seen it yet , ” said [she]0-i , rising ; “[638-monsieur] come to the window and take a better view . ” [I]638-monsieur followed [her]0-i ; [she]0-i opened the sash , and leaning out [I]638-monsieur saw in full [the enclosed demesne which had hitherto been to [me]638-monsieur [an unknown region]2437-an unknown region]2436-the enclosed demesne which had hitherto been to me an unknown region . [It]2436-the enclosed demesne which had hitherto been to me an unknown region was a long , not very broad strip of cultured ground , with [an alley bordered by enormous old fruit trees]2438-an alley bordered by enormous old fruit trees down the middle ; there was [a sort of lawn]2439-a sort of lawn , a parterre of rose - trees , some flower - borders , and , on the far side , a thickly planted copse of lilacs , laburnums , and acacias . It looked pleasant , to [me]638-monsieur — very pleasant , so long a time had elapsed since [I]638-monsieur had seen [a garden of any sort]2440-a garden of any sort . But it was not only on [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [[Reuter]152-mdlle ’s garden]2441-reuter ’s garden that [my]638-monsieur eyes dwelt ; when [I]638-monsieur had taken a view of [her]152-mdlle well - trimmed beds and budding shrubberies , [I]638-monsieur allowed [my]638-monsieur glance to come back to [herself]152-mdlle , nor did [I]638-monsieur hastily withdraw it . [I]638-monsieur had thought to see [a tall , meagre , yellow , conventual image in black , with a close white cap , bandaged under the chin like a nun]2442-a tall , meagre , yellow , conventual image in black , with a close white cap , bandaged under the chin like a nun ’s head - gear ; whereas , there stood by [me]638-monsieur [a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than [I]638-monsieur , but was still young]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young ; [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young could not , [I]638-monsieur thought , be more than six or seven and twenty ; [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young was as fair as [a fair Englishwoman]2444-a fair englishwoman ; [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young had no cap ; [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young hair was nut - brown , and [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young wore it in curls ; pretty [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young features were not , nor very soft , nor very regular , but neither were they in any degree plain , and [I]638-monsieur already saw cause to deem [them]2445-them expressive . What was [their]2445-them predominant cast ? Was it sagacity?—sense ? Yes , [I]638-monsieur thought so ; but [I]638-monsieur could scarcely as yet be sure . [I]638-monsieur discovered , however , that there was a certain serenity of eye , and freshness of complexion , most pleasing to behold . The colour on [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young cheek was like the bloom on a good apple , which is as sound at the core as it is red on the rind . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle and [I]638-monsieur entered upon business . [She]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young said [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young was not absolutely certain of the wisdom of the step [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young was about to take , because [I]638-monsieur was so young , and [parents]2446-parents might possibly object to [a professor like [me]638-monsieur]2447-a professor like me for [[their]2446-parents daughters]2029-their daughters : “[638-monsieur] But it is often well to act on [one]1983-one ’s own judgment , ” said [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young , “[1983-one] and to lead [parents]2446-parents , rather than be led by [them]2446-parents . The fitness of [a professor]629-a professor is not a matter of age ; and , from what [I]0-i have heard , and from what [I]0-i observe [myself]0-i , [I]0-i would much rather trust [you]703-you than [M. Ledru]160-m. ledru , [the music - master]704-the music - master , who is [a married man of near fifty]705-a married man of near fifty . ” [I]160-m. ledru remarked that [I]160-m. ledru hoped [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young would find [me]160-m. ledru worthy of [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young good opinion ; that if [I]160-m. ledru knew [myself]160-m. ledru , [I]160-m. ledru was incapable of betraying any confidence reposed in [me]160-m. ledru . “[160-m. ledru] Du reste , ” said [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young , “[160-m. ledru] the surveillance will be strictly attended to . ” And then [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young proceeded to discuss the subject of terms . [She]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young was very cautious , quite on [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young guard ; [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young did not absolutely bargain , but [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young warily sounded [me]160-m. ledru to find out what [my]160-m. ledru expectations might be ; and when [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young could not get [me]160-m. ledru to name a sum , [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young reasoned and reasoned with a fluent yet quiet circumlocution of speech , and at last nailed [me]160-m. ledru down to five hundred francs per annum — not too much , but [I]160-m. ledru agreed . Before the negotiation was completed , it began to grow a little dusk . [I]160-m. ledru did not hasten it , for [I]160-m. ledru liked well enough to sit and hear [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young talk ; [I]160-m. ledru was amused with the sort of business talent [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young displayed . [Edward]99-mr. crimsworth could not have shown [himself]99-mr. crimsworth more practical , though [he]99-mr. crimsworth might have evinced more coarseness and urgency ; and then [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young had so many reasons , so many explanations ; and , after all , [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young succeeded in proving [herself]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young quite disinterested and even liberal . At last [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young concluded , [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young could say no more , because , as [I]160-m. ledru acquiesced in all things , there was no further ground for the exercise of [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young parts of speech . [I]160-m. ledru was obliged to rise . [I]160-m. ledru would rather have sat a little longer ; what had [I]160-m. ledru to return to but [[my]160-m. ledru small empty room]2449-my small empty room ? And [my]160-m. ledru eyes had a pleasure in looking at [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , especially now , when the twilight softened [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young features a little , and , in the doubtful dusk , [I]160-m. ledru could fancy [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young forehead as open as it was really elevated , [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young mouth touched with turns of sweetness as well as defined in lines of sense . When [I]160-m. ledru rose to go , [I]160-m. ledru held out [my]160-m. ledru hand , on purpose , though [I]160-m. ledru knew it was contrary to the etiquette of foreign habits ; [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young smiled , and said — “[160-m. ledru] Ah ! c’est comme tous les Anglais , ” but gave [me]160-m. ledru [her]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young hand very kindly . “[160-m. ledru] It is the privilege of [[my]0-i country]706-my country , [Mademoiselle]153-zoraide , ” said [I]153-zoraide ; “[153-zoraide] and , remember , [I]0-i shall always claim it . ” [She]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young laughed a little , quite good - naturedly , and with the sort of tranquillity obvious in all [she]2443-a little and roundly formed woman , who might indeed be older than i , but was still young did — a tranquillity which soothed and suited [me]160-m. ledru singularly , at least [I]160-m. ledru thought so that evening . [Brussels]18-brussels seemed a very pleasant place to [me]160-m. ledru when [I]160-m. ledru got out again into [the street]2240-the street , and it appeared as if some cheerful , eventful , upward - tending career were even then opening to [me]160-m. ledru , on that selfsame mild , still April night . So impressionable [a being]2451-a being is [man]457-man , or at least [such a man as [I]160-m. ledru was in those days]2453-such a man as i was in those days . NEXT day the morning hours seemed to pass very slowly at [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s ; [I]160-m. ledru wanted the afternoon to come that [I]160-m. ledru might go again to [the neighbouring pensionnat]2454-the neighbouring pensionnat and give [my]160-m. ledru first lesson within [[its]2454-the neighbouring pensionnat pleasant precincts]2455-its pleasant precincts ; for pleasant [they]2455-its pleasant precincts appeared to [me]160-m. ledru . At noon the hour of recreation arrived ; at one o’clock [we]2456-we had lunch ; this got on the time , and at last St. Gudule ’s deep bell , tolling slowly two , marked the moment for which [I]160-m. ledru had been waiting . At the foot of the narrow back - stairs that descended from [[my]160-m. ledru room]2457-my room , [I]160-m. ledru met [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet . “[160-m. ledru] Comme vous avez l’air rayonnant ! ” said [he]146-m. pelet . “[160-m. ledru] Je ne vous ai jamais vu aussi gai . Que s’est - il donc passe ? ” “[160-m. ledru] Apparemment que j’aime les changements , ” replied [I.]160-m. ledru “[160-m. ledru] Ah ! je comprends — c’est cela — soyez sage seulement . Vous etes bien jeune — trop jeune pour le role que vous allez jouer ; il faut prendre garde — savez - vous ? ” “[160-m. ledru] Mais quel danger y a - t - il ? ” “[160-m. ledru] Je n’en sais rien — ne vous laissez pas aller a de vives impressions — voila tout . ” [I]160-m. ledru laughed : a sentiment of exquisite pleasure played over [my]160-m. ledru nerves at the thought that “[160-m. ledru] vives impressions ” were likely to be created ; it was the deadness , the sameness of life ’s daily ongoings that had hitherto been [my]160-m. ledru bane ; [my]160-m. ledru blouse - clad “[160-m. ledru] eleves ” in [[the boys]636-the boys ’ seminary]2459-the boys ’ seminary never stirred in [me]160-m. ledru any “[160-m. ledru] vives impressions ” except it might be occasionally some of anger . [I]638-monsieur broke from [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , and as [I]638-monsieur strode down [the passage]2460-the passage [he]146-m. pelet followed [me]638-monsieur with one of [his]146-m. pelet laughs — a very French , rakish , mocking sound . Again [I]638-monsieur stood at the neighbouring door , and soon was re - admitted into [the cheerful passage]2461-the cheerful passage with [its]2461-the cheerful passage clear dove - colour imitation marble walls . [I]638-monsieur followed [the portress]2423-the portress , and descending a step , and making a turn , [I]638-monsieur found [myself]638-monsieur in [a sort of corridor]2463-a sort of corridor ; a side - door opened , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s little figure , as graceful as it was plump , appeared . [I]638-monsieur could now see [her]152-mdlle dress in full daylight ; a neat , simple mousseline - laine gown fitted [her]152-mdlle compact round shape to perfection — delicate little collar and manchettes of lace , trim Parisian brodequins showed [her]152-mdlle neck , wrists , and feet , to complete advantage ; but how grave was [her]152-mdlle face as [she]152-mdlle came suddenly upon [me]638-monsieur ! Solicitude and business were in [her]152-mdlle eye — on [her]152-mdlle forehead ; [she]152-mdlle looked almost stern . [Her]152-mdlle “[638-monsieur] Bon jour , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ” was quite polite , but so orderly , so commonplace , it spread directly a cool , damp towel over [my]638-monsieur “[638-monsieur] vives impressions . ” [The servant]2158-the servant turned back when [[her]2158-the servant mistress]2424-her mistress appeared , and [I]708-monsieur walked slowly along [the corridor]2466-the corridor , side by side with [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle . “[708-monsieur] [Monsieur]708-monsieur will give a lesson in the first class to - day , ” said [she]152-mdlle ; “[638-monsieur] dictation or reading will perhaps be the best thing to begin with , for those are the easiest forms of communicating instruction in a foreign language ; and , at the first , [a master]2226-a master naturally feels a little unsettled . ” [She]152-mdlle was quite right , as [I]710-mesdemoiselles had found from experience ; it only remained for [me]710-mesdemoiselles to acquiesce . [We]2467-we proceeded now in silence . [The corridor]2466-the corridor terminated in [a hall]2469-a hall , large , lofty , and square ; a glass door on one side showed within [a long narrow refectory]2470-a long narrow refectory , with tables , an armoire , and two lamps ; [it]2470-a long narrow refectory was empty ; large glass doors , in front , opened on [the playground and garden]2471-the playground and garden ; a broad staircase ascended spirally on the opposite side ; the remaining wall showed a pair of great folding - doors , now closed , and admitting , doubtless , to the classes . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle turned [her]152-mdlle eye laterally on [me]710-mesdemoiselles , to ascertain , probably , whether [I]710-mesdemoiselles was collected enough to be ushered into [[her]152-mdlle sanctum sanctorum]2472-her sanctum sanctorum . [I]710-mesdemoiselles suppose [she]152-mdlle judged [me]710-mesdemoiselles to be in a tolerable state of self - government , for [she]152-mdlle opened the door , and [I]710-mesdemoiselles followed [her]152-mdlle through . A rustling sound of uprising greeted [our]2467-we entrance ; without looking to the right or left , [I]710-mesdemoiselles walked straight up [the lane]2473-the lane between two sets of benches and desks , and took possession of the empty chair and isolated desk raised on an estrade , of one step high , so as to command [one division]2474-one division ; the other division being under the surveillance of [a maitresse similarly elevated]2475-a maitresse similarly elevated . At the back of [the estrade]2476-the estrade , and attached to a moveable partition dividing [this schoolroom]2477-this schoolroom from another beyond , was a large tableau of wood painted black and varnished ; a thick crayon of white chalk lay on [my]710-mesdemoiselles desk for the convenience of elucidating any grammatical or verbal obscurity which might occur in [my]710-mesdemoiselles lessons by writing it upon the tableau ; a wet sponge appeared beside the chalk , to enable [me]710-mesdemoiselles to efface the marks when they had served the purpose intended . [I]710-mesdemoiselles carefully and deliberately made these observations before allowing [myself]710-mesdemoiselles to take one glance at the benches before [me]710-mesdemoiselles ; having handled the crayon , looked back at the tableau , fingered the sponge in order to ascertain that it was in a right state of moisture , [I]710-mesdemoiselles found [myself]710-mesdemoiselles cool enough to admit of looking calmly up and gazing deliberately round [me]710-mesdemoiselles . And first [I]710-mesdemoiselles observed that [Mdlle . Reuter]152-mdlle had already glided away , [she]152-mdlle was nowhere visible ; [a maitresse]2478-a maitresse or [teacher]2479-teacher , [the one who occupied the corresponding estrade to [my]710-mesdemoiselles own]2480-the one who occupied the corresponding estrade to my own , alone remained to keep guard over [me]710-mesdemoiselles ; [she]152-mdlle was a little in the shade , and , with [my]710-mesdemoiselles short sight , [I]710-mesdemoiselles could only see that [she]152-mdlle was of [a thin bony figure and rather tallowy complexion]2481-a thin bony figure and rather tallowy complexion , and that [her]152-mdlle attitude , as [she]152-mdlle sat , partook equally of listlessness and affectation . More obvious , more prominent , shone on by the full light of the large window , were [the occupants of the benches just before [me]710-mesdemoiselles , of whom some were [girls of fourteen , fifteen , sixteen]2483-girls of fourteen , fifteen , sixteen , [some young women from eighteen ( as it appeared to [me]710-mesdemoiselles ) up to twenty]2484-some young women from eighteen ( as it appeared to me ) up to twenty]2482-the occupants of the benches just before me , of whom some were girls of fourteen , fifteen , sixteen , some young women from eighteen ( as it appeared to me ) up to twenty ; the most modest attire , the simplest fashion of wearing the hair , were apparent in all ; and good features , ruddy , blooming complexions , large and brilliant eyes , forms full , even to solidity , seemed to abound . [I]710-mesdemoiselles did not bear the first view like [a stoic]2485-a stoic ; [I]710-mesdemoiselles was dazzled , [my]710-mesdemoiselles eyes fell , and in a voice somewhat too low [I]710-mesdemoiselles murmured — “[710-mesdemoiselles] Prenez vos cahiers de dictee , [mesdemoiselles]710-mesdemoiselles . ” Not so had [I]710-mesdemoiselles bid [the boys at Pelet]2486-the boys at pelet ’s take [their]2486-the boys at pelet reading - books . A rustle followed , and an opening of desks ; behind the lifted lids which momentarily screened the heads bent down to search for exercise - books , [I]710-mesdemoiselles heard tittering and whispers . “[710-mesdemoiselles] [Eulalie]161-eulalie , je suis prete a pleuer de rire , ” observed one . “[161-eulalie] Comme il a rougi en parlant ! ” “[710-mesdemoiselles] Oui , c’est un veritable blanc - bec . ” “[162-hortense] Tais - toi , [Hortense]162-hortense — il nous ecoute . ” And now the lids sank and the heads reappeared ; [I]162-hortense had marked three , [the whisperers]2487-the whisperers , and [I]162-hortense did not scruple to take a very steady look at [them]2487-the whisperers as [they]2487-the whisperers emerged from [their]2487-the whisperers temporary eclipse . It is astonishing what ease and courage [their]2487-the whisperers little phrases of flippancy had given [me]162-hortense ; the idea by which [I]162-hortense had been awed was that the youthful beings before [me]162-hortense , with [their]2487-the whisperers dark nun - like robes and softly braided hair , were [a kind of half - angels]2488-a kind of half - angels . The light titter , the giddy whisper , had already in some measure relieved [my]162-hortense mind of that fond and oppressive fancy . The three [I]162-hortense allude to were just in front , within half a yard of [my]162-hortense estrade , and were among the most womanly - looking present . [Their]2487-the whisperers names [I]162-hortense knew afterwards , and may as well mention now ; [they]2487-the whisperers were [Eulalie]161-eulalie , [Hortense]162-hortense , [Caroline]163-caroline . [Eulalie]161-eulalie was tall , and very finely shaped : [she]161-eulalie was fair , and [her]161-eulalie features were those of [a Low Country Madonna]2489-a low country madonna ; many a “[162-hortense] figure de Vierge ” have [I]162-hortense seen in Dutch pictures exactly resembling [hers]161-eulalie ; there were no angles in [her]161-eulalie shape or in [her]161-eulalie face , all was curve and roundness — neither thought , sentiment , nor passion disturbed by line or flush the equality of [her]161-eulalie pale , clear skin ; [her]161-eulalie noble bust heaved with [her]161-eulalie regular breathing , [her]161-eulalie eyes moved a little — by these evidences of life alone could [I]162-hortense have distinguished [her]161-eulalie from [some large handsome figure moulded in wax]2490-some large handsome figure moulded in wax . [Hortense]162-hortense was of middle size and stout , [her]162-hortense form was ungraceful , [her]162-hortense face striking , more alive and brilliant than [Eulalie]161-eulalie ’s , [her]162-hortense hair was dark brown , [her]162-hortense complexion richly coloured ; there were frolic and mischief in [her]162-hortense eye : consistency and good sense [she]162-hortense might possess , but none of [her]162-hortense features betokened those qualities . [Caroline]163-caroline was little , though evidently full grown ; raven - black hair , very dark eyes , absolutely regular features , with a colourless olive complexion , clear as to the face and sallow about the neck , formed in [her]163-caroline that assemblage of points whose union [many persons]2491-many persons regard as the perfection of beauty . How , with the tintless pallor of [her]163-caroline skin and the classic straightness of [her]163-caroline lineaments , [she]163-caroline managed to look sensual , [I]162-hortense do n’t know . [I]162-hortense think [her]163-caroline lips and eyes contrived the affair between [them]2492-them , and the result left no uncertainty on [the beholder]2493-the beholder ’s mind . [She]163-caroline was sensual now , and in ten years ’ time [she]163-caroline would be coarse — promise plain was written in [her]163-caroline face of much future folly . If [I]162-hortense looked at [these girls]2494-these girls with little scruple , [they]2494-these girls looked at [me]162-hortense with still less . [Eulalie]161-eulalie raised [her]161-eulalie unmoved eye to [mine]162-hortense , and seemed to expect , passively but securely , an impromptu tribute to [her]161-eulalie majestic charms . [Hortense]162-hortense regarded [me]162-hortense boldly , and giggled at the same time , while [she]162-hortense said , with an air of impudent freedom — “[162-hortense] Dictez - nous quelquechose de facile pour commencer , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ” [Caroline]163-caroline shook [her]163-caroline loose ringlets of abundant but somewhat coarse hair over [her]163-caroline rolling black eyes ; parting [her]163-caroline lips , as full as those of [a hot - blooded Maroon]2495-a hot - blooded maroon , [she]163-caroline showed [her]163-caroline well - set teeth sparkling between them , and treated [me]638-monsieur at the same time to a smile “[638-monsieur] de sa facon . ” Beautiful as [Pauline Borghese]164-pauline borghese , [she]163-caroline looked at the moment scarcely purer than [Lucrece de Borgia]165-lucrece de borgia . [Caroline]163-caroline was of [noble family]2496-noble family . [I]638-monsieur heard [[her]163-caroline lady - mother]2497-her lady - mother ’s character afterwards , and then [I]638-monsieur ceased to wonder at the precocious accomplishments of [the daughter]2498-the daughter . [These three]2499-these three , [I]638-monsieur at once saw , deemed [themselves]2499-these three [the queens of [the school]2501-the school]2500-the queens of the school , and conceived that by [their]2499-these three splendour [they]2499-these three threw all the rest into the shade . In less than five minutes [they]2499-these three had thus revealed to [me]638-monsieur [[their]2499-these three characters]2502-their characters , and in less than five minutes [I]638-monsieur had buckled on a breast - plate of steely indifference , and let down a visor of impassible austerity . “[638-monsieur] Take [your]712-your pens and commence writing , ” said [I]638-monsieur , in as dry and trite a voice as if [I]638-monsieur had been addressing only [Jules Vanderkelkov]149-jules vanderkelkov and [Co. The dictee]2503-co. the dictee now commenced . [[My]638-monsieur three belles]2504-my three belles interrupted [me]638-monsieur perpetually with little silly questions and uncalled - for remarks , to some of which [I]638-monsieur made no answer , and to others replied very quietly and briefly . “[638-monsieur] Comment dit - on point et virgule en Anglais , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ” “[638-monsieur] Semi - colon , mademoiselle . ” “[638-monsieur] Semi - collong ? Ah , comme c’est drole ! ” ( giggle . ) “[638-monsieur] J’ai une si mauvaise plume — impossible d’ecrire ! ” “[638-monsieur] Mais , [monsieur]638-monsieur — je ne sais pas suivre — vous allez si vite . ” “[638-monsieur] Je n’ai rien compris , moi ! ” Here a general murmur arose , and [the teacher]2505-the teacher , opening [her]2505-the teacher lips for the first time , ejaculated — “[710-mesdemoiselles] Silence , [mesdemoiselles]710-mesdemoiselles ! ” No silence followed — on the contrary , [the three ladies in front]2506-the three ladies in front began to talk more loudly . “[710-mesdemoiselles] C’est si difficile , l’Anglais ! ” “[638-monsieur] Je deteste la dictee . ” “[638-monsieur] Quel ennui d’ecrire quelquechose que l’on ne comprend pas ! ” [Some of [those behind]2508-those behind]2507-some of those behind laughed : a degree of confusion began to pervade [the class]2509-the class ; it was necessary to take prompt measures . “[710-mesdemoiselles] Donnez - moi votre cahier , ” said [I]710-mesdemoiselles to [Eulalie]161-eulalie in an abrupt tone ; and bending over , [I]710-mesdemoiselles took it before [she]161-eulalie had time to give it . “[710-mesdemoiselles] Et vous , mademoiselle — donnez - moi le votre , ” continued [I]638-monsieur , more mildly , addressing [a little pale , plain looking girl who sat in the first row of the other division]2510-a little pale , plain looking girl who sat in the first row of the other division , and whom [I]638-monsieur had remarked as being at once [the ugliest and the most attentive in [the room]1922-the room]2511-the ugliest and the most attentive in the room ; [she]161-eulalie rose up , walked over to [me]638-monsieur , and delivered [her]161-eulalie book with a grave , modest curtsey . [I]638-monsieur glanced over the two dictations ; [Eulalie]161-eulalie ’s was slurred , blotted , and full of silly mistakes — [Sylvie]166-sylvie ’s ( such was the name of [the ugly little girl]2513-the ugly little girl ) was clearly written , it contained no error against sense , and but few faults of orthography . [I]638-monsieur coolly read aloud both exercises , marking the faults — then [I]638-monsieur looked at [Eulalie]161-eulalie : “[638-monsieur] C’est honteux ! ” said [I]638-monsieur , and [I]638-monsieur deliberately tore [her]161-eulalie dictation in four parts , and presented [her]161-eulalie with the fragments . [I]638-monsieur returned [Sylvie]166-sylvie [her]166-sylvie book with a smile , saying — “[638-monsieur] C’est bien — je suis content de vous . ” [Sylvie]166-sylvie looked calmly pleased , [Eulalie]161-eulalie swelled like [an incensed turkey]2514-an incensed turkey , but the mutiny was quelled : the conceited coquetry and futile flirtation of the first bench were exchanged for a taciturn sullenness , much more convenient to [me]638-monsieur , and the rest of [my]638-monsieur lesson passed without interruption . A bell clanging out in [the yard]2127-the yard announced the moment for the cessation of school labours . [I]638-monsieur heard [our]2516-our own bell at the same time , and that of [a certain public college]2517-a certain public college immediately after .
