Order dissolved instantly ; up started [every pupil]2518-every pupil , [I]638-monsieur hastened to seize [my]638-monsieur hat , bow to [the maitresse]2519-the maitresse , and quit [the room]1922-the room before the tide of [externats]2250-externats should pour from the inner class , where [I]638-monsieur knew near a hundred were prisoned , and whose rising tumult [I]638-monsieur already heard . [I]638-monsieur had scarcely crossed [the hall]1910-the hall and gained [the corridor]2466-the corridor , when [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle came again upon [me]638-monsieur . “[638-monsieur] Step in [here]398-here a moment , ” said [she]152-mdlle , and [she]152-mdlle held open the door of [the side room]2524-the side room from whence [she]152-mdlle had issued on [my]638-monsieur arrival ; it was a salle - à - manger , as appeared from the beaufet and the armoire vitree , filled with glass and china , which formed part of [its]398-here furniture . Ere [she]152-mdlle had closed the door on [me]638-monsieur and [herself]152-mdlle , [the corridor]2466-the corridor was already filled with [day - pupils]2526-day - pupils , tearing down [their]2526-day - pupils cloaks , bonnets , and cabas from the wooden pegs on which [they]2526-day - pupils were suspended ; the shrill voice of [a maitresse]2478-a maitresse was heard at intervals vainly endeavouring to enforce some sort of order ; vainly , [I]638-monsieur say : discipline there was none in these rough ranks , and yet this was considered [one of the best - conducted schools in [Brussels]18-brussels]2528-one of the best - conducted schools in brussels . “[638-monsieur] Well , [you]717-you have given [your]717-you first lesson , ” began [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle in the most calm , equable voice , as though quite unconscious of the chaos from which [we]2529-we were separated only by a single wall . “[717-you] Were [you]717-you satisfied with [[your]717-you pupils]718-your pupils , or did any circumstance in [their]718-your pupils conduct give [you]717-you cause for complaint ? Conceal nothing from [me]0-i , repose in [me]0-i entire confidence . ” Happily , [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc felt in [myself]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc complete power to manage [[my]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc pupils]2276-my pupils without aid ; the enchantment , the golden haze which had dazzled [my]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc perspicuity at first , had been a good deal dissipated . [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc can not say [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc was chagrined or downcast by the contrast which the reality of [a pensionnat de demoiselles]2531-a pensionnat de demoiselles presented to [my]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc vague ideal of [the same community]2532-the same community ; [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc was only enlightened and amused ; consequently , [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc felt in no disposition to complain to [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , and [I]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc received [her]152-mdlle considerate invitation to confidence with a smile . “[720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc] A thousand thanks , [mademoiselle]719-mademoiselle , all has gone very smoothly . ” [She]152-mdlle looked more than doubtful . “[720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc] Et [les trois demoiselles du premier banc]720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc ? ” said [she]152-mdlle . “[720-les trois demoiselles du premier banc] Ah ! tout va au mieux ! ” was [my]721-me answer , and [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ceased to question [me]721-me ; but [her]152-mdlle eye — not large , not brilliant , not melting , or kindling , but astute , penetrating , practical , showed [she]152-mdlle was even with [me]721-me ; it let out a momentary gleam , which said plainly , “[721-me] Be as close as [you]721-me like , [I]0-i am not dependent on [your]721-me candour ; what [you]721-me would conceal [I]0-i already know . ” By a transition so quiet as to be scarcely perceptible , [the directress]2533-the directress ’s manner changed ; the anxious business - air passed from [her]152-mdlle face , and [she]152-mdlle began chatting about the weather and [the town]2149-the town , and asking in neighbourly wise after [M.]146-m. pelet and [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet . [I]0-i answered all [her]152-mdlle little questions ; [she]152-mdlle prolonged [her]152-mdlle talk , [I]0-i went on following its many little windings ; [she]152-mdlle sat so long , said so much , varied so often the topics of discourse , that it was not difficult to perceive [she]152-mdlle had a particular aim in thus detaining [me]0-i . [Her]152-mdlle mere words could have afforded no clue to this aim , but [her]152-mdlle countenance aided ; while [her]152-mdlle lips uttered only affable commonplaces , [her]152-mdlle eyes reverted continually to [my]0-i face . [Her]152-mdlle glances were not given in full , but out of the corners , so quietly , so stealthily , yet [I]0-i think [I]0-i lost not one . [I]0-i watched [her]152-mdlle as keenly as [she]152-mdlle watched [me]0-i ; [I]0-i perceived soon that [she]152-mdlle was feeling after [my]0-i real character ; [she]152-mdlle was searching for salient points , and weak points , and eccentric points ; [she]152-mdlle was applying now this test , now that , hoping in the end to find some chink , some niche , where [she]152-mdlle could put in [her]152-mdlle little firm foot and stand upon [my]0-i neck — mistress of [my]0-i nature . Do not mistake [me]0-i , [reader]2168-reader , it was no amorous influence [she]152-mdlle wished to gain — at that time it was only the power of the politician to which [she]152-mdlle aspired ; [I]0-i was now installed as [a professor in [[her]152-mdlle establishment]2537-her establishment]2536-a professor in her establishment , and [she]152-mdlle wanted to know where [her]152-mdlle mind was superior to [mine]0-i — by what feeling or opinion [she]152-mdlle could lead [me]0-i . [I]0-i enjoyed the game much , and did not hasten its conclusion ; sometimes [I]0-i gave [her]152-mdlle hopes , beginning a sentence rather weakly , when [her]152-mdlle shrewd eye would light up — [she]152-mdlle thought [she]152-mdlle had [me]0-i ; having led [her]152-mdlle a little way , [I]0-i delighted to turn round and finish with sound , hard sense , whereat [her]152-mdlle countenance would fall . At last [a servant]367-a servant entered to announce dinner ; the conflict being thus necessarily terminated , [we]2539-we parted without having gained any advantage on either side : [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle had not even given [me]0-i an opportunity of attacking [her]152-mdlle with feeling , and [I]0-i had managed to baffle [her]152-mdlle little schemes of craft . It was a regular drawn battle . [I]0-i again held out [my]0-i hand when [I]0-i left [the room]1922-the room , [she]152-mdlle gave [me]0-i [hers]152-mdlle ; it was a small and white hand , but how cool ! [I]0-i met [her]152-mdlle eye too in full — obliging [her]152-mdlle to give [me]0-i a straightforward look ; this last test went against [me]0-i : it left [her]152-mdlle as it found [her]152-mdlle — moderate , temperate , tranquil ; [me]0-i it disappointed . “[0-i] [I]0-i am growing wiser , ” thought [I]0-i , as [I]0-i walked back to [M. Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet . “[0-i] Look at [this little woman]722-this little woman ; is [she]722-this little woman like [the women of [novelists]724-novelists and [romancers]725-romancers]723-the women of novelists and romancers ? To read of female character as depicted in Poetry and Fiction , one would think it was made up of sentiment , either for good or bad — here is a specimen , and a most sensible and respectable specimen , too , whose staple ingredient is abstract reason . [No Talleyrand]167-no talleyrand was ever more passionless than [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide ! ” So [I]153-zoraide thought then ; [I]153-zoraide found afterwards that blunt susceptibilities are very consistent with strong propensities . [I]153-zoraide HAD indeed had a very long talk with [the crafty little politician]2541-the crafty little politician , and on regaining [[my]153-zoraide quarters]2542-my quarters , [I]153-zoraide found that dinner was half over . To be late at meals was against a standing rule of the establishment , and had it been one of [the Flemish ushers who thus entered after the removal of the soup and the commencement of the first course]2543-the flemish ushers who thus entered after the removal of the soup and the commencement of the first course , [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet would probably have greeted [him]2541-the crafty little politician with a public rebuke , and would certainly have mulcted [him]2541-the crafty little politician both of soup and fish ; as it was , [that polite though partial gentleman]2544-that polite though partial gentleman only shook [his]2544-that polite though partial gentleman head , and as [I]153-zoraide took [my]153-zoraide place , unrolled [my]153-zoraide napkin , and said [my]153-zoraide heretical grace to [myself]153-zoraide , [he]2544-that polite though partial gentleman civilly despatched [a servant]367-a servant to [the kitchen]2370-the kitchen , to bring [me]153-zoraide a plate of “[153-zoraide] puree aux carottes ” ( for this was a maigre - day ) , and before sending away the first course , reserved for [me]153-zoraide a portion of the stock - fish of which it consisted . Dinner being over , [the boys]636-the boys rushed out for [their]636-the boys evening play ; [Kint]168-kint and [Vandam]169-vandam ( [the two ushers]2548-the two ushers ) of course followed [them]636-the boys . [Poor fellows]2549-poor fellows ! if [they]2549-poor fellows had not looked so very heavy , so very soulless , so very indifferent to all things in [heaven above]2550-heaven above or in [the earth beneath]2551-the earth beneath , [I]153-zoraide could have pitied [them]2549-poor fellows greatly for the obligation [they]2549-poor fellows were under to trail after [those rough lads]2552-those rough lads everywhere and at all times ; even as it was , [I]153-zoraide felt disposed to scout [myself]153-zoraide as [a privileged prig]2553-a privileged prig when [I]153-zoraide turned to ascend to [[my]153-zoraide chamber]369-my chamber , sure to find there , if not enjoyment , at least liberty ; but this evening ( as had often happened before ) [I]153-zoraide was to be still farther distinguished . “[153-zoraide] Eh bien , mauvais sujet ! ” said the voice of [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , and [he]146-m. pelet chuckled inwardly . “[749-my wife] There is character about [her]749-my wife mouth — firmness — but [she]749-my wife has a very pleasant smile ; do n’t [you]638-monsieur think so ? ” “[638-monsieur] Rather crafty . ” “[638-monsieur] True , but that expression of craft is owing to [her]749-my wife eyebrows ; have [you]638-monsieur remarked [her]749-my wife eyebrows ? ” [I]638-monsieur answered that [I]638-monsieur had not . “[638-monsieur] [You]638-monsieur have not seen [her]749-my wife looking down then ? ” said [he]638-monsieur . “[638-monsieur] No . ” “[638-monsieur] It is a treat , notwithstanding . Observe [her]749-my wife when [she]749-my wife has some knitting , or [some other woman]753-some other woman ’s work in hand , and sits the image of peace , calmly intent on [her]749-my wife needles and [her]749-my wife silk , some discussion meantime going on around [her]749-my wife , in the course of which peculiarities of character are being developed , or important interests canvassed ; [she]749-my wife takes no part in it ; [her]749-my wife humble , feminine mind is wholly with [her]749-my wife knitting ; none of [her]749-my wife features move ; [she]749-my wife neither presumes to smile approval , nor frown disapprobation ; [her]749-my wife little hands assiduously ply their unpretending task ; if [she]749-my wife can only get this purse finished , or this bonnet - grec completed , it is enough for [her]749-my wife . Pelet]146-m. pelet , “[0-i] the eyelid will flicker , the light - coloured lashes be lifted a second , and a blue eye , glancing out from under the screen , will take its brief , sly , searching survey , and retreat again . ” [I]755-i smiled , and so did [Pelet]146-m. pelet , and after a few minutes ’ silence , [I]755-i asked : “[755-i] Will [she]749-my wife ever marry , do [you]755-i think ? ” “[749-my wife] Marry ! Will [birds]756-birds pair ? Of course it is both [her]749-my wife intention and resolution to marry when [she]749-my wife finds a suitable match , and [no one]757-no one is better aware than [herself]749-my wife of the sort of impression [she]749-my wife is capable of producing ; [no one]757-no one likes better to captivate in a quiet way . At first [I]0-i thought [them]765-these blooming young creatures angels , but [they]765-these blooming young creatures did not leave [me]0-i long under that delusion ; three of [the eldest and handsomest]766-the eldest and handsomest undertook the task of setting [me]0-i right , and [they]765-these blooming young creatures managed so cleverly that in five minutes [I]0-i knew [them]765-these blooming young creatures , at least , for what [they]765-these blooming young creatures were — [three arrant coquettes]767-three arrant coquettes . ” “[767-three arrant coquettes] Je les connais ! ” exclaimed [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet . “[767-three arrant coquettes] Elles sont toujours au premier rang a l’eglise et a la promenade ; [une blonde superbe]768-une blonde superbe , [une jolie espiegle]769-une jolie espiegle , une belle brune . ” “[768-une blonde superbe] Exactly . ” “[768-une blonde superbe] Lovely creatures all of [them]770-their — heads for [artists]771-artists ; what a group [they]770-their would make , taken together ! [Eulalie]161-eulalie ( [I]0-i know [their]770-their names ) , with [her]161-eulalie smooth braided hair and calm ivory brow . [Hortense]162-hortense , with [her]162-hortense rich chesnut locks so luxuriantly knotted , plaited , twisted , as if [she]162-hortense did not know how to dispose of all [their]770-their abundance , with [her]162-hortense vermilion lips , damask cheek , and roguish laughing eye . And [Caroline de Blemont]163-caroline ! Ah , there is beauty ! beauty in perfection . What a cloud of sable curls about the face of [a houri]772-a houri ! What fascinating lips ! What glorious black eyes ! [[Your]773-i Byron]774-your byron would have worshipped [her]162-hortense , and [you]773-i — [you]773-i cold , frigid islander!—you played the austere , the insensible in the presence of [an Aphrodite so exquisite]775-an aphrodite so exquisite ? ” [I]773-i might have laughed at [the director]2349-the director ’s enthusiasm had [I]773-i believed it real , but there was something in [his]2349-the director tone which indicated got - up raptures . [I]773-i felt [he]2349-the director was only affecting fervour in order to put [me]773-i off [my]773-i guard , to induce [me]773-i to come out in return , so [I]773-i scarcely even smiled . [He]2349-the director went on : “[773-i] Confess , [William]103-william , do not the mere good looks of [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide appear dowdyish and commonplace compared with the splendid charms of [some of [[her]153-zoraide pupils]777-her pupils]776-some of her pupils ? ” The question discomposed [me]773-i , but [I]773-i now felt plainly that [[my]773-i principal]2291-my principal was endeavouring ( for reasons best known to [himself]2291-my principal — at that time [I]773-i could not fathom them ) to excite ideas and wishes in [my]773-i mind alien to what was right and honourable . The iniquity of the instigation proved its antidote , and when [he]2291-my principal further added : — “[773-i] [Each of [those three beautiful girls]779-those three beautiful girls]778-each of those three beautiful girls will have a handsome fortune ; and with a little address , [a gentlemanlike , intelligent young fellow like [you]103-william]780-a gentlemanlike , intelligent young fellow like you might make [himself]780-a gentlemanlike , intelligent young fellow like you master of the hand , heart , and purse of [any one of [the trio]782-the trio]781-any one of the trio . ” [I]638-monsieur replied by a look and an interrogative “[638-monsieur] [Monsieur]638-monsieur ? ” which startled [him]2291-my principal . [He]2291-my principal laughed a forced laugh , affirmed that [he]2291-my principal had only been joking , and demanded whether [I]638-monsieur could possibly have thought [him]2291-my principal in earnest . Just then the bell rang ; the play - hour was over ; it was an evening on which [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet was accustomed to read passages from the drama and the belles lettres to [[his]146-m. pelet pupils]2563-his pupils . [He]146-m. pelet did not wait for [my]638-monsieur answer , but rising , left [the room]1922-the room , humming as [he]146-m. pelet went some gay strain of Beranger ’s . DAILY , as [I]638-monsieur continued [my]638-monsieur attendance at [the seminary of Mdlle]2565-the seminary of mdlle . [Reuter]153-zoraide , did [I]638-monsieur find fresh occasions to compare the ideal with the real . What had [I]638-monsieur known of [female character]2566-female character previously to [my]638-monsieur arrival at [Brussels]18-brussels ? Precious little . And what was [my]638-monsieur notion of it ? Something vague , slight , gauzy , glittering ; now when [I]638-monsieur came in contact with it [I]638-monsieur found it to be a palpable substance enough ; very hard too sometimes , and often heavy ; there was metal in it , both lead and iron . Let [the idealists]2567-the idealists , [the dreamers about earthly angel]2568-the dreamers about earthly angel and human flowers , just look here while [I]638-monsieur open [my]638-monsieur portfolio and show [them]2567-the idealists a sketch or two , pencilled after nature . [I]638-monsieur took these sketches in [the second - class schoolroom of [Mdlle . Reuter]152-mdlle ’s establishment]2569-the second - class schoolroom of mdlle . reuter ’s establishment , where about a hundred specimens of [the genus “[638-monsieur] jeune fille ” collected together]2570-the genus “ jeune fille ” collected together offered a fertile variety of subject . A miscellaneous assortment they were , differing both in caste and [country]2571-country ; as [I]638-monsieur sat on [my]638-monsieur estrade and glanced over the long range of desks , [I]638-monsieur had under [my]638-monsieur eye French , English , [Belgians]2212-belgians , [Austrians]2573-austrians , and [Prussians]2574-prussians . [The majority]2575-the majority belonged to [the class bourgeois]2576-the class bourgeois ; but there were [many countesses]2577-many countesses , there were [the daughters of [two generals]2579-two generals]2578-the daughters of two generals and of several [colonels]2580-colonels , [captains]2581-captains , and [government employés]2582-government employés ; [these ladies]2583-these ladies sat side by side with [young females destined to be [demoiselles de magasins]2585-demoiselles de magasins]2584-young females destined to be demoiselles de magasins , and with [some Flamandes]2586-some flamandes , [genuine aborigines of [the country]334-the country]2587-genuine aborigines of the country . In dress all were nearly similar , and in manners there was small difference ; exceptions there were to the general rule , but [the majority]2575-the majority gave the tone to the establishment , and that tone was rough , boisterous , masked by a point - blank disregard of all forbearance towards each other or [[their]2575-the majority teachers]2590-their teachers ; an eager pursuit by [each individual]2591-each individual of [her]2591-each individual own interest and convenience ; and a coarse indifference to the interest and convenience of [every one else]2592-every one else . [Most of [them]2575-the majority]2593-most of them could lie with audacity when it appeared advantageous to do so . [All]2594-all understood the art of speaking fair when a point was to be gained , and could with consummate skill and at a moment ’s notice turn the cold shoulder the instant civility ceased to be profitable . Very little open quarrelling ever took place amongst [them]2575-the majority ; but backbiting and talebearing were universal . Close friendships were forbidden by the rules of [the school]2501-the school , and [no one girl]2596-no one girl seemed to cultivate more regard for [another]2597-another than was just necessary to secure [a companion]2598-a companion when solitude would have been irksome . [They]2575-the majority were each and all supposed to have been reared in utter unconsciousness of vice . The precautions used to keep [them]2575-the majority ignorant , if not innocent , were innumerable . How was it , then , that [scarcely one of [those girls having attained the age of fourteen]2600-those girls having attained the age of fourteen]2599-scarcely one of those girls having attained the age of fourteen could look [a man in the face with modesty and propriety]2601-a man in the face with modesty and propriety ? An air of bold , impudent flirtation , or [a loose , silly leer]2602-a loose , silly leer , was sure to answer the most ordinary glance from a masculine eye . [I]638-monsieur know nothing of the arcana of the Roman Catholic religion , and [I]638-monsieur am not [a bigot in matters of theology]2603-a bigot in matters of theology , but [I]638-monsieur suspect the root of this precocious impurity , so obvious , so general in [Popish countries]2604-popish countries , is to be found in the discipline , if not the doctrines of [the Church of [Rome]38-rome]2605-the church of rome . [I]638-monsieur record what [I]638-monsieur have seen : [these girls]2494-these girls belonged to what are called [the respectable ranks of society]2607-the respectable ranks of society ; [they]2494-these girls had all been carefully brought up , yet was the mass of [them]2494-these girls mentally depraved . So much for the general view : now for [one or two selected specimens]2608-one or two selected specimens . The first picture is a full length of [Aurelia Koslow]170-aurelia , [a German fraulein]2609-a german fraulein , or rather [a half - breed between German and [Russian]171-russian]2610-a half - breed between german and russian . [She]170-aurelia is eighteen years of age , and has been sent to [Brussels]18-brussels to finish [her]170-aurelia education ; [she]170-aurelia is of middle size , stiffly made , body long , legs short , bust much developed but not compactly moulded , waist disproportionately compressed by an inhumanly braced corset , dress carefully arranged , large feet tortured into small bottines , head small , hair smoothed , braided , oiled , and gummed to perfection ; very low forehead , very diminutive and vindictive grey eyes , somewhat Tartar features , rather flat nose , rather high - cheek bones , yet the ensemble not positively ugly ; tolerably good complexion . So much for [person]1956-person . As to mind , deplorably ignorant and ill - informed : incapable of writing or speaking correctly even German , [her]170-aurelia native tongue , a dunce in French , and [her]170-aurelia attempts at learning English a mere farce , yet [she]170-aurelia has been at school twelve years ; but as [she]170-aurelia invariably gets [her]170-aurelia exercises , of every description , done by [a fellow pupil]2612-a fellow pupil , and reads [her]170-aurelia lessons off a book concealed in [her]170-aurelia lap , it is not wonderful that [her]170-aurelia progress has been so snail - like . [I]638-monsieur do not know what [Aurelia]170-aurelia ’s daily habits of life are , because [I]638-monsieur have not the opportunity of observing [her]170-aurelia at all times ; but from what [I]638-monsieur see of the state of [her]170-aurelia desk , books , and papers , [I]638-monsieur should say [she]170-aurelia is slovenly and even dirty ; [her]170-aurelia outward dress , as [I]638-monsieur have said , is well attended to , but in passing behind [her]170-aurelia bench , [I]638-monsieur have remarked that [her]170-aurelia neck is gray for want of washing , and [her]170-aurelia hair , so glossy with gum and grease , is not such as [one]1983-one feels tempted to pass the hand over , much less to run the fingers through . [Aurelia]170-aurelia ’s conduct in class , at least when [I]638-monsieur am present , is something extraordinary , considered as an index of girlish innocence . The moment [I]638-monsieur enter [the room]1922-the room , [she]170-aurelia nudges [[her]170-aurelia next neighbour]2615-her next neighbour and indulges in a half - suppressed laugh . As [I]638-monsieur take [my]638-monsieur seat on the estrade , [she]170-aurelia fixes [her]170-aurelia eye on [me]638-monsieur ; [she]170-aurelia seems resolved to attract , and , if possible , monopolize [my]638-monsieur notice : to this end [she]170-aurelia launches at [me]638-monsieur all sorts of looks , languishing , provoking , leering , laughing . As [I]638-monsieur am found quite proof against this sort of artillery — for [we]2616-we scorn what , unasked , is lavishly offered — [she]170-aurelia has recourse to the expedient of making noises ; sometimes [she]170-aurelia sighs , sometimes groans , sometimes utters inarticulate sounds , for which language has no name . If , in walking up [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom , [I]638-monsieur pass near [her]170-aurelia , [she]170-aurelia puts out [her]170-aurelia foot that it may touch [mine]638-monsieur ; if [I]638-monsieur do not happen to observe the manoeuvre , and [my]638-monsieur boot comes in contact with [her]170-aurelia brodequin , [she]170-aurelia affects to fall into convulsions of suppressed laughter ; if [I]638-monsieur notice the snare and avoid it , [she]170-aurelia expresses [her]170-aurelia mortification in sullen muttering , where [I]638-monsieur hear [myself]638-monsieur abused in bad French , pronounced with an intolerable Low German accent . Not far from [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Koslow]170-aurelia sits [another young lady]2618-another young lady by name [Adele Dronsart]172-adele : this is [a Belgian , rather low of stature , in form heavy , with broad waist , short neck and limbs]2619-a belgian , rather low of stature , in form heavy , with broad waist , short neck and limbs , good red and white complexion , features well chiselled and regular , well - cut eyes of a clear brown colour , light brown hair , good teeth , age not much above fifteen , but as full - grown as [a stout young Englishwoman of twenty]2620-a stout young englishwoman of twenty . This portrait gives the idea of [a somewhat dumpy but good - looking damsel]2621-a somewhat dumpy but good - looking damsel , does it not ? Well , when [I]638-monsieur looked along the row of young heads , [my]638-monsieur eye generally stopped at this of [Adele]172-adele ’s ; [her]170-aurelia gaze was ever waiting for [mine]638-monsieur , and it frequently succeeded in arresting it . [She]172-adele was [an unnatural - looking being]2622-an unnatural - looking being — so young , fresh , blooming , yet so Gorgon - like . Suspicion , sullen ill - temper were on [her]172-adele forehead , vicious propensities in [her]172-adele eye , envy and panther - like deceit about [her]172-adele mouth . In general [she]172-adele sat very still ; [her]172-adele massive shape looked as if it could not bend much , nor did [her]172-adele large head — so broad at the base , so narrow towards the top — seem made to turn readily on [her]172-adele short neck . [She]172-adele had but two varieties of expression ; the prevalent one a forbidding , dissatisfied scowl , varied sometimes by a most pernicious and perfidious smile . [She]172-adele was shunned by [[her]172-adele fellow - pupils]2623-her fellow - pupils , for , bad as many of [them]2623-her fellow - pupils were , [few]2624-few were as bad as [she]172-adele . [Aurelia]170-aurelia and [Adele]172-adele were in the first division of [the second class]2625-the second class ; [the second division]2626-the second division was headed by [a pensionnaire named [Juanna Trista]173-juanna trista]2627-a pensionnaire named juanna trista . [This girl]2628-this girl was of mixed Belgian and Spanish origin ; [[her]2628-this girl Flemish mother]2629-her flemish mother was dead , [[her]2628-this girl Catalonian father]2630-her catalonian father was [a merchant residing in [the — — [Isles]39-isles]2632-the — — isles , where [Juanna]173-juanna trista had been born and whence [she]173-juanna trista was sent to [Europe]40-europe to be educated]2631-a merchant residing in the — — isles , where juanna had been born and whence she was sent to europe to be educated . [I]638-monsieur wonder that [any one]447-any one , looking at [that girl]2634-that girl ’s head and countenance , would have received [her]2634-that girl under [their]447-any one roof . [She]2634-that girl had precisely the same shape of skull as [Pope Alexander the Sixth]174-pope alexander the sixth ; [her]2634-that girl organs of benevolence , veneration , conscientiousness , adhesiveness , were singularly small , those of self - esteem , firmness , destructiveness , combativeness , preposterously large ; [her]2634-that girl head sloped up in the penthouse shape , was contracted about the forehead , and prominent behind ; [she]2634-that girl had rather good , though large and marked features ; [her]2634-that girl temperament was fibrous and bilious , [her]2634-that girl complexion pale and dark , hair and eyes black , form angular and rigid but proportionate , age fifteen . [Juanna]173-juanna trista was not very thin , but [she]2634-that girl had a gaunt visage , and [her]2634-that girl “[638-monsieur] regard ” was fierce and hungry ; narrow as was [her]2634-that girl brow , it presented space enough for the legible graving of two words , Mutiny and Hate ; in some one of [her]2634-that girl other lineaments [I]638-monsieur think the eye — cowardice had also its distinct cipher . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Trista]173-juanna trista thought fit to trouble [my]638-monsieur first lessons with a coarse work - day sort of turbulence ; [she]173-juanna trista made noises with [her]173-juanna trista mouth like a horse , [she]173-juanna trista ejected [her]173-juanna trista saliva , [she]173-juanna trista uttered brutal expressions ; behind and below [her]173-juanna trista were seated a band of very vulgar , inferior - looking [Flamandes]175-flamandes , including two or three examples of that deformity of person and imbecility of intellect whose frequency in [the Low Countries]41-the low countries would seem to furnish proof that the climate is such as to induce degeneracy of the human mind and body ; these , [I]638-monsieur soon found , were completely under [her]173-juanna trista influence , and with [their]2635-their aid [she]173-juanna trista got up and sustained a swinish tumult , which [I]638-monsieur was constrained at last to quell by ordering [her]173-juanna trista and two of [her]173-juanna trista tools to rise from [their]2635-their seats , and , having kept [them]2635-their standing five minutes , turning them bodily out of [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom : [the accomplices]2637-the accomplices into [a large place adjoining called [the grands salle]2639-the grands salle]2638-a large place adjoining called the grands salle ; [the principal]2640-the principal into a cabinet , of which [I]638-monsieur closed the door and pocketed the key . This judgment [I]638-monsieur executed in the presence of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , who looked much aghast at beholding so decided a proceeding — the most severe that had ever been ventured on in [[her]173-juanna trista establishment]2537-her establishment . [Her]173-juanna trista look of affright [I]638-monsieur answered with one of composure , and finally with a smile , which perhaps flattered , and certainly soothed [her]173-juanna trista . [Juanna Trista]173-juanna trista remained in [Europe]40-europe long enough to repay , by malevolence and ingratitude , all who had ever done [her]173-juanna trista a good turn ; and [she]173-juanna trista then went to join [[her]173-juanna trista father]2642-her father in the — — Isles , exulting in the thought that [she]173-juanna trista should there have [slaves]2643-slaves , whom , as [she]173-juanna trista said , [she]173-juanna trista could kick and strike at will . These three pictures are from the life . [I]638-monsieur possess others , as marked and as little agreeable , but [I]638-monsieur will spare [[my]638-monsieur reader]2644-my reader the exhibition of them . Doubtless it will be thought that [I]638-monsieur ought now , by way of contrast , to show something charming ; [some gentle virgin head , circled with a halo , some sweet personification of innocence]2645-some gentle virgin head , circled with a halo , some sweet personification of innocence , clasping the dove of peace to [her]173-juanna trista bosom . No : [I]638-monsieur saw nothing of the sort , and therefore can not portray it . [The pupil in [the school]2501-the school possessing the happiest disposition]2646-the pupil in the school possessing the happiest disposition was [a young girl from [the country]334-the country]2648-a young girl from the country , [Louise Path]176-louise path ; [she]176-louise path was sufficiently benevolent and obliging , but not well taught nor well mannered ; moreover , the plague - spot of dissimulation was in [her]176-louise path also ; honour and principle were unknown to [her]176-louise path , [she]176-louise path had scarcely heard [their]2650-their names . [The least exceptionable pupil]2651-the least exceptionable pupil was [the poor little Sylvie [I]638-monsieur have mentioned once before]2652-the poor little sylvie i have mentioned once before . [Sylvie]166-sylvie was gentle in manners , intelligent in mind ; [she]166-sylvie was even sincere , as far as [her]166-sylvie religion would permit [her]166-sylvie to be so , but [her]166-sylvie physical organization was defective ; weak health stunted [her]166-sylvie growth and chilled [her]166-sylvie spirits , and then , destined as [she]166-sylvie was for [the cloister]2653-the cloister , [her]166-sylvie whole soul was warped to a conventual bias , and in the tame , trained subjection of [her]166-sylvie manner , one read that [she]166-sylvie had already prepared [herself]166-sylvie for [her]166-sylvie future course of life , by giving up [her]166-sylvie independence of thought and action into the hands of [some despotic confessor]2654-some despotic confessor . [She]166-sylvie permitted [herself]166-sylvie no original opinion , no preference of companion or employment ; in everything [she]166-sylvie was guided by [another]2597-another . With a pale , passive , automaton air , [she]166-sylvie went about all day long doing what [she]166-sylvie was bid ; never what [she]166-sylvie liked , or what , from innate conviction , [she]166-sylvie thought it right to do . [The poor little future religieuse]2656-the poor little future religieuse had been early taught to make the dictates of [her]2656-the poor little future religieuse own reason and conscience quite subordinate to the will of [[her]2656-the poor little future religieuse spiritual director]2657-her spiritual director . [She]2656-the poor little future religieuse was [the model pupil of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter ’s establishment]2659-reuter ’s establishment]2658-the model pupil of mdlle . reuter ’s establishment ; pale , blighted image , where life lingered feebly , but whence the soul had been conjured by [Romish wizard - craft]2660-romish wizard - craft ! [A few English pupils]2661-a few english pupils there were in [this school]2662-this school , and these might be divided into two classes . 1st . The continental English — [the daughters chiefly of [broken adventurers , whom debt or dishonour had driven from [their]2664-broken adventurers , whom debt or dishonour had driven from their own country [own country]2665-own country]2664-broken adventurers , whom debt or dishonour had driven from their own country]2663-the daughters chiefly of broken adventurers , whom debt or dishonour had driven from their own country . [These poor girls]2666-these poor girls had never known the advantages of [settled homes]2667-settled homes , decorous example , or honest Protestant education ; resident a few months now in [one Catholic school]2668-one catholic school , now in another , as [[their]2666-these poor girls parents]2669-their parents wandered from [land]2055-land to [land]2055-land — from [France]42-france to [Germany]43-germany , from [Germany]43-germany to [Belgium]21-belgium — [they]2666-these poor girls had picked up some scanty instruction , many bad habits , losing every notion even of the first elements of religion and morals , and acquiring an imbecile indifference to every sentiment that can elevate humanity ; [they]2666-these poor girls were distinguishable by an habitual look of sullen dejection , the result of crushed self - respect and constant browbeating from [[their]2666-these poor girls Popish fellow - pupils]2672-their popish fellow - pupils , who hated [them]2666-these poor girls as English , and scorned [them]2666-these poor girls as [heretics]2673-heretics . [The second class]2625-the second class were British English . Of these [I]638-monsieur did not encounter half a dozen during the whole time of [my]638-monsieur attendance at [the seminary]2675-the seminary ; [their]2666-these poor girls characteristics were clean but careless dress , ill - arranged hair ( compared with [the tight and trim foreigners]2676-the tight and trim foreigners ) , erect carriage , flexible figures , white and taper hands , features more irregular , but also more intellectual than those of [the Belgians]151-belgians , grave and modest countenances , a general air of native propriety and decency ; by this last circumstance alone [I]638-monsieur could at a glance distinguish [the daughter of Albion and nursling of Protestantism]2677-the daughter of albion and nursling of protestantism from [the foster - child of [Rome]38-rome]2678-the foster - child of rome , [the protégée of Jesuistry]2679-the protégée of jesuistry : proud , too , was the aspect of [these British girls]2680-these british girls ; at once envied and ridiculed by [[their]2666-these poor girls continental associates]2681-their continental associates , [they]2666-these poor girls warded off insult with austere civility , and met hate with mute disdain ; [they]2666-these poor girls eschewed company - keeping , and in the midst of numbers seemed to dwell isolated . [The teachers presiding over this mixed multitude]2682-the teachers presiding over this mixed multitude were three in number , all French — [their]2682-the teachers presiding over this mixed multitude names [Mdlles . Zephyrine]177-mdlles . zephyrine , [Pelagie]178-pelagie , and [Suzette]179-suzette ; the two last were commonplace personages enough ; [their]2666-these poor girls look was ordinary , [their]2666-these poor girls manner was ordinary , [their]2666-these poor girls temper was ordinary , [their]2666-these poor girls thoughts , feelings , and views were all ordinary — were [I]638-monsieur to write a chapter on the subject [I]638-monsieur could not elucidate it further . [Zephyrine]180-zephyrine was somewhat more distinguished in appearance and deportment than [Pelagie]178-pelagie and [Suzette]179-suzette , but in character genuine Parisian coquette , perfidious , [mercenary , and dry - hearted]2683-mercenary , and dry - hearted . [A fourth maitresse]2684-a fourth maitresse [I]638-monsieur sometimes saw [who seemed to come daily to teach needlework , or netting , or lace - mending , or some such flimsy art]2685-who seemed to come daily to teach needlework , or netting , or lace - mending , or some such flimsy art ; but of [her]2684-a fourth maitresse [I]638-monsieur never had more than a passing glimpse , as [she]2684-a fourth maitresse sat in [the carré]2686-the carré , with [her]2684-a fourth maitresse frames and [some dozen of [the elder pupils]2688-the elder pupils]2687-some dozen of the elder pupils about [her]2684-a fourth maitresse , consequently [I]638-monsieur had no opportunity of studying [her]2684-a fourth maitresse character , or even of observing [her]2684-a fourth maitresse person much ; the latter , [I]638-monsieur remarked , had a very English air for [a maitresse]2478-a maitresse , otherwise it was not striking ; of character [I]638-monsieur should think [she]2684-a fourth maitresse possessed but little , as [[her]2684-a fourth maitresse pupils]777-her pupils seemed constantly “[638-monsieur] en revolte ” against [her]2684-a fourth maitresse authority . [She]2684-a fourth maitresse did not reside in [the house]1897-the house ; [her]2684-a fourth maitresse name , [I]638-monsieur think , was [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances . Amidst this assemblage of all that was insignificant and defective , much that was vicious and repulsive ( by that last epithet many would have described [the two or three stiff , silent , decently behaved , ill - dressed British girls]2692-the two or three stiff , silent , decently behaved , ill - dressed british girls ) , [the sensible , sagacious , affable directress]2693-the sensible , sagacious , affable directress shone like a steady star over a marsh full of [Jack - o’-lanthorns]2694-jack - o’-lanthorns ; profoundly aware of [her]2684-a fourth maitresse superiority , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse derived an inward bliss from that consciousness which sustained [her]2684-a fourth maitresse under all the care and responsibility inseparable from [her]2684-a fourth maitresse position ; it kept [her]2684-a fourth maitresse temper calm , [her]2684-a fourth maitresse brow smooth , [her]2684-a fourth maitresse manner tranquil . [She]2684-a fourth maitresse liked — as who would not?—on entering [the school - room]2290-the school - room , to feel that [her]2684-a fourth maitresse sole presence sufficed to diffuse that order and quiet which all the remonstrances , and even commands , of [[her]2684-a fourth maitresse underlings]2696-her underlings frequently failed to enforce ; [she]2684-a fourth maitresse liked to stand in comparison , or rather — contrast , with those who surrounded [her]2684-a fourth maitresse , and to know that in personal as well as mental advantages , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse bore away the undisputed palm of preference—(the [three teachers]2697-three teachers were all plain . ) [[Her]2684-a fourth maitresse pupils]777-her pupils [she]2684-a fourth maitresse managed with such indulgence and address , taking always on [herself]2684-a fourth maitresse the office of [recompenser and eulogist]2699-recompenser and eulogist , and abandoning to [[her]2684-a fourth maitresse subalterns]2700-her subalterns every invidious task of blame and punishment , that [they]777-her pupils all regarded [her]2684-a fourth maitresse with deference , if not with affection ; [[her]2684-a fourth maitresse teachers]2701-her teachers did not love [her]2684-a fourth maitresse , but [they]2701-her teachers submitted because [they]2701-her teachers were [[her]2684-a fourth maitresse inferiors]2702-her inferiors in everything ; [the various masters who attended [her]2684-a fourth maitresse school]2703-the various masters who attended her school were each and all in some way or other under [her]2684-a fourth maitresse influence ; over one [she]2684-a fourth maitresse had acquired power by [her]2684-a fourth maitresse skilful management of [his]2704-his bad temper ; over another by little attentions to [his]2704-his petty caprices ; a third [she]2684-a fourth maitresse had subdued by flattery ; a fourth — [a timid man]2705-a timid man — [she]2684-a fourth maitresse kept in awe by a sort of austere decision of [mien]2706-mien ; [me]638-monsieur , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse still watched , still tried by the most ingenious tests — [she]2684-a fourth maitresse roved round [me]638-monsieur , baffled , yet persevering ; [I]638-monsieur believe [she]2684-a fourth maitresse thought [I]638-monsieur was like a smooth and bare precipice , which offered neither jutting stone nor tree - root , nor tuft of grass to aid [the climber]2707-the climber . Now [she]2684-a fourth maitresse flattered with exquisite tact , now [she]2684-a fourth maitresse moralized , now [she]2684-a fourth maitresse tried how far [I]638-monsieur was accessible to mercenary motives , then [she]2684-a fourth maitresse disported on the brink of affection — knowing that [some men]2708-some men are won by weakness — anon , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse talked excellent sense , aware that [others]2056-others have the folly to admire judgment . [I]638-monsieur found it at once pleasant and easy to evade all these efforts ; it was sweet , when [she]2684-a fourth maitresse thought [me]638-monsieur nearly won , to turn round and to smile in [her]2684-a fourth maitresse very eyes , half scornfully , and then to witness [her]2684-a fourth maitresse scarcely veiled , though mute mortification . Still [she]2684-a fourth maitresse persevered , and at last , [I]638-monsieur am bound to confess it , [her]2684-a fourth maitresse finger , essaying , proving every atom of the casket , touched its secret spring , and for a moment the lid sprung open ; [she]2684-a fourth maitresse laid [her]2684-a fourth maitresse hand on the jewel within ; whether [she]2684-a fourth maitresse stole and broke it , or whether the lid shut again with a snap on [her]2684-a fourth maitresse fingers , read on , and [you]2710-you shall know . It happened that [I]638-monsieur came one day to give a lesson when [I]638-monsieur was indisposed ; [I]638-monsieur had a bad cold and a cough ; two hours ’ incessant talking left [me]638-monsieur very hoarse and tired ; as [I]638-monsieur quitted [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom , and was passing along [the corridor]2466-the corridor , [I]638-monsieur met [Mdlle . Reuter]152-mdlle ; [she]2684-a fourth maitresse remarked , with an anxious air , that [I]638-monsieur looked very pale and tired . “[638-monsieur] Yes , ” [I]638-monsieur said , “[638-monsieur] [I]0-i was fatigued ; ” and then , with increased interest , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse rejoined , “[0-i] [You]0-i shall not go away till [you]0-i have had some refreshment . ” [She]2684-a fourth maitresse persuaded [me]0-i to step into [the parlour]2294-the parlour , and was very kind and gentle while [I]0-i stayed . The next day [she]2684-a fourth maitresse was kinder still ; [she]2684-a fourth maitresse came [herself]2684-a fourth maitresse into [the class]2509-the class to see that the windows were closed , and that there was no draught ; [she]2684-a fourth maitresse exhorted [me]0-i with friendly earnestness not to over - exert [myself]0-i ; when [I]0-i went away , [she]2684-a fourth maitresse gave [me]0-i [her]2684-a fourth maitresse hand unasked , and [I]0-i could not but mark , by a respectful and gentle pressure , that [I]0-i was sensible of the favour , and grateful for it . [My]0-i modest demonstration kindled a little merry smile on [her]2684-a fourth maitresse countenance ; [I]0-i thought [her]2684-a fourth maitresse almost charming . During the remainder of the evening , [my]0-i mind was full of impatience for the afternoon of the next day to arrive , that [I]0-i might see [her]2684-a fourth maitresse again . [I]0-i was not disappointed , for [she]2684-a fourth maitresse sat in the class during the whole of [my]0-i subsequent lesson , and often looked at [me]0-i almost with affection . At four o’clock [she]2684-a fourth maitresse accompanied [me]0-i out of [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom , asking with solicitude after [my]0-i health , then scolding [me]0-i sweetly because [I]0-i spoke too loud and gave [myself]0-i too much trouble ; [I]0-i stopped at the glass - door which led into [the garden]2422-the garden , to hear [her]2684-a fourth maitresse lecture to the end ; the door was open , it was a very fine day , and while [I]0-i listened to the soothing reprimand , [I]0-i looked at the sunshine and flowers , and felt very happy . [The day - scholars]2717-the day - scholars began to pour from [the schoolrooms]2718-the schoolrooms into [the passage]2460-the passage . “[0-i] Will [you]784-you go into [the garden]2422-the garden a minute or two , ” asked [she]2684-a fourth maitresse , “[784-you] till [they]786-they are gone ? ” [I]787-i descended the steps without answering , but [I]787-i looked back as much as to say — “[787-i] [You]787-i will come with [me]0-i ? ” In another minute [I]787-i and [the directress]2533-the directress were walking side by side down [the alley]2721-the alley bordered with fruit - trees , whose white blossoms were then in full blow as well as their tender green leaves . The sky was blue , the air still , the May afternoon was full of brightness and fragrance . Released from [the stifling class , surrounded with flowers and foliage]2722-the stifling class , surrounded with flowers and foliage , with [a pleasing , smiling , affable woman]2723-a pleasing , smiling , affable woman at [my]787-i side — how did [I]787-i feel ? Why , very enviably . It seemed as if the romantic visions [my]787-i imagination had suggested of [this garden]2724-this garden , while it was yet hidden from [me]787-i by the jealous boards , were more than realized ; and , when a turn in [the alley]2721-the alley shut out the view of [the house]1897-the house , and some tall shrubs excluded [[M. Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s mansion]2727-m. pelet ’s mansion , and screened [us]2728-us momentarily from [the other houses]2729-the other houses , rising amphitheatre - like round [this green spot]2730-this green spot , [I]787-i gave [my]787-i arm to [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , and led [her]152-mdlle to a garden - chair , nestled under some lilacs near . [She]152-mdlle sat down ; [I]787-i took [my]787-i place at [her]152-mdlle side . [She]152-mdlle went on talking to [me]787-i with that ease which communicates ease , and , as [I]787-i listened , a revelation dawned in [my]787-i mind that [I]787-i was on the brink of falling in love . The dinner - bell rang , both at [[her]152-mdlle house]2003-her house and [M. Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet ; [we]2732-we were obliged to part ; [I]787-i detained [her]152-mdlle a moment as [she]152-mdlle was moving away . “[787-i] [I]0-i want something , ” said [I.]787-i “[0-i] What ? ” asked [Zoraide]153-zoraide naively . “[787-i] Only a flower . ” “[787-i] Gather it then — or two , or twenty , if [you]0-i like . ” “[1983-one] No — [one]1983-one will do -- but [you]0-i must gather it , and give it to [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] What a caprice ! ” [she]152-mdlle exclaimed , but [she]152-mdlle raised [herself]152-mdlle on [her]152-mdlle tip - toes , and , plucking a beautiful branch of lilac , offered it to [me]0-i with grace . [I]0-i took it , and went away , satisfied for the present , and hopeful for the future . Certainly that May day was a lovely one , and [it]2733-it closed in moonlight night of summer warmth and serenity . [I]0-i remember this well ; for , having sat up late that evening , correcting devoirs , and feeling weary and a little oppressed with the closeness of [[my]0-i small room]2734-my small room , [I]0-i opened the often - mentioned boarded window , whose boards , however , [I]0-i had persuaded [old Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet to have removed since [I]0-i had filled the post of [professor in [the pensionnat de demoiselles]2736-the pensionnat de demoiselles]2735-professor in the pensionnat de demoiselles , as , from that time , it was no longer “[0-i] inconvenient ” for [me]0-i to overlook [[my]0-i own pupils]2737-my own pupils at [their]2737-my own pupils sports . [I]0-i sat down in the window - seat , rested [my]0-i arm on the sill , and leaned out : above [me]0-i was the clear - obscure of a cloudless night sky — splendid moonlight subdued the tremulous sparkle of the stars — below lay [the garden]2422-the garden , varied with silvery lustre and deep shade , and all fresh with dew — a grateful perfume exhaled from the closed blossoms of the fruit - trees — not a leaf stirred , the night was breezeless . [My]0-i window looked directly down upon [a certain walk of [Mdlle]152-mdlle]2739-a certain walk of mdlle . [[Reuter]152-mdlle ’s garden]2441-reuter ’s garden , called “[0-i] l’allee defendue , ” so named because [the pupils]2333-the pupils were forbidden to enter [it]2441-reuter ’s garden on account of [its]2441-reuter ’s garden proximity to [[the boys]636-the boys ’ school]2743-the boys ’ school . It was here that the lilacs and laburnums grew especially thick ; this was [the most sheltered nook in [the enclosure]2745-the enclosure]2744-the most sheltered nook in the enclosure , [its]2441-reuter ’s garden shrubs screened [the garden - chair where that afternoon [I]0-i had sat with [the young directress]2747-the young directress]2746-the garden - chair where that afternoon i had sat with the young directress . [I]0-i need not say that [my]0-i thoughts were chiefly with [her]789-her as [I]0-i leaned from the lattice , and let [my]0-i eye roam , now over the walks and borders of [the garden]2422-the garden , now along the many - windowed front of [the house]1897-the house which rose white beyond the masses of foliage . [I]0-i wondered in what part of [the building]2750-the building was situated [[her]789-her apartment]2751-her apartment ; and a single light , shining through the persiennes of one croisee , seemed to direct [me]0-i to it . “[0-i] [She]789-her watches late , ” thought [I]789-her , “[789-her] for it must be now near midnight . [She]789-her is [a fascinating little woman]790-a fascinating little woman , ” [I]789-her continued in voiceless soliloquy ; “[789-her] [her]789-her image forms a pleasant picture in memory ; [I]0-i know [she]789-her is not what [the world]1872-the world calls pretty — no matter , there is harmony in [her]789-her aspect , and [I]0-i like it ; [her]789-her brown hair , [her]789-her blue eye , the freshness of [her]789-her cheek , the whiteness of [her]789-her neck , all suit [my]0-i taste . Then [I]0-i respect [her]789-her talent ; the idea of marrying [a doll]792-a doll or [a fool]304-a fool was always abhorrent to [me]0-i : [I]0-i know that [a pretty doll]794-a pretty doll , [a fair fool]795-a fair fool , might do well enough for the honeymoon ; but when passion cooled , how dreadful to find a lump of wax and wood laid in [my]0-i bosom , [a half idiot]796-a half idiot clasped in [my]0-i arms , and to remember that [I]0-i had made of this [[my]0-i equal]797-my equal — nay , [[my]0-i idol]798-my idol — to know that [I]0-i must pass the rest of [my]0-i dreary life with [a creature incapable of understanding what [I]0-i said , of appreciating what [I]0-i thought , or of sympathizing with what [I]0-i felt]799-a creature incapable of understanding what i said , of appreciating what i thought , or of sympathizing with what i felt ! “ Now , [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i , “ has tact , caractère , judgment , discretion ; has [she]153-zoraide heart ? What a good , simple little smile played about [her]153-zoraide lips when [she]153-zoraide gave [me]0-i the branch of lilacs ! [I]0-i have thought [her]153-zoraide crafty , dissembling , interested sometimes , it is true ; but may not much that looks like cunning and dissimulation in [her]153-zoraide conduct be only the efforts made by [a bland temper]2752-a bland temper to traverse quietly perplexing difficulties ? And as to interest , [she]153-zoraide wishes to make [her]153-zoraide way in [the world]1872-the world , no doubt , and who can blame [her]153-zoraide ? Even if [she]153-zoraide be truly deficient in sound principle , is it not rather [her]153-zoraide misfortune than [her]153-zoraide fault ? [She]153-zoraide has been brought up [a Catholic]2754-a catholic : had [she]153-zoraide been born [an Englishwoman]2755-an englishwoman , and reared [a Protestant]2756-a protestant , might [she]153-zoraide not have added straight integrity to all [her]153-zoraide other excellences ? Supposing [she]153-zoraide were to marry [an English and Protestant husband]2757-an english and protestant husband , would [she]153-zoraide not , rational , sensible as [she]153-zoraide is , quickly acknowledge the superiority of right over expediency , honesty over policy ? It would be worth [a man]353-a man ’s while to try the experiment ; to - morrow [I]0-i will renew [my]0-i observations . [She]153-zoraide knows that [I]0-i watch [her]153-zoraide : how calm [she]153-zoraide is under scrutiny ! it seems rather to gratify than annoy [her]153-zoraide . ”[0-i] Here a strain of music stole in upon [my]0-i monologue , and suspended it ; it was a bugle , very skilfully played , in [the neighbourhood of [the park]2244-the park]800-the neighbourhood of the park , [I]0-i thought , or on [the Place Royale]802-the place royale . So sweet were the tones , so subduing their effect at that hour , in the midst of silence and under the quiet reign of moonlight , [I]0-i ceased to think , that [I]0-i might listen more intently . The strain retreated , its sound waxed fainter and was soon gone ; [my]0-i ear prepared to repose on the absolute hush of midnight once more . No . What murmur was that which , low , and yet near and approaching nearer , frustrated the expectation of total silence ? It was [some one conversing]803-some one conversing — yes , evidently , an audible , though subdued voice spoke in [the garden]2422-the garden immediately below [me]0-i . [Another]2597-another answered ; the first voice was that of [a man]353-a man , [the second that of a woman]807-the second that of a woman ; and [a man]353-a man and [a woman]2098-a woman [I]0-i saw coming slowly down [the alley]2721-the alley . [Their]811-their forms were at first in shade , [I]0-i could but discern a dusk outline of each , but a ray of moonlight met them at the termination of the walk , when they were under [my]0-i very nose , and revealed very plainly , very unequivocally , [Mdlle]152-mdlle .
