Francois Pelet]146-m. pelet . And [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet was saying — “ A quand donc le jour des noces , [ma bien - aimee]2759-ma bien - aimee ? ”[146-m. pelet] And [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle answered — “ Mais , [Francois]146-m. pelet , tu sais bien qu’il [me]152-mdlle serait impossible de [me]152-mdlle marier avant les vacances . ”[152-mdlle] “ June , July , August , a whole quarter ! ”[2349-the director] exclaimed [the director]2349-the director . “ How can [I]2349-the director wait so long?—I who am ready , even now , to expire at [your]146-m. pelet feet with impatience ! ”[2349-the director] “ Ah ! if [you]146-m. pelet die , the whole affair will be settled without any trouble about [notaries]2760-notaries and contracts ; [I]152-mdlle shall only have to order a slight mourning dress , which will be much sooner prepared than the nuptial trousseau . ”[152-mdlle] “ [Cruel Zoraide]182-cruel zoraide ! [you]146-m. pelet laugh at the distress of one who loves [you]146-m. pelet so devotedly as [I]152-mdlle do : [my]152-mdlle torment is [your]146-m. pelet sport ; [you]146-m. pelet scruple not to stretch [my]152-mdlle soul on the rack of jealousy ; for , deny it as [you]146-m. pelet will , [I]152-mdlle am certain [you]146-m. pelet have cast encouraging glances on [that school - boy]2761-that school - boy , [Crimsworth]103-william ; [he]2761-that school - boy has presumed to fall in love , which [he]2761-that school - boy dared not have done unless [you]146-m. pelet had given [him]2761-that school - boy room to hope . ”[152-mdlle] “ What do [you]146-m. pelet say , [Francois]146-m. pelet ? Do [you]146-m. pelet say [Crimsworth]103-william is in love with [me]2349-the director ? ”[2349-the director] “ Over head and ears . ”[152-mdlle] “ Has [he]2761-that school - boy told [you]146-m. pelet so ? ”[152-mdlle] “ No — but [I]152-mdlle see it in [his]2761-that school - boy face : [he]2761-that school - boy blushes whenever [your]0-i name is mentioned . ”[152-mdlle] A little laugh of exulting coquetry announced [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s gratification at this piece of intelligence ( which was a lie , by - the - by — [I]0-i had never been so far gone as that , after all ) . [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet proceeded to ask what [she]816-she intended to do with [me]0-i , intimating pretty plainly , and not very gallantly , that it was nonsense for [her]816-she to think of taking such a “ blanc - bec ”[816-she] as [a husband]817-a husband , since [she]816-she must be at least ten years older than [I]0-i ( was [she]816-she then thirty - two ? [I]0-i should not have thought it ) . [I]0-i heard [her]816-she disclaim any intentions on the subject — [the director]2349-the director , however , still pressed [her]816-she to give a definite answer . “ [Francois]146-m. pelet , ”[816-she] said [she]816-she , “ [you]146-m. pelet are jealous , ”[816-she] and still [she]816-she laughed ; then , as if suddenly recollecting that this coquetry was not consistent with the character for modest dignity [she]816-she wished to establish , [she]816-she proceeded , in a demure voice : “ Truly , [[my]816-she dear]2762-my dear [Francois]146-m. pelet , [I]816-she will not deny that [this young Englishman]2763-this young englishman may have made some attempts to ingratiate [himself]2763-this young englishman with [me]816-she ; but , so far from giving [him]2763-this young englishman any encouragement , [I]816-she have always treated [him]2763-this young englishman with as much reserve as it was possible to combine with civility ; affianced as [I]816-she am to [you]146-m. pelet , [I]816-she would give [no man]1919-no man false hopes ; believe [me]816-she , [dear friend]2765-dear friend . ”[816-she] Still [Pelet]146-m. pelet uttered murmurs of distrust — so [I]0-i judged , at least , from [her]816-she reply . “ What folly ! How could [I]0-i prefer [an unknown foreigner]2766-an unknown foreigner to [you]146-m. pelet ? And then — not to flatter [your]146-m. pelet vanity — [Crimsworth]103-william could not bear comparison with [you]146-m. pelet either physically or mentally ; [he]2766-an unknown foreigner is not [a handsome man]1982-a handsome man at all ; some may call [him]2766-an unknown foreigner [gentleman - like and intelligent - looking]2768-gentleman - like and intelligent - looking , but for [my]0-i part — ”[0-i] The rest of the sentence was lost in the distance , as [the pair]819-the pair , rising from the chair in which [they]819-the pair had been seated , moved away . [I]0-i waited [their]819-the pair return , but soon the opening and shutting of a door informed [me]0-i that [they]819-the pair had re - entered [the house]1897-the house ; [I]0-i listened a little longer , all was perfectly still ; [I]0-i listened more than an hour — at last [I]0-i heard [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet come in and ascend to [[his]146-m. pelet chamber]821-his chamber . Glancing once more towards the long front of [the garden - house]822-the garden - house , [I]0-i perceived that [its]822-the garden - house solitary light was at length extinguished ; so , for a time , was [my]0-i faith in love and friendship . [I]0-i went to bed , but something feverish and fiery had got into [my]0-i veins which prevented [me]0-i from sleeping much that night . NEXT morning [I]0-i rose with the dawn , and having dressed [myself]0-i and stood half - an - hour , [my]0-i elbow leaning on the chest of drawers , considering what means [I]0-i should adopt to restore [my]0-i spirits , fagged with sleeplessness , to [their]819-the pair ordinary tone — for [I]0-i had no intention of getting up a scene with [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , reproaching [him]146-m. pelet with perfidy , sending [him]146-m. pelet a challenge , or performing other gambadoes of the sort — [I]0-i hit at last on the expedient of walking out in the cool of the morning to [a neighbouring establishment of baths]823-a neighbouring establishment of baths , and treating [myself]0-i to a bracing plunge . The remedy produced the desired effect . [I]0-i came back at seven o’clock steadied and invigorated , and was able to greet [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , when [he]146-m. pelet entered to breakfast , with an unchanged and tranquil countenance ; even a cordial offering of the hand and the flattering appellation of “ mon fils , ”[146-m. pelet] pronounced in that caressing tone with which [Monsieur]824-monsieur had , of late days especially , been accustomed to address [me]0-i , did not elicit any external sign of the feeling which , though subdued , still glowed at [my]0-i heart . Not that [I]0-i nursed vengeance — no ; but the sense of insult and treachery lived in [me]0-i like a kindling , though as yet smothered coal . [God]119-god knows [I]0-i am not by nature vindictive ; [I]0-i would not hurt [a man]353-a man because [I]0-i can no longer trust or like [him]353-a man ; but neither [my]0-i reason nor feelings are of the vacillating order — they are not of that sand - like sort where impressions , if soon made , are as soon effaced . Once convinced that [[my]0-i friend]666-my friend ’s disposition is incompatible with [my]0-i own , once assured that [he]146-m. pelet is indelibly stained with certain defects obnoxious to [my]0-i principles , and [I]0-i dissolve the connection . [I]0-i did so with [Edward]99-mr. crimsworth . As to [Pelet]146-m. pelet , the discovery was yet new ; should [I]0-i act thus with [him]146-m. pelet ? It was the question [I]0-i placed before [my]0-i mind as [I]0-i stirred [my]0-i cup of coffee with a half - pistolet ( [we]827-we never had spoons ) , [Pelet]146-m. pelet meantime being seated opposite , [his]146-m. pelet pallid face looking as knowing and more haggard than usual , [his]146-m. pelet blue eye turned , now sternly on [[his]146-m. pelet boys]828-his boys and ushers , and now graciously on [me]0-i . “ Circumstances must guide [me]0-i , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ; and meeting [Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s false glance and insinuating smile , [I]0-i thanked heaven that [I]0-i had last night opened [my]0-i window and read by the light of a full moon the true meaning of that guileful countenance . [I]0-i felt half [[his]146-m. pelet master]1904-his master , because the reality of [his]146-m. pelet nature was now known to [me]0-i ; smile and flatter as [he]146-m. pelet would , [I]0-i saw [his]146-m. pelet soul lurk behind [his]146-m. pelet smile , and heard in every one of [his]146-m. pelet smooth phrases a voice interpreting their treacherous import . But [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide ? Of course [her]830-her defection had cut [me]0-i to the quick ? That stint must have gone too deep for any consolations of philosophy to be available in curing its smart ? Not at all . The night fever over , [I]0-i looked about for balm to that wound also , and found some nearer [home]1905-home than at [Gilead]44-gilead . Reason was [[my]0-i physician]832-my physician ; [she]830-her began by proving that the prize [I]0-i had missed was of little value : [she]830-her admitted that , physically , [Zoraide]153-zoraide might have suited [me]0-i , but affirmed that [our]833-our souls were not in harmony , and that discord must have resulted from the union of [her]830-her mind with [mine]0-i . [She]830-her then insisted on the suppression of all repining , and commanded [me]0-i rather to rejoice that [I]0-i had escaped a snare . [Her]830-her medicament did [me]0-i good . [I]0-i felt its strengthening effect when [I]0-i met [the directress]2533-the directress the next day ; its stringent operation on the nerves suffered no trembling , no faltering ; it enabled [me]0-i to face [her]830-her with firmness , to pass [her]830-her with ease . [She]830-her had held out [her]830-her hand to [me]0-i — that [I]0-i did not choose to see . [She]830-her had greeted [me]0-i with a charming smile — it fell on [my]0-i heart like light on stone . [I]0-i passed on to [the estrade]2476-the estrade , [she]830-her followed [me]0-i ; [her]830-her eye , fastened on [my]0-i face , demanded of every feature the meaning of [my]0-i changed and careless manner . “ [I]0-i will give [her]830-her an answer , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i ; and , meeting [her]830-her gaze full , arresting , fixing [her]830-her glance , [I]0-i shot into [her]830-her eyes , from [my]0-i own , a look , where there was no respect , no love , no tenderness , no gallantry ; where the strictest analysis could detect nothing but scorn , hardihood , irony . [I]0-i made [her]830-her bear it , and feel it ; [her]830-her steady countenance did not change , but [her]830-her colour rose , and [she]830-her approached [me]0-i as if fascinated . [She]830-her stepped on to the estrade , and stood close by [my]0-i side ; [she]830-her had nothing to say . [I]0-i would not relieve [her]830-her embarrassment , and negligently turned over the leaves of a book . “ [I]830-her hope [you]0-i feel quite recovered to - day , ”[830-her] at last [she]830-her said , in a low tone . “ And [I]830-her , [mademoiselle]719-mademoiselle , hope that [you]0-i took no cold last night in consequence of [your]0-i late walk in [the garden]2422-the garden . ”[830-her] Quick enough of comprehension , [she]830-her understood [me]0-i directly ; [her]830-her face became a little blanched — a very little — but no muscle in [her]830-her rather marked features moved ; and , calm and self - possessed , [she]830-her retired from the estrade , taking [her]830-her seat quietly at a little distance , and occupying [herself]830-her with netting a purse . [I]0-i proceeded to give [my]0-i lesson ; it was a “ Composition , ”[0-i] [i.e.]0-i , [I]0-i dictated certain general questions , of which [the pupils]2333-the pupils were to compose the answers from memory , access to books being forbidden . While [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Eulalie]161-eulalie , [Hortense]162-hortense , [Caroline]163-caroline , & c. , were pondering over the string of rather abstruse grammatical interrogatories [I]0-i had propounded , [I]0-i was at liberty to employ the vacant half hour in further observing [the directress]2533-the directress [herself]830-her . The green silk purse was progressing fast in [her]830-her hands ; [her]830-her eyes were bent upon it ; [her]830-her attitude , as [she]830-her sat netting within two yards of [me]0-i , was still yet guarded ; in [her]830-her whole person were expressed at once , and with equal clearness , vigilance and repose — a rare union ! Looking at [her]830-her , [I]0-i was forced , as [I]0-i had often been before , to offer [her]830-her good sense , [her]830-her wondrous self - control , the tribute of involuntary admiration . [She]830-her had felt that [I]0-i had withdrawn from [her]830-her [my]0-i esteem ; [she]830-her had seen contempt and coldness in [my]0-i eye , and to [her]830-her , who coveted the approbation of all around [her]830-her , who thirsted after universal good opinion , such discovery must have been an acute wound . [I]0-i had witnessed its effect in the momentary pallor of [her]830-her cheek -- cheek unused to vary ; yet how quickly , by dint of self - control , had [she]830-her recovered [her]830-her composure ! With what quiet dignity [she]830-her now sat , almost at [my]0-i side , sustained by [her]830-her sound and vigorous sense ; no trembling in [her]830-her somewhat lengthened , though shrewd upper lip , no coward shame on [her]830-her austere forehead ! “ There is metal there , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , as [I]0-i gazed . “ Would that there were fire also , living ardour to make the steel glow — then [I]0-i could love [her]830-her . ”[0-i] Presently [I]0-i discovered that [she]830-her knew [I]0-i was watching [her]830-her , for [she]830-her stirred not , [she]830-her lifted not [her]830-her crafty eyelid ; [she]830-her had glanced down from [her]830-her netting to [her]830-her small foot , peeping from the soft folds of [her]830-her purple merino gown ; thence [her]830-her eye reverted to [her]830-her hand , ivory white , with a bright garnet ring on the forefinger , and a light frill of lace round the wrist ; with a scarcely perceptible movement [she]830-her turned [her]830-her head , causing [her]830-her nut - brown curls to wave gracefully . In these slight signs [I]0-i read that the wish of [her]830-her heart , the design of [her]830-her brain , was to lure back the game [she]830-her had scared . A little incident gave [her]830-her the opportunity of addressing [me]0-i again . While all was silence in the class — silence , but for the rustling of copy - books and the travelling of pens over their pages — a leaf of the large folding - door , opening from [the hall]1910-the hall , unclosed , admitting [a pupil who , after making a hasty obeisance , ensconced [herself]839-a pupil who , after making a hasty obeisance , ensconced herself with some appearance of trepidation , probably occasioned by her entering so late , in a vacant seat at the desk nearest the door with some appearance of trepidation , probably occasioned by [her]839-a pupil who , after making a hasty obeisance , ensconced herself with some appearance of trepidation , probably occasioned by her entering so late , in a vacant seat at the desk nearest the door entering so late , in a vacant seat at the desk nearest the door]839-a pupil who , after making a hasty obeisance , ensconced herself with some appearance of trepidation , probably occasioned by her entering so late , in a vacant seat at the desk nearest the door . Being seated , [she]830-her proceeded , still with an air of hurry and embarrassment , to open [her]830-her cabas , to take out [her]830-her books ; and , while [I]0-i was waiting for [her]830-her to look up , in order to make out [her]830-her identity — for , shortsighted as [I]0-i was , [I]0-i had not recognized [her]830-her at [her]830-her entrance — [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , leaving [her]152-mdlle chair , approached [the estrade]2476-the estrade . “ [Monsieur Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort , ”[152-mdlle] said [she]152-mdlle , in a whisper : for when [the schoolrooms]2718-the schoolrooms were silent , [the directress]2533-the directress always moved with velvet tread , and spoke in the most subdued key , enforcing order and stillness fully as much by example as precept : “ [Monsieur Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort , [that young person , who has just entered]2771-that young person , who has just entered , wishes to have the advantage of taking lessons with [you]2772-you in English ; [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered is not [a pupil of [the house]1897-the house]2773-a pupil of the house ; [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered is , indeed , in one sense , [a teacher]631-a teacher , for [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered gives instruction in lace - mending , and in little varieties of ornamental needle - work . [She]2771-that young person , who has just entered very properly proposes to qualify [herself]2771-that young person , who has just entered for [a higher department of education]2776-a higher department of education , and has asked permission to attend [your]2772-you lessons , in order to perfect [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered knowledge of English , in which language [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered has , [I]2533-the directress believe , already made some progress ; of course it is [my]2533-the directress wish to aid [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered in an effort so praiseworthy ; [you]2772-you will permit [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered then to benefit by [your]2772-you instruction — n’est ce pas , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[2533-the directress] And [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s eyes were raised to [mine]843-mine with a look at once naive , benign , and beseeching . [I]0-i replied , “ Of course , ”[0-i] very laconically , almost abruptly . “ Another word , ”[152-mdlle] [she]152-mdlle said , with softness : “ [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances has not received a regular education ; perhaps [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered natural talents are not of the highest order : but [I]152-mdlle can assure [you]2772-you of the excellence of [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered intentions , and even of the amiability of [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered disposition . [Monsieur]2778-monsieur will then , [I]152-mdlle am sure , have the goodness to be considerate with [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered at first , and not expose [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered backwardness , [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered inevitable deficiencies , before [the young ladies]654-the young ladies , who , in a sense , are [[her]2771-that young person , who has just entered pupils]777-her pupils . Will [Monsieur Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort favour [me]152-mdlle by attending to this hint ? ”[152-mdlle] [I]0-i nodded . [She]152-mdlle continued with subdued earnestness — “ Pardon [me]152-mdlle , [monsieur]638-monsieur , if [I]152-mdlle venture to add that what [I]152-mdlle have just said is of importance to [the poor girl]2782-the poor girl ; [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered already experiences great difficulty in impressing these giddy young things with a due degree of deference for [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered authority , and should that difficulty be increased by new discoveries of [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered incapacity , [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered might find [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered position in [[my]152-mdlle establishment]633-my establishment too painful to be retained ; a circumstance [I]152-mdlle should much regret for [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered sake , as [she]2771-that young person , who has just entered can ill afford to lose the profits of [her]2771-that young person , who has just entered occupation here . ”[152-mdlle] [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle possessed marvellous tact ; but tact the most exclusive , unsupported by sincerity , will sometimes fail of its effect ; thus , on this occasion , the longer [she]152-mdlle preached about the necessity of being indulgent to [the governess pupil]844-the governess pupil , the more impatient [I]0-i felt as [I]0-i listened . [I]0-i discerned so clearly that while [her]152-mdlle professed motive was a wish to aid [the dull , though well - meaning Mdlle]845-the dull , though well - meaning mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , [her]152-mdlle real one was no other than a design to impress [me]0-i with an idea of [her]152-mdlle own exalted goodness and tender considerateness ; so having again hastily nodded assent to [her]152-mdlle remarks , [I]0-i obviated their renewal by suddenly demanding the compositions , in a sharp accent , and stepping from the estrade , [I]0-i proceeded to collect them . As [I]0-i passed [the governess - pupil]846-the governess - pupil , [I]0-i said to [her]846-the governess - pupil — “ [You]846-the governess - pupil have come in too late to receive a lesson to - day ; try to be more punctual next time . ”[0-i] [I]0-i was behind [her]846-the governess - pupil , and could not read in [her]846-the governess - pupil face the effect of [my]0-i not very civil speech . Probably [I]0-i should not have troubled [myself]0-i to do so , had [I]0-i been full in front ; but [I]0-i observed that [she]846-the governess - pupil immediately began to slip [her]846-the governess - pupil books into [her]846-the governess - pupil cabas again ; and , presently , after [I]0-i had returned to [the estrade]2476-the estrade , while [I]0-i was arranging the mass of compositions , [I]0-i heard the folding - door again open and close ; and , on looking up , [I]0-i perceived [her]846-the governess - pupil place vacant . [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , “ [She]846-the governess - pupil will consider [her]846-the governess - pupil first attempt at taking a lesson in English something of a failure ; ”[0-i] and [I]0-i wondered whether [she]846-the governess - pupil had departed in the sulks , or whether stupidity had induced [her]846-the governess - pupil to take [my]0-i words too literally , or , finally , whether [my]0-i irritable tone had wounded [her]846-the governess - pupil feelings . The last notion [I]0-i dismissed almost as soon as [I]0-i had conceived it , for not having seen any appearance of sensitiveness in any human face since [my]0-i arrival in [Belgium]21-belgium , [I]0-i had begun to regard it almost as a fabulous quality . Whether [her]846-the governess - pupil physiognomy announced it [I]0-i could not tell , for [her]846-the governess - pupil speedy exit had allowed [me]0-i no time to ascertain the circumstance . [I]0-i had , indeed , on two or three previous occasions , caught a passing view of [her]846-the governess - pupil ( as [I]0-i believe has been mentioned before ) ; but [I]0-i had never stopped to scrutinize either [her]846-the governess - pupil face or person , and had but the most vague idea of [her]846-the governess - pupil general appearance . Just as [I]0-i had finished rolling up the compositions , the four o’clock bell rang ; with [my]0-i accustomed alertness in obeying that signal , [I]0-i grasped [my]0-i hat and evacuated [the premises]848-the premises . IF [I]0-i was punctual in quitting [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s domicile , [I]0-i was at least equally punctual in arriving [there]1998-there ; [I]0-i came the next day at five minutes before two , and on reaching [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom door , before [I]0-i opened it , [I]0-i heard a rapid , gabbling sound , which warned [me]0-i that [the “ priere du midi ”]2784-the “ priere du midi ”[2784-the “ priere du midi ”] was not yet concluded . [I]0-i waited the termination thereof ; it would have been impious to intrude [my]0-i heretical presence during its progress . How [the repeater of the prayer]851-the repeater of the prayer did cackle and splutter ! [I]0-i never before or since heard language enounced with such steam - engine haste . “ Notre Pere qui etes au ciel ”[851-the repeater of the prayer] went off like a shot ; then followed an address to [Marie]183-minnie “ vierge celeste , reine des anges , maison d’or , tour d’ivoire ! ”[851-the repeater of the prayer] and then an invocation to [the saint of the day]852-the saint of the day ; and then down [they]853-they all sat , and the solemn ( ? ) rite was over ; and [I]0-i entered , flinging the door wide and striding in fast , as it was [my]0-i wo nt to do now ; for [I]0-i had found that in entering with aplomb , and mounting the estrade with emphasis , consisted the grand secret of ensuring immediate silence . The folding - doors between the two classes , opened for the prayer , were instantly closed ; [a maitresse]2478-a maitresse , work - box in hand , took [her]2478-a maitresse seat at [her]2478-a maitresse appropriate desk ; [the pupils]2333-the pupils sat still with [their]2333-the pupils pens and books before [them]2333-the pupils ; [[my]0-i three beauties in [the van]857-the van]856-my three beauties in the van , now well humbled by a demeanour of consistent coolness , sat erect with [their]856-my three beauties in the van hands folded quietly on [their]856-my three beauties in the van knees ; [they]856-my three beauties in the van had given up giggling and whispering to [each other]283-each other , and no longer ventured to utter pert speeches in [my]0-i presence ; [they]856-my three beauties in the van now only talked to [me]0-i occasionally with [their]856-my three beauties in the van eyes , by means of which organs [they]856-my three beauties in the van could still , however , say very audacious and coquettish things . [Had]859-had affection , goodness , modesty , real talent , ever employed those bright orbs as [interpreters]860-interpreters , [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i could have refrained from giving a kind and encouraging , perhaps an ardent reply now and then ; but as it was , [I]0-i found pleasure in answering the glance of vanity with the gaze of stoicism . Youthful , fair , brilliant , as were [many of [[my]0-i pupils]2276-my pupils]861-many of my pupils , [I]0-i can truly say that in [me]0-i [they]856-my three beauties in the van never saw any other bearing than such as [an austere , though just guardian]863-an austere , though just guardian , might have observed towards [them]856-my three beauties in the van . If any doubt the accuracy of this assertion , as inferring more conscientious self - denial or [Scipio]184-scipio - like self - control than [they]856-my three beauties in the van feel disposed to give [me]0-i credit for , let [them]856-my three beauties in the van take into consideration the following circumstances , which , while detracting from [my]0-i merit , justify [my]0-i veracity . Know , [O incredulous reader]864-o incredulous reader ! that [a master]2226-a master stands in a somewhat different relation towards [a pretty , light - headed , probably ignorant girl]866-a pretty , light - headed , probably ignorant girl , to that occupied by [a partner at a ball]867-a partner at a ball , or [a gallant on [the promenade]869-the promenade]868-a gallant on the promenade . [A professor]629-a professor does not meet [[his]629-a professor pupil]871-his pupil to see [her]871-his pupil dressed in satin and muslin , with hair perfumed and curled , neck scarcely shaded by aerial lace , round white arms circled with bracelets , feet dressed for the gliding dance . It is not [his]629-a professor business to whirl [her]871-his pupil through the waltz , to feed [her]871-his pupil with compliments , to heighten [her]871-his pupil beauty by the flush of gratified vanity . Neither does [he]629-a professor encounter [her]871-his pupil on [the smooth - rolled , tree shaded Boulevard]872-the smooth - rolled , tree shaded boulevard , in [the green and sunny park]873-the green and sunny park , whither [she]871-his pupil repairs clad in [her]871-his pupil becoming walking dress , [her]871-his pupil scarf thrown with grace over [her]871-his pupil shoulders , [her]871-his pupil little bonnet scarcely screening [her]871-his pupil curls , the red rose under its brim adding a new tint to the softer rose on [her]871-his pupil cheek ; [her]871-his pupil face and eyes , too , illumined with smiles , perhaps as transient as the sunshine of the gala - day , but also quite as brilliant ; it is not [[his]629-a professor office]874-his office to walk by [her]871-his pupil side , to listen to [her]871-his pupil lively chat , to carry [her]871-his pupil parasol , scarcely larger than a broad green leaf , to lead in a ribbon [her]871-his pupil Blenheim spaniel or Italian greyhound . No : [he]629-a professor finds [her]871-his pupil in [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom , plainly dressed , with books before [her]871-his pupil . Owing to [her]871-his pupil education or [her]871-his pupil nature books are to [her]871-his pupil a nuisance , and [she]871-his pupil opens them with aversion , yet [[her]871-his pupil teacher]876-her teacher must instil into [her]871-his pupil mind the contents of these books ; that mind resists the admission of grave information , it recoils , it grows restive , sullen tempers are shown , disfiguring frowns spoil the symmetry of the face , sometimes coarse gestures banish grace from the deportment , while muttered expressions , redolent of native and ineradicable vulgarity , desecrate the sweetness of the voice . Where the temperament is serene though the intellect be sluggish , an unconquerable dullness opposes every effort to instruct . Where there is cunning but not energy , dissimulation , falsehood , a thousand schemes and tricks are put in play to evade the necessity of application ; in short , to [the tutor]877-the tutor , [female youth]878-female youth , female charms are like tapestry hangings , of which the wrong side is continually turned towards [him]629-a professor ; and even when [he]629-a professor sees the smooth , neat external surface [he]629-a professor so well knows what knots , long stitches , and jagged ends are behind that [he]629-a professor has scarce a temptation to admire too fondly the seemly forms and bright colours exposed to general view . [Our]879-our likings are regulated by [our]879-our circumstances . [The artist]880-the artist prefers [a hilly country]881-a hilly country because it is picturesque ; [the engineer]882-the engineer [a flat one]883-a flat one because it is convenient ; [the man of pleasure]884-the man of pleasure likes what [he]884-the man of pleasure calls “ [a fine woman”—she[884-the man of pleasure] suits [him]884-the man of pleasure]2785-a fine woman”—she suits him ; [the fashionable young gentleman]885-the fashionable young gentleman admires [the fashionable young lady]886-the fashionable young lady — [she]886-the fashionable young lady is of [his]884-the man of pleasure kind ; [the toil - worn , fagged , probably irritable tutor]887-the toil - worn , fagged , probably irritable tutor , blind almost to beauty , insensible to airs and graces , glories chiefly in certain mental qualities : application , love of knowledge , natural capacity , docility , truthfulness , gratefulness , are the charms that attract [his]629-a professor notice and win [his]629-a professor regard . These [he]629-a professor seeks , but seldom meets ; these , if by chance [he]629-a professor finds , [he]629-a professor would fain retain for ever , and when separation deprives [him]629-a professor of them [he]629-a professor feels as if some ruthless hand had snatched from [him]629-a professor [his]629-a professor only ewe - lamb . Such being the case , and the case it is , [[my]0-i readers]888-my readers will agree with [me]0-i that there was nothing either very meritorious or very marvellous in the integrity and moderation of [my]0-i conduct at [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter ’s pensionnat de demoiselles]889-reuter ’s pensionnat de demoiselles . [My]0-i first business this afternoon consisted in reading the list of places for the month , determined by the relative correctness of the compositions given the preceding day . The list was headed , as usual , by the name of [Sylvie]166-sylvie , [that plain , quiet little girl [I]0-i have described before as being at once [the best and ugliest pupil in the establishment]891-the best and ugliest pupil in the establishment]890-that plain , quiet little girl i have described before as being at once the best and ugliest pupil in the establishment ; the second place had fallen to the lot of [a certain Leonie Ledru]185-a certain leonie ledru , [a diminutive , sharp - featured , and parchment - skinned creature of quick wits , frail conscience , and indurated feelings]892-a diminutive , sharp - featured , and parchment - skinned creature of quick wits , frail conscience , and indurated feelings ; a lawyer - like thing , of whom [I]0-i used to say that , had [she]185-a certain leonie ledru been [a boy]1928-a boy , [she]185-a certain leonie ledru would have made [a model of [an unprincipled , clever attorney]895-an unprincipled , clever attorney]894-a model of an unprincipled , clever attorney . Then came [Eulalie]161-eulalie , the proud beauty , [the Juno of [the school]2501-the school , whom six long years of drilling in the simple grammar of the English language]896-the juno of the school , whom six long years of drilling in the simple grammar of the english language had compelled , despite the stiff phlegm of [her]185-a certain leonie ledru intellect , to acquire a mechanical acquaintance with most of its rules . No smile , no trace of pleasure or satisfaction appeared in [Sylvie]166-sylvie ’s nun - like and passive face as [she]185-a certain leonie ledru heard [her]166-sylvie name read first . [I]0-i always felt saddened by the sight of [that poor girl]898-that poor girl ’s absolute quiescence on all occasions , and it was [my]0-i custom to look at [her]166-sylvie , to address [her]166-sylvie , as seldom as possible ; [her]166-sylvie extreme docility , [her]166-sylvie assiduous perseverance , would have recommended [her]166-sylvie warmly to [my]0-i good opinion ; [her]166-sylvie modesty , [her]166-sylvie intelligence , would have induced [me]0-i to feel most kindly — most affectionately towards [her]166-sylvie , notwithstanding the almost ghastly plainness of [her]166-sylvie features , the disproportion of [her]166-sylvie form , the corpse - like lack of animation in [her]166-sylvie countenance , had [I]0-i not been aware that every friendly word , every kindly action , would be reported by [her]166-sylvie to [[her]166-sylvie confessor]899-her confessor , and by [him]899-her confessor misinterpreted and poisoned . Once [I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand on [her]166-sylvie head , in token of approbation ; [I]0-i thought [Sylvie]166-sylvie was going to smile , [her]166-sylvie dim eye almost kindled ; but , presently , [she]166-sylvie shrank from [me]0-i ; [I]0-i was [a man]353-a man and [a heretic]901-a heretic ; [she]166-sylvie , [poor child]902-poor child ! [a destined nun and devoted Catholic]903-a destined nun and devoted catholic : thus a four - fold wall of separation divided [her]166-sylvie mind from [mine]0-i . A pert smirk , and a hard glance of triumph , was [Leonie]185-a certain leonie ledru ’s method of testifying [her]185-a certain leonie ledru gratification ; [Eulalie]161-eulalie looked sullen and envious — [she]185-a certain leonie ledru had hoped to be first . [Hortense]162-hortense and [Caroline]163-caroline exchanged a reckless grimace on hearing [their]904-their names read out somewhere near the bottom of the list ; the brand of mental inferiority was considered by [them]904-their as no disgrace , [their]904-their hopes for the future being based solely on [their]904-their personal attractions . This affair arranged , the regular lesson followed . During a brief interval , employed by [the pupils]2333-the pupils in ruling [their]2333-the pupils books , [my]0-i eye , ranging carelessly over the benches , observed , for the first time , that the farthest seat in the farthest row — a seat usually vacant — was again filled by [the new scholar]906-the new scholar , [the Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances so ostentatiously recommended to [me]0-i by [the directress]2533-the directress . To - day [I]0-i had on [my]0-i spectacles ; [her]185-a certain leonie ledru appearance , therefore , was clear to [me]0-i at the first glance ; [I]0-i had not to puzzle over it . [She]185-a certain leonie ledru looked young ; yet , had [I]0-i been required to name [her]185-a certain leonie ledru exact age , [I]0-i should have been somewhat nonplussed ; the slightness of [her]185-a certain leonie ledru figure might have suited seventeen ; a certain anxious and pre - occupied expression of face seemed the indication of riper years . [She]185-a certain leonie ledru was dressed , like all the rest , in a dark stuff gown and a white collar ; [her]185-a certain leonie ledru features were dissimilar to any there , not so rounded , more defined , yet scarcely regular . The shape of [her]185-a certain leonie ledru head too was different , the superior part more developed , the base considerably less . [I]0-i felt assured , at first sight , that [she]185-a certain leonie ledru was not [a Belgian]908-a belgian ; [her]185-a certain leonie ledru complexion , [her]185-a certain leonie ledru countenance , [her]185-a certain leonie ledru lineaments , [her]185-a certain leonie ledru figure , were all distinct from [theirs]909-theirs , and , evidently , the type of another race — of [a race less gifted with fullness of flesh and plenitude of blood]910-a race less gifted with fullness of flesh and plenitude of blood ; less jocund , material , unthinking . When [I]0-i first cast [my]0-i eyes on [her]185-a certain leonie ledru , [she]185-a certain leonie ledru sat looking fixedly down , [her]185-a certain leonie ledru chin resting on [her]185-a certain leonie ledru hand , and [she]185-a certain leonie ledru did not change [her]185-a certain leonie ledru attitude till [I]0-i commenced the lesson . [None of [the Belgian girls]912-the belgian girls]911-none of the belgian girls would have retained one position , and that a reflective one , for the same length of time . Yet , having intimated that [her]185-a certain leonie ledru appearance was peculiar , as being unlike that of [[her]185-a certain leonie ledru Flemish companions]913-her flemish companions , [I]0-i have little more to say respecting it ; [I]0-i can pronounce no encomiums on [her]185-a certain leonie ledru beauty , for [she]185-a certain leonie ledru was not beautiful ; nor offer condolence on [her]185-a certain leonie ledru plainness , for neither was [she]185-a certain leonie ledru plain ; a careworn character of forehead , and a corresponding moulding of the mouth , struck [me]0-i with a sentiment resembling surprise , but these traits would probably have passed unnoticed by [any less crotchety observer]914-any less crotchety observer . Now , [reader]2168-reader , though [I]0-i have spent more than a page in describing [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , [I]0-i know well enough that [I]0-i have left on [your]181-frances mind ’s eye no distinct picture of [her]185-a certain leonie ledru ; [I]0-i have not painted [her]185-a certain leonie ledru complexion , nor [her]185-a certain leonie ledru eyes , nor [her]185-a certain leonie ledru hair , nor even drawn the outline of [her]185-a certain leonie ledru shape . [You]181-frances can not tell whether [her]185-a certain leonie ledru nose was aquiline or retrousse , whether [her]185-a certain leonie ledru chin was long or short , [her]185-a certain leonie ledru face square or oval ; nor could [I]0-i the first day , and it is not [my]0-i intention to communicate to [you]181-frances at once a knowledge [I]0-i [myself]0-i gained by little and little . [I]0-i gave a short exercise : which [they]916-they all wrote down . [I]0-i saw [the new pupil]917-the new pupil was puzzled at first with the novelty of the form and language ; once or twice [she]917-the new pupil looked at [me]0-i with a sort of painful solicitude , as not comprehending at all what [I]0-i meant ; then [she]917-the new pupil was not ready when [the others]918-the others were , [she]917-the new pupil could not write [her]917-the new pupil phrases so fast as they did ; [I]0-i would not help [her]917-the new pupil , [I]0-i went on relentless . [She]917-the new pupil looked at [me]0-i ; [her]917-the new pupil eye said most plainly , “ [I]917-the new pupil can not follow [you]0-i . ”[917-the new pupil] [I]0-i disregarded the appeal , and , carelessly leaning back in [my]0-i chair , glancing from time to time with a nonchalant air out of the window , [I]0-i dictated a little faster . On looking towards [her]917-the new pupil again , [I]0-i perceived [her]917-the new pupil face clouded with embarrassment , but [she]917-the new pupil was still writing on most diligently ; [I]0-i paused a few seconds ; [she]917-the new pupil employed the interval in hurriedly re - perusing what [she]917-the new pupil had written , and shame and discomfiture were apparent in [her]917-the new pupil countenance ; [she]917-the new pupil evidently found [she]917-the new pupil had made great nonsense of it . In ten minutes more the dictation was complete , and , having allowed a brief space in which to correct it , [I]0-i took [their]919-their books ; it was with a reluctant hand [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances gave up [hers]181-frances , but , having once yielded it to [my]0-i possession , [she]917-the new pupil composed [her]917-the new pupil anxious face , as if , for the present [she]917-the new pupil had resolved to dismiss regret , and had made up [her]917-the new pupil mind to be thought unprecedentedly stupid . Glancing over [her]917-the new pupil exercise , [I]0-i found that several lines had been omitted , but what was written contained very few faults ; [I]0-i instantly inscribed “ Bon ”[0-i] at the bottom of the page , and returned it to [her]917-the new pupil ; [she]917-the new pupil smiled , at first incredulously , then as if reassured , but did not lift [her]917-the new pupil eyes ; [she]917-the new pupil could look at [me]0-i , it seemed , when perplexed and bewildered , but not when gratified ; [I]0-i thought that scarcely fair . SOME time elapsed before [I]0-i again gave a lesson in the first class ; the holiday of [Whitsuntide]45-whitsuntide occupied three days , and on the fourth it was the turn of the second division to receive [my]0-i instructions . As [I]0-i made the transit of the carré , [I]0-i observed , as usual , the band of [sewers surrounding [Mdlle]152-mdlle]920-sewers surrounding mdlle . [Henri]181-frances ; there were only about a dozen of [them]920-sewers surrounding mdlle , but [they]920-sewers surrounding mdlle made as much noise as might have sufficed for fifty ; they seemed very little under [her]917-the new pupil control ; three or four at once assailed [her]917-the new pupil with importunate requirements ; [she]917-the new pupil looked harassed , [she]917-the new pupil demanded silence , but in vain . [She]917-the new pupil saw [me]0-i , and [I]0-i read in [her]917-the new pupil eye pain that [a stranger]575-a stranger should witness the insubordination of [her]917-the new pupil pupils ; [she]917-the new pupil seemed to entreat order — [her]917-the new pupil prayers were useless ; then [I]0-i remarked that [she]917-the new pupil compressed [her]917-the new pupil lips and contracted [her]917-the new pupil brow ; and [her]917-the new pupil countenance , if [I]0-i read it correctly , said—“I have done [my]917-the new pupil best ; [I]917-the new pupil seem to merit blame notwithstanding ; blame [me]917-the new pupil then who will . ”[917-the new pupil] [I]0-i passed on ; as [I]0-i closed the [school - room]922-school - room door , [I]0-i heard [her]917-the new pupil say , suddenly and sharply , addressing [one of [the eldest and most turbulent of [the lot]925-the lot]924-the eldest and most turbulent of the lot]923-one of the eldest and most turbulent of the lot — “ [Amelie Mullenberg]186-amelie mullenberg , ask [me]917-the new pupil no question , and request of [me]917-the new pupil no assistance , for a week to come ; during that space of time [I]917-the new pupil will neither speak to [you]186-amelie mullenberg nor help [you]186-amelie mullenberg . ”[917-the new pupil] The words were uttered with emphasis — nay , with vehemence — and a comparative silence followed ; whether the calm was permanent , [I]0-i know not ; two doors now closed between [me]0-i and [the carré]2686-the carré . Next day was appropriated to [the first class]927-the first class ; on [my]0-i arrival , [I]0-i found [the directress]2533-the directress seated , as usual , in a chair between the two estrades , and before [her]2533-the directress was standing [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , in an attitude ( as it seemed to [me]0-i ) of somewhat reluctant attention . [The directress]2533-the directress was knitting and talking at the same time . Amidst the hum of [a large school - room]930-a large school - room , it was easy so to speak in the ear of [one person]931-one person , as to be heard by [that person alone]932-that person alone , and it was thus [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle parleyed with [[her]152-mdlle teacher]876-her teacher . The face of [the latter]934-the latter was a little flushed , not a little troubled ; there was vexation in it , whence resulting [I]0-i know not , for [the directress]2533-the directress looked very placid indeed ; [she]2533-the directress could not be scolding in such gentle whispers , and with so equable [a mien]936-a mien ; no , it was presently proved that [her]2533-the directress discourse had been of the most friendly tendency , for [I]0-i heard the closing words — “ C’est assez , ma bonne amie ; a present je ne veux pas vous retenir davantage . ”[0-i] Without reply , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances turned away ; dissatisfaction was plainly evinced in [her]2533-the directress face , and a smile , slight and brief , but bitter , distrustful , and , [I]0-i thought , scornful , curled [her]2533-the directress lip as [she]2533-the directress took [her]2533-the directress place in the class ; it was a secret , involuntary smile , which lasted but a second ; an air of depression succeeded , chased away presently by one of attention and interest , when [I]0-i gave the word for [all the pupils]937-all the pupils to take [their]937-all the pupils reading - books . In general [I]0-i hated the reading - lesson , it was such a torture to the ear to listen to [their]937-all the pupils uncouth mouthing of [my]0-i native tongue , and no effort of example or precept on [my]0-i part ever seemed to effect the slightest improvement in [their]937-all the pupils accent . To - day , each in [her]2533-the directress appropriate key , lisped , stuttered , mumbled , and jabbered as usual ; about fifteen had racked [me]0-i in turn , and [my]0-i auricular nerve was expecting with resignation the discords of the sixteenth , when [a full , though low voice]938-a full , though low voice , read out , in clear correct English . “ On [his]2786-his way to [Perth]46-perth , [the king]2787-the king was met by [a Highland woman]2788-a highland woman , calling [herself]2788-a highland woman [a prophetess]2789-a prophetess ; [she]2788-a highland woman stood at the side of [the ferry by which [he]2786-his was about to travel to [the north]1893-the north]2790-the ferry by which he was about to travel to the north , and cried with a loud voice , ‘ [[My]938-a full , though low voice lord [the king]2787-the king]2792-my lord the king , if [you]2787-the king pass [this water]2794-this water [you]2787-the king will never return again alive!’”—(vide[938-a full , though low voice] the History of [Scotland]47-scotland ) [I]0-i looked up in amazement ; the voice was a voice of [Albion]187-albion ; the accent was pure and silvery ; it only wanted firmness , and assurance , to be the counterpart of what [any well - educated lady]939-any well - educated lady in [Essex]48-essex or [Middlesex]49-middlesex might have enounced , yet [the speaker]2085-the speaker or [reader]2168-reader was no other than [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , in whose grave , joyless face [I]0-i saw no mark of consciousness that [she]152-mdlle had performed any extraordinary feat . [No one else evinced surprise]942-no one else evinced surprise either . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle knitted away assiduously ; [I]0-i was aware , however , that at the conclusion of the paragraph , [she]152-mdlle had lifted [her]152-mdlle eyelid and honoured [me]0-i with a glance sideways ; [she]152-mdlle did not know the full excellency of [the teacher]2505-the teacher ’s style of reading , but [she]152-mdlle perceived that [her]152-mdlle accent was not that of the others , and wanted to discover what [I]0-i thought ; [I]0-i masked [my]0-i visage with indifference , and ordered [the next girl]944-the next girl to proceed . When the lesson was over , [I]0-i took advantage of the confusion caused by breaking up , to approach [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances ; [she]181-frances was standing near the window and retired as [I]0-i advanced ; [she]181-frances thought [I]0-i wanted to look out , and did not imagine that [I]0-i could have anything to say to [her]181-frances . [I]0-i took [her]181-frances exercise - book out of [her]181-frances hand ; as [I]0-i turned over the leaves [I]0-i addressed [her]181-frances : — “ [You]181-frances have had lessons in English before ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked . “ No , [sir]625-sir . ”[0-i] “ No ! [you]181-frances read it well ; [you]181-frances have been in [England]11-england ? ”[0-i] “ Oh , no ! ”[0-i] with some animation . “ [You]181-frances have been in English families ? ”[0-i] Still the answer was “ No . ”[0-i] Here [my]0-i eye , resting on the flyleaf of the book , saw written , “ [Frances Evan Henri]188-frances evan henri . ”[0-i] “ [Your]181-frances name ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked “ Yes , [sir]625-sir . ”[0-i] [My]0-i interrogations were cut short ; [I]0-i heard a little rustling behind [me]0-i , and close at [my]0-i back was [the directress]2533-the directress , professing to be examining the interior of a desk . “ [Mademoiselle]153-zoraide , ”[2533-the directress] said [she]2533-the directress , looking up and addressing [the teacher]2505-the teacher , “ Will [you]153-zoraide have the goodness to go and stand in [the corridor]2466-the corridor , while [the young ladies]654-the young ladies are putting on [their]654-the young ladies things , and try to keep some order ? ”[2533-the directress] [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]188-frances evan henri obeyed . “ What splendid weather ! ”[2533-the directress] observed [the directress]2533-the directress cheerfully , glancing at the same time from the window . [I]0-i assented and was withdrawing . “ What of [[your]0-i new pupil]2799-your new pupil , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[2533-the directress] continued [she]2533-the directress , following [my]0-i retreating steps . “ Is [she]2799-your new pupil likely to make progress in English ? ”[2533-the directress] “ Indeed [I]2533-the directress can hardly judge . [She]2799-your new pupil possesses a pretty good accent ; of [her]2799-your new pupil real knowledge of the language [I]2533-the directress have as yet had no opportunity of forming an opinion . ”[2533-the directress] “ And [her]2799-your new pupil natural capacity , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? [I]2533-the directress wish [you]0-i a very good afternoon . ”[2533-the directress] [She]2533-the directress still pursued [me]0-i . “ [You]0-i will observe , [monsieur]638-monsieur , and tell [me]2533-the directress what [you]0-i think ; [I]2533-the directress could so much better rely on [your]0-i opinion than on [my]2533-the directress own ; [women]2360-women can not judge of these things as [men]1921-men can , and , excuse [my]2533-the directress pertinacity , [monsieur]638-monsieur , but it is natural [I]2533-the directress should feel interested about [this poor little girl]2806-this poor little girl ( pauvre petite ) ; [she]2806-this poor little girl has scarcely any relations , [her]2806-this poor little girl own efforts are all [she]2806-this poor little girl has to look to , [her]2806-this poor little girl acquirements must be [her]2806-this poor little girl sole fortune ; [her]2806-this poor little girl present position has once been [mine]0-i , or nearly so ; it is then but natural [I]2533-the directress should sympathize with [her]2806-this poor little girl ; and sometimes when [I]2533-the directress see the difficulty [she]2806-this poor little girl has in managing [pupils]2269-pupils , [I]2533-the directress feel quite chagrined . [I]2533-the directress doubt not [she]2806-this poor little girl does [her]2806-this poor little girl best , [her]2806-this poor little girl intentions are excellent ; but , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [she]2806-this poor little girl wants tact and firmness . [I]2533-the directress have talked to [her]2806-this poor little girl on the subject , but [I]2533-the directress am not fluent , and probably did not express [myself]2533-the directress with clearness ; [she]2806-this poor little girl never appears to comprehend [me]2533-the directress . Now , would [you]638-monsieur occasionally , when [you]638-monsieur see an opportunity , slip in a word of advice to [her]2806-this poor little girl on the subject ; [men]1921-men have so much more influence than [women]2360-women have — [they]1921-men argue so much more logically than [we]2811-we do ; and [you]638-monsieur , [monsieur]638-monsieur , in particular , have so paramount a power of making [yourself]638-monsieur obeyed ; a word of advice from [you]638-monsieur could not but do [her]2806-this poor little girl good ; even if [she]2806-this poor little girl were sullen and headstrong ( which [I]2533-the directress hope [she]2806-this poor little girl is not ) , [she]2806-this poor little girl would scarcely refuse to listen to [you]638-monsieur ; for [my]2533-the directress own part , [I]2533-the directress can truly say that [I]2533-the directress never attend one of [your]638-monsieur lessons without deriving benefit from witnessing [your]638-monsieur management of [the pupils]2333-the pupils . [The other masters]2814-the other masters are a constant source of anxiety to [me]2533-the directress ; [they]2814-the other masters can not impress [the young ladies]654-the young ladies with sentiments of respect , nor restrain the levity natural to [youth]2816-youth : in [you]638-monsieur , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]2533-the directress feel the most absolute confidence ; try then to put [this poor child]2818-this poor child into the way of controlling [[our]2819-our giddy , high - spirited [Brabantoises]189-brabantoises]2820-our giddy , high - spirited brabantoises . But , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]2533-the directress would add one word more ; do n’t alarm [her]2818-this poor child amour propre ; beware of inflicting a wound there . [I]2533-the directress reluctantly admit that in that particular [she]2818-this poor child is blameably — some would say ridiculously — susceptible . [I]2533-the directress fear [I]2533-the directress have touched this sore point inadvertently , and [she]2818-this poor child can not get over it . ”[2533-the directress] During the greater part of this harangue [my]0-i hand was on the lock of the outer door ; [I]0-i now turned it . “ Au revoir , mademoiselle , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , and [I]0-i escaped . [I]0-i saw [the directress]2533-the directress ’s stock of words was yet far from exhausted . [She]2533-the directress looked after [me]0-i , [she]2533-the directress would fain have detained [me]0-i longer . [Her]2533-the directress manner towards [me]0-i had been altered ever since [I]0-i had begun to treat [her]2533-the directress with hardness and indifference : [she]2533-the directress almost cringed to [me]0-i on every occasion ; [she]2533-the directress consulted [my]0-i countenance incessantly , and beset [me]0-i with innumerable little officious attentions . Servility creates despotism . This slavish homage , instead of softening [my]0-i heart , only pampered whatever was stern and exacting in its mood . The very circumstance of [her]2533-the directress hovering round [me]0-i like a fascinated bird , seemed to transform [me]0-i into a rigid pillar of stone ; [her]2533-the directress flatteries irritated [my]0-i scorn , [her]2533-the directress blandishments confirmed [my]0-i reserve . At times [I]0-i wondered what [she]2533-the directress meant by giving [herself]2533-the directress such trouble to win [me]0-i , when [the more profitable Pelet]949-the more profitable pelet was already in [her]2533-the directress nets , and when , too , [she]2533-the directress was aware that [I]0-i possessed [her]2533-the directress secret , for [I]0-i had not scrupled to tell [her]2533-the directress as much : but the fact is that as it was [her]2533-the directress nature to doubt the reality and under - value the worth of modesty , affection , disinterestedness — to regard these qualities as foibles of character — so it was equally [her]2533-the directress tendency to consider pride , hardness , selfishness , as proofs of strength . [She]2533-the directress would trample on the neck of humility , [she]2533-the directress would kneel at the feet of disdain ; [she]2533-the directress would meet tenderness with secret contempt , indifference [she]2533-the directress would woo with ceaseless assiduities . Benevolence , devotedness , enthusiasm , were [her]2533-the directress antipathies ; for dissimulation and self - interest [she]2533-the directress had a preference — they were real wisdom in [her]2533-the directress eyes ; moral and physical degradation , mental and bodily inferiority , [she]2533-the directress regarded with indulgence ; they were foils capable of being turned to good account as set - offs for [her]2533-the directress own endowments . To violence , injustice , tyranny , [she]2533-the directress succumbed — [they]950-they were [[her]2533-the directress natural masters]951-her natural masters ; [she]2533-the directress had no propensity to hate , no impulse to resist [them]950-they ; the indignation [their]950-they behests awake in some hearts was unknown in [hers]2533-the directress . From all this it resulted that [the false and selfish]952-the false and selfish called [her]2533-the directress wise , [the vulgar and debased]953-the vulgar and debased termed [her]2533-the directress charitable , the insolent and unjust dubbed [her]2533-the directress amiable , the conscientious and benevolent generally at first accepted as valid [her]2533-the directress claim to be considered one of [themselves]950-they ; but ere long the plating of pretension wore off , the real material appeared below , and [they]950-they laid [her]2533-the directress aside as a deception . In the course of another fortnight [I]0-i had seen sufficient of [Frances Evans Henri]181-frances , to enable [me]0-i to form a more definite opinion of [her]2533-the directress character . [I]0-i found [her]2533-the directress possessed in a somewhat remarkable degree of at least two good points , viz . , perseverance and a sense of duty ; [I]0-i found [she]2533-the directress was really capable of applying to study , of contending with difficulties . At first [I]0-i offered [her]2533-the directress the same help which [I]0-i had always found it necessary to confer on [the others]918-the others ; [I]0-i began with unloosing for [her]2533-the directress each knotty point , but [I]0-i soon discovered that such help was regarded by [[my]0-i new pupil]955-my new pupil as degrading ; [she]2533-the directress recoiled from it with a certain proud impatience . Hereupon [I]0-i appointed [her]2533-the directress long lessons , and left [her]2533-the directress to solve alone any perplexities [they]956-they might present . [She]2533-the directress set to the task with serious ardour , and having quickly accomplished one labour , eagerly demanded more . So much for [her]2533-the directress perseverance ; as to [her]2533-the directress sense of duty , it evinced itself thus : [she]2533-the directress liked to learn , but hated to teach ; [her]2533-the directress progress as [a pupil]957-a pupil depended upon [herself]2533-the directress , and [I]0-i saw that on [herself]2533-the directress [she]2533-the directress could calculate with certainty ; [her]2533-the directress success as [a teacher]631-a teacher rested partly , perhaps chiefly , upon the will of [others]2056-others ; it cost [her]2533-the directress a most painful effort to enter into conflict with this foreign will , to endeavour to bend it into subjection to [her]2533-the directress own ; for in what regarded [people]960-people in general the action of [her]2533-the directress will was impeded by many scruples ; it was as unembarrassed as strong where [her]2533-the directress own affairs were concerned , and to it [she]2533-the directress could at any time subject [her]2533-the directress inclination , if that inclination went counter to [her]2533-the directress convictions of right ; yet when called upon to wrestle with the propensities , the habits , the faults of [others]2056-others , of [children especially , who are deaf to reason , and , for the most part , insensate to persuasion]962-children especially , who are deaf to reason , and , for the most part , insensate to persuasion , [her]2533-the directress will sometimes almost refused to act ; then came in the sense of duty , and forced the reluctant will into operation . A wasteful expense of energy and labour was frequently the consequence ; [Frances]181-frances toiled for and with [[her]181-frances pupils]777-her pupils like a drudge , but it was long ere [her]181-frances conscientious exertions were rewarded by anything like docility on [their]777-her pupils part , because [they]777-her pupils saw that [they]777-her pupils had power over [her]181-frances , inasmuch as by resisting [her]181-frances painful attempts to convince , persuade , control — by forcing [her]181-frances to the employment of coercive measures — [they]777-her pupils could inflict upon [her]181-frances exquisite suffering . [Human beings]964-human beings — [human children]965-human children especially — seldom deny [themselves]964-human beings the pleasure of exercising a power which [they]964-human beings are conscious of possessing , even though that power consist only in a capacity to make [others]2056-others wretched ; [a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of [[his]967-a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of his instructor , while his nerves are tougher and his bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over that instructor instructor]968-his instructor , while [his]967-a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of his instructor , while his nerves are tougher and his bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over that instructor nerves are tougher and [his]967-a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of his instructor , while his nerves are tougher and his bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over that instructor bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over [that instructor]969-that instructor]967-a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of his instructor , while his nerves are tougher and his bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over that instructor , and [he]967-a pupil whose sensations are duller than those of his instructor , while his nerves are tougher and his bodily strength perhaps greater , has an immense advantage over that instructor will generally use it relentlessly , because [the very young , very healthy , very thoughtless]970-the very young , very healthy , very thoughtless , know neither how to sympathize nor how to spare . [Frances]181-frances , [I]0-i fear , suffered much ; a continual weight seemed to oppress [her]181-frances spirits ; [I]0-i have said [she]181-frances did not live in [the house]1897-the house , and whether in [[her]181-frances own abode]972-her own abode , wherever that might be , [she]181-frances wore the same preoccupied , unsmiling , sorrowfully resolved air that always shaded [her]181-frances features under the roof of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , [I]0-i could not tell . One day [I]0-i gave , as a devoir , the trite little anecdote of [Alfred]190-alfred tending cakes in [[the herdsman]973-the herdsman ’s hut]974-the herdsman ’s hut , to be related with amplifications . A singular affair [most of [the pupils]2333-the pupils]975-most of the pupils made of it ; brevity was what [they]975-most of the pupils had chiefly studied ; the majority of the narratives were perfectly unintelligible ; those of [Sylvie]166-sylvie and [Leonie Ledru]185-a certain leonie ledru alone pretended to anything like sense and connection . [Eulalie]161-eulalie , indeed , had hit , upon a clever expedient for at once ensuring accuracy and saving trouble ; [she]161-eulalie had obtained access somehow to an abridged history of [England]11-england , and had copied the anecdote out fair . [I]0-i wrote on the margin of [her]161-eulalie production “ Stupid and deceitful , ”[0-i] and then tore it down the middle . Last in the pile of single - leaved devoirs , [I]0-i found one of several sheets , neatly written out and stitched together ; [I]0-i knew the hand , and scarcely needed the evidence of the signature “ [Frances Evans Henri]181-frances ”[0-i] to confirm [my]0-i conjecture as to [the writer]977-the writer ’s identity . Night was [my]0-i usual time for correcting devoirs , and [[my]0-i own room]2411-my own room the usual scene of such task — task most onerous hitherto ; and it seemed strange to [me]0-i to feel rising within [me]0-i an incipient sense of interest , as [I]0-i snuffed the candle and addressed [myself]0-i to the perusal of [the poor teacher]979-the poor teacher ’s manuscript . “ Now , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i , “ [I]0-i shall see a glimpse of what [she]979-the poor teacher really is ; [I]0-i shall get an idea of the nature and extent of [her]979-the poor teacher powers ; not that [she]979-the poor teacher can be expected to express [herself]979-the poor teacher well in a foreign tongue , but still , if [she]979-the poor teacher has any mind , here will be a reflection of it . ”[0-i] The narrative commenced by a description of [[a Saxon peasant]980-a saxon peasant ’s hut , situated within the confines of [a great , leafless , winter forest]982-a great , leafless , winter forest]981-a saxon peasant ’s hut , situated within the confines of a great , leafless , winter forest ; it represented an evening in December ; flakes of snow were falling , and [the herdsman]973-the herdsman foretold a heavy storm ; [he]973-the herdsman summoned [[his]973-the herdsman wife]569-his wife to aid [him]973-the herdsman in collecting [their]985-their flock , roaming far away on [the pastoral banks of [the Thone]50-the thone]986-the pastoral banks of the thone ; [he]973-the herdsman warns [her]569-his wife that it will be late ere [they]985-their return . [The good woman]987-the good woman is reluctant to quit [her]987-the good woman occupation of baking cakes for the evening meal ; but acknowledging the primary importance of securing the herds and flocks , [she]987-the good woman puts on [her]987-the good woman sheep - skin mantle ; and , addressing [a stranger who rests half reclined on a bed of rushes near the hearth]988-a stranger who rests half reclined on a bed of rushes near the hearth , bids [him]988-a stranger who rests half reclined on a bed of rushes near the hearth mind the bread till [her]987-the good woman return . “ Take care , [young man]2822-young man , ”[987-the good woman] [she]987-the good woman continues , “ that [you]2822-young man fasten the door well after [us]985-their ; and , above all , open to none in [our]985-their absence ; whatever sound [you]2822-young man hear , stir not , and look not out . The night will soon fall ; [this forest]2823-this forest is most wild and lonely ; strange noises are often heard therein after sunset ; wolves haunt these glades , and [Danish warriors]2824-danish warriors infest [the country]334-the country ; worse things are talked of ; [you]2822-young man might chance to hear , as it were , a child cry , and on opening the door to afford it succour , a great black bull , or a shadowy goblin dog , might rush over the threshold ; or , more awful still , if something flapped , as with wings , against the lattice , and then a raven or a white dove flew in and settled on the hearth , [such a visitor]2826-such a visitor would be a sure sign of misfortune to [the house]1897-the house ; therefore , heed [my]987-the good woman advice , and lift the latchet for nothing . ”[987-the good woman] [[Her]987-the good woman husband]1958-her husband calls [her]987-the good woman away , [both]990-both depart . [The stranger , left alone]991-the stranger , left alone , listens awhile to the muffled snow - wind , the remote , swollen sound of [the river]1941-the river , and then [he]991-the stranger , left alone speaks . “ It is Christmas Eve , ”[991-the stranger , left alone] says [he]991-the stranger , left alone , “ [I]991-the stranger , left alone mark the date ; here [I]991-the stranger , left alone sit alone on a rude couch of rushes , sheltered by the thatch of [[a herdsman]2828-a herdsman ’s hut]2829-a herdsman ’s hut ; [I]991-the stranger , left alone , whose inheritance was [a kingdom]2830-a kingdom , owe [my]991-the stranger , left alone night ’s harbourage to [a poor serf]2831-a poor serf ; [my]991-the stranger , left alone throne is usurped , [my]991-the stranger , left alone crown presses the brow of [an invader]2832-an invader ; [I]991-the stranger , left alone have [no friends]2833-no friends ; [[my]991-the stranger , left alone troops]2834-my troops wander broken in [the hills of [Wales]51-wales]2835-the hills of wales ; [reckless robbers]2836-reckless robbers spoil [[my]991-the stranger , left alone country]706-my country ; [[my]991-the stranger , left alone subjects]2838-my subjects lie prostrate , [their]2838-my subjects breasts crushed by the heel of [the brutal Dane]2839-the brutal dane . Fate ! [thou]2840-thy hast done [thy]2840-thy worst , and now [thou]2840-thy standest before [me]991-the stranger , left alone resting [thy]2840-thy hand on [thy]2840-thy blunted blade . Ay ; [I]991-the stranger , left alone see [thine]2840-thy eye confront [mine]991-the stranger , left alone and demand why [I]991-the stranger , left alone still live , why [I]991-the stranger , left alone still hope . [Pagan demon]2841-pagan demon , [I]991-the stranger , left alone credit not thine omnipotence , and so can not succumb to [thy]2840-thy power . [[My]991-the stranger , left alone God]2282-my god , whose Son , as on this night , took on [Him]2843-him the form of [man]457-man , and for [man vouchsafed to suffer and bleed]2845-man vouchsafed to suffer and bleed , controls [thy]2840-thy hand , and without [His]2843-him behest [thou]2840-thy canst not strike a stroke . [[My]991-the stranger , left alone God]2282-my god is sinless , eternal , all - wise — in [Him]2282-my god is [my]991-the stranger , left alone trust ; and though stripped and crushed by [thee]2282-my god — though naked , desolate , void of resource — [I]991-the stranger , left alone do not despair , [I]991-the stranger , left alone can not despair : were the lance of [Guthrum]191-guthrum now wet with [my]991-the stranger , left alone blood , [I]991-the stranger , left alone should not despair . [I]991-the stranger , left alone watch , [I]991-the stranger , left alone toil , [I]991-the stranger , left alone hope , [I]991-the stranger , left alone pray ; [Jehovah]192-jehovah , in [his]192-jehovah own time , will aid . ”[991-the stranger , left alone] [I]0-i need not continue the quotation ; the whole devoir was in the same strain . There were errors of orthography , there were foreign idioms , there were some faults of construction , there were verbs irregular transformed into verbs regular ; it was mostly made up , as the above example shows , of short and somewhat rude sentences , and the style stood in great need of polish and sustained dignity ; yet such as it was , [I]0-i had hitherto seen nothing like it in the course of [my]0-i professorial experience . [The girl]993-the girl ’s mind had conceived a picture of [the hut]994-the hut , of [the two peasants]995-the two peasants , of [the crownless king]996-the crownless king ; [she]993-the girl had imagined [the wintry forest]997-the wintry forest , [she]993-the girl had recalled [the old Saxon ghost - legends]998-the old saxon ghost - legends , [she]993-the girl had appreciated [Alfred]190-alfred ’s courage under calamity , [she]993-the girl had remembered [his]190-alfred Christian education , and had shown [him]190-alfred , with the rooted confidence of those primitive days , relying on the scriptural Jehovah for aid against the mythological Destiny . This [she]993-the girl had done without a hint from [me]0-i : [I]0-i had given the subject , but not said a word about the manner of treating it . “ [I]0-i will find , or make , an opportunity of speaking to [her]993-the girl , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i as [I]0-i rolled the devoir up ; “ [I]0-i will learn what [she]993-the girl has of English in [her]993-the girl besides the name of [Frances Evans]181-frances ; [she]993-the girl is [no novice in the language]2847-no novice in the language , that is evident , yet [she]993-the girl told [me]0-i [she]993-the girl had neither been in [England]11-england , nor taken lessons in English , nor lived in [English families]2848-english families . ”[0-i] In the course of [my]0-i next lesson , [I]0-i made a report of [the other devoirs]999-the other devoirs , dealing out praise and blame in very small retail parcels , according to [my]0-i custom , for there was no use in blaming severely , and high encomiums were rarely merited . [I]0-i said nothing of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances ’s exercise , and , spectacles on nose , [I]0-i endeavoured to decipher in [her]152-mdlle countenance [her]152-mdlle sentiments at the omission . [I]0-i wanted to find out whether in [her]152-mdlle existed a consciousness of [her]152-mdlle own talents . “ If [she]152-mdlle thinks [she]152-mdlle did a clever thing in composing [that devoir]2849-that devoir , [she]152-mdlle will now look mortified , ”[0-i] thought [I.]0-i Grave as usual , almost sombre , was [her]152-mdlle face ; as usual , [her]152-mdlle eyes were fastened on the cahier open before [her]152-mdlle ; there was something , [I]0-i thought , of expectation in [her]152-mdlle attitude , as [I]0-i concluded a brief review of the last devoir , and when , casting it from [me]0-i and rubbing [my]0-i hands , [I]0-i bade [them]1000-them take [their]1000-them grammars , some slight change did pass over [her]152-mdlle air and mien , as though [she]152-mdlle now relinquished a faint prospect of pleasant excitement ; [she]152-mdlle had been waiting for something to be discussed in which [she]152-mdlle had a degree of interest ; the discussion was not to come on , so expectation sank back , shrunk and sad , but attention , promptly filling up the void , repaired in a moment the transient collapse of feature ; still , [I]0-i felt , rather than saw , during the whole course of the lesson , that a hope had been wrenched from [her]152-mdlle , and that if [she]152-mdlle did not show distress , it was because [she]152-mdlle would not . At four o’clock , when the bell rang and [the room]1922-the room was in immediate tumult , instead of taking [my]0-i hat and starting from the estrade , [I]0-i sat still a moment . [I]0-i looked at [Frances]181-frances , [she]181-frances was putting [her]181-frances books into [her]181-frances cabas ; having fastened the button , [she]181-frances raised [her]181-frances head ; encountering [my]0-i eye , [she]181-frances made a quiet , respectful obeisance , as bidding good afternoon , and was turning to depart : — “ Come here , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , lifting [my]0-i finger at the same time . [She]181-frances hesitated ; [she]181-frances could not hear the words amidst the uproar now pervading [both school - rooms]1002-both school - rooms ; [I]0-i repeated the sign ; [she]181-frances approached ; again [she]181-frances paused within half a yard of [the estrade]2476-the estrade , and looked shy , and still doubtful whether [she]181-frances had mistaken [my]0-i meaning . “ Step up , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , speaking with decision . It is the only way of dealing with [diffident , easily embarrassed characters]1004-diffident , easily embarrassed characters , and with some slight manual aid [I]0-i presently got [her]181-frances placed just where [I]0-i wanted [her]181-frances to be , that is , between [my]0-i desk and the window , where [she]181-frances was screened from the rush of the second division , and where [no one]757-no one could sneak behind [her]181-frances to listen . “ Take a seat , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , placing a tabouret ; and [I]0-i made [her]181-frances sit down . [I]0-i knew what [I]0-i was doing would be considered a very strange thing , and , what was more , [I]0-i did not care . [Frances]181-frances knew it also , and , [I]0-i fear , by an appearance of agitation and trembling , that [she]181-frances cared much . [I]0-i drew from [my]0-i pocket the rolled - up devoir . “ This is [yours]181-frances , [I]0-i suppose ? ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , addressing [her]181-frances in English , for [I]0-i now felt sure [she]181-frances could speak English . “ Yes , ”[181-frances] [she]181-frances answered distinctly ; and as [I]0-i unrolled it and laid it out flat on the desk before [her]181-frances with [my]0-i hand upon it , and a pencil in that hand , [I]0-i saw [her]181-frances moved , and , as it were , kindled ; [her]181-frances depression beamed as a cloud might behind which the sun is burning . “ [This devoir]2850-this devoir has numerous faults , ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i “ It will take [you]181-frances some years of careful study before [you]181-frances are in a condition to write English with absolute correctness . [Attend]193-attend : [I]0-i will point out some principal defects . ”[0-i] And [I]0-i went through it carefully , noting every error , and demonstrating why they were errors , and how the words or phrases ought to have been written . In the course of this sobering process [she]181-frances became calm . [I]0-i now went on : “ As to the substance of [[your]181-frances devoir]2851-your devoir , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , it has surprised [me]0-i ; [I]0-i perused it with pleasure , because [I]0-i saw in it some proofs of taste and fancy . Taste and fancy are not the highest gifts of the human mind , but such as they are [you]181-frances possess them — not probably in a paramount degree , but in a degree beyond what [the majority]2575-the majority can boast .
