[You]181-frances may then take courage ; cultivate the faculties that [God]119-god and nature have bestowed on [you]181-frances , and do not fear in any crisis of suffering , under any pressure of injustice , to derive free and full consolation from the consciousness of [their]2853-their strength and rarity . ”[0-i] “ Strength and rarity ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i repeated to [myself]0-i ; “ ay , the words are probably true , ”[0-i] for on looking up , [I]0-i saw the sun had dissevered its screening cloud , [her]181-frances countenance was transfigured , a smile shone in [her]181-frances eyes — a smile almost triumphant ; it seemed to say — “ [I]181-frances am glad [you]181-frances have been forced to discover so much of [my]181-frances nature ; [you]181-frances need not so carefully moderate [your]181-frances language . Do [you]181-frances think [I]181-frances am [myself]181-frances [a stranger to [myself]181-frances]2854-a stranger to myself ? What [you]181-frances tell [me]181-frances in terms so qualified , [I]181-frances have known fully from [a child]2855-a child . ”[181-frances] [She]181-frances did say this as plainly as a frank and flashing glance could , but in a moment the glow of [her]181-frances complexion , the radiance of [her]181-frances aspect , had subsided ; if strongly conscious of [her]181-frances talents , [she]181-frances was equally conscious of [her]181-frances harassing defects , and the remembrance of these obliterated for a single second , now reviving with sudden force , at once subdued the too vivid characters in which [her]181-frances sense of [her]181-frances powers had been expressed . So quick was the revulsion of feeling , [I]0-i had not time to check [her]181-frances triumph by reproof ; ere [I]0-i could contract [my]0-i brows to a frown [she]181-frances had become serious and almost mournful - looking . “ Thank [you]0-i , [sir]625-sir , ”[181-frances] said [she]181-frances , rising . There was gratitude both in [her]181-frances voice and in the look with which [she]181-frances accompanied it . It was time , indeed , for [our]1006-our conference to terminate ; for , when [I]0-i glanced around , behold [all the boarders]1007-all the boarders ( [the day - scholars]2717-the day - scholars had departed ) were congregated within a yard or two of [my]0-i desk , and stood staring with eyes and mouths wide open ; [the three maitresses]1009-the three maitresses formed a whispering knot in one corner , and , close at [my]0-i elbow , was [the directress]2533-the directress , sitting on a low chair , calmly clipping the tassels of [her]2533-the directress finished purse . AFTER all [I]0-i had profited but imperfectly by the opportunity [I]0-i had so boldly achieved of speaking to [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances ; it was [my]0-i intention to ask [her]181-frances how [she]181-frances came to be possessed of two English baptismal names , [Frances]181-frances and [Evans]181-frances , in addition to [her]181-frances French surname , also whence [she]181-frances derived [her]181-frances good accent . [I]0-i had forgotten both points , or , rather , [our]1011-our colloquy had been so brief that [I]0-i had not had time to bring them forward ; moreover , [I]0-i had not half tested [her]181-frances powers of speaking English ; all [I]0-i had drawn from [her]181-frances in that language were the words “ Yes , ”[0-i] and “ Thank [you]0-i , [sir]625-sir . ”[0-i] “ No matter , ”[0-i] [I]0-i reflected . “ What has been left incomplete now , shall be finished another day . ”[0-i] Nor did [I]0-i fail to keep the promise thus made to [myself]0-i . It was difficult to get even a few words of particular conversation with [one pupil among so many]1012-one pupil among so many ; but , according to the old proverb , “ Where there is a will , there is a way ; ”[0-i] and again and again [I]0-i managed to find an opportunity for exchanging a few words with [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , regardless that envy stared and [detraction]194-detraction whispered whenever [I]0-i approached [her]181-frances . “ [Your]181-frances book an instant . ”[181-frances] Such was the mode in which [I]0-i often began these brief dialogues ; the time was always just at the conclusion of the lesson ; and motioning to [her]181-frances to rise , [I]0-i installed [myself]0-i in [her]181-frances place , allowing [her]181-frances to stand deferentially at [my]0-i side ; for [I]0-i esteemed it wise and right in [her]181-frances case to enforce strictly all forms ordinarily in use between [master]1013-master and [pupil]1014-pupil ; the rather because [I]0-i perceived that in proportion as [my]0-i manner grew austere and magisterial , [hers]181-frances became easy and self - possessed — an odd contradiction , doubtless , to the ordinary effect in such cases ; but so it was . “ A pencil , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , holding out [my]0-i hand without looking at [her]181-frances . ( [I]0-i am now about to sketch a brief report of the first of these conferences . ) [She]181-frances gave [me]0-i one , and while [I]0-i underlined some errors in a grammatical exercise [she]181-frances had written , [I]0-i observed — “ [You]181-frances are not [a native of [Belgium]21-belgium]2858-a native of belgium ? ”[0-i] “ No . ”[181-frances] “ Nor of [France]42-france ? ”[181-frances] “ No . ”[181-frances] “ Where , then , is [[your]181-frances birthplace]2859-your birthplace ? ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances was born at [Geneva]52-geneva . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances do n’t call [Frances]181-frances and [Evans Swiss]181-frances names , [I]181-frances presume ? ”[181-frances] “ No , [sir]625-sir ; they are English names . ”[181-frances] “ Just so ; and is it the custom of [the Genevese]2861-the genevese to give [[their]2861-the genevese children]2862-their children English appellatives ? ”[181-frances] “ Non , [Monsieur]638-monsieur ; mais — ”[181-frances] “ Speak English , if [you]625-sir please . ”[181-frances] “ [Mais]195-mais — ”[181-frances] “ English — ”[181-frances] “ But ”[181-frances] ( slowly and with embarrassment ) “ [[my]181-frances parents]2864-my parents were not all the two Genevese . ”[181-frances] “ Say both , instead of ‘ all the two , ’ mademoiselle . ”[181-frances] “ [Not both Swiss]2865-not both swiss : [[my]181-frances mother]1887-my mother was English . ”[181-frances] “ Ah ! and of English extraction ? ”[181-frances] “ Yes — [[her]1887-my mother ancestors]2867-her ancestors were all English . ”[181-frances] “ And [[your]181-frances father]489-your father ? ”[181-frances] “ [He]489-your father was [Swiss]196-the swiss . ”[181-frances] “ What besides ? What was [his]489-your father profession ? ”[181-frances] “ [Ecclesiastic — pastor]2869-ecclesiastic — pastor — [he]489-your father had [a church]2870-a church . ”[181-frances] “ Since [[your]181-frances mother]2871-your mother is [an Englishwoman]2755-an englishwoman , why do [you]181-frances not speak English with more facility ? ”[181-frances] “ Maman est morte , il y a dix ans . ”[181-frances] “ And [you]181-frances do homage to [her]1887-my mother memory by forgetting [her]1887-my mother language . Have the goodness to put French out of [your]181-frances mind so long as [I]181-frances converse with [you]181-frances — keep to English . ”[181-frances] “ C’est si difficile , [monsieur]638-monsieur , quand on n’en a plus l’habitude . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances had the habitude formerly , [I]181-frances suppose ? Now answer [me]181-frances in [[your]181-frances mother]2871-your mother tongue . ”[181-frances] “ Yes , [sir]625-sir , [I]181-frances spoke the English more than the French when [I]181-frances was [a child]2855-a child . ”[181-frances] “ Why do [you]181-frances not speak it now ? ”[181-frances] “ Because [I]181-frances have [no English friends]2877-no english friends . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances live with [[your]181-frances father]489-your father , [I]181-frances suppose ? ”[181-frances] “ [[My]181-frances father]298-my father is dead . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances have [brothers]394-brothers and [sisters]2881-sisters ? ”[181-frances] “ Not one . ”[181-frances] “ Do [you]181-frances live alone ? ”[181-frances] “ No — [I]181-frances have [an aunt]2882-an aunt — ma tante [Julienne]197-julienne . ”[181-frances] “ [[[Your]181-frances father]489-your father ’s sister]2884-your father ’s sister ? ”[181-frances] “ Justement , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[181-frances] “ Is that English ? ”[181-frances] “ No — but [I]181-frances forget — ”[181-frances] “ For which , [mademoiselle]153-zoraide , if [you]153-zoraide were [a child]2855-a child [I]181-frances should certainly devise some slight punishment ; at [your]153-zoraide age — [you]153-zoraide must be two or three and twenty , [I]181-frances should think ? ”[181-frances] “ Pas encore , [monsieur]638-monsieur — en un mois j’aurai dix - neuf ans . ”[181-frances] “ Well , nineteen is a mature age , and , having attained it , [you]153-zoraide ought to be so solicitous for [your]153-zoraide own improvement , that it should not be needful for [a master]2226-a master to remind [you]153-zoraide twice of the expediency of [your]153-zoraide speaking English whenever practicable . ”[181-frances] To this wise speech [I]0-i received no answer ; and , when [I]0-i looked up , [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil was smiling to [herself]1015-my pupil a much - meaning , though not very gay smile ; it seemed to say , “ [He]638-monsieur talks of [he]638-monsieur knows not what : ”[181-frances] it said this so plainly , that [I]0-i determined to request information on the point concerning which [my]0-i ignorance seemed to be thus tacitly affirmed . “ Are [you]153-zoraide solicitous for [your]153-zoraide own improvement ? ”[0-i] “ Rather . ”[1015-my pupil] “ How do [you]153-zoraide prove it , [mademoiselle]153-zoraide ? ”[1015-my pupil] An odd question , and bluntly put ; it excited a second smile . “ Why , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]1015-my pupil am not inattentive — am [I]1015-my pupil ? [I]1015-my pupil learn [my]1015-my pupil lessons well — ”[1015-my pupil] “ Oh , [a child]2855-a child can do that ! and what more do [you]153-zoraide do ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ What more can [I]1015-my pupil do ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ Oh , certainly , not much ; but [you]153-zoraide are [a teacher]631-a teacher , are [you]153-zoraide not , as well as [a pupil]957-a pupil ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ Yes . ”[1015-my pupil] “ [You]153-zoraide teach lace - mending ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ Yes . ”[1015-my pupil] “ A dull , stupid occupation ; do [you]153-zoraide like it ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ No — it is tedious . ”[1015-my pupil] “ Why do [you]153-zoraide pursue it ? Why do [you]153-zoraide not rather teach history , geography , grammar , even arithmetic ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ Is [monsieur]638-monsieur certain that [I]1015-my pupil am [myself]1015-my pupil thoroughly acquainted with these studies ? ”[1015-my pupil] “ [I]1015-my pupil do n’t know ; [you]153-zoraide ought to be at [your]153-zoraide age . ”[1015-my pupil] “ But [I]1015-my pupil never was at [school]2894-school , [monsieur]638-monsieur — ”[1015-my pupil] “ Indeed ! What then were [[your]153-zoraide friends]2896-your friends — what was [[your]153-zoraide aunt]2897-your aunt about ? [She]2897-your aunt is very much to blame . ”[1015-my pupil] “ [No monsieur]2898-no monsieur , no — [[my]1015-my pupil aunt]2899-my aunt is good — [she]2899-my aunt is not to blame — [she]2899-my aunt does what [she]2899-my aunt can ; [she]2899-my aunt lodges and nourishes [me]1015-my pupil ”[1015-my pupil] ( [I]0-i report [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]197-julienne ’s phrases literally , and it was thus [she]152-mdlle translated from the French ) . “ [She]2899-my aunt is not rich ; [she]2899-my aunt has only an annuity of twelve hundred francs , and it would be impossible for [her]2899-my aunt to send [me]1015-my pupil to [school]2894-school . ”[1015-my pupil] “ Rather , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i on hearing this , but [I]0-i continued , in the dogmatical tone [I]0-i had adopted : — “ It is sad , however , that [you]197-julienne should be brought up in ignorance of the most ordinary branches of education ; had [you]197-julienne known something of history and grammar [you]197-julienne might , by degrees , have relinquished [your]197-julienne lace - mending drudgery , and risen in [the world]1872-the world . ”[0-i] “ It is what [I]0-i mean to do . ”[0-i] “ How ? By a knowledge of English alone ? That will not suffice ; [no respectable family]2902-no respectable family will receive [a governess whose whole stock of knowledge consists in a familiarity with one foreign language]2903-a governess whose whole stock of knowledge consists in a familiarity with one foreign language . ”[0-i] “ [Monsieur]2904-monsieur , [I]0-i know other things . ”[0-i] “ Yes , yes , [you]197-julienne can work with [Berlin]198-berlin wools , and embroider handkerchiefs and collars — that will do little for [you]197-julienne . ”[152-mdlle] [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]197-julienne ’s lips were unclosed to answer , but [she]1016-she checked [herself]1016-she , as thinking the discussion had been sufficiently pursued , and remained silent . “ Speak , ”[0-i] [I]0-i continued , impatiently ; “ [I]0-i never like the appearance of acquiescence when the reality is not there ; and [you]197-julienne had a contradiction at [your]197-julienne tongue ’s end . ”[0-i] “ [Monsieur]2905-monsieur , [I]0-i have had many lessons both in grammar , history , geography , and arithmetic . [I]0-i have gone through a course of each study . ”[0-i] “ Bravo ! but how did [you]197-julienne manage it , since [[your]197-julienne aunt]2897-your aunt could not afford to send [you]197-julienne to [school]2894-school ? ”[0-i] “ By lace - mending ; by the thing [monsieur]638-monsieur despises so much . ”[0-i] “ Truly ! And now , mademoiselle , it will be a good exercise for [you]197-julienne to explain to [me]0-i in English how such a result was produced by such means . ”[0-i] “ [Monsieur]2909-monsieur , [I]1017-i begged [[my]1017-i aunt]2899-my aunt to have [me]1017-i taught lace - mending soon after [we]2911-we came to [Brussels]18-brussels , because [I]1017-i knew it was a métier , a trade which was easily learnt , and by which [I]1017-i could earn some money very soon . [I]1017-i learnt it in a few days , and [I]1017-i quickly got work , for [all the [Brussels]18-brussels ladies]2912-all the brussels ladies have old lace — very precious — which must be mended all the times it is washed . [I]1017-i earned money a little , and this money [I]1017-i gave for lessons in the studies [I]1017-i have mentioned ; some of it [I]1017-i spent in buying books , English books especially ; soon [I]1017-i shall try to find a place of [governess]2018-governess , or [school - teacher]2914-school - teacher , when [I]1017-i can write and speak English well ; but it will be difficult , because [those who know [I]1017-i have been [a lace - mender]2916-a lace - mender]2915-those who know i have been a lace - mender will despise [me]1017-i , as [the pupils here]2917-the pupils here despise [me]1017-i . Pourtant j’ai mon projet , ”[1017-i] [she]1017-i added in a lower tone . “ What is it ? ”[1017-i] “ [I]1017-i will go and live in [England]11-england ; [I]1017-i will teach French [there]1998-there . ”[1017-i] The words were pronounced emphatically . [She]1017-i said “ [England]11-england ”[1017-i] as [you]1018-you might suppose [an Israelite of [Moses]199-moses]1019-an israelite of moses ’ days would have said [Canaan]53-canaan . “ Have [you]0-i a wish to see [England]11-england ? ”[1017-i] “ Yes , and an intention . ”[1017-i] And here a voice , the voice of [the directress]2533-the directress , interposed : “ [Mademoiselle Henri]200-henri , je crois qu’il va pleuvoir ; vous feriez bien , ma bonne amie , de retourner chez vous tout de suite . ”[2533-the directress] In silence , without a word of thanks for this officious warning , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri collected [her]200-henri books ; [she]200-henri moved to [me]0-i respectfully , endeavoured to move to [her]200-henri superior , though the endeavour was almost a failure , for [her]200-henri head seemed as if it would not bend , and thus departed . Where there is one grain of perseverance or wilfulness in the composition , trifling obstacles are ever known rather to stimulate than discourage . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle might as well have spared [herself]152-mdlle the trouble of giving that intimation about the weather ( by - the - by [her]152-mdlle prediction was falsified by the event — it did not rain that evening ) . At the close of the next lesson [I]0-i was again at [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [[Henri]200-henri ’s desk]1021-henri ’s desk . Thus did [I]0-i accost [her]200-henri : — “ What is [your]200-henri idea of [England]11-england , [mademoiselle]200-henri ? Why do [you]200-henri wish to go [there]1998-there ? ”[0-i] Accustomed by this time to the calculated abruptness of [my]0-i manner , it no longer discomposed or surprised [her]200-henri , and [she]200-henri answered with only so much of hesitation as was rendered inevitable by the difficulty [she]200-henri experienced in improvising the translation of [her]200-henri thoughts from French to English . “ [England]11-england is something unique , as [I]200-henri have heard and read ; [my]200-henri idea of it is vague , and [I]200-henri want to go [there]1998-there to render [my]200-henri idea clear , definite . ”[200-henri] “ Hum ! How much of [England]11-england do [you]200-henri suppose [you]200-henri could see if [you]200-henri went [there]1998-there in the capacity of [a teacher]631-a teacher ? A strange notion [you]200-henri must have of getting a clear and definite idea of [a country]2923-a country ! All [you]200-henri could see of [Great Britain]30-great britain would be the interior of [a school]2924-a school , or at most of [one or two private dwellings]2925-one or two private dwellings . ”[1022-i] “ It would be [an English school]2926-an english school ; they would be [English dwellings]2927-english dwellings . ”[1022-i] “ Indisputably ; but what then ? What would be the value of observations made on a scale so narrow ? ”[200-henri] “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , might not [one]1983-one learn something by analogy ? An — echantillon — a — a sample often serves to give an idea of the whole ; besides , narrow and wide are words comparative , are they not ? All [my]1022-i life would perhaps seem narrow in [your]638-monsieur eyes — all the life of a — that little animal subterranean — une taupe — comment dit - on ? ”[1022-i] “ [Mole]201-mole . ”[1022-i] “ Yes — a mole , which lives underground would seem narrow even to [me]1022-i . ”[1022-i] “ Well , [mademoiselle]200-henri — what then ? Proceed . ”[200-henri] “ Mais , [monsieur]638-monsieur , vous [me]1022-i comprenez . ”[1022-i] “ Not in the least ; have the goodness to explain . ”[1022-i] “ Why , [monsieur]638-monsieur , it is just so . In [Switzerland]55-switzerland [I]200-henri have done but little , learnt but little , and seen but little ; [my]200-henri life there was in a circle ; [I]200-henri walked the same round every day ; [I]200-henri could not get out of it ; had [I]200-henri rested — remained there even till [my]200-henri death , [I]200-henri should never have enlarged it , because [I]200-henri am poor and not skilful , [I]200-henri have not great acquirements ; when [I]200-henri was quite tired of this round , [I]200-henri begged [[my]200-henri aunt]2899-my aunt to go to [Brussels]18-brussels ; [my]200-henri existence is no larger here , because [I]200-henri am no richer or higher ; [I]200-henri walk in as narrow a limit , but the scene is changed ; it would change again if [I]200-henri went to [England]11-england . [I]200-henri knew something of [the bourgeois of [Geneva]52-geneva]2933-the bourgeois of geneva , now [I]200-henri know something of [the bourgeois of [Brussels]18-brussels]2934-the bourgeois of brussels ; if [I]200-henri went to [London]19-london , [I]200-henri would know something of [the bourgeois of [London]19-london]2935-the bourgeois of london . Can [you]2936-you make any sense out of what [I]200-henri say , [monsieur]638-monsieur , or is it all obscure ? ”[200-henri] “ [I]1022-i see , [I]1022-i see — now let [us]2938-us advert to another subject ; [you]2936-you propose to devote [your]2936-you life to teaching , and [you]2936-you are [a most unsuccessful teacher]2939-a most unsuccessful teacher ; [you]2936-you can not keep [[your]2936-you pupils]718-your pupils in order . ”[1022-i] A flush of painful confusion was the result of this harsh remark ; [she]1022-i bent [her]1022-i head to the desk , but soon raising it replied — “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]1022-i am not [a skilful teacher]2942-a skilful teacher , it is true , but practice improves ; besides , [I]1022-i work under difficulties ; here [I]1022-i only teach sewing , [I]1022-i can show no power in sewing , no superiority — it is a subordinate art ; then [I]1022-i have [no associates]2943-no associates in [this house]2024-this house , [I]1022-i am isolated ; [I]1022-i am too [a heretic]901-a heretic , which deprives [me]1022-i of influence . ”[1022-i] “ And in [England]11-england [you]638-monsieur would be [a foreigner]2050-a foreigner ; that too would deprive [you]638-monsieur of influence , and would effectually separate [you]638-monsieur from all round [you]638-monsieur ; in [England]11-england [you]638-monsieur would have as few connections , as little importance as [you]638-monsieur have [here]398-here . ”[200-henri] “ But [I]1023-i should be learning something ; for the rest , there are probably difficulties for such as [I]1023-i everywhere , and if [I]1023-i must contend , and perhaps be conquered , [I]1023-i would rather submit to English pride than to Flemish coarseness ; besides , [monsieur]638-monsieur — ”[1023-i] [She]1023-i stopped — not evidently from any difficulty in finding words to express [herself]1023-i , but because discretion seemed to say , “ [You]638-monsieur have said enough . ”[1023-i] “ Finish [your]1023-i phrase , ”[0-i] [I]0-i urged . “ Besides , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]0-i long to live once more among [Protestants]2950-protestants ; [they]2950-protestants are more honest than [Catholics]2951-catholics ; [a Romish school]2952-a romish school is [a building with porous walls , a hollow floor]2953-a building with porous walls , a hollow floor , a false ceiling ; [every room in [this house]2024-this house]2954-every room in this house , [monsieur]638-monsieur , has eyeholes and ear - holes , and what [the house]1897-the house is , [the inhabitants]2958-the inhabitants are , very treacherous ; [they]2958-the inhabitants all think it lawful to tell lies ; [they]2958-the inhabitants all call it politeness to profess friendship where [they]2958-the inhabitants feel hatred . ”[0-i] “ All ? ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ; “ [you]1023-i mean [the pupils]2333-the pupils — [the mere children]2960-the mere children — inexperienced , giddy things , who have not learnt to distinguish the difference between right and wrong ? ”[0-i] “ On the contrary , [monsieur]638-monsieur — [the children]2962-the children are the most sincere ; [they]2962-the children have not yet had time to become accomplished in duplicity ; [they]2962-the children will tell lies , but [they]2962-the children do it inartificially , and [you]638-monsieur know [they]2962-the children are lying ; but [the grown - up people]2963-the grown - up people are very false ; [they]2962-the children deceive [strangers]2964-strangers , [they]2962-the children deceive [each other]283-each other — ”[1024-a servant here] [A servant here]1024-a servant here entered : — “ [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri — [Mdlle]152-mdlle . Reuter vous prie de vouloir bien conduire la petite de Dorlodot chez elle , elle vous attend dans [le cabinet de Rosalie la portiere]2966-le cabinet de rosalie la portiere — c’est que sa bonne n’est pas venue la chercher — voyez - vous . ”[1024-a servant here] “ Eh bien ! est - ce que je suis sa bonne — moi ? ”[152-mdlle] demanded [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ; then smiling , with that same bitter , derisive smile [I]0-i had seen on [her]200-henri lips once before , [she]200-henri hastily rose and made [her]200-henri exit . [THE young Anglo - Swiss]1025-the young anglo - swiss evidently derived both pleasure and profit from the study of [her]200-henri mother - tongue . In teaching [her]200-henri [I]0-i did not , of course , confine [myself]0-i to the ordinary school routine ; [I]0-i made instruction in English a channel for instruction in literature . [I]0-i prescribed to [her]200-henri a course of reading ; [she]200-henri had a little selection of English classics , a few of which had been left [her]200-henri by [[her]200-henri mother]1026-her mother , and the others [she]200-henri had purchased with [her]200-henri own penny - fee . [I]0-i lent [her]200-henri some more modern works ; all these [she]200-henri read with avidity , giving [me]0-i , in writing , a clear summary of each work when [she]200-henri had perused it . Composition , too , [she]200-henri delighted in . Such occupation seemed the very breath of [her]200-henri nostrils , and soon [her]200-henri improved productions wrung from [me]0-i the avowal that those qualities in [her]200-henri [I]0-i had termed taste and fancy ought rather to have been denominated judgment and imagination . When [I]0-i intimated so much , which [I]0-i did as usual in dry and stinted phrase , [I]0-i looked for the radiant and exulting smile [my]0-i one word of eulogy had elicited before ; but [Frances]181-frances coloured . If [she]200-henri did smile , it was very softly and shyly ; and instead of looking up to [me]0-i with a conquering glance , [her]200-henri eyes rested on [my]0-i hand , which , stretched over [her]200-henri shoulder , was writing some directions with a pencil on the margin of [her]200-henri book . “ Well , are [you]200-henri pleased that [I]0-i am satisfied with [your]200-henri progress ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked . “ Yes , ”[200-henri] said [she]200-henri slowly , gently , the blush that had half subsided returning . “ But [I]0-i do not say enough , [I]0-i suppose ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i continued . “ [My]0-i praises are too cool ? ”[0-i] [She]200-henri made no answer , and , [I]0-i thought , looked a little sad . [I]0-i divined [her]200-henri thoughts , and should much have liked to have responded to them , had it been expedient so to do . [She]200-henri was not now very ambitious of [my]0-i admiration — not eagerly desirous of dazzling [me]0-i ; a little affection — ever so little — pleased [her]200-henri better than all the panegyrics in [the world]1872-the world . Feeling this , [I]0-i stood a good while behind [her]200-henri , writing on the margin of [her]200-henri book . [I]0-i could hardly quit [my]0-i station or relinquish [my]0-i occupation ; something retained [me]0-i bending there , [my]0-i head very near [hers]200-henri , and [my]0-i hand near [hers]200-henri too ; but the margin of a copy - book is not an illimitable space — so , doubtless , [the directress]2533-the directress thought ; and [she]200-henri took occasion to walk past in order to ascertain by what art [I]0-i prolonged so disproportionately the period necessary for filling it . [I]0-i was obliged to go . Distasteful effort — to leave what [we]1029-we most prefer ! [Frances]181-frances did not become pale or feeble in consequence of [her]181-frances sedentary employment ; perhaps the stimulus it communicated to [her]181-frances mind counterbalanced the inaction it imposed on [her]181-frances body . [She]181-frances changed , indeed , changed obviously and rapidly ; but it was for the better . When [I]0-i first saw [her]181-frances , [her]181-frances countenance was sunless , [her]181-frances complexion colourless ; [she]181-frances looked like one who had no source of enjoyment , no store of bliss anywhere in [the world]1872-the world ; now the cloud had passed from [her]181-frances mien , leaving space for the dawn of hope and interest , and those feelings rose like a clear morning , animating what had been depressed , tinting what had been pale . [Her]181-frances eyes , whose colour [I]0-i had not at first known , so dim were they with repressed tears , so shadowed with ceaseless dejection , now , lit by a ray of the sunshine that cheered [her]181-frances heart , revealed irids of bright hazel — irids large and full , screened with long lashes ; and pupils instinct with fire . That look of wan emaciation which anxiety or low spirits often communicates to a thoughtful , thin face , rather long than round , having vanished from [hers]181-frances , a clearness of skin almost bloom , and a plumpness almost embonpoint , softened the decided lines of [her]181-frances features . [Her]181-frances figure shared in this beneficial change ; it became rounder , and as the harmony of [her]181-frances form was complete and [her]181-frances stature of the graceful middle height , [one]1983-one did not regret ( or at least [I]0-i did not regret ) the absence of confirmed fulness , in contours , still slight , though compact , elegant , flexible — the exquisite turning of waist , wrist , hand , foot , and ankle satisfied completely [my]0-i notions of symmetry , and allowed a lightness and freedom of movement which corresponded with [my]0-i ideas of grace . Thus improved , thus wakened to life , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances began to take a new footing in [the school]2501-the school ; [her]181-frances mental power , manifested gradually but steadily , ere long extorted recognition even from [the envious]1033-the envious ; and when [the young and healthy]1034-the young and healthy saw that [she]181-frances could smile brightly , converse gaily , move with vivacity and alertness , [they]1034-the young and healthy acknowledged in [her]181-frances a sisterhood of youth and health , and tolerated [her]181-frances as of [their]1034-the young and healthy kind accordingly . To speak truth , [I]0-i watched this change much as [a gardener]1035-a gardener watches the growth of a precious plant , and [I]0-i contributed to it too , even as [the said gardener]1036-the said gardener contributes to the development of [his]1036-the said gardener favourite . To [me]0-i it was not difficult to discover how [I]0-i could best foster [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil , cherish [her]181-frances starved feelings , and induce the outward manifestation of that inward vigour which sunless drought and blighting blast had hitherto forbidden to expand . Constancy of attention — a kindness as mute as watchful , always standing by [her]181-frances , cloaked in the rough garb of austerity , and making its real nature known only by a rare glance of interest , or a cordial and gentle word ; real respect masked with seeming imperiousness , directing , urging [her]181-frances actions , yet helping [her]181-frances too , and that with devoted care : these were the means [I]0-i used , for these means best suited [Frances]181-frances ’ feelings , as susceptible as deep vibrating — [her]181-frances nature at once proud and shy . The benefits of [my]0-i system became apparent also in [her]181-frances altered demeanour as [a teacher]631-a teacher ; [she]181-frances now took [her]181-frances place amongst [[her]181-frances pupils]777-her pupils with an air of spirit and firmness which assured [them]777-her pupils at once that [she]181-frances meant to be obeyed — and obeyed [she]181-frances was . [They]777-her pupils felt [they]777-her pupils had lost [their]777-her pupils power over [her]181-frances . If [any girl]1040-any girl had rebelled , [she]181-frances would no longer have taken [her]181-frances rebellion to heart ; [she]181-frances possessed a source of comfort [they]777-her pupils could not drain , a pillar of support [they]777-her pupils could not overthrow : formerly , when insulted , [she]181-frances wept ; now , [she]181-frances smiled . The public reading of one of [[her]181-frances devoirs]1041-her devoirs achieved the revelation of [her]181-frances talents to all and sundry ; [I]0-i remember the subject — it was [an emigrant]1042-an emigrant ’s letter to [[his]1042-an emigrant friends]1043-his friends at [home]1905-home . It opened with simplicity ; some natural and graphic touches disclosed to [the reader]2032-the reader the scene of [virgin forest]1046-virgin forest and [great , New - World river — barren of sail and flag]1047-great , new - world river — barren of sail and flag — amidst which the epistle was supposed to be indited . The difficulties and dangers that attend [a settler]1048-a settler ’s life , were hinted at ; and in the few words said on that subject , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances failed not to render [audible the voice of resolve , patience , endeavour]1049-audible the voice of resolve , patience , endeavour . The disasters which had driven [him]1042-an emigrant from [[his]1042-an emigrant native country]1050-his native country were alluded to ; stainless honour , inflexible independence , indestructible self - respect there took the word . Past days were spoken of ; the grief of parting , the regrets of absence , were touched upon ; feeling , forcible and fine , breathed eloquent in every period . At the close , consolation was suggested ; religious faith became there [the speaker]2085-the speaker , and [she]2085-the speaker spoke well . [The devoir]1052-the devoir was powerfully written in language at once chaste and choice , in a style nerved with vigour and graced with harmony . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle was quite sufficiently acquainted with English to understand it when read or spoken in [her]152-mdlle presence , though [she]152-mdlle could neither speak nor write it [herself]152-mdlle . During the perusal of [this devoir]2850-this devoir , [she]152-mdlle sat placidly busy , [her]152-mdlle eyes and fingers occupied with the formation of a “ riviere ”[152-mdlle] or open - work hem round a cambric handkerchief ; [she]152-mdlle said nothing , and [her]152-mdlle face and forehead , clothed with a mask of purely negative expression , were as blank of comment as [her]152-mdlle lips . As neither surprise , pleasure , approbation , nor interest were evinced in [her]152-mdlle countenance , so no more were disdain , envy , annoyance , weariness ; if [that inscrutable mien]1054-that inscrutable mien said anything , it was simply this — “ The matter is too trite to excite an emotion , or call forth an opinion . ”[1054-that inscrutable mien] As soon as [I]0-i had done , a hum rose ; [several of [the pupils]2333-the pupils]1055-several of the pupils , pressing round [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]181-frances , began to beset [her]152-mdlle with compliments ; the composed voice of [the directress]2533-the directress was now heard : — “ [Young ladies , such of [you]2967-young ladies , such of you as have cloaks and umbrellas as have cloaks and umbrellas]2967-young ladies , such of you as have cloaks and umbrellas will hasten to return [home]1905-home before the shower becomes heavier ”[2533-the directress] ( it was raining a little ) , “ [the remainder]2969-the remainder will wait till [[their]2969-the remainder respective servants]2970-their respective servants arrive to fetch [them]2969-the remainder . ”[2533-the directress] And [the school]2501-the school dispersed , for it was four o’clock . “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , a word , ”[152-mdlle] said [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , stepping on to the estrade , and signifying , by a movement of the hand , that [she]152-mdlle wished [me]0-i to relinquish , for an instant , the castor [I]0-i had clutched . “ [Mademoiselle]200-henri , [I]152-mdlle am at [your]638-monsieur service . ”[152-mdlle] “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , it is of course an excellent plan to encourage effort in [young people]677-young people by making conspicuous the progress of [any particularly industrious pupil]2974-any particularly industrious pupil ; but do [you]638-monsieur not think that in the present instance , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri can hardly be considered as a concurrent with [the other pupils]2975-the other pupils ? [She]200-henri is older than most of [them]2975-the other pupils , and has had advantages of an exclusive nature for acquiring a knowledge of English ; on the other hand , [her]200-henri sphere of life is somewhat beneath [theirs]2975-the other pupils ; under these circumstances , a public distinction , conferred upon [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri , may be the means of suggesting comparisons , and exciting feelings such as would be far from advantageous to [the individual]2976-the individual forming [their]2975-the other pupils object . The interest [I]152-mdlle take in [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s real welfare makes [me]152-mdlle desirous of screening [her]200-henri from annoyances of this sort ; besides , [monsieur]638-monsieur , as [I]152-mdlle have before hinted to [you]638-monsieur , the sentiment of amour - propre has a somewhat marked preponderance in [her]200-henri character ; celebrity has a tendency to foster this sentiment , and in [her]200-henri it should be rather repressed — [she]200-henri rather needs keeping down than bringing forward ; and then [I]152-mdlle think , [monsieur]638-monsieur — it appears to [me]152-mdlle that ambition , literary ambition especially , is not a feeling to be cherished in the mind of [a woman]2098-a woman : would not [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri be much safer and happier if taught to believe that in the quiet discharge of social duties consists [her]200-henri real vocation , than if stimulated to aspire after applause and publicity ? [She]200-henri may never marry ; scanty as are [her]200-henri resources , obscure as are [her]200-henri connections , uncertain as is [her]200-henri health ( for [I]152-mdlle think [her]200-henri consumptive , [[her]200-henri mother]1026-her mother died of that complaint ) , it is more than probable [she]200-henri never will . [I]152-mdlle do not see how [she]200-henri can rise to a position , whence such a step would be possible ; but even in celibacy it would be better for [her]200-henri to retain the character and habits of [a respectable decorous female]2981-a respectable decorous female . ”[152-mdlle] “ Indisputably , [mademoiselle]200-henri , ”[0-i] was [my]0-i answer . “ [Your]200-henri opinion admits of no doubt ; ”[0-i] and , fearful of the harangue being renewed , [I]0-i retreated under cover of that cordial sentence of assent . At the date of a fortnight after the little incident noted above , [I]0-i find it recorded in [my]0-i diary that a hiatus occurred in [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s usually regular attendance in class . The first day or two [I]0-i wondered at [her]200-henri absence , but did not like to ask an explanation of it ; [I]0-i thought indeed some chance word might be dropped which would afford [me]0-i the information [I]0-i wished to obtain , without [my]0-i running the risk of exciting silly smiles and gossiping whispers by demanding it . But when a week passed and the seat at the desk near the door still remained vacant , and when no allusion was made to the circumstance by [any individual of the class]1059-any individual of the class — when , on the contrary , [I]0-i found that all observed a marked silence on the point — [I]0-i determined , coute qui coute , to break the ice of this silly reserve . [I]0-i selected [Sylvie]166-sylvie as [[my]0-i informant]1060-my informant , because from [her]166-sylvie [I]0-i knew that [I]0-i should at least get a sensible answer , unaccompanied by wriggle , titter , or other flourish of folly . “ Ou donc est [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i said one day as [I]0-i returned an exercise - book [I]0-i had been examining . “ Elle est partie , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[0-i] “ Partie ? et pour combien de temps ? Quand reviendra - t - elle ? ”[0-i] “ Elle est partie pour toujours , [monsieur]638-monsieur ; elle ne reviendra plus . ”[0-i] “ Ah ! ”[0-i] was [my]0-i involuntary exclamation ; then after a pause : — “ En etes - vous bien sure , [Sylvie]166-sylvie ? ”[0-i] “ Oui , oui , [monsieur]638-monsieur , mademoiselle la directrice nous l’a dit elle - meme il y a deux ou trois jours . ”[0-i] And [I]0-i could pursue [my]0-i inquiries no further ; time , place , and circumstances forbade [my]0-i adding another word . [I]0-i could neither comment on what had been said , nor demand further particulars . A question as to the reason of [the teacher]2505-the teacher ’s departure , as to whether it had been voluntary or otherwise , was indeed on [my]0-i lips , but [I]0-i suppressed it — there were [listeners]1062-listeners all round . An hour after , in passing [Sylvie]166-sylvie in [the corridor]2466-the corridor as [she]166-sylvie was putting on [her]166-sylvie bonnet , [I]0-i stopped short and asked : — “ [Sylvie]166-sylvie , do [you]166-sylvie know [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s address ? [I]0-i have some books of [hers]152-mdlle , ”[0-i] [I]0-i added carelessly , “ and [I]0-i should wish to send them to [her]152-mdlle . ”[0-i] “ No , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[166-sylvie] replied [Sylvie]166-sylvie ; “ but perhaps [Rosalie]202-rosalie , [the portress]2423-the portress , will be able to give it [you]638-monsieur . ”[166-sylvie] [Rosalie]202-rosalie ’s cabinet was just at hand ; [I]0-i stepped in and repeated the inquiry . [Rosalie]202-rosalie — [a smart French grisette]1064-a smart french grisette — looked up from [her]202-rosalie work with a knowing smile , precisely the sort of smile [I]0-i had been so desirous to avoid exciting . [Her]202-rosalie answer was prepared ; [she]202-rosalie knew nothing whatever of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s address — had never known it . Turning from [her]202-rosalie with impatience — for [I]0-i believed [she]202-rosalie lied and was hired to lie — [I]0-i almost knocked down [some one who had been standing at [my]0-i back]1065-some one who had been standing at my back ; it was [the directress]2533-the directress . [My]0-i abrupt movement made [her]202-rosalie recoil two or three steps . [I]0-i was obliged to apologize , which [I]0-i did more concisely than politely . [No man]1919-no man likes to be dogged , and in the very irritable mood in which [I]0-i then was the sight of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle thoroughly incensed [me]0-i . At the moment [I]0-i turned [her]202-rosalie countenance looked hard , dark , and inquisitive ; [her]202-rosalie eyes were bent upon [me]0-i with an expression of almost hungry curiosity . [I]0-i had scarcely caught this phase of physiognomy ere it had vanished ; a bland smile played on [her]202-rosalie features ; [my]0-i harsh apology was received with good - humoured facility . “ Oh , do n’t mention it , [monsieur]638-monsieur ; [you]638-monsieur only touched [my]202-rosalie hair with [your]638-monsieur elbow ; it is no worse , only a little dishevelled . ”[202-rosalie] [She]202-rosalie shook it back , and passing [her]202-rosalie fingers through [her]202-rosalie curls , loosened them into more numerous and flowing ringlets . Then [she]202-rosalie went on with vivacity : “ [Rosalie]202-rosalie , [I]202-rosalie was coming to tell [you]202-rosalie to go instantly and close the windows of [the salon]2988-the salon ; the wind is rising , and the muslin curtains will be covered with dust . ”[202-rosalie] [Rosalie]202-rosalie departed . “ Now , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i , “ this will not do ; [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle thinks [her]202-rosalie meanness in eaves - dropping is screened by [her]202-rosalie art in devising a pretext , whereas the muslin curtains [she]202-rosalie speaks of are not more transparent than this same pretext . ”[0-i] An impulse came over [me]0-i to thrust the flimsy screen aside , and confront [her]202-rosalie craft boldly with a word or two of plain truth . “ The rough - shod foot treads most firmly on slippery ground , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i ; so [I]0-i began : “ [Mademoiselle Henri]200-henri has left [[your]202-rosalie establishment]2989-your establishment — been dismissed , [I]0-i presume ? ”[0-i] “ Ah , [I]2533-the directress wished to have a little conversation with [you]0-i , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[2533-the directress] replied [the directress]2533-the directress with the most natural and affable air in [the world]1872-the world ; “ but [we]1070-we can not talk quietly here ; will [Monsieur]2991-monsieur step into [the garden]2422-the garden a minute ? ”[202-rosalie] And [she]202-rosalie preceded [me]0-i , stepping out through the glass - door [I]0-i have before mentioned . “ There , ”[202-rosalie] said [she]202-rosalie , when [we]1070-we had reached the centre of [the middle alley]1071-the middle alley , and when the foliage of shrubs and trees , now in their summer pride , closing behind and around [us]1070-we , shut out the view of [the house]1897-the house , and thus imparted a sense of seclusion even to this little plot of ground in [the very core of [a capital]1074-a capital]1073-the very core of a capital . “ There , [one]1983-one feels quiet and free when there are only pear - trees and rose - bushes about one ; [I]2533-the directress dare say [you]0-i , like [me]2533-the directress , [monsieur]638-monsieur , are sometimes tired of being eternally in the midst of life ; of having human faces always round [you]0-i , human eyes always upon [you]0-i , human voices always in [your]0-i ear . [I]2533-the directress am sure [I]2533-the directress often wish intensely for liberty to spend a whole month in [the country]334-the country at [some little farm - house]2996-some little farm - house , bien gentille , bien propre , tout entouree de champs et de bois ; quelle vie charmante que la vie champetre ! N’est - ce pas , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[2533-the directress] “ Cela depend , mademoiselle . ”[2533-the directress] “ Que le vent est bon et frais ! ”[2533-the directress] continued [the directress]2533-the directress ; and [she]2533-the directress was right there , for it was a south wind , soft and sweet . [I]0-i carried [my]0-i hat in [my]0-i hand , and this gentle breeze , passing through [my]0-i hair , soothed [my]0-i temples like balm . Its refreshing effect , however , penetrated no deeper than the mere surface of the frame ; for as [I]0-i walked by the side of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle , [my]0-i heart was still hot within [me]0-i , and while [I]0-i was musing the fire burned ; then spake [I]0-i with [my]0-i tongue : — “ [I]0-i understand [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri is gone from hence , and will not return ? ”[0-i] “ Ah , true ! [I]0-i meant to have named the subject to [you]638-monsieur some days ago , but [my]0-i time is so completely taken up , [I]0-i can not do half the things [I]0-i wish : have [you]638-monsieur never experienced what it is , [monsieur]638-monsieur , to find the day too short by twelve hours for [your]638-monsieur numerous duties ? ”[0-i] “ Not often . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s departure was not voluntary , [I]0-i presume ? If it had been , [she]200-henri would certainly have given [me]0-i some intimation of it , being [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil . ”[0-i] “ Oh , did [she]200-henri not tell [you]638-monsieur ? that was strange ; for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i never thought of adverting to the subject ; when one has so many things to attend to , [one]1983-one is apt to forget little incidents that are not of primary importance . ”[0-i] “ [You]638-monsieur consider [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s dismission , then , as a very insignificant event ? ”[0-i] “ Dismission ? Ah ! [she]200-henri was not dismissed ; [I]0-i can say with truth , [monsieur]638-monsieur , that since [I]0-i became [the head of [this establishment]3003-this establishment [no master]3004-no master or [teacher]2479-teacher]3002-the head of this establishment no master or teacher has ever been dismissed from it . ”[0-i] “ Yet [some]3006-some have left it , [mademoiselle]200-henri ? ”[0-i] “ Many ; [I]0-i have found it necessary to change frequently — a change of [instructors]3007-instructors is often beneficial to the interests of [a school]2924-a school ; it gives life and variety to the proceedings ; it amuses [the pupils]2333-the pupils , and suggests to [the parents]3010-the parents the idea of exertion and progress . ”[0-i] “ Yet when [you]638-monsieur are tired of [a professor]629-a professor or [maitresse]3012-maitresse , [you]638-monsieur scruple to dismiss [them]3013-them ? ”[0-i] “ No need to have recourse to such extreme measures , [I]0-i assure [you]638-monsieur . [Allons]203-allons , [monsieur le professeur]3014-monsieur le professeur — asseyons - nous ; je vais vous donner une petite lecon dans votre etat d’instituteur . ”[0-i] ( [I]0-i wish [I]0-i might write all [she]1076-she said to [me]0-i in French — it loses sadly by being translated into English . ) [We]1077-we had now reached [the garden - chair]1078-the garden - chair ; [the directress]2533-the directress sat down , and signed to [me]0-i to sit by [her]2533-the directress , but [I]0-i only rested [my]0-i knee on the seat , and stood leaning [my]0-i head and arm against the embowering branch of a huge laburnum , whose golden flowers , blent with the dusky green leaves of a lilac - bush , formed a mixed arch of shade and sunshine over the retreat . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle sat silent a moment ; some novel movements were evidently working in [her]152-mdlle mind , and they showed their nature on [her]152-mdlle astute brow ; [she]152-mdlle was meditating some chef d’oeuvre of policy . Convinced by several months ’ experience that the affectation of virtues [she]152-mdlle did not possess was unavailing to ensnare [me]0-i — aware that [I]0-i had read [her]152-mdlle real nature , and would believe nothing of the character [she]152-mdlle gave out as being [hers]152-mdlle — [she]152-mdlle had determined , at last , to try a new key , and see if the lock of [my]0-i heart would yield to that ; a little audacity , a word of truth , a glimpse of the real . “ Yes , [I]152-mdlle will try , ”[152-mdlle] was [her]152-mdlle inward resolve ; and then [her]152-mdlle blue eye glittered upon [me]0-i — it did not flash — nothing of flame ever kindled in its temperate gleam . “ [Monsieur]3015-monsieur fears to sit by [me]152-mdlle ? ”[152-mdlle] [she]152-mdlle inquired playfully . “ [I]152-mdlle have no wish to usurp [[Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s place]3016-pelet ’s place , ”[152-mdlle] [I]0-i answered , for [I]0-i had got the habit of speaking to [her]152-mdlle bluntly — a habit begun in anger , but continued because [I]0-i saw that , instead of offending , it fascinated [her]152-mdlle . [She]152-mdlle cast down [her]152-mdlle eyes , and drooped [her]152-mdlle eyelids ; [she]152-mdlle sighed uneasily ; [she]152-mdlle turned with an anxious gesture , as if [she]152-mdlle would give [me]0-i the idea of a bird that flutters in its cage , and would fain fly from [its]1080-its jail and jailer , and seek [its]1080-its natural mate and pleasant nest . “ Well — and [your]152-mdlle lesson ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i demanded briefly . “ Ah ! ”[152-mdlle] [she]152-mdlle exclaimed , recovering [herself]152-mdlle , “ [you]0-i are so young , so frank and fearless , so talented , so impatient of imbecility , so disdainful of vulgarity , [you]0-i need a lesson ; here it is then : far more is to be done in [this world]423-this world by dexterity than by strength ; but , perhaps , [you]0-i knew that before , for there is delicacy as well as power in [your]0-i character — policy , as well as pride ? ”[152-mdlle] “ Go on , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ; and [I]0-i could hardly help smiling , the flattery was so piquant , so finely seasoned . [She]152-mdlle caught the prohibited smile , though [I]0-i passed [my]0-i hand over [my]0-i month to conceal it ; and again [she]152-mdlle made room for [me]0-i to sit beside [her]152-mdlle . [I]0-i shook [my]0-i head , though temptation penetrated to [my]0-i senses at the moment , and once more [I]0-i told [her]152-mdlle to go on . “ Well , then , if ever [you]0-i are at the head of [a large establishment]3018-a large establishment , dismiss [nobody]449-nobody . To speak truth , [monsieur]638-monsieur ( and to [you]0-i [I]152-mdlle will speak truth ) , [I]152-mdlle despise [people who are always making rows]3021-people who are always making rows , blustering , sending off [one to the right]3022-one to the right , and [another to the left , urging and hurrying circumstances]3023-another to the left , urging and hurrying circumstances . [I]152-mdlle ’ll tell [you]0-i what [I]152-mdlle like best to do , [monsieur]638-monsieur , shall [I]152-mdlle ? ”[152-mdlle] [She]152-mdlle looked up again ; [she]152-mdlle had compounded [her]152-mdlle glance well this time — much archness , more deference , a spicy dash of coquetry , an unveiled consciousness of capacity . [I]0-i nodded ; [she]152-mdlle treated [me]0-i like [the great Mogul]1081-the great mogul ; so [I]0-i became [the great Mogul]1081-the great mogul as far as [she]152-mdlle was concerned . “ [I]1083-i like , [monsieur]638-monsieur , to take [my]1083-i knitting in [my]1083-i hands , and to sit quietly down in [my]1083-i chair ; circumstances defile past [me]1083-i ; [I]1083-i watch [their]3026-their march ; so long as [they]3026-their follow the course [I]1083-i wish , [I]1083-i say nothing , and do nothing ; [I]1083-i do n’t clap [my]1083-i hands , and cry out ‘ Bravo ! How lucky [I]1083-i am ! ’ to attract the attention and envy of [[my]1083-i neighbours]3027-my neighbours — [I]1083-i am merely passive ; but when events fall out ill — when circumstances become adverse — [I]1083-i watch very vigilantly ; [I]1083-i knit on still , and still [I]1083-i hold [my]1083-i tongue ; but every now and then , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]1083-i just put [my]1083-i toe out — so — and give the rebellious circumstance a little secret push , without noise , which sends it the way [I]1083-i wish , and [I]1083-i am successful after all , and [nobody]449-nobody has seen [my]1083-i expedient . So , when [teachers]2258-teachers or [masters]2341-masters become troublesome and inefficient — when , in short , the interests of [the school]2501-the school would suffer from [their]3033-their retaining [their]3033-their places — [I]1083-i mind [my]1083-i knitting , events progress , circumstances glide past ; [I]1083-i see one which , if pushed ever so little awry , will render untenable the post [I]1083-i wish to have vacated — the deed is done — the stumbling - block removed — and [no one]757-no one saw [me]1083-i : [I]1083-i have not made [an enemy]3035-an enemy , [I]1083-i am rid of [an incumbrance]3036-an incumbrance . ”[1083-i] A moment since , and [I]0-i thought [her]1083-i alluring ; this speech concluded , [I]0-i looked on [her]1083-i with distaste . “ Just like [you]1083-i , ”[0-i] was [my]0-i cold answer . “ And in this way [you]1083-i have ousted [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ? [You]1083-i wanted [[her]152-mdlle office]3037-her office , therefore [you]1083-i rendered it intolerable to [her]152-mdlle ? ”[0-i] “ Not at all , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]2533-the directress was merely anxious about [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s health ; no , [your]638-monsieur moral sight is clear and piercing , but there [you]638-monsieur have failed to discover the truth . [I]2533-the directress took — [I]2533-the directress have always taken a real interest in [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s welfare ; [I]2533-the directress did not like [her]152-mdlle going out in all weathers ; [I]2533-the directress thought it would be more advantageous for [her]152-mdlle to obtain a permanent situation ; besides , [I]2533-the directress considered [her]152-mdlle now qualified to do something more than teach sewing . [I]2533-the directress reasoned with [her]152-mdlle ; left the decision to [herself]152-mdlle ; [she]152-mdlle saw the correctness of [my]2533-the directress views , and adopted them . ”[2533-the directress] “ Excellent ! and now , [mademoiselle]200-henri , [you]638-monsieur will have the goodness to give [me]0-i [her]152-mdlle address . ”[0-i] “ [Her]152-mdlle address ! ”[0-i] and a sombre and stony change came over [the mien of [the directress]2533-the directress]1084-the mien of the directress . “ [Her]152-mdlle address ? [Ah?—well]204-ah?—well — [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could oblige [you]638-monsieur , [monsieur]638-monsieur , but [I]0-i can not , and [I]0-i will tell [you]638-monsieur why ; whenever [I]0-i [myself]0-i asked [her]152-mdlle for [her]152-mdlle address , [she]152-mdlle always evaded the inquiry . [I]0-i thought — [I]0-i may be wrong — but [I]0-i thought [her]152-mdlle motive for doing so , was a natural , though mistaken reluctance to introduce [me]0-i to some , probably , very poor abode ; [her]152-mdlle means were narrow , [her]152-mdlle origin obscure ; [she]152-mdlle lives somewhere , doubtless , in [the ‘ basse ville]3040-the ‘ basse ville . ’ ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i ’ll not lose sight of [[my]0-i best pupil]3041-my best pupil yet , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ though [she]152-mdlle were born of [beggars]3042-beggars and lodged in [a cellar]3043-a cellar ; for the rest , it is absurd to make a bugbear of [her]152-mdlle origin to [me]0-i — [I]0-i happen to know that [she]152-mdlle was [[a Swiss pastor]3044-a swiss pastor ’s daughter]3045-a swiss pastor ’s daughter , neither more nor less ; and , as to [her]152-mdlle narrow means , [I]0-i care nothing for the poverty of [her]152-mdlle purse so long as [her]152-mdlle heart overflows with affluence . ”[0-i] “ [Your]0-i sentiments are perfectly noble , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[2533-the directress] said [the directress]2533-the directress , affecting to suppress a yawn ; [her]2533-the directress sprightliness was now extinct , [her]2533-the directress temporary candour shut up ; the little , red - coloured , piratical - looking pennon of audacity [she]2533-the directress had allowed to float a minute in the air , was furled , and the broad , sober - hued flag of dissimulation again hung low over [the citadel]1087-the citadel . [I]0-i did not like [her]2533-the directress thus , so [I]0-i cut short the tête - à - tête and departed . [NOVELISTS]724-novelists should never allow [themselves]724-novelists to weary of the study of real life . If [they]724-novelists observed this duty conscientiously , [they]724-novelists would give [us]1089-we fewer pictures chequered with vivid contrasts of light and shade ; [they]724-novelists would seldom elevate [[their]724-novelists heroes]1090-their heroes and [heroines]1091-heroines to the heights of rapture — still seldomer sink [them]724-novelists to the depths of despair ; for if [we]1089-we rarely taste the fulness of joy in this life , [we]1089-we yet more rarely savour the acrid bitterness of hopeless anguish ; unless , indeed , [we]1089-we have plunged like beasts into sensual indulgence , abused , strained , stimulated , again overstrained , and , at last , destroyed [our]1089-we faculties for enjoyment ; then , truly , [we]1089-we may find [ourselves]1089-we without support , robbed of hope . [Our]1089-we agony is great , and how can it end ? [We]1089-we have broken the spring of [our]1089-we powers ; life must be all suffering — too feeble to conceive faith — death must be darkness — [God]119-god , spirits , religion can have no place in [our]1089-we collapsed minds , where linger only hideous and polluting recollections of vice ; and time brings [us]1089-we on to the brink of the grave , and dissolution flings [us]1089-we in — a rag eaten through and through with disease , wrung together with pain , stamped into the churchyard sod by the inexorable heel of despair . But [the man of regular life and rational mind]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind never despairs . [He]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind loses [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind property — it is a blow — [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind staggers a moment ; then , [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind energies , roused by the smart , are at work to seek a remedy ; activity soon mitigates regret . Sickness affects [him]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind ; [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind takes patience — endures what [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind can not cure . Acute pain racks [him]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind ; [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind writhing limbs know not where to find rest ; [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind leans on [Hope]205-hope ’s anchors . [Death]206-death takes from [him]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind what [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind loves ; roots up , and tears violently away the stem round which [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind affections were twined — a dark , dismal time , a frightful wrench — but some morning [Religion]207-religion looks into [[his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind desolate house]1093-his desolate house with sunrise , and says , that in [another world]1094-another world , another life , [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind shall meet [[his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind kindred]1095-his kindred again . [She]1096-she speaks of [that world]1097-that world as a place unsullied by sin — of that life , as an era unembittered by suffering ; [she]1096-she mightily strengthens [her]1096-she consolation by connecting with it two ideas — which [mortals]1098-mortals can not comprehend , but on which [they]1098-mortals love to repose — Eternity , Immortality ; and the mind of [the mourner]1099-the mourner , being filled with an image , faint yet glorious , of [heavenly hills]1100-heavenly hills all light and peace — of [a spirit resting there in bliss]1101-a spirit resting there in bliss — of a day when [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind spirit shall also alight there , free and disembodied — of a reunion perfected by love , purified from fear — [he]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind takes courage — goes out to encounter the necessities and discharge the duties of life ; and , though sadness may never lift [her]1096-she burden from [his]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind mind , [Hope]205-hope will enable [him]1092-the man of regular life and rational mind to support it . Well — and what suggested all this ? and what is the inference to be drawn therefrom ? What suggested it , is the circumstance of [[my]0-i best pupil]3041-my best pupil — [my]0-i treasure — being snatched from [my]0-i hands , and put away out of [my]0-i reach ; the inference to be drawn from it is — that , being [a steady , reasonable man]1103-a steady , reasonable man , [I]0-i did not allow the resentment , disappointment , and grief , engendered in [my]0-i mind by this evil chance , to grow there to any monstrous size ; nor did [I]0-i allow [them]1104-them to monopolize the whole space of [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i pent them , on the contrary , in one strait and secret nook . In the daytime , too , when [I]0-i was about [my]0-i duties , [I]0-i put them on the silent system ; and it was only after [I]0-i had closed the door of [[my]0-i chamber]369-my chamber at night that [I]0-i somewhat relaxed [my]0-i severity towards [these morose nurslings]1106-these morose nurslings , and allowed vent to [their]1106-these morose nurslings language of murmurs ; then , in revenge , [they]1106-these morose nurslings sat on [my]0-i pillow , haunted [my]0-i bed , and kept [me]0-i awake with [their]1106-these morose nurslings long , midnight cry . A week passed . [I]0-i had said nothing more to [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle . [I]0-i had been calm in [my]0-i demeanour to [her]152-mdlle , though stony cold and hard . When [I]0-i looked at [her]152-mdlle , it was with the glance fitting to be bestowed on one who [I]0-i knew had consulted jealousy as [an adviser , and employed treachery as an instrument]1107-an adviser , and employed treachery as an instrument — the glance of quiet disdain and rooted distrust . On Saturday evening , ere [I]0-i left [the house]1897-the house , [I]0-i stept into [the salle - à - manger]1109-the salle - à - manger , where [she]152-mdlle was sitting alone , and , placing [myself]0-i before [her]152-mdlle , [I]0-i asked , with the same tranquil tone and manner that [I]0-i should have used had [I]0-i put the question for the first time — “ [Mademoiselle]200-henri , will [you]152-mdlle have the goodness to give [me]152-mdlle the address of [Frances Evans Henri]181-frances ? ”[152-mdlle] A little surprised , but not disconcerted , [she]152-mdlle smilingly disclaimed any knowledge of that address , adding , “ [Monsieur]3047-monsieur has perhaps forgotten that [I]152-mdlle explained all about that circumstance before — a week ago ? ”[152-mdlle] “ [Mademoiselle]200-henri , ”[0-i] [I]0-i continued , “ [you]152-mdlle would greatly oblige [me]0-i by directing [me]0-i to [[that young person]3048-that young person ’s abode]3049-that young person ’s abode . ”[0-i] [She]152-mdlle seemed somewhat puzzled ; and , at last , looking up with an admirably counterfeited air of naivete , [she]152-mdlle demanded , “ Does [Monsieur]3050-monsieur think [I]152-mdlle am telling an untruth ? ”[152-mdlle] Still avoiding to give [her]152-mdlle a direct answer , [I]0-i said , “ It is not then [your]152-mdlle intention , [mademoiselle]200-henri , to oblige [me]0-i in this particular ? ”[0-i] “ But , [monsieur]638-monsieur , how can [I]0-i tell [you]638-monsieur what [I]0-i do not know ? ”[0-i] “ Very well ; [I]0-i understand [you]152-mdlle perfectly , [mademoiselle]200-henri , and now [I]0-i have only two or three words to say . This is the last week in July ; in another month the vacation will commence , have the goodness to avail [yourself]152-mdlle of the leisure it will afford [you]152-mdlle to look out for [another English master]3052-another english master — at the close of August , [I]0-i shall be under the necessity of resigning [my]0-i post in [[your]152-mdlle establishment]2989-your establishment . ”[0-i] [I]0-i did not wait for [her]1110-her comments on this announcement , but bowed and immediately withdrew . That same evening , soon after dinner , [a servant]367-a servant brought [me]0-i a small packet ; it was directed in a hand [I]0-i knew , but had not hoped so soon to see again ; being in [[my]0-i own apartment]1112-my own apartment and alone , there was nothing to prevent [my]0-i immediately opening it ; it contained four five - franc pieces , and a note in English . “ [MONSIEUR]638-monsieur , “[0-i] [I]0-i came to [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [[Reuter]152-mdlle ’s house]1113-reuter ’s house yesterday , at the time when [I]0-i knew [you]152-mdlle would be just about finishing [your]152-mdlle lesson , and [I]0-i asked if [I]0-i might go into [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom and speak to [you]152-mdlle . [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle came out and said [you]152-mdlle were already gone ; it had not yet struck four , so [I]0-i thought [she]152-mdlle must be mistaken , but concluded it would be vain to call another day on the same errand . In one sense a note will do as well — it will wrap up the 20 francs , the price of the lessons [I]0-i have received from [you]152-mdlle ; and if it will not fully express the thanks [I]0-i owe [you]152-mdlle in addition — if it will not bid [you]152-mdlle good - bye as [I]0-i could wish to have done — if it will not tell [you]152-mdlle , as [I]0-i long to do , how sorry [I]0-i am that [I]0-i shall probably never see [you]152-mdlle more — why , spoken words would hardly be more adequate to the task . Had [I]0-i seen [you]152-mdlle , [I]0-i should probably have stammered out something feeble and unsatisfactory — something belying [my]0-i feelings rather than explaining them ; so it is perhaps as well that [I]0-i was denied admission to [your]152-mdlle presence . [You]152-mdlle often remarked , [monsieur]638-monsieur , that [my]0-i devoirs dwelt a great deal on fortitude in bearing grief — [you]152-mdlle said [I]0-i introduced that theme too often : [I]0-i find indeed that it is much easier to write about a severe duty than to perform it , for [I]0-i am oppressed when [I]0-i see and feel to what a reverse fate has condemned [me]0-i ; [you]152-mdlle were kind to [me]0-i , [monsieur]638-monsieur — very kind ; [I]0-i am afflicted — [I]0-i am heart - broken to be quite separated from [you]152-mdlle ; soon [I]0-i shall have [no friend on]1117-no friend on [earth]1118-earth . But it is useless troubling [you]152-mdlle with [my]0-i distresses . What claim have [I]0-i on [your]152-mdlle sympathy ? None ; [I]0-i will then say no more . “ Farewell , [Monsieur]638-monsieur . “[0-i] F. E. [HENRI]200-henri . ” [I]200-henri put up the note in [my]200-henri pocket - book . [I]200-henri slipped the five - franc pieces into [my]200-henri purse — then [I]200-henri took a turn through [[my]200-henri narrow chamber]3056-my narrow chamber . “[200-henri] [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle talked about [her]152-mdlle poverty , ” said [I]152-mdlle , “[152-mdlle] and [she]152-mdlle is poor ; yet [she]152-mdlle pays [her]152-mdlle debts and more . [I]0-i have not yet given [her]152-mdlle a quarter ’s lessons , and [she]152-mdlle has sent [me]0-i a quarter ’s due . [I]0-i wonder of what [she]152-mdlle deprived [herself]152-mdlle to scrape together the twenty francs — [I]0-i wonder what sort of a place [she]152-mdlle has to live in , and what sort of a woman [[her]152-mdlle aunt]1119-her aunt is , and whether [she]152-mdlle is likely to get employment to supply [the place [she]152-mdlle has lost]1120-the place she has lost . No doubt [she]152-mdlle will have to trudge about long enough from school to [school]2894-school , to inquire here , and apply [there]1998-there — be rejected in [this place]1123-this place , disappointed in that . Many an evening [she]152-mdlle ’ll go to [her]152-mdlle bed tired and unsuccessful . And [the directress]2533-the directress would not let [her]152-mdlle in to bid [me]0-i good - bye ? [I]0-i might not have the chance of standing with [her]152-mdlle for a few minutes at a window in [the schoolroom]734-the schoolroom and exchanging some half - dozen of sentences — getting to know where [she]152-mdlle lived — putting matters in train for having all things arranged to [my]0-i mind ? No address on the note”—I continued , drawing it again from the pocket - book and examining it on each side of the two leaves : “[2360-women] [women]2360-women are [women]2360-women , that is certain , and always do business like [women]2360-women ; [men]1921-men mechanically put a date and address to [their]1921-men communications . And these five - franc pieces?”—(I hauled them forth from [my]152-mdlle purse)—“if[152-mdlle] [she]152-mdlle had offered [me]0-i them [herself]152-mdlle instead of tying them up with a thread of green silk in a kind of Lilliputian packet , [I]0-i could have thrust them back into [her]152-mdlle little hand , and shut up the small , taper fingers over them — so — and compelled [her]152-mdlle shame , [her]152-mdlle pride , [her]152-mdlle shyness , all to yield to a little bit of determined Will — now where is [she]152-mdlle ? How can [I]0-i get at [her]152-mdlle ? ” Opening [my]0-i chamber door [I]0-i walked down into [the kitchen]2370-the kitchen . “[0-i] Who brought the packet ? ” [I]0-i asked of [the servant who had delivered it to [me]0-i]3058-the servant who had delivered it to me . “[0-i] [Un petit commissionaire]1130-un petit commissionaire , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ” “[1130-un petit commissionaire] Did [he]1130-un petit commissionaire say anything ? ” “[1130-un petit commissionaire] [Rien]208-rien . ” And [I]1130-un petit commissionaire wended [my]1130-un petit commissionaire way up the back - stairs , wondrously the wiser for [my]1130-un petit commissionaire inquiries . “[1130-un petit commissionaire] No matter , ” said [I]1130-un petit commissionaire to [myself]1130-un petit commissionaire , as [I]1130-un petit commissionaire again closed the door . “[1130-un petit commissionaire] No matter — [I’ll]0-i seek [her]152-mdlle through [Brussels]18-brussels . ” And [I]0-i did . [I]0-i sought [her]152-mdlle day by day whenever [I]0-i had a moment ’s leisure , for four weeks ; [I]0-i sought [her]152-mdlle on Sundays all day long ; [I]0-i sought [her]152-mdlle on [the Boulevards]3059-the boulevards , in [the Allee Verte]3060-the allee verte , in [the Park]2244-the park ; [I]0-i sought [her]152-mdlle in [Ste . Gudule]33-ste . gudule and [St. Jacques]56-st. jacques ; [I]0-i sought [her]152-mdlle in [the two Protestant chapels]3062-the two protestant chapels ; [I]0-i attended these latter at the German , French , and English services , not doubting that [I]0-i should meet [her]152-mdlle at one of them . All [my]0-i researches were absolutely fruitless ; [my]0-i security on the last point was proved by the event to be equally groundless with [my]0-i other calculations . [I]0-i stood at the door of [each chapel]3063-each chapel after the service , and waited till [every individual]3064-every individual had come out , scrutinizing every gown draping a slender form , peering under every bonnet covering a young head . In vain ; [I]0-i saw [girlish figures]3065-girlish figures pass [me]0-i , drawing [their]3065-girlish figures black scarfs over [their]3065-girlish figures sloping shoulders , but none of [them]3065-girlish figures had the exact turn and air of [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s ; [I]0-i saw pale and thoughtful faces “[0-i] encadrees ” in bands of brown hair , but [I]1132-i never found [her]1132-i forehead , [her]1132-i eyes , [her]1132-i eyebrows . All the features of all the faces [I]1132-i met seemed frittered away , because [my]1132-i eye failed to recognize the peculiarities it was bent upon ; an ample space of brow and a large , dark , and serious eye , with a fine but decided line of eyebrow traced above . “[1132-i] [She]1132-i has probably left [Brussels]18-brussels — perhaps is gone to [England]11-england , as [she]1132-i said [she]1132-i would , ” muttered [I]1132-i inwardly , as on the afternoon of the fourth Sunday , [I]1132-i turned from the door of [the chapel - royal]3066-the chapel - royal which [the door - keeper]3067-the door - keeper had just closed and locked , and followed in the wake of [the last of [the congregation]3069-the congregation , now dispersed and dispersing over [the square]3070-the square]3068-the last of the congregation , now dispersed and dispersing over the square . [I]1132-i had soon outwalked [the couples of [English gentlemen]3072-english gentlemen and [ladies]350-ladies]3071-the couples of english gentlemen and ladies . ( Gracious goodness ! why do n’t [they]3071-the couples of english gentlemen and ladies dress better ? [My]1132-i eye is yet filled with visions of the high - flounced , slovenly , and tumbled dresses in costly silk and satin , of the large unbecoming collars in expensive lace ; of the ill - cut coats and strangely fashioned pantaloons which every Sunday , at the English service , filled [the choirs of [the chapel - royal]3066-the chapel - royal]3074-the choirs of the chapel - royal , and after it , issuing forth into [the square]3070-the square , came into disadvantageous contrast with [freshly and trimly attired foreign figures]3077-freshly and trimly attired foreign figures , hastening to attend salut at [the church of [Coburg]57-coburg]3078-the church of coburg . ) [I]1132-i had passed [these pairs of Britons]3079-these pairs of britons , and the groups of [pretty British children]3080-pretty british children , and [the British footmen]3081-the british footmen and [waiting - maids]3082-waiting - maids ; [I]1132-i had crossed [the Place Royale]58-the place royale , and got into [the Rue Royale]28-the rue royale , thence [I]1132-i had diverged into [the Rue de Louvain]59-the rue de louvain — [an old and quiet street]3083-an old and quiet street . [I]1132-i remember that , feeling a little hungry , and not desiring to go back and take [my]1132-i share of the “[1132-i] gouter , ” now on the refectory - table at [Pelet’s]60-pelet’s — to wit , pistolets and water — [I]1132-i stepped into [[a baker]3084-a baker ’s]3085-a baker ’s and refreshed [myself]1132-i on a couc(?)—it is a Flemish word , [I]1132-i do n’t know how to spell it — A corinthe — anglice , a currant bun — and a cup of coffee ; and then [I]1132-i strolled on towards [the Porte de Louvain]61-the porte de louvain . Very soon [I]1132-i was out of [the city]2190-the city , and slowly mounting [the hill]2175-the hill , which ascends from the gate , [I]1132-i took [my]1132-i time ; for the afternoon , though cloudy , was very sultry , and not a breeze stirred to refresh the atmosphere . [No inhabitant of [Brussels]18-brussels]3088-no inhabitant of brussels need wander far to search for solitude ; let [him]3088-no inhabitant of brussels but move half a league from [[his]3088-no inhabitant of brussels own city]3089-his own city and [he]3088-no inhabitant of brussels will find [her]3089-his own city brooding still and blank over [the wide fields]3090-the wide fields , so drear though so fertile , spread out treeless and trackless round [the capital of [Brabant]31-brabant]3091-the capital of brabant . Having gained [the summit of the hill]3092-the summit of the hill , and having stood and looked long over the cultured but lifeless campaign , [I]1132-i felt a wish to quit [the high road]3093-the high road , which [I]1132-i had hitherto followed , and get in among [those tilled grounds]3094-those tilled grounds — fertile as the beds of [a Brobdignagian kitchen - garden]3095-a brobdignagian kitchen - garden — spreading far and wide even to the boundaries of the horizon , where , from a dusk green , distance changed them to a sullen blue , and confused their tints with those of the livid and thunderous - looking sky . Accordingly [I]1132-i turned up a by - path to the right ; [I]1132-i had not followed it far ere it brought [me]1132-i , as [I]1132-i expected , into [the fields]3096-the fields , amidst which , just before [me]1132-i , stretched a long and lofty white wall enclosing , as [it]3097-it seemed from the foliage showing above , some thickly planted nursery of yew and cypress , for of that species were the branches resting on the pale parapets , and crowding gloomily about a massive cross , planted doubtless on a central eminence and extending its arms , which seemed of black marble , over the summits of those sinister trees . [I]1132-i approached , wondering to [what house this well - protected garden appertained]3098-what house this well - protected garden appertained ; [I]1132-i turned the angle of the wall , thinking to see [some stately residence]3099-some stately residence ; [I]1132-i was close upon great iron gates ; there was a hut serving for [a lodge]3100-a lodge near , but [I]1132-i had no occasion to apply for the key — the gates were open ; [I]1132-i pushed one leaf back — rain had rusted its hinges , for it groaned dolefully as they revolved . Thick planting embowered the entrance . Passing up [the avenue]1896-the avenue , [I]1132-i saw objects on each hand which , in their own mute language of inscription and sign , explained clearly to what abode [I]1132-i had made [my]1132-i way .
