This was [the house appointed for all living]3102-the house appointed for all living ; crosses , monuments , and garlands of everlastings announced , “[1132-i] [The Protestant Cemetery]1133-the protestant cemetery , outside the gate of [Louvain]27-louvain . ” [The place]3103-the place was large enough to afford half an hour ’s strolling without the monotony of treading continually the same path ; and , for those who love to peruse the annals of graveyards , here was variety of inscription enough to occupy the attention for double or treble that space of time . [Hither people of many kindreds]3104-hither people of many kindreds , tongues , and [nations]3105-nations , had brought [their]3104-hither people of many kindreds dead for interment ; and here , on pages of stone , of marble , and of brass , were written names , dates , last tributes of pomp or love , in English , in French , in German , and Latin . Here [the Englishman]3106-the englishman had erected a marble monument over the remains of [his]3106-the englishman Mary Smith or [Jane Brown]209-brown , and inscribed [it]3103-the place only with [her]209-brown name . There [the French widower]3107-the french widower had shaded [the grave of [his]3106-the englishman Elmire or [Celestine]62-celestine]3108-the grave of his elmire or celestine with a brilliant thicket of roses , amidst which a little tablet rising , bore an equally bright testimony to [her]209-brown countless virtues . [Every nation]3109-every nation , [tribe]3110-tribe , and kindred , mourned after its own fashion ; and how soundless was the mourning of all ! [My]1132-i own tread , though slow and upon smooth - rolled paths , seemed to startle , because it formed the sole break to a silence otherwise total . Not only the winds , but [the very fitful , wandering airs]3111-the very fitful , wandering airs , were that afternoon , as by common consent , all fallen asleep in [[their]3104-hither people of many kindreds various quarters]3112-their various quarters ; the north was hushed , the south silent , the east sobbed not , nor did the west whisper . The clouds in heaven were condensed and dull , but apparently quite motionless . Under the trees of [this cemetery]3113-this cemetery nestled a warm breathless gloom , out of which the cypresses stood up straight and mute , above which the willows hung low and still ; where the flowers , as languid as fair , waited listless for night dew or thunder - shower ; where [the tombs]3114-the tombs , and those they hid , lay impassible to sun or shadow , to rain or drought . Importuned by the sound of [my]1132-i own footsteps , [I]1132-i turned off upon [the turf]3115-the turf , and slowly advanced to a grove of yews ; [I]1132-i saw something stir among the stems ; [I]1132-i thought it might be a broken branch swinging , [my]1132-i short - sighted vision had caught no form , only a sense of motion ; but the dusky shade passed on , appearing and disappearing at the openings in [the avenue]1896-the avenue . [I]1132-i soon discerned it was a living thing , and [a human thing]3117-a human thing ; and , drawing nearer , [I]1132-i perceived it was [a woman]2098-a woman , pacing slowly to and fro , and evidently deeming [herself]2098-a woman alone as [I]1132-i had deemed [myself]1132-i alone , and meditating as [I]1132-i had been meditating . Ere long [she]2098-a woman returned to a seat which [I]1132-i fancy [she]2098-a woman had but just quitted , or [I]1132-i should have caught sight of [her]2098-a woman before . [It]3119-it was in a nook , screened by a clump of trees ; there was the white wall before [her]2098-a woman , and a little stone set up against the wall , and , at the foot of the stone , was an allotment of turf freshly turned up , a new - made grave . [I]1132-i put on [my]1132-i spectacles , and passed softly close behind [her]2098-a woman ; glancing at the inscription on the stone , [I]1132-i read , “[1132-i] [Julienne Henri]197-julienne , died at [Brussels]18-brussels , aged sixty . August 10th , 18—. ” Having perused the inscription , [I]1134-mon maitre looked down at the form sitting bent and thoughtful just under [my]1134-mon maitre eyes , unconscious of the vicinity of any living thing ; it was [a slim , youthful figure in mourning apparel of the plainest black stuff , with a little simple , black crape bonnet]3120-a slim , youthful figure in mourning apparel of the plainest black stuff , with a little simple , black crape bonnet ; [I]1134-mon maitre felt , as well as saw , who it was ; and , moving neither hand nor foot , [I]1134-mon maitre stood some moments enjoying the security of conviction . [I]1134-mon maitre had sought [her]2098-a woman for a month , and had never discovered one of [her]2098-a woman traces — never met a hope , or seized a chance of encountering [her]2098-a woman anywhere . [I]1134-mon maitre had been forced to loosen [my]1134-mon maitre grasp on expectation ; and , but an hour ago , had sunk slackly under the discouraging thought that the current of life , and the impulse of destiny , had swept [her]2098-a woman for ever from [my]1134-mon maitre reach ; and , behold , while bending suddenly earthward beneath the pressure of despondency — while following with [my]1134-mon maitre eyes the track of sorrow on the turf of [a graveyard]3121-a graveyard — here was [my]1134-mon maitre lost jewel dropped on the tear - fed herbage , nestling in the messy and mouldy roots of yew - trees . [Frances]181-frances sat very quiet , [her]181-frances elbow on [her]181-frances knee , and [her]181-frances head on [her]181-frances hand . [I]1134-mon maitre knew [she]2098-a woman could retain a thinking attitude a long time without change ; at last , a tear fell ; [she]2098-a woman had been looking at the name on the stone before [her]2098-a woman , and [her]2098-a woman heart had no doubt endured one of those constrictions with which [the desolate living]3122-the desolate living , regretting the dead , are , at times , so sorely oppressed . Many tears rolled down , which [she]2098-a woman wiped away , again and again , with [her]2098-a woman handkerchief ; some distressed sobs escaped [her]2098-a woman , and then , the paroxysm over , [she]2098-a woman sat quiet as before . [I]1134-mon maitre put [my]1134-mon maitre hand gently on [her]2098-a woman shoulder ; no need further to prepare [her]2098-a woman , for [she]2098-a woman was neither hysterical nor liable to fainting - fits ; a sudden push , indeed , might have startled [her]2098-a woman , but the contact of [my]1134-mon maitre quiet touch merely woke attention as [I]1134-mon maitre wished ; and , though [she]2098-a woman turned quickly , yet so lightning - swift is thought — in some minds especially — [I]1134-mon maitre believe the wonder of what — the consciousness of who it was that thus stole unawares on [her]2098-a woman solitude , had passed through [her]2098-a woman brain , and flashed into [her]2098-a woman heart , even before [she]2098-a woman had effected that hasty movement ; at least , [Amazement]210-amazement had hardly opened [her]2098-a woman eyes and raised them to [mine]1134-mon maitre , ere Recognition informed [their]3123-their irids with most speaking brightness . Nervous surprise had hardly discomposed [her]2098-a woman features ere a sentiment of most vivid joy shone clear and warm on [her]2098-a woman whole countenance . [I]1134-mon maitre had hardly time to observe that [she]2098-a woman was wasted and pale , ere called to feel a responsive inward pleasure by the sense of most full and exquisite pleasure glowing in the animated flush , and shining in the expansive light , now diffused over [[my]1134-mon maitre pupil]1015-my pupil ’s face . It was the summer sun flashing out after the heavy summer shower ; and what fertilizes more rapidly than that beam , burning almost like fire in its ardour ? [I]1134-mon maitre hate boldness — that boldness which is of the brassy brow and insensate nerves ; but [I]1134-mon maitre love the courage of the strong heart , the fervour of the generous blood ; [I]1134-mon maitre loved with passion the light of [Frances Evans]181-frances ’ clear hazel eye when it did not fear to look straight into [mine]1134-mon maitre ; [I]1134-mon maitre loved the tones with which [she]2098-a woman uttered the words — “[1134-mon maitre] Mon maitre ! [mon maitre]1134-mon maitre ! ” [I]1134-mon maitre loved the movement with which [she]2098-a woman confided [her]2098-a woman hand to [my]1134-mon maitre hand ; [I]1134-mon maitre loved [her]2098-a woman as [she]2098-a woman stood there , penniless and parentless ; for [a sensualist charmless]3125-a sensualist charmless , for [me]1134-mon maitre a treasure — [my]1134-mon maitre best object of sympathy on [earth]1118-earth , thinking such thoughts as [I]1134-mon maitre thought , feeling such feelings as [I]1134-mon maitre felt ; [my]1134-mon maitre ideal of the shrine in which to seal [my]1134-mon maitre stores of love ; personification of discretion and forethought , of diligence and perseverance , of self - denial and self - control — [those guardians]3127-those guardians , [those trusty keepers of the gift [I]1134-mon maitre longed to confer on [her]2098-a woman — the gift of all [my]1134-mon maitre affections]3128-those trusty keepers of the gift i longed to confer on her — the gift of all my affections ; [model of truth and honour , of independence and conscientiousness]3129-model of truth and honour , of independence and conscientiousness — [those refiners and sustainers of an honest life]3130-those refiners and sustainers of an honest life ; [silent possessor of a well of tenderness , of a flame , as genial as still , as pure as quenchless , of natural feeling , natural passion]3131-silent possessor of a well of tenderness , of a flame , as genial as still , as pure as quenchless , of natural feeling , natural passion — those sources of refreshment and comfort to the sanctuary of [home]1905-home . [I]1134-mon maitre knew how quietly and how deeply the well bubbled in [her]2098-a woman heart ; [I]1134-mon maitre knew how the more dangerous flame burned safely under the eye of reason ; [I]1134-mon maitre had seen when the fire shot up a moment high and vivid , when the accelerated heat troubled life ’s current in its channels ; [I]1134-mon maitre had seen reason reduce the rebel , and humble its blaze to embers . [I]1134-mon maitre had confidence in [Frances Evans]181-frances ; [I]1134-mon maitre had respect for [her]2098-a woman , and as [I]1134-mon maitre drew [her]2098-a woman arm through [mine]1134-mon maitre , and led [her]2098-a woman out of [the cemetery]3133-the cemetery , [I]1134-mon maitre felt [I]1134-mon maitre had another sentiment , as strong as confidence , as firm as respect , more fervid than either — that of love . “[1134-mon maitre] Well , [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil , ” said [I]1015-my pupil , as the ominous sounding gate swung to behind [us—“Well]1015-my pupil[1015-my pupil] , [I]0-i have found [you]1015-my pupil again : a month ’s search has seemed long , and [I]0-i little thought to have discovered [my]0-i lost sheep straying amongst graves . ” Never had [I]200-henri addressed [her]1015-my pupil but as “[200-henri] [Mademoiselle]200-henri ” before , and to speak thus was to take up a tone new to both [her]1015-my pupil and [me]1134-mon maitre . [Her]1015-my pupil answer suprised [me]1134-mon maitre that this language ruffled none of [her]1015-my pupil feelings , woke no discord in [her]1015-my pupil heart : “[1134-mon maitre] [Mon maitre]1134-mon maitre , ” [she]1015-my pupil said , “[1134-mon maitre] have [you]1134-mon maitre troubled [yourself]1134-mon maitre to seek [me]0-i ? [I]0-i little imagined [you]1015-my pupil would think much of [my]0-i absence , but [I]0-i grieved bitterly to be taken away from [you]1015-my pupil . [I]0-i was sorry for that circumstance when heavier troubles ought to have made [me]0-i forget it . ” “[0-i] [[Your]1134-mon maitre aunt]2897-your aunt is dead ? ” “[0-i] Yes , a fortnight since , and [she]2897-your aunt died full of regret , which [I]0-i could not chase from [her]2897-your aunt mind ; [she]2897-your aunt kept repeating , even during the last night of [her]2897-your aunt existence , ‘ [Frances]181-frances , [you]181-frances will be so lonely when [I]0-i am gone , so friendless : ’ [she]2897-your aunt wished too that [she]2897-your aunt could have been buried in [Switzerland]55-switzerland , and it was [I]0-i who persuaded [her]2897-your aunt in [her]2897-your aunt old age to leave [the banks of [Lake Leman]63-lake leman]1138-the banks of lake leman , and to come , only as it seems to die , in [this flat region of [Flanders]64-flanders]1139-this flat region of flanders . Willingly would [I]0-i have observed [her]2897-your aunt last wish , and taken [her]2897-your aunt remains back to [[our]1140-our own country]1141-our own country , but that was impossible ; [I]0-i was forced to lay [her]2897-your aunt here . ” “[0-i] [She]2897-your aunt was ill but a short time , [I]0-i presume ? ” “[2897-your aunt] But three weeks . When [she]2897-your aunt began to sink [I]0-i asked [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s leave to stay with [her]2897-your aunt and wait on [her]2897-your aunt ; [I]0-i readily got leave . ” “[152-mdlle] Do [you]152-mdlle return to [the pensionnat]2420-the pensionnat ! ” [I]1143-monsieur demanded hastily . “[1143-monsieur] [Monsieur]1143-monsieur , when [I]0-i had been at [home]1905-home a week [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle called one evening , just after [I]0-i had got [[my]0-i aunt]2899-my aunt to bed ; [she]2897-your aunt went into [[her]2897-your aunt room]1146-her room to speak to [her]2897-your aunt , and was extremely civil and affable , as [she]2897-your aunt always is ; afterwards [she]2897-your aunt came and sat with [me]0-i a long time , and just as [she]2897-your aunt rose to go away , [she]2897-your aunt said : “ [Mademoiselle]200-henri , [I]2897-your aunt shall not soon cease to regret [your]200-henri departure from [[my]2897-your aunt establishment]633-my establishment , though indeed it is true that [you]200-henri have taught [[your]200-henri class of [pupils]2269-pupils]3135-your class of pupils so well that [they]3135-your class of pupils are all quite accomplished in the little works [you]200-henri manage so skilfully , and have not the slightest need of further instruction ; [[my]2897-your aunt second teacher]3137-my second teacher must in future supply [your]200-henri place , with regard to [the younger pupils]3138-the younger pupils , as well as [she]3137-my second teacher can , though [she]3137-my second teacher is indeed [an inferior artiste to [you]200-henri]3139-an inferior artiste to you , and doubtless it will be [your]200-henri part now to assume a higher position in [your]200-henri calling ; [I]2897-your aunt am sure [you]200-henri will everywhere find [schools]3140-schools and [families]3141-families willing to profit by [your]200-henri talents . ’ And then [she]3137-my second teacher paid [me]2897-your aunt [my]2897-your aunt last quarter ’s salary . [I]2897-your aunt asked , as [mademoiselle]200-henri would no doubt think , very bluntly , if [she]3137-my second teacher designed to discharge [me]2897-your aunt from [the establishment]2348-the establishment . [She]3137-my second teacher smiled at [my]2897-your aunt inelegance of speech , and answered that ‘ [our]3143-our connection as [employer and employed]3144-employer and employed was certainly dissolved , but that [she]3137-my second teacher hoped still to retain the pleasure of [my]2897-your aunt acquaintance ; [she]3137-my second teacher should always be happy to see [me]2897-your aunt as [a friend]3145-a friend ; ’ and then [she]3137-my second teacher said something about the excellent condition of [the streets]2077-the streets , and the long continuance of fine weather , and went away quite cheerful . ”[2897-your aunt] [I]0-i laughed inwardly ; all this was so like [the directress]2533-the directress — so like what [I]0-i had expected and guessed of [her]2533-the directress conduct ; and then the exposure and proof of [her]2533-the directress lie , unconsciously afforded by [Frances:—“She]211-frances:—“she had frequently applied for [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri ’s address , ”[2533-the directress] forsooth ; “ [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Henri]200-henri had always evaded giving it , ”[2533-the directress] & c. , & c. , and [here]398-here [I]0-i found [her]2533-the directress [a visitor at [the very house of whose locality [she]2533-the directress had professed absolute ignorance]1150-the very house of whose locality she had professed absolute ignorance]1149-a visitor at the very house of whose locality she had professed absolute ignorance ! Any comments [I]0-i might have intended to make on [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil ’s communication , were checked by the plashing of large rain - drops on [our]1152-we faces and on [the path]1153-the path , and by the muttering of a distant but coming storm . The warning obvious in stagnant air and leaden sky had already induced [me]0-i to take [the road leading back to [Brussels]18-brussels]1154-the road leading back to brussels , and now [I]0-i hastened [my]0-i own steps and those of [[my]0-i companion]1155-my companion , and , as [our]1152-we way lay downhill , [we]1152-we got on rapidly . There was an interval after the fall of the first broad drops before heavy rain came on ; in the meantime [we]1152-we had passed through [the Porte de Louvain]1156-the porte de louvain , and were again in [the city]2190-the city . “ Where do [you]181-frances live ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked ; “ [I]0-i will see [you]181-frances safe [home]1905-home . ”[0-i] “ [Rue Notre Dame aux Neiges]65-rue notre dame aux neiges , ”[181-frances] answered [Frances]181-frances . It was not far from [the Rue de Louvain]59-the rue de louvain , and [we]1152-we stood on the doorsteps of [the house]1897-the house [we]1152-we sought ere the clouds , severing with loud peal and shattered cataract of lightning , emptied their livid folds in a torrent , heavy , prone , and broad . “ Come in ! come in ! ”[181-frances] said [Frances]181-frances , as , after putting [her]181-frances into [the house]1897-the house , [I]0-i paused ere [I]0-i followed : the word decided [me]0-i ; [I]0-i stepped across the threshold , shut the door on the rushing , flashing , whitening storm , and followed [her]181-frances [upstairs]1160-upstairs to [[her]181-frances apartments]1161-her apartments . Neither [she]181-frances nor [I]0-i were wet ; a projection over the door had warded off the straight - descending flood ; none but the first , large drops had touched [our]1152-we garments ; one minute more and [we]1152-we should not have had a dry thread on [us]1152-we . Stepping over a little mat of green wool , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in [a small room]1162-a small room with a painted floor and a square of green carpet in the middle ; the articles of furniture were few , but all bright and exquisitely clean ; order reigned through its narrow limits — such order as it soothed [my]0-i punctilious soul to behold . And [I]0-i had hesitated to enter [the abode]1163-the abode , because [I]0-i apprehended after all that [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ’s hint about [its]1163-the abode extreme poverty might be too well - founded , and [I]0-i feared to embarrass [the lace - mender]1164-the lace - mender by entering [[her]181-frances lodgings]1165-her lodgings unawares ! Poor [the place]3103-the place might be ; poor truly [it]3103-the place was ; but [its]3103-the place neatness was better than elegance , and had but a bright little fire shone on that clean hearth , [I]0-i should have deemed [it]3103-the place more attractive than [a palace]1167-a palace . No fire was there , however , and no fuel laid ready to light ; [the lace - mender]1164-the lace - mender was unable to allow [herself]1164-the lace - mender that indulgence , especially now when , deprived by death of [[her]1164-the lace - mender sole relative]1169-her sole relative , [she]1164-the lace - mender had only [her]1164-the lace - mender own unaided exertions to rely on . [Frances]181-frances went into [an inner room]1170-an inner room to take off [her]181-frances bonnet , and [she]181-frances came out a model of frugal neatness , with [her]181-frances well - fitting black stuff dress , so accurately defining [her]181-frances elegant bust and taper waist , with [her]181-frances spotless white collar turned back from a fair and shapely neck , with [her]181-frances plenteous brown hair arranged in smooth bands on [her]181-frances temples , and in a large Grecian plait behind : ornaments [she]181-frances had none — neither brooch , ring , nor ribbon ; [she]181-frances did well enough without them — perfection of fit , proportion of form , grace of carriage , agreeably supplied [their]1171-their place . [Her]181-frances eye , as [she]181-frances re - entered [the small sitting - room]1172-the small sitting - room , instantly sought mine , which was just then lingering on the hearth ; [I]0-i knew [she]181-frances read at once the sort of inward ruth and pitying pain which the chill vacancy of that hearth stirred in [my]0-i soul : quick to penetrate , quick to determine , and quicker to put in practice , [she]181-frances had in a moment tied a holland apron round [her]181-frances waist ; then [she]181-frances disappeared , and reappeared with a basket ; it had a cover ; [she]181-frances opened it , and produced wood and coal ; deftly and compactly [she]181-frances arranged them in the grate . “ It is [her]181-frances whole stock , and [she]181-frances will exhaust it out of hospitality , ”[0-i] thought [I.]0-i “ What are [you]181-frances going to do ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked : “ not surely to light a fire this hot evening ? [I]0-i shall be smothered . ”[0-i] “ Indeed , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]181-frances feel it very chilly since the rain began ; besides , [I]181-frances must boil the water for [my]181-frances tea , for [I]181-frances take tea on Sundays ; [you]638-monsieur will be obliged to try and bear the heat . ”[181-frances] [She]181-frances had struck a light ; the wood was already in a blaze ; and truly , when contrasted with the darkness , the wild tumult of the tempest without , that peaceful glow which began to beam on the now animated hearth , seemed very cheering . A low , purring sound , from some quarter , announced that another being , besides [myself]0-i , was pleased with the change ; a black cat , roused by the light from its sleep on a little cushioned foot - stool , came and rubbed its head against [Frances]181-frances ’ gown as [she]181-frances knelt ; [she]181-frances caressed it , saying it had been a favourite with [her]181-frances “ pauvre tante [Julienne]197-julienne . ”[181-frances] The fire being lit , the hearth swept , and a small kettle of a very antique pattern , such as [I]0-i thought [I]0-i remembered to have seen in [old farmhouses in [England]11-england]1173-old farmhouses in england , placed over the now ruddy flame , [Frances]181-frances ’ hands were washed , and [her]181-frances apron removed in an instant ; then [she]181-frances opened a cupboard , and took out a tea - tray , on which [she]181-frances had soon arranged a china tea - equipage , whose pattern , shape , and size , denoted a remote antiquity ; a little , old - fashioned silver spoon was deposited in each saucer ; and a pair of silver tongs , equally old - fashioned , were laid on the sugar - basin ; from the cupboard , too , was produced a tidy silver cream - ewer , not larger then an egg - shell . While making these preparations , [she]181-frances chanced to look up , and , reading curiosity in [my]0-i eyes , [she]181-frances smiled and asked — “ Is this like [England]11-england , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[181-frances] “ Like [the England]11-england of a hundred years ago , ”[0-i] [I]0-i replied . “ Is it truly ? Well , everything on this tray is at least a hundred years old : these cups , these spoons , this ewer , are all heirlooms ; [[my]1174-my great - grandmother]3150-my great - grandmother left them to [[my]1174-my grandmother]3151-my grandmother , [she]3150-my great - grandmother to [[my]1174-my mother]1887-my mother , and [[my]1174-my mother]1887-my mother brought them with [her]1887-my mother from [England]11-england to [Switzerland]55-switzerland , and left them to [me]1174-my ; and , ever since [I]1174-my was [a little girl]3154-a little girl , [I]1174-my have thought [I]1174-my should like to carry them back to [England]11-england , whence [they]3155-they came . ”[1174-my] [She]1174-my put some pistolets on the table ; [she]1174-my made the tea , as foreigners do make tea — [i.e.]1175-i.e. , at the rate of a teaspoonful to half - a - dozen cups ; [she]1174-my placed [me]0-i a chair , and , as [I]0-i took it , [she]1174-my asked , with a sort of exaltation — “ Will it make [you]0-i think [yourself]0-i at [home]1905-home for a moment ? ”[1174-my] “ If [I]0-i had [a home in [England]11-england]3157-a home in england , [I]0-i believe it would recall it , ”[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; and , in truth , there was a sort of illusion in seeing [the fair - complexioned English - looking girl]1176-the fair - complexioned english - looking girl presiding at the English meal , and speaking in the English language . “ [You]0-i have then no [home]1905-home ? ”[1174-my] was [her]1174-my remark . “ None , nor ever have had . If ever [I]1174-my possess [a home]3159-a home , it must be of [my]1174-my own making , and the task is yet to begin . ”[1174-my] And , as [I]0-i spoke , a pang , new to [me]0-i , shot across [my]0-i heart : it was a pang of mortification at the humility of [my]0-i position , and the inadequacy of [my]0-i means ; while with that pang was born a strong desire to do more , earn more , be more , possess more ; and in the increased possessions , [my]0-i roused and eager spirit panted to include [the home [I]0-i had never had]1177-the home i had never had , [the wife [I]0-i inwardly vowed to win]1178-the wife i inwardly vowed to win . [Frances]181-frances ’ tea was little better than hot water , sugar , and milk ; and [her]181-frances pistolets , with which [she]181-frances could not offer [me]0-i butter , were sweet to [my]0-i palate as manna . The repast over , and the treasured plate and porcelain being washed and put by , the bright table rubbed still brighter , “ le chat de ma tante Julienne ”[181-frances] also being fed with provisions brought forth on a plate for its special use , a few stray cinders , and a scattering of ashes too , being swept from the hearth , [Frances]181-frances at last sat down ; and then , as [she]181-frances took a chair opposite to [me]0-i , [she]181-frances betrayed , for the first time , a little embarrassment ; and no wonder , for indeed [I]0-i had unconsciously watched [her]181-frances rather too closely , followed all [her]181-frances steps and all [her]181-frances movements a little too perseveringly with [my]0-i eyes , for [she]181-frances mesmerized [me]0-i by the grace and alertness of [her]181-frances action — by the deft , cleanly , and even decorative effect resulting from each touch of [her]181-frances slight and fine fingers ; and when , at last , [she]181-frances subsided to stillness , the intelligence of [her]181-frances face seemed beauty to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i dwelt on it accordingly . [Her]181-frances colour , however , rising , rather than settling with repose , and [her]181-frances eyes remaining downcast , though [I]0-i kept waiting for the lids to be raised that [I]0-i might drink a ray of the light [I]0-i loved — a light where fire dissolved in softness , where affection tempered penetration , where , just now at least , pleasure played with thought — this expectation not being gratified , [I]0-i began at last to suspect that [I]0-i had probably [myself]0-i to blame for the disappointment ; [I]0-i must cease gazing , and begin talking , if [I]0-i wished to break the spell under which [she]181-frances now sat motionless ; so recollecting the composing effect which an authoritative tone and manner had ever been wo nt to produce on [her]181-frances , [I]0-i said — “ Get one of [your]181-frances English books , mademoiselle , for the rain yet falls heavily , and will probably detain [me]0-i half an hour longer . ”[0-i] Released , and set at ease , up [she]181-frances rose , got [her]181-frances book , and accepted at once the chair [I]0-i placed for [her]181-frances at [my]0-i side . [She]181-frances had selected “ Paradise Lost ”[181-frances] from [her]181-frances shelf of classics , thinking , [I]0-i suppose , the religious character of the book best adapted it to [Sunday]212-sunday ; [I]0-i told [her]181-frances to begin at the beginning , and while [she]181-frances read [Milton]213-milton ’s invocation to [that heavenly muse , who on the “ secret top of [Oreb]214-oreb or Sinai]3160-that heavenly muse , who on the “ secret top of oreb or sinai ”[3160-that heavenly muse , who on the “ secret top of oreb or sinai] had taught [the Hebrew]215-the hebrew shepherd how in the womb of chaos , the conception of [a world]1179-a world had originated and ripened , [I]0-i enjoyed , undisturbed , the treble pleasure of having [her]181-frances near [me]0-i , hearing the sound of [her]181-frances voice — a sound sweet and satisfying in [my]0-i ear — and looking , by intervals , at [her]181-frances face : of this last privilege , [I]0-i chiefly availed [myself]0-i when [I]0-i found fault with an intonation , a pause , or an emphasis ; as long as [I]0-i dogmatized , [I]0-i might also gaze , without exciting too warm a flush . “ Enough , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , when [she]181-frances had gone through some half dozen pages ( a work of time with [her]181-frances , for [she]181-frances read slowly and paused often to ask and receive information)—“enough ; and now the rain is ceasing , and [I]181-frances must soon go . ”[181-frances] For indeed , at that moment , looking towards the window , [I]0-i saw it all blue ; the thunder - clouds were broken and scattered , and the setting August sun sent a gleam like the reflection of rubies through the lattice . [I]0-i got up ; [I]0-i drew on [my]0-i gloves . “ [You]0-i have not yet found another situation to supply the place of that from which [you]0-i were dismissed by [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle ? ”[0-i] “ No , [monsieur]638-monsieur ; [I]0-i have made inquiries everywhere , but [they]3162-they all ask [me]0-i for references ; and to speak truth , [I]0-i do not like to apply to [the directress]2533-the directress , because [I]0-i consider [she]2533-the directress acted neither justly nor honourably towards [me]0-i ; [she]2533-the directress used underhand means to set [my]0-i pupils against [me]0-i , and thereby render [me]0-i unhappy while [I]0-i held [my]0-i place in [[her]2533-the directress establishment]2537-her establishment , and [she]2533-the directress eventually deprived [me]0-i of it by a masked and hypocritical manoeuvre , pretending that [she]2533-the directress was acting for [my]0-i good , but really snatching from [me]0-i [my]0-i chief means of subsistence , at a crisis when not only [my]0-i own life , but that of another , depended on [my]0-i exertions : of [her]2533-the directress [I]0-i will never more ask a favour . ”[0-i] “ How , then , do [you]0-i propose to get on ? How do [you]0-i live now ? ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i have still [my]0-i lace - mending trade ; with care it will keep [me]0-i from starvation , and [I]0-i doubt not by dint of exertion to get better employment yet ; it is only a fortnight since [I]0-i began to try ; [my]0-i courage or hopes are by no means worn out yet . ”[0-i] “ And if [you]0-i get what [you]0-i wish , what then ? what are [your]0-i ultimate views ? ”[0-i] “ To save enough to cross the Channel : [I]0-i always look to [England]11-england as [my]0-i Canaan . ”[0-i] “ Well , well — ere long [I]0-i shall pay [you]1180-her another visit ; good evening now , ”[0-i] and [I]0-i left [her]1180-her rather abruptly ; [I]0-i had much ado to resist a strong inward impulse , urging [me]0-i to take a warmer , more expressive leave : what so natural as to fold [her]1180-her for a moment in a close embrace , to imprint one kiss on [her]1180-her cheek or forehead ? [I]0-i was not unreasonable — that was all [I]0-i wanted ; satisfied in that point , [I]0-i could go away content ; and Reason denied [me]0-i even this ; [she]1180-her ordered [me]0-i to turn [my]0-i eyes from [her]1180-her face , and [my]0-i steps from [[her]1180-her apartment]2751-her apartment — to quit [her]1180-her as dryly and coldly as [I]0-i would have quitted old [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet . [I]0-i obeyed , but [I]0-i swore rancorously to be avenged one day . “ [I]0-i ’ll earn a right to do as [I]0-i please in this matter , or [I]0-i ’ll die in the contest . [I]0-i have one object before [me]0-i now — to get [that Genevese girl]3165-that genevese girl for [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife ; and [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife [she]749-my wife shall be — that is , provided [she]749-my wife has as much , or half as much regard for [[her]749-my wife master]3168-her master as [he]3168-her master has for [her]749-my wife . And would [she]749-my wife be so docile , so smiling , so happy under [my]0-i instructions if [she]749-my wife had not ? would [she]749-my wife sit at [my]0-i side when [I]0-i dictate or correct , with such [a still , contented , halcyon mien]3169-a still , contented , halcyon mien ? ”[0-i] for [I]0-i had ever remarked , that however sad or harassed [her]1182-her countenance might be when [I]0-i entered [a room]1183-a room , yet after [I]0-i had been near [her]1182-her , spoken to [her]1182-her a few words , given [her]1182-her some directions , uttered perhaps some reproofs , [she]1182-her would , all at once , nestle into a nook of happiness , and look up serene and revived . The reproofs suited [her]1182-her best of all : while [I]0-i scolded [she]1182-her would chip away with [her]1182-her pen - knife at a pencil or a pen ; fidgetting a little , pouting a little , defending [herself]1182-her by monosyllables , and when [I]0-i deprived [her]1182-her of the pen or pencil , fearing it would be all cut away , and when [I]0-i interdicted even the monosyllabic defence , for the purpose of working up the subdued excitement a little higher , [she]1182-her would at last raise [her]1182-her eyes and give [me]0-i a certain glance , sweetened with gaiety , and pointed with defiance , which , to speak truth , thrilled [me]0-i as nothing had ever done , and made [me]0-i , in a fashion ( though happily [she]1182-her did not know it ) , [[her]1182-her subject]1184-her subject , if not [[her]1182-her slave]1185-her slave . After such little scenes [her]1182-her spirits would maintain their flow , often for some hours , and , as [I]0-i remarked before , [her]1182-her health therefrom took a sustenance and vigour which , previously to the event of [[her]1182-her aunt]1119-her aunt ’s death and [her]1182-her dismissal , had almost recreated [her]1182-her whole frame . It has taken [me]0-i several minutes to write these last sentences ; but [I]0-i had thought all [their]1187-their purport during the brief interval of descending the stairs from [[Frances]181-frances ’ room]1188-frances ’ room . Just as [I]0-i was opening the outer door , [I]0-i remembered the twenty francs which [I]0-i had not restored ; [I]0-i paused : impossible to carry them away with [me]0-i ; difficult to force them back on [their original owner]1189-their original owner ; [I]0-i had now seen [her]1182-her in [[her]1182-her own humble abode]1190-her own humble abode , witnessed the dignity of [her]1182-her poverty , the pride of order , the fastidious care of conservatism , obvious in the arrangement and economy of [[her]1182-her little home]1191-her little home ; [I]0-i was sure [she]1182-her would not suffer [herself]1182-her to be excused paying [her]1182-her debts ; [I]0-i was certain the favour of indemnity would be accepted from no hand , perhaps least of all from [mine]0-i : yet these four five - franc pieces were a burden to [my]0-i self - respect , and [I]0-i must get rid of them . An expedient — a clumsy one no doubt , but the best [I]0-i could devise - suggested itself to [me]0-i . [I]0-i darted up the stairs , knocked , re - entered [the room]1922-the room as if in haste : — “ [Mademoiselle]200-henri , [I]0-i have forgotten one of [my]0-i gloves ; [I]0-i must have left it here . ”[0-i] [She]1182-her instantly rose to seek it ; as [she]1182-her turned [her]1182-her back , [I]0-i — being now at the hearth — noiselessly lifted a little vase , one of a set of china ornaments , as old - fashioned as the tea - cups — slipped the money under it , then saying—“Oh here is [my]0-i glove ! [I]0-i had dropped it within the fender ; good evening , [mademoiselle]719-mademoiselle , ”[0-i] [I]0-i made [my]0-i second exit . Brief as [my]0-i impromptu return had been , it had afforded [me]0-i time to pick up a heart - ache ; [I]0-i remarked that [Frances]181-frances had already removed the red embers of [her]181-frances cheerful little fire from the grate : forced to calculate every item , to save in every detail , [she]181-frances had instantly on [my]0-i departure retrenched a luxury too expensive to be enjoyed alone . “ [I]0-i am glad it is not yet winter , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i ; “ but in two months more come the winds and rains of November ; would to [God]119-god that before then [I]0-i could earn the right , and the power , to shovel coals into that grate ad libitum ! ”[0-i] Already the pavement was drying ; a balmy and fresh breeze stirred the air , purified by lightning ; [I]0-i felt the West behind [me]0-i , where spread a sky like opal ; azure immingled with crimson : the enlarged sun , glorious in Tyrian tints , dipped [his]1193-his brim already ; stepping , as [I]0-i was , eastward , [I]0-i faced a vast bank of clouds , but also [I]0-i had before [me]0-i the arch of an evening rainbow ; a perfect rainbow — high , wide , vivid . [I]0-i looked long ; [my]0-i eye drank in the scene , and [I]0-i suppose [my]0-i brain must have absorbed it ; for that night , after lying awake in pleasant fever a long time , watching the silent sheet - lightning , which still played among the retreating clouds , and flashed silvery over the stars , [I]0-i at last fell asleep ; and then in a dream were reproduced the setting sun , the bank of clouds , the mighty rainbow . [I]0-i stood , methought , on [a terrace]1194-a terrace ; [I]0-i leaned over a parapeted wall ; there was space below [me]0-i , depth [I]0-i could not fathom , but hearing an endless dash of waves , [I]0-i believed it to be [the sea]1195-the sea ; [sea]1196-sea spread to the horizon ; [sea of changeful green and intense blue]1197-sea of changeful green and intense blue : all was soft in the distance ; all vapour - veiled . A spark of gold glistened on the line between water and air , floated up , approached , enlarged , changed ; the object hung midway between heaven and [earth]1118-earth , under the arch of the rainbow ; the soft but dusk clouds diffused behind . [It]1199-it hovered as on wings ; pearly , fleecy , gleaming air streamed like raiment round it ; light , tinted with carnation , coloured what seemed face and limbs ; a large star shone with still lustre on [an angel]1200-an angel ’s forehead ; an upraised arm and hand , glancing like a ray , pointed to the bow overhead , and a voice in [my]0-i heart whispered — “ Hope smiles on [Effort]216-effort ! ”[0-i] A COMPETENCY was what [I]0-i wanted ; a competency it was now [my]0-i aim and resolve to secure ; but never had [I]0-i been farther from the mark . With August the school - year ( l’annee scolaire ) closed , the examinations concluded , the prizes were adjudged , [the schools]1201-the schools dispersed , the gates of [all colleges]1202-all colleges , the doors of all pensionnats shut , not to be reopened till the beginning or middle of October . The last day of August was at hand , and what was [my]0-i position ? Had [I]0-i advanced a step since the commencement of the past quarter ? On the contrary , [I]0-i had receded one . By renouncing [my]0-i engagement as [English master in [Mdlle]152-mdlle]1203-english master in mdlle . [[Reuter]154-madame pelet ’s establishment]2659-reuter ’s establishment , [I]0-i had voluntarily cut off 20l . from [my]0-i yearly income ; [I]0-i had diminished [my]0-i 60l . per annum to 40l . , and even that sum [I]0-i now held by a very precarious tenure . It is some time since [I]0-i made any reference to [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet . The moonlight walk is , [I]0-i think , the last incident recorded in this narrative where [that gentleman]315-that gentleman cuts any conspicuous figure : the fact is , since that event , a change had come over the spirit of [our]1206-our intercourse . [He]315-that gentleman , indeed , ignorant that the still hour , a cloudless moon , and an open lattice , had revealed to [me]0-i the secret of [his]315-that gentleman selfish love and false friendship , would have continued smooth and complaisant as ever ; but [I]0-i grew spiny as a porcupine , and inflexible as a blackthorn cudgel ; [I]0-i never had a smile for [his]315-that gentleman raillery , never a moment for [his]315-that gentleman society ; [his]315-that gentleman invitations to take coffee with [him]315-that gentleman in [[his]315-that gentleman parlour]2091-his parlour were invariably rejected , and very stiffly and sternly rejected too ; [his]315-that gentleman jesting allusions to [the directress]2533-the directress ( which [he]315-that gentleman still continued ) were heard with a grim calm very different from the petulant pleasure they were formerly wo nt to excite . For a long time [Pelet]146-m. pelet bore with [my]0-i frigid demeanour very patiently ; [he]146-m. pelet even increased [his]146-m. pelet attentions ; but finding that even a cringing politeness failed to thaw or move [me]0-i , [he]146-m. pelet at last altered too ; in [his]146-m. pelet turn [he]146-m. pelet cooled ; [his]146-m. pelet invitations ceased ; [his]146-m. pelet countenance became suspicious and overcast , and [I]0-i read in the perplexed yet brooding aspect of [his]146-m. pelet brow , a constant examination and comparison of premises , and an anxious endeavour to draw thence some explanatory inference . Ere long , [I]0-i fancy , [he]146-m. pelet succeeded , for [he]146-m. pelet was not without penetration ; perhaps , too , [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Zoraide]153-zoraide might have aided [him]146-m. pelet in the solution of the enigma ; at any rate [I]0-i soon found that the uncertainty of doubt had vanished from [his]146-m. pelet manner ; renouncing all pretence of friendship and cordiality , [he]146-m. pelet adopted a reserved , formal , but still scrupulously polite deportment . This was the point to which [I]0-i had wished to bring [him]146-m. pelet , and [I]0-i was now again comparatively at [my]0-i ease . [I]0-i did not , it is true , like [my]0-i position in [[his]146-m. pelet house]2046-his house ; but being freed from the annoyance of false professions and double - dealing [I]0-i could endure it , especially as no heroic sentiment of hatred or jealousy of [the director]2349-the director distracted [my]0-i philosophical soul ; [he]146-m. pelet had not , [I]0-i found , wounded [me]0-i in a very tender point , the wound was so soon and so radically healed , leaving only a sense of contempt for the treacherous fashion in which it had been inflicted , and a lasting mistrust of the hand which [I]0-i had detected attempting to stab in the dark . This state of things continued till about the middle of July , and then there was a little change ; [Pelet]146-m. pelet came [home]1905-home one night , an hour after [his]146-m. pelet usual time , in a state of unequivocal intoxication , a thing anomalous with [him]146-m. pelet ; for if [he]146-m. pelet had some of the worst faults of [[his]146-m. pelet countrymen]1212-his countrymen , [he]146-m. pelet had also one at least of [their]1212-his countrymen virtues , i.e. sobriety . So drunk , however , was [he]146-m. pelet upon this occasion , that after having roused [the whole establishment]1213-the whole establishment ( except [the pupils]2333-the pupils , whose dormitory being over the classes in [a building apart from [the dwelling - house]1216-the dwelling - house]1215-a building apart from the dwelling - house , was consequently out of the reach of disturbance ) by violently ringing the hall - bell and ordering lunch to be brought in immediately , for [he]146-m. pelet imagined it was noon , whereas the city bells had just tolled midnight ; after having furiously rated [the servants]665-the servants for [their]665-the servants want of punctuality , and gone near to chastise [[his]146-m. pelet poor old mother]1218-his poor old mother , who advised [him]146-m. pelet to go to bed , [he]146-m. pelet began raving dreadfully about “ le maudit Anglais , [Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort . ”[146-m. pelet] [I]0-i had not yet retired ; some German books [I]0-i had got hold of had kept [me]0-i up late ; [I]0-i heard the uproar below , and could distinguish [the director]2349-the director ’s voice exalted in a manner as appalling as it was unusual . Opening [my]0-i door a little , [I]0-i became aware of a demand on [his]146-m. pelet part for “ [Creemsvort]159-monsieur creemsvort ”[146-m. pelet] to be brought down to [him]146-m. pelet that [he]146-m. pelet might cut [his]146-m. pelet throat on the hall - table and wash [his]146-m. pelet honour , which [he]146-m. pelet affirmed to be in a dirty condition , in infernal British blood . “ [He]146-m. pelet is either mad or drunk , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i , “ and in either case [the old woman]3171-the old woman and [the servants]665-the servants will be the better of [a man]353-a man ’s assistance , ”[0-i] so [I]0-i descended straight to [the hall]1910-the hall . [I]0-i found [him]146-m. pelet staggering about , [his]146-m. pelet eyes in a fine frenzy rolling — a pretty sight [he]146-m. pelet was , a just medium between [the fool]1221-the fool and [the lunatic]1222-the lunatic . “ Come , [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ [you]146-m. pelet had better go to bed , ”[0-i] and [I]0-i took hold of [his]146-m. pelet arm . [His]146-m. pelet excitement , of course , increased greatly at sight and touch of [the individual]2976-the individual for whose blood [he]146-m. pelet had been making application : [he]146-m. pelet struggled and struck with fury — but [a drunken man]1224-a drunken man is no match for [a sober one]1225-a sober one ; and , even in [his]146-m. pelet normal state , [Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s worn out frame could not have stood against [my]0-i sound one . [I]0-i got [him]146-m. pelet up - stairs , and , in process of time , to bed . During the operation [he]146-m. pelet did not fail to utter comminations which , though broken , had a sense in them ; while stigmatizing [me]0-i as [the treacherous spawn of [a perfidious country]1227-a perfidious country]1226-the treacherous spawn of a perfidious country , [he]146-m. pelet , in the same breath , anathematized [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide ; [he]146-m. pelet termed [her]153-zoraide “ femme sotte et vicieuse , ”[146-m. pelet] who , in a fit of lewd caprice , had thrown [herself]153-zoraide away on an unprincipled adventurer ; directing the point of the last appellation by a furious blow , obliquely aimed at [me]0-i . [I]0-i left [him]146-m. pelet in the act of bounding elastically out of the bed into which [I]0-i had tucked [him]146-m. pelet ; but , as [I]0-i took the precaution of turning the key in the door behind [me]0-i , [I]0-i retired to [[my]0-i own room]2411-my own room , assured of [his]146-m. pelet safe custody till the morning , and free to draw undisturbed conclusions from the scene [I]0-i had just witnessed . Now , it was precisely about this time that [the directress]2533-the directress , stung by [my]0-i coldness , bewitched by [my]0-i scorn , and excited by the preference [she]2533-the directress suspected [me]0-i of cherishing for another , had fallen into a snare of [her]2533-the directress own laying — was [herself]2533-the directress caught in the meshes of the very passion with which [she]2533-the directress wished to entangle [me]0-i . Conscious of the state of things in [that quarter]1230-that quarter , [I]0-i gathered , from the condition in which [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i employer]2062-my employer , that [[his]2062-my employer lady - love]1232-his lady - love had betrayed the alienation of [her]2533-the directress affections — inclinations , rather , [I]0-i would say ; affection is a word at once too warm and too pure for the subject — had let [him]2062-my employer see that the cavity of [her]2533-the directress hollow heart , emptied of [his]2062-my employer image , was now occupied by that of [[his]2062-my employer usher]1233-his usher . It was not without some surprise that [I]0-i found [myself]0-i obliged to entertain this view of the case ; [Pelet]146-m. pelet , with [[his]146-m. pelet old - established school]1234-his old - established school , was so convenient , so profitable a match — [Zoraide]153-zoraide was so calculating , so interested [a woman]2098-a woman — [I]0-i wondered mere personal preference could , in [her]153-zoraide mind , have prevailed for a moment over worldly advantage : yet , it was evident , from what [Pelet]146-m. pelet said , that , not only had [she]153-zoraide repulsed [him]146-m. pelet , but had even let slip expressions of partiality for [me]0-i . One of [his]146-m. pelet drunken exclamations was , “ And the jade doats on [your]0-i youth , [[you]0-i raw blockhead]3174-you raw blockhead ! and talks of [your]0-i noble deportment , as [she]153-zoraide calls [your]0-i accursed English formality — and [your]0-i pure morals , forsooth ! des moeurs de Caton a - t - elle dit — sotte ! ”[146-m. pelet] [Hers]153-zoraide , [I]0-i thought , must be [a curious soul]1236-a curious soul , where in spite of a strong , natural tendency to estimate unduly advantages of wealth and station , the sardonic disdain of [a fortuneless subordinate]1237-a fortuneless subordinate had wrought a deeper impression than could be imprinted by the most flattering assiduities of [a prosperous chef d'institution]1238-a prosperous chef d'institution . [I]0-i smiled inwardly ; and strange to say , though [my]0-i amour propre was excited not disagreeably by the conquest , [my]0-i better feelings remained untouched . Next day , when [I]0-i saw [the directress]2533-the directress , and when [she]2533-the directress made an excuse to meet [me]0-i in [the corridor]2466-the corridor , and besought [my]0-i notice by a demeanour and look subdued to Helot humility , [I]0-i could not love , [I]0-i could scarcely pity [her]2533-the directress . To answer briefly and dryly some interesting inquiry about [my]0-i health — to pass [her]2533-the directress by with a stern bow — was all [I]0-i could ; [her]2533-the directress presence and manner had then , and for some time previously and consequently , a singular effect upon [me]0-i : [they]1241-they sealed up all that was good , elicited all that was noxious in [my]0-i nature ; sometimes they enervated [my]0-i senses , but they always hardened [my]0-i heart . [I]0-i was aware of the detriment done , and quarrelled with [myself]0-i for the change . [I]0-i had ever hated [a tyrant]535-a tyrant ; and , behold , the possession of [a slave]1957-a slave , self - given , went near to transform [me]0-i into what [I]0-i abhorred ! There was at once a sort of low gratification in receiving this luscious incense from [an attractive and still young worshipper]1244-an attractive and still young worshipper ; and an irritating sense of degradation in the very experience of the pleasure . When [she]2533-the directress stole about [me]0-i with the soft step of [a slave]1957-a slave , [I]0-i felt at once barbarous and sensual as a pasha . [I]0-i endured [her]2533-the directress homage sometimes ; sometimes [I]0-i rebuked it . [My]0-i indifference or harshness served equally to increase the evil [I]0-i desired to check . “ Que le dedain lui sied bien ! ”[2533-the directress] [I]0-i once overheard [her]2533-the directress say to [[her]2533-the directress mother]1026-her mother : “ il est beau comme Apollon quand il sourit de son air hautain . ”[2533-the directress] And [the jolly old dame]1247-the jolly old dame laughed , and said [she]1247-the jolly old dame thought [[her]1247-the jolly old dame daughter]1248-her daughter was bewitched , for [I]0-i had no point of [a handsome man]1982-a handsome man about [me]0-i , except being straight and without deformity . “ Pour moi , ”[1247-the jolly old dame] [she]1247-the jolly old dame continued , “ il [me]1247-the jolly old dame fait tout l’effet d’un chat - huant , avec ses besicles . ”[1247-the jolly old dame] [Worthy old girl]1250-worthy old girl ! [I]0-i could have gone and kissed [her]2533-the directress had [she]2533-the directress not been a little too old , too fat , and too red - faced ; [her]1247-the jolly old dame sensible , truthful words seemed so wholesome , contrasted with the morbid illusions of [[her]1247-the jolly old dame daughter]1248-her daughter . When [Pelet]146-m. pelet awoke on the morning after [his]146-m. pelet frenzy fit , [he]146-m. pelet retained no recollection of what had happened the previous night , and [[his]146-m. pelet mother]409-his mother fortunately had the discretion to refrain from informing [him]146-m. pelet that [I]0-i had been a witness of [his]146-m. pelet degradation . [He]146-m. pelet did not again have recourse to wine for curing [his]146-m. pelet griefs , but even in [his]146-m. pelet sober mood [he]146-m. pelet soon showed that the iron of jealousy had entered into [his]146-m. pelet soul . [A thorough Frenchman]1253-a thorough frenchman , the national characteristic of ferocity had not been omitted by nature in compounding the ingredients of [his]146-m. pelet character ; it had appeared first in [his]146-m. pelet access of drunken wrath , when some of [his]146-m. pelet demonstrations of hatred to [my]0-i person were of a truly fiendish character , and now it was more covertly betrayed by momentary contractions of the features , and flashes of fierceness in [his]146-m. pelet light blue eyes , when [their]1254-their glance chanced to encounter [mine]0-i . [He]146-m. pelet absolutely avoided speaking to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i was now spared even the falsehood of [his]146-m. pelet politeness . In this state of [our]1255-our mutual relations , [my]0-i soul rebelled sometimes almost ungovernably , against living in [the house]1897-the house and discharging the service of [such a man]1257-such a man ; but who is free from the constraint of circumstances ? At that time , [I]0-i was not : [I]0-i used to rise each morning eager to shake off [his]146-m. pelet yoke , and go out with [my]0-i portmanteau under [my]0-i arm , if [a beggar]1258-a beggar , at least [a freeman]1259-a freeman ; and in the evening , when [I]0-i came back from [the pensionnat de demoiselles]2736-the pensionnat de demoiselles , a certain pleasant voice in [my]0-i ear ; a certain face , so intelligent , yet so docile , so reflective , yet so soft , in [my]0-i eyes ; [a certain cast of character , at once proud and pliant , sensitive and sagacious , serious and ardent]1261-a certain cast of character , at once proud and pliant , sensitive and sagacious , serious and ardent , in [my]0-i head ; a certain tone of feeling , fervid and modest , refined and practical , pure and powerful , delighting and troubling [my]0-i memory — visions of new ties [I]0-i longed to contract , of new duties [I]0-i longed to undertake , had taken [the rover]1262-the rover and the rebel out of [me]0-i , and had shown endurance of [my]0-i hated lot in the light of a Spartan virtue . But [Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s fury subsided ; a fortnight sufficed for its rise , progress , and extinction : in that space of time the dismissal of [the obnoxious teacher]1263-the obnoxious teacher had been effected in [the neighbouring house]653-the neighbouring house , and in the same interval [I]0-i had declared [my]0-i resolution to follow and find out [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil , and upon [my]0-i application for [her]1015-my pupil address being refused , [I]0-i had summarily resigned [my]0-i own post . This last act seemed at once to restore [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Reuter]152-mdlle to [her]152-mdlle senses ; [her]152-mdlle sagacity , [her]152-mdlle judgment , so long misled by a fascinating delusion , struck again into the right track the moment that delusion vanished . By the right track , [I]0-i do not mean the steep and difficult path of principle — in that path [she]152-mdlle never trod ; but the plain highway of common sense , from which [she]152-mdlle had of late widely diverged . When there [she]152-mdlle carefully sought , and having found , industriously pursued the trail of [[her]152-mdlle old suitor]1266-her old suitor , [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet . [She]152-mdlle soon overtook [him]146-m. pelet . What arts [she]152-mdlle employed to soothe and blind [him]146-m. pelet [I]0-i know not , but [she]152-mdlle succeeded both in allaying [his]146-m. pelet wrath , and hoodwinking [his]146-m. pelet discernment , as was soon proved by the alteration in [his]146-m. pelet mien and manner ; [she]152-mdlle must have managed to convince [him]146-m. pelet that [I]0-i neither was , nor ever had been , [a rival of [his]146-m. pelet]1267-a rival of his , for the fortnight of fury against [me]0-i terminated in a fit of exceeding graciousness and amenity , not unmixed with a dash of exulting self - complacency , more ludicrous than irritating . [[Pelet]146-m. pelet ’s bachelor]1268-pelet ’s bachelor ’s life had been passed in proper French style with due disregard to moral restraint , and [I]0-i thought [his]146-m. pelet married life promised to be very French also . [He]146-m. pelet often boasted to [me]0-i what a terror [he]146-m. pelet had been to [certain husbands of [his]146-m. pelet acquaintance]1269-certain husbands of his acquaintance ; [I]0-i perceived it would not now be difficult to pay [him]146-m. pelet back in [his]146-m. pelet own coin . The crisis drew on . No sooner had the holidays commenced than note of preparation for some momentous event sounded all through [the premises of [Pelet]146-m. pelet]1270-the premises of pelet : [painters]1271-painters , [polishers]1272-polishers , and [upholsterers]1273-upholsterers were immediately set to work , and there was talk of “ la chambre de [Madame]154-madame pelet , ”[738-the old duenna] “ le salon de Madame . ”[738-the old duenna] Not deeming it probable that [the old duenna]738-the old duenna at present graced with that title in [[our]1275-our house]325-our house , had inspired [[her]738-the old duenna son]2371-her son with such enthusiasm of filial piety , as to induce [him]2371-her son to fit up [apartments]388-apartments expressly for [her]738-the old duenna use , [I]0-i concluded , in common with [the cook]2380-the cook , [the two housemaids]1280-the two housemaids , and [the kitchen - scullion]1281-the kitchen - scullion , that [a new and more juvenile Madame]1282-a new and more juvenile madame was destined to be [the tenant of [these gay chambers]1284-these gay chambers]1283-the tenant of these gay chambers . Presently official announcement of the coming event was put forth . In another week ’s time [M. Francois Pelet]146-m. pelet , [directeur]1285-directeur , and [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Zoraide Reuter]153-zoraide , directrice , were to be joined together in the bands of matrimony . [Monsieur]1286-monsieur , in person , heralded the fact to [me]0-i ; terminating [his]1286-monsieur communication by an obliging expression of [his]1286-monsieur desire that [I]0-i should continue , as heretofore , [[his]1286-monsieur ablest assistant and most trusted friend]1287-his ablest assistant and most trusted friend ; and a proposition to raise [my]0-i salary by an additional two hundred francs per annum . [I]0-i thanked [him]1286-monsieur , gave no conclusive answer at the time , and , when [he]1286-monsieur had left [me]0-i , threw off [my]0-i blouse , put on [my]0-i coat , and set out on a long walk outside [the Porte de Flandre]1288-the porte de flandre , in order , as [I]0-i thought , to cool [my]0-i blood , calm [my]0-i nerves , and shake [my]0-i disarranged ideas into some order . In fact , [I]0-i had just received what was virtually [my]0-i dismissal . [I]0-i could not conceal , [I]0-i did not desire to conceal from [myself]0-i the conviction that , being now certain that [Mdlle . Reuter]152-mdlle was destined to become [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet it would not do for [me]0-i to remain [a dependent dweller in [the house which was soon to be [hers]154-madame pelet]1290-the house which was soon to be hers]1289-a dependent dweller in the house which was soon to be hers . [Her]154-madame pelet present demeanour towards [me]0-i was deficient neither in dignity nor propriety ; but [I]0-i knew [her]154-madame pelet former feeling was unchanged . Decorum now repressed , and [Policy]217-policy masked it , but Opportunity would be too strong for either of these — Temptation would shiver [their]1291-their restraints . [I]0-i was [no pope]1292-no pope — [I]0-i could not boast infallibility : in short , if [I]0-i stayed , the probability was that , in three months ’ time , a practical modern French novel would be in full process of concoction under the roof of the unsuspecting [Pelet]154-madame pelet . Now , modern French novels are not to [my]0-i taste , either practically or theoretically . Limited as had yet been [my]0-i experience of life , [I]0-i had once had the opportunity of contemplating , near at hand , an example of the results produced by a course of interesting and romantic domestic treachery . No golden halo of fiction was about this example , [I]0-i saw it bare and real , and it was very loathsome . [I]0-i saw a mind degraded by the practice of mean subterfuge , by the habit of perfidious deception , and a body depraved by the infectious influence of the vice - polluted soul . [I]0-i had suffered much from the forced and prolonged view of this spectacle ; those sufferings [I]0-i did not now regret , for [their]1291-their simple recollection acted as a most wholesome antidote to temptation . [They]1291-their had inscribed on [my]0-i reason the conviction that unlawful pleasure , trenching on another ’s rights , is delusive and envenomed pleasure — its hollowness disappoints at the time , its poison cruelly tortures afterwards , its effects deprave for ever . From all this resulted the conclusion that [I]0-i must leave [Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet , and that instantly ; “ but , ”[140-prudence] said [Prudence]140-prudence , “ [you]0-i know not where to go , nor how to live ; ”[140-prudence] and then the dream of true love came over [me]0-i : [Frances Henri]181-frances seemed to stand at [my]0-i side ; [her]181-frances slender waist to invite [my]0-i arm ; [her]181-frances hand to court [my]0-i hand ; [I]0-i felt it was made to nestle in mine ; [I]0-i could not relinquish [my]0-i right to it , nor could [I]0-i withdraw [my]0-i eyes for ever from [hers]181-frances , where [I]0-i saw so much happiness , such a correspondence of heart with heart ; over whose expression [I]0-i had such influence ; where [I]0-i could kindle bliss , infuse awe , stir deep delight , rouse sparkling spirit , and sometimes waken pleasurable dread . [My]0-i hopes to will and possess , [my]0-i resolutions to merit and rise , rose in array against [me]0-i ; and here [I]0-i was about to plunge into the gulf of absolute destitution ; “ and all this , ”[0-i] suggested an inward voice , “ because [you]0-i fear an evil which may never happen ! ”[0-i] “ It will happen ; [you]0-i know it will , ”[1293-that stubborn monitor , conscience] answered [that stubborn monitor , Conscience]1293-that stubborn monitor , conscience . “ Do what [you]0-i feel is right ; obey [me]1293-that stubborn monitor , conscience , and even in the sloughs of want [I]1293-that stubborn monitor , conscience will plant for [you]0-i firm footing . ”[1293-that stubborn monitor , conscience] And then , as [I]0-i walked fast along [the road]1962-the road , there rose upon [me]0-i a strange , inly - felt idea of [some Great Being]1295-some great being , unseen , but all present , who in [His]1295-some great being beneficence desired only [my]0-i welfare , and now watched the struggle of good and evil in [my]0-i heart , and waited to see whether [I]0-i should obey [His]1295-some great being voice , heard in the whispers of [my]0-i conscience , or lend an ear to the sophisms by which [[His]1295-some great being enemy]1296-his enemy and [mine]0-i — [the Spirit of Evil]1297-the spirit of evil — sought to lead [me]0-i astray . Rough and steep was the path indicated by divine suggestion ; mossy and declining the green way along which Temptation strewed flowers ; but whereas , methought , [the Deity of Love]1298-the deity of love , [the Friend of all that exists]1299-the friend of all that exists , would smile well - pleased were [I]0-i to gird up [my]0-i loins and address [myself]0-i to the rude ascent ; so , on the other hand , each inclination to the velvet declivity seemed to kindle a gleam of triumph on the brow of [the man - hating , God - defying demon]1300-the man - hating , god - defying demon . Sharp and short [I]0-i turned round ; fast [I]0-i retraced [my]0-i steps ; in half an hour [I]0-i was again at [M. Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet : [I]0-i sought [him]1295-some great being in [[his]1295-some great being study]1301-his study ; brief parley , concise explanation sufficed ; [my]0-i manner proved that [I]0-i was resolved ; [he]1295-some great being , perhaps , at heart approved [my]0-i decision . After twenty minutes ’ conversation , [I]0-i re - entered [[my]0-i own room]2411-my own room , self - deprived of the means of living , self - sentenced to leave [[my]0-i present [home]1905-home]1303-my present home , with the short notice of a week in which to provide another . DIRECTLY as [I]0-i closed the door , [I]0-i saw laid on the table two letters ; [my]0-i thought was , that they were notes of invitation from [the friends of some of [[my]0-i pupils]2276-my pupils]1305-the friends of some of my pupils ; [I]0-i had received such marks of attention occasionally , and with [me]0-i , who had [no friends]2833-no friends , correspondence of more interest was out of the question ; [the postman]1308-the postman ’s arrival had never yet been an event of interest to [me]0-i since [I]0-i came to [Brussels]18-brussels . [I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand carelessly on the documents , and coldly and slowly glancing at them , [I]0-i prepared to break the seals ; [my]0-i eye was arrested and [my]0-i hand too ; [I]0-i saw what excited [me]0-i , as if [I]0-i had found a vivid picture where [I]0-i expected only to discover a blank page : on one cover was an English postmark ; on the other , [a lady]347-a lady ’s clear , fine autograph ; the last [I]0-i opened first : — “ [MONSIEUR]638-monsieur , “[0-i] [I]0-i found out what [you]1310-you had done the very morning after [your]1310-you visit to [me]0-i ; [you]1310-you might be sure [I]0-i should dust the china , every day ; and , as [no one]757-no one but [you]1310-you had been in [[my]0-i room]2457-my room for a week , and as fairy - money is not current in [Brussels]18-brussels , [I]0-i could not doubt who left the twenty francs on the chimney - piece . [I]0-i thought [I]0-i heard [you]1310-you stir the vase when [I]0-i was stooping to look for [your]1310-you glove under the table , and [I]0-i wondered [you]1310-you should imagine it had got into such a little cup . Now , [monsieur]638-monsieur , the money is not [mine]0-i , and [I]0-i shall not keep it ; [I]0-i will not send it in this note because it might be lost — besides , it is heavy ; but [I]0-i will restore it to [you]1310-you the first time [I]0-i see [you]1310-you , and [you]1310-you must make no difficulties about taking it ; because , in the first place , [I]0-i am sure , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [you]1310-you can understand that [one]1983-one likes to pay [one]1983-one ’s debts ; that it is satisfactory to owe [no man]1919-no man anything ; and , in the second place , [I]0-i can now very well afford to be honest , as [I]0-i am provided with a situation . This last circumstance is , indeed , the reason of [my]0-i writing to [you]1310-you , for it is pleasant to communicate good news ; and , in these days , [I]0-i have only [[my]0-i master]1318-my master to whom [I]0-i can tell anything . “ A week ago , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]1319-you was sent for by a [Mrs. Wharton]218-mrs. wharton , [an English lady]3177-an english lady ; [[her]218-mrs. wharton eldest daughter]3178-her eldest daughter was going to be married , and [some rich relation]3179-some rich relation having made [her]218-mrs. wharton a present of a veil and dress in costly old lace , as precious , [they]3179-some rich relation said , almost as jewels , but a little damaged by time , [I]1319-you was commissioned to put them in repair . [I]1319-you had to do it at [the house]1897-the house ; [they]3179-some rich relation gave [me]1319-you , besides , some embroidery to complete , and nearly a week elapsed before [I]1319-you had finished everything . While [I]1319-you worked , [Miss Wharton]219-miss wharton often came into [the room]1922-the room and sat with [me]1319-you , and so did [Mrs. Wharton]218-mrs. wharton ; [they]3179-some rich relation made [me]1319-you talk English ; asked how [I]1319-you had learned to speak it so well ; then [they]3179-some rich relation inquired what [I]1319-you knew besides — what books [I]1319-you had read ; soon [they]3179-some rich relation seemed to make a sort of wonder of [me]1319-you , considering [me]1319-you no doubt as [a learned grisette]3182-a learned grisette . One afternoon , [Mrs. Wharton]218-mrs. wharton brought in [a Parisian lady]3183-a parisian lady to test the accuracy of [my]1319-you knowledge of French ; the result of it was that , owing probably in a great degree to [the mother]3184-the mother ’s and [daughter]3185-daughter ’s good humour about the marriage , which inclined [them]3179-some rich relation to do beneficent deeds , and partly , [I]1319-you think , because [they]3179-some rich relation are naturally [benevolent people]3186-benevolent people , [they]3179-some rich relation decided that the wish [I]1319-you had expressed to do something more than mend lace was a very legitimate one ; and the same day [they]3179-some rich relation took [me]1319-you in [[their]3179-some rich relation carriage]3187-their carriage to [Mrs. D.‘s]220-mrs. d.‘s , who is [the directress of [the first English school at [Brussels]18-brussels]3189-the first english school at brussels]3188-the directress of the first english school at brussels . It seems [she]220-mrs. d.‘s happened to be in want of [a French lady]3190-a french lady to give lessons in geography , history , grammar , and composition , in the French language . [Mrs. Wharton]218-mrs. wharton recommended [me]1319-you very warmly ; and , as [two of [[her]218-mrs. wharton younger daughters]3192-her younger daughters]3191-two of her younger daughters are [pupils]2269-pupils in [the house]1897-the house , [her]218-mrs. wharton patronage availed to get [me]1319-you [the place]3103-the place . It was settled that [I]1319-you am to attend six hours daily ( for , happily , it was not required that [I]1319-you should live in [the house]1897-the house ; [I]1319-you should have been sorry to leave [[my]1319-you lodgings]2067-my lodgings ) , and , for this , [Mrs. D.]221-mrs. d. will give [me]1319-you twelve hundred francs per annum . “[1319-you] [You]1319-you see , therefore , [monsieur]638-monsieur , that [I]0-i am now rich ; richer almost than [I]0-i ever hoped to be : [I]0-i feel thankful for it , especially as [my]0-i sight was beginning to be injured by constant working at fine lace ; and [I]0-i was getting , too , very weary of sitting up late at nights , and yet not being able to find time for reading or study . [I]0-i began to fear that [I]0-i should fall ill , and be unable to pay [my]0-i way ; this fear is now , in a great measure , removed ; and , in truth , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]0-i am very grateful to [God]119-god for the relief ; and [I]0-i feel it necessary , almost , to speak of [my]0-i happiness to some one who is kind - hearted enough to derive joy from seeing others joyful . [I]0-i could not , therefore , resist the temptation of writing to [you]1319-you ; [I]0-i argued with [myself]0-i it is very pleasant for [me]0-i to write , and it will not be exactly painful , though it may be tiresome to [monsieur]638-monsieur to read . Do not be too angry with [my]0-i circumlocution and inelegancies of expression , and , believe [me]0-i “ [[Your]1319-you attached pupil]3198-your attached pupil , “[0-i] F. E. [HENRI]181-frances . ” Having read this letter , [I]181-frances mused on its contents for a few moments — whether with sentiments pleasurable or otherwise [I]181-frances will hereafter note — and then took up the other . It was directed in a hand to [me]181-frances unknown — small , and rather neat ; neither masculine nor exactly feminine ; the seal bore a coat of arms , concerning which [I]181-frances could only decipher that it was not that of [the Seacombe family]3199-the seacombe family , consequently the epistle could be from none of [my]181-frances almost forgotten , and certainly quite forgetting patrician relations . From whom , then , was it ? [I]181-frances removed the envelope ; the note folded within ran as follows : “[181-frances] [I]0-i have no doubt in [the world]1872-the world that [you]1319-you are doing well in [that greasy Flanders]1324-that greasy flanders ; living probably on [the fat of [the unctuous land]1326-the unctuous land]1325-the fat of the unctuous land ; sitting like [a black - haired , tawny - skinned , long - nosed Israelite by the flesh - pots of [Egypt]15-egypt]1327-a black - haired , tawny - skinned , long - nosed israelite by the flesh - pots of egypt ; or like [a rascally son of [Levi]222-levi near the brass cauldrons of [the sanctuary]1329-the sanctuary]1328-a rascally son of levi near the brass cauldrons of the sanctuary , and every now and then plunging in a consecrated hook , and drawing out of the sea of broth the fattest of heave - shoulders and the fleshiest of wave - breasts . [I]0-i know this , because [you]1319-you never write to [any one in [England]11-england]1330-any one in england . Thankless dog that [you]1319-you are ! [I]0-i , by the sovereign efficacy of [my]0-i recommendation , got [you]1319-you [the place where [you]1319-you are now living in clover]1331-the place where you are now living in clover , and yet not a word of gratitude , or even acknowledgment , have [you]1319-you ever offered in return ; but [I]0-i am coming to see [you]1319-you , and small conception can [you]1319-you , with [your]1319-you addled aristocratic brains , form of the sort of moral kicking [I]0-i have , ready packed in [my]0-i carpet - bag , destined to be presented to [you]1319-you immediately on [my]0-i arrival . “ Meantime [I]1332-i know all about [your]1319-you affairs , and have just got information , by [Brown]209-brown ’s last letter , that [you]1319-you are said to be on the point of forming an advantageous match with [a pursy , little Belgian schoolmistress]3200-a pursy , little belgian schoolmistress — a [Mdlle . Zenobie]223-mdlle , or some such name . Wo n’t [I]1332-i have a look at [her]3200-a pursy , little belgian schoolmistress when [I]1332-i come over ! And this [you]1319-you may rely on : if [she]3200-a pursy , little belgian schoolmistress pleases [my]1332-i taste , or if [I]1332-i think it worth while in a pecuniary point of view , [I]1332-i ’ll pounce on [your]1319-you prize and bear [her]3200-a pursy , little belgian schoolmistress away triumphant in spite of [your]1319-you teeth . Yet [I]1332-i do n’t like dumpies either , and [Brown]209-brown says [she]3200-a pursy , little belgian schoolmistress is little and stout — the better fitted for [a wiry , starved - looking chap like [you]1319-you]3201-a wiry , starved - looking chap like you . “[1332-i] Be on the look - out , for [you]1332-i know neither the day nor hour when [your]1332-i — — ” ( [I]1332-i do n’t wish to blaspheme , so [I]1332-i ’ll leave a blank)—cometh . “[1332-i] [Yours]1332-i truly , “ [HUNSDEN YORKE HUNSDEN]115-yorke . ”[1332-i] “ Humph ! ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ; and ere [I]0-i laid the letter down , [I]0-i again glanced at the small , neat handwriting , not a bit like that of [a mercantile man]1333-a mercantile man , nor , indeed , of [any man except [Hunsden]115-yorke [himself]115-yorke]1334-any man except hunsden himself . [They]1335-they talk of affinities between the autograph and the character : what affinity was there here ? [I]0-i recalled [the writer]977-the writer ’s peculiar face and certain traits [I]0-i suspected , rather than knew , to appertain to [his]977-the writer nature , and [I]0-i answered , “ A great deal . ”[0-i] [Hunsden]115-yorke , then , was coming to [Brussels]18-brussels , and coming [I]0-i knew not when ; coming charged with the expectation of finding [me]0-i on the summit of prosperity , about to be married , to step into a warm nest , to lie comfortably down by the side of [a snug , well - fed little mate]1337-a snug , well - fed little mate . “ [I]0-i wish [him]115-yorke joy of the fidelity of the picture [he]115-yorke has painted , ”[0-i] thought [I.]0-i “ What will [he]115-yorke say when , instead of a pair of plump turtle doves , billing and cooing in a bower of roses , [he]115-yorke finds a single lean cormorant , standing mateless and shelterless on [poverty ’s [bleak cliff]3203-bleak cliff]3202-poverty ’s bleak cliff ? Oh , confound [him]115-yorke ! Let [him]115-yorke come , and let [him]115-yorke laugh at the contrast between rumour and fact . Were [he]115-yorke the devil [himself]115-yorke , instead of being merely very like [him]115-yorke , [I]0-i ’d not condescend to get out of [his]115-yorke way , or to forge a smile or a cheerful word wherewith to avert [his]115-yorke sarcasm . ”[0-i] Then [I]0-i recurred to the other letter : that struck a chord whose sound [I]0-i could not deaden by thrusting [my]0-i fingers into [my]0-i ears , for it vibrated within ; and though its swell might be exquisite music , its cadence was a groan . That [Frances]181-frances was relieved from the pressure of want , that the curse of excessive labour was taken off [her]181-frances , filled [me]0-i with happiness ; that [her]181-frances first thought in prosperity should be to augment [her]181-frances joy by sharing it with [me]0-i , met and satisfied the wish of [my]0-i heart . Two results of [her]181-frances letter were then pleasant , sweet as two draughts of nectar ; but applying [my]0-i lips for the third time to the cup , and they were excoriated as with vinegar and gall .
