[Two persons whose desires are moderate]1338-two persons whose desires are moderate may live well enough in [Brussels]18-brussels on an income which would scarcely afford a respectable maintenance for one in [London]19-london : and that , not because the necessaries of life are so much dearer in [the latter capital]1339-the latter capital , or taxes so much higher than in the former , but because [the English]224-the english surpass in folly [all the nations on [God ’s earth]119-god]1340-all the nations on god ’s earth , and are more abject slaves to custom , to opinion , to the desire to keep up a certain appearance , than [the Italians]1341-the italians are to priestcraft , [the French]225-the french to vain - glory , [the Russians]1342-the russians to [[their]1342-the russians Czar]1343-their czar , or [the Germans]1344-the germans to black beer . [I]0-i have seen a degree of sense in the modest arrangement of [one homely Belgian household]1345-one homely belgian household , that might put to shame the elegance , the superfluities , the luxuries , the strained refinements of [a hundred genteel English mansions]1346-a hundred genteel english mansions . In [Belgium]21-belgium , provided [you]1347-you can make money , [you]1347-you may save it ; this is scarcely possible in [England]11-england ; ostentation there lavishes in a month what industry has earned in a year . More shame to all classes in [that most bountiful and beggarly country]1348-that most bountiful and beggarly country for [their]1349-their servile following of Fashion ; [I]0-i could write a chapter or two on this subject , but must forbear , at least for the present . Had [I]0-i retained [my]0-i 60l . per annum [I]0-i could , now that [Frances]181-frances was in possession of 50l . , have gone straight to [her]181-frances this very evening , and spoken out the words which , repressed , kept fretting [my]0-i heart with fever ; [our]1350-our united income would , as [we]1350-our should have managed it , have sufficed well for [our]1350-our mutual support ; since [we]1350-our lived in [a country where economy was not confounded with meanness , where frugality in dress , food , and furniture , was not synonymous with vulgarity in these various points]1351-a country where economy was not confounded with meanness , where frugality in dress , food , and furniture , was not synonymous with vulgarity in these various points . But [the placeless usher , bare of resource , and unsupported by connections]1352-the placeless usher , bare of resource , and unsupported by connections , must not think of this ; such a sentiment as love , such a word as marriage , were misplaced in [his]1352-the placeless usher , bare of resource , and unsupported by connections heart , and on [his]1352-the placeless usher , bare of resource , and unsupported by connections lips . Now for the first time did [I]0-i truly feel what it was to be poor ; now did the sacrifice [I]0-i had made in casting from [me]0-i the means of living put on a new aspect ; instead of a correct , just , honourable act , it seemed a deed at once light and fanatical ; [I]0-i took several turns in [[my]0-i room]2457-my room , under the goading influence of most poignant remorse ; [I]0-i walked a quarter of an hour from the wall to the window ; and at the window , self - reproach seemed to face [me]0-i ; at the wall , self - disdain : all at once out spoke Conscience : — “ Down , [stupid tormenters]3204-stupid tormenters ! ”[181-frances] cried [she]181-frances ; “ [the man]2218-the man has done [his]2218-the man duty ; [you]0-i shall not bait [him]2218-the man thus by thoughts of what might have been ; [he]2218-the man relinquished a temporary and contingent good to avoid a permanent and certain evil [he]2218-the man did well . Let [him]2218-the man reflect now , and when [your]0-i blinding dust and deafening hum subside , [he]2218-the man will discover a path . ”[181-frances] [I]0-i sat down ; [I]0-i propped [my]0-i forehead on both [my]0-i hands ; [I]0-i thought and thought an hour — two hours ; vainly . [I]0-i seemed like [one sealed in a subterranean vault , who gazes at utter blackness]1354-one sealed in a subterranean vault , who gazes at utter blackness ; at blackness ensured by yard - thick stone walls around , and by piles of [building above]1355-building above , expecting light to penetrate through granite , and through cement firm as granite . But there are chinks , or there may be chinks , in the best adjusted masonry ; there was a chink in [[my]0-i cavernous cell]1356-my cavernous cell ; for , eventually , [I]0-i saw , or seemed to see , a ray — pallid , indeed , and cold , and doubtful , but still a ray , for it showed that narrow path which conscience had promised after two , three hours ’ torturing research in brain and memory , [I]0-i disinterred certain remains of circumstances , and conceived a hope that by putting them together an expedient might be framed , and a resource discovered . The circumstances were briefly these : Some three months ago [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet had , on the occasion of [his]146-m. pelet fete , given [the boys]636-the boys a treat , which treat consisted in a party of pleasure to [a certain place of public resort in [the outskirts of [Brussels]18-brussels]1359-the outskirts of brussels , of which [I]0-i do not at this moment remember the name , but near [it]1360-it were several of [those lakelets called etangs]1361-those lakelets called etangs]1358-a certain place of public resort in the outskirts of brussels , of which i do not at this moment remember the name , but near it were several of those lakelets called etangs ; and there was [one etang , larger than the rest , where on holidays [people]960-people were accustomed to amuse [themselves]960-people by rowing round [it]1362-one etang , larger than the rest , where on holidays people were accustomed to amuse themselves by rowing round it in little boats in [little boats]1364-little boats]1362-one etang , larger than the rest , where on holidays people were accustomed to amuse themselves by rowing round it in little boats . [The boys having eaten an unlimited quantity of “ gaufres]3206-the boys having eaten an unlimited quantity of “ gaufres , ”[2349-the director] and drank several bottles of Louvain beer , amid the shades of a garden made and provided for such crams , petitioned [the director]2349-the director for leave to take a row on [the etang]1366-the etang . [Half a dozen of [the eldest]1368-the eldest]1367-half a dozen of the eldest succeeded in obtaining leave , and [I]0-i was commissioned to accompany [them]1367-half a dozen of the eldest as [surveillant]1369-surveillant . Among [the half dozen]1370-the half dozen happened to be a certain [Jean Baptiste Vandenhuten]226-jean , [a most ponderous young Flamand]1371-a most ponderous young flamand , not tall , but even now , at the early age of sixteen , possessing a breadth and depth of personal development truly national . It chanced that [Jean]226-jean was [the first lad]1372-the first lad to step into [the boat]1373-the boat ; [he]1372-the first lad stumbled , rolled to one side , the boat revolted at [his]1372-the first lad weight and capsized . [Vandenhuten]226-jean sank like lead , rose , sank again . [My]0-i coat and waistcoat were off in an instant ; [I]0-i had not been brought up at [Eton]1-eton and boated and bathed and swam there ten long years for nothing ; it was a natural and easy act for [me]0-i to leap to the rescue . [The lads]544-the lads and [the boatmen]1375-the boatmen yelled ; [they]1376-they thought there would be two deaths by drowning instead of one ; but as [Jean]226-jean rose the third time , [I]0-i clutched [him]1372-the first lad by one leg and the collar , and in three minutes more both [he]1372-the first lad and [I]0-i were safe landed . To speak heaven ’s truth , [my]0-i merit in the action was small indeed , for [I]0-i had run no risk , and subsequently did not even catch cold from the wetting ; but when [M.]146-m. pelet and [Madame Vandenhuten]227-madame vandenhuten , of whom [Jean Baptiste]226-jean was [the sole hope]1377-the sole hope , came to hear of the exploit , [they]1376-they seemed to think [I]0-i had evinced a bravery and devotion which no thanks could sufficiently repay . [Madame]227-madame vandenhuten , in particular , was “ certain [I]227-madame vandenhuten must have dearly loved [[their]1376-they sweet son]3207-their sweet son , or [I]227-madame vandenhuten would not thus have hazarded [my]227-madame vandenhuten own life to save [his]3207-their sweet son . ”[227-madame vandenhuten] [Monsieur]1378-monsieur , [an honest - looking , though phlegmatic man]1379-an honest - looking , though phlegmatic man , said very little , but [he]1378-monsieur would not suffer [me]0-i to leave [the room]1922-the room , till [I]0-i had promised that in case [I]0-i ever stood in need of help [I]0-i would , by applying to [him]1378-monsieur , give [him]1378-monsieur a chance of discharging the obligation under which [he]1378-monsieur affirmed [I]0-i had laid [him]1378-monsieur . These words , then , were [my]0-i glimmer of light ; it was here [I]0-i found [my]0-i sole outlet ; and in truth , though the cold light roused , it did not cheer [me]0-i ; nor did the outlet seem such as [I]0-i should like to pass through . Right [I]0-i had none to [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten ’s good offices ; it was not on the ground of merit [I]0-i could apply to [him]1378-monsieur ; no , [I]0-i must stand on that of necessity : [I]0-i had no work ; [I]0-i wanted work ; [my]0-i best chance of obtaining it lay in securing [his]1378-monsieur recommendation . This [I]0-i knew could be had by asking for it ; not to ask , because the request revolted [my]0-i pride and contradicted [my]0-i habits , would , [I]0-i felt , be an indulgence of false and indolent fastidiousness . [I]0-i might repent the omission all [my]0-i life ; [I]0-i would not then be guilty of it . That evening [I]0-i went to [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten ’s ; but [I]0-i had bent the bow and adjusted the shaft in vain ; the string broke . [I]0-i rang the bell at the great door ( it was [a large , handsome house in [an expensive part of [the town]2149-the town]1382-an expensive part of the town]1381-a large , handsome house in an expensive part of the town ) ; [a manservant]1384-a manservant opened ; [I]0-i asked for [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten ; [M. [I]0-i left [my]0-i card , and retraced [my]0-i steps . A WEEK is gone ; le jour des noces arrived ; the marriage was solemnized at [St. Jacques]56-st. jacques ; [Mdlle]152-mdlle . [Zoraide]153-zoraide became [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet , [née Reuter]154-madame pelet ; and , in about an hour after this transformation , “ [the happy pair]3208-the happy pair , ”[1387-newspapers] as [newspapers]1387-newspapers phrase it , were on [their]1385-family way to [Paris]70-paris ; where , according to previous arrangement , the honeymoon was to be spent . The next day [I]0-i quitted [the pensionnat]2420-the pensionnat . [Myself]0-i and [my]0-i chattels ( some books and clothes ) were soon transferred to [a modest lodging [I]0-i had hired in [a street not far off]1390-a street not far off]1389-a modest lodging i had hired in a street not far off . In half an hour [my]0-i clothes were arranged in a commode , [my]0-i books on a shelf , and the “ flitting ”[0-i] was effected . [I]0-i should not have been unhappy that day had not one pang tortured [me]0-i — a longing to go to [the Rue Notre Dame aux Neiges]1391-the rue notre dame aux neiges , resisted , yet irritated by an inward resolve to avoid [that street]1392-that street till such time as the mist of doubt should clear from [my]0-i prospects . It was a sweet September evening — very mild , very still ; [I]0-i had nothing to do ; at that hour [I]0-i knew [Frances]181-frances would be equally released from occupation ; [I]0-i thought [she]181-frances might possibly be wishing for [[her]181-frances master]3168-her master , [I]0-i knew [I]0-i wished for [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil . Imagination began with [her]181-frances low whispers , infusing into [my]0-i soul the soft tale of pleasures that might be . “ [You]0-i will find [her]181-frances reading or writing , ”[181-frances] said [she]181-frances ; “ [you]0-i can take [your]0-i seat at [her]181-frances side ; [you]0-i need not startle [her]181-frances peace by undue excitement ; [you]0-i need not embarrass [her]181-frances manner by unusual action or language . Be as [you]0-i always are ; look over what [she]181-frances has written ; listen while [she]181-frances reads ; chide [her]181-frances , or quietly approve ; [you]0-i know the effect of either system ; [you]0-i know [her]181-frances smile when pleased , [you]0-i know the play of [her]181-frances looks when roused ; [you]0-i have the secret of awakening what expression [you]0-i will , and [you]0-i can choose amongst that pleasant variety . With [you]0-i [she]181-frances will sit silent as long as it suits [you]0-i to talk alone ; [you]0-i can hold [her]181-frances under a potent spell : intelligent as [she]181-frances is , eloquent as [she]181-frances can be , [you]0-i can seal [her]181-frances lips , and veil [her]181-frances bright countenance with diffidence ; yet , [you]0-i know , [she]181-frances is not all monotonous mildness ; [you]0-i have seen , with a sort of strange pleasure , revolt , scorn , austerity , bitterness , lay energetic claim to a place in [her]181-frances feelings and physiognomy ; [you]0-i know that few could rule [her]181-frances as [you]0-i do ; [you]0-i know [she]181-frances might break , but never bend under the hand of Tyranny and Injustice , but Reason and Affection can guide [her]181-frances by a sign . Try [their]3209-their influence now . Go — they are not passions ; [you]0-i may handle them safely . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances will not go was [my]181-frances answer to [the sweet temptress]3210-the sweet temptress . [A man]353-a man is master of [himself]353-a man to a certain point , but not beyond it . Could [I]181-frances seek [Frances]181-frances to - night , could [I]181-frances sit with [her]181-frances alone in [a quiet room]3212-a quiet room , and address [her]181-frances only in the language of Reason and Affection ? ”[181-frances] “ No , ”[181-frances] was the brief , fervent reply of that Love which had conquered and now controlled [me]0-i . Time seemed to stagnate ; the sun would not go down ; [my]0-i watch ticked , but [I]0-i thought the hands were paralyzed . “ What a hot evening ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i cried , throwing open the lattice ; for , indeed , [I]0-i had seldom felt so feverish . Hearing a step ascending [the common stair]1395-the common stair , [I]0-i wondered whether [the “ locataire , ”]3213-the “ locataire , ”[1396-he] now mounting to [[his]1396-he apartments]1397-his apartments , were as unsettled in mind and condition as [I]0-i was , or whether [he]1396-he lived in the calm of certain resources , and in the freedom of unfettered feelings . What ! was [he]1396-he coming in person to solve the problem hardly proposed in inaudible thought ? [He]1396-he had actually knocked at the door — at [my]0-i door ; a smart , prompt rap ; and , almost before [I]0-i could invite [him]1396-he in , [he]1396-he was over the threshold , and had closed the door behind [him]1396-he . “ And how are [you]1396-he ? ”[1396-he] asked an indifferent , quiet voice , in the English language ; while [[my]0-i visitor]1398-my visitor , without any sort of bustle or introduction , put [his]1396-he hat on the table , and [his]1396-he gloves into [his]1396-he hat , and drawing the only armchair [the room]1922-the room afforded a little forward , seated [himself]1396-he tranquilly therein . “ Ca n’t [you]0-i speak ? ”[1396-he] [he]1396-he inquired in a few moments , in a tone whose nonchalance seemed to intimate that it was much the same thing whether [I]0-i answered or not . The fact is , [I]0-i found it desirable to have recourse to [[my]0-i good friends]1400-my good friends “ les besicles ; ”[1396-he] not exactly to ascertain the identity of [[my]0-i visitor]1398-my visitor — for [I]0-i already knew [him]1396-he , confound [his]1396-he impudence ! but to see how [he]1396-he looked — to get a clear notion of [his]1396-he mien and countenance . [I]0-i wiped the glasses very deliberately , and put them on quite as deliberately ; adjusting them so as not to hurt the bridge of [my]0-i nose or get entangled in [my]0-i short tufts of dun hair . [I]0-i was sitting in the window - seat , with [my]0-i back to the light , and [I]0-i had [him]1396-he vis - à - vis ; a position [he]1396-he would much rather have had reversed ; for , at any time , [he]1396-he preferred scrutinizing to being scrutinized . Yes , it was [he]1396-he , and no mistake , with [his]1396-he six feet of length arranged in a sitting attitude ; with [his]1396-he dark travelling surtout with its velvet collar , [his]1396-he gray pantaloons , [his]1396-he black stock , and [his]1396-he face , the most original one Nature ever modelled , yet the least obtrusively so ; not one feature that could be termed marked or odd , yet the effect of the whole unique . There is no use in attempting to describe what is indescribable . Being in no hurry to address [him]1396-he , [I]0-i sat and stared at [my]0-i ease . “ Oh , that ’s [your]0-i game — is it ? ”[1396-he] said [he]1396-he at last . “ Well , [we]3214-we ’ll see which is soonest tired . ”[1396-he] And [he]1396-he slowly drew out a fine cigar - case , picked one to [his]1396-he taste , lit it , took a book from the shelf convenient to [his]1396-he hand , then leaning back , proceeded to smoke and read as tranquilly as if [he]1396-he had been in [[his]1396-he own room]1402-his own room , in [Grove - street]2080-grove - street , [X—-shire]71-x—-shire , [England]11-england . [I]0-i knew [he]1396-he was capable of continuing in that attitude till midnight , if [he]1396-he conceived the whim , so [I]0-i rose , and taking the book from [his]1396-he hand , [I]0-i said , — “ [You]1396-he did not ask for it , and [you]1396-he shall not have it . ”[0-i] “ It is silly and dull , ”[1396-he] [he]1396-he observed , “ so [I]1396-he have not lost much ; ”[1396-he] then the spell being broken , [he]1396-he went on : “ [I]1396-he thought [you]0-i lived at [Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet ; [I]1396-he went [there]1998-there this afternoon expecting to be starved to death by sitting in [a boarding - school drawing - room]3216-a boarding - school drawing - room , and [they]3217-they told [me]1396-he [you]0-i were gone , had departed this morning ; [you]0-i had left [your]0-i address behind [you]0-i though , which [I]1396-he wondered at ; it was a more practical and sensible precaution than [I]1396-he should have imagined [you]0-i capable of . Why did [you]0-i leave ? ”[1396-he] “ Because [M. Pelet]146-m. pelet has just married [the lady whom [you]0-i and [Mr. Brown]133-mr. brown assigned to [me]1396-he as [[my]1396-he wife]749-my wife]3218-the lady whom you and mr. brown assigned to me as my wife . ”[1396-he] “ Oh , indeed ! ”[115-yorke] replied [Hunsden]115-yorke with a short laugh ; “ so [you]0-i ’ve lost both [[your]0-i wife]3220-your wife and [[your]0-i place]3221-your place ? ”[115-yorke] “ Precisely so . ”[115-yorke] [I]0-i saw [him]115-yorke give a quick , covert glance all round [[my]0-i room]2457-my room ; [he]115-yorke marked [its]2457-my room narrow limits , [its]2457-my room scanty furniture : in an instant [he]115-yorke had comprehended the state of matters — had absolved [me]0-i from the crime of prosperity . A curious effect this discovery wrought in [his]115-yorke strange mind ; [I]0-i am morally certain that if [he]115-yorke had found [me]0-i installed in [a handsome parlour , lounging on a soft couch , with [a pretty , wealthy wife]1406-a pretty , wealthy wife at [my]0-i side]1405-a handsome parlour , lounging on a soft couch , with a pretty , wealthy wife at my side , [he]115-yorke would have hated [me]0-i ; a brief , cold , haughty visit , would in such a case have been the extreme limit of [his]115-yorke civilities , and never would [he]115-yorke have come near [me]0-i more , so long as the tide of fortune bore [me]0-i smoothly on its surface ; but the painted furniture , the bare walls , the cheerless solitude of [[my]0-i room]2457-my room relaxed [his]115-yorke rigid pride , and [I]0-i know not what softening change had taken place both in [his]115-yorke voice and look ere [he]115-yorke spoke again . “ [You]115-yorke have got another place ? ”[115-yorke] “ No . ”[153-zoraide] “ [You]115-yorke are in the way of getting one ? ”[153-zoraide] “ No . ”[115-yorke] “ That is bad ; have [you]115-yorke applied to [Brown]133-mr. brown ? ”[153-zoraide] “ No , indeed . ”[153-zoraide] “ [You]115-yorke had better ; [he]133-mr. brown often has it in [his]133-mr. brown power to give useful information in such matters . ”[153-zoraide] “ [He]133-mr. brown served [me]153-zoraide once very well ; [I]153-zoraide have no claim on [him]133-mr. brown , and am not in the humour to bother [him]133-mr. brown again . ”[153-zoraide] “ Oh , if [you]115-yorke ’re bashful , and dread being intrusive , [you]115-yorke need only commission [me]153-zoraide . Yes , that ’s right , [lad]487-lad — make much of [me]153-zoraide — [I’m]153-zoraide a nonpareil : there ’s nothing like [me]153-zoraide in [the common herd]3226-the common herd . In the meantime , to put all humbug aside and talk sense for a few moments , [you]115-yorke would be greatly the better of a situation , and what is more , [you]115-yorke are [a fool]304-a fool if [you]115-yorke refuse to take one from any hand that offers it . ”[153-zoraide] “ Very well , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ; now [you]109-hunsden have settled that point , talk of something else . Well , [lad]487-lad , [I]0-i ’ll not bore [you]487-lad ; [I]0-i see how it is : [Zoraide]232-zoraide has jilted [you]487-lad — married [some one richer]3239-some one richer , as [any sensible woman]3240-any sensible woman would have done if [she]232-zoraide had had the chance . ”[0-i] [I]0-i made no reply — [I]0-i let [him]109-hunsden think so , not feeling inclined to enter into an explanation of the real state of things , and as little to forge a false account ; but it was not easy to blind [Hunsden]109-hunsden ; [my]0-i very silence , instead of convincing [him]109-hunsden that [he]109-hunsden had hit the truth , seemed to render [him]109-hunsden doubtful about it ; [he]109-hunsden went on : — “ [I]109-hunsden suppose the affair has been conducted as such affairs always are amongst [rational people]3241-rational people : [you]487-lad offered [her]232-zoraide [your]487-lad youth and [your]487-lad talents — such as they are — in exchange for [her]232-zoraide position and money : [I]109-hunsden do n’t suppose [you]487-lad took appearance , or what is called love , into the account — for [I]109-hunsden understand [she]232-zoraide is older than [you]487-lad , and [Brown]133-mr. brown says , rather sensible - looking than beautiful . And now [we]3243-we ’ll talk of something else . ”[109-hunsden] “ Do , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , very glad to dismiss the topic , and especially glad to have baffled the sagacity of [[my]0-i cross - questioner]1408-my cross - questioner — if , indeed , [I]0-i had baffled it ; for though [his]1408-my cross - questioner words now led away from the dangerous point , [his]1408-my cross - questioner eyes , keen and watchful , seemed still preoccupied with the former idea . “ [You]487-lad want to hear news from [X]7-x — — ? And what interest can [you]487-lad have in X — — ? [You]487-lad left [no friends there]3244-no friends there , for [you]487-lad made none . [Nobody]449-nobody ever asks after [you]487-lad — [neither man]3246-neither man nor [woman]3247-woman ; and if [I]1408-my cross - questioner mention [your]487-lad name in company , [the men]3248-the men look as if [I]1408-my cross - questioner had spoken of [Prester John]233-prester john ; and [the women]3249-the women sneer covertly . [Our]3250-our X — — [belles]3251-belles must have disliked [you]487-lad . How did [you]487-lad excite [their]3251-belles displeasure ? ”[1408-my cross - questioner] “ [I]1408-my cross - questioner do n’t know . [I]1408-my cross - questioner seldom spoke to [them]3251-belles — [they]3251-belles were nothing to [me]1408-my cross - questioner . [I]1408-my cross - questioner considered [them]3251-belles only as something to be glanced at from a distance ; [their]3251-belles dresses and faces were often pleasing enough to the eye : but [I]1408-my cross - questioner could not understand [their]3251-belles conversation , nor even read [their]3251-belles countenances . When [I]1408-my cross - questioner caught snatches of what [they]3251-belles said , [I]1408-my cross - questioner could never make much of it ; and the play of [their]3251-belles lips and eyes did not help [me]1408-my cross - questioner at all . ”[1408-my cross - questioner] “ That was [your]487-lad fault , not [theirs]3251-belles . There are sensible , as well as [handsome women in X]3252-handsome women in x — — ; [women]2360-women it is worth [any man]3254-any man ’s while to talk to , and with whom [I]109-hunsden can talk with pleasure : but [you]487-lad had and have no pleasant address ; there is nothing in [you]487-lad to induce [a woman]2098-a woman to be affable . [I]109-hunsden have remarked [you]487-lad sitting near the door in [a room full of company]3256-a room full of company , bent on hearing , not on speaking ; on observing , not on entertaining ; looking frigidly shy at the commencement of a party , confusingly vigilant about the middle , and insultingly weary towards the end . Is that the way , do [you]487-lad think , ever to communicate pleasure or excite interest ? No ; and if [you]487-lad are generally unpopular , it is because [you]487-lad deserve to be so . ”[109-hunsden] “ Content ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i ejaculated . “ No , [you]487-lad are not content ; [you]487-lad see beauty always turning its back on [you]487-lad ; [you]487-lad are mortified and then [you]487-lad sneer . [I]0-i verily believe all that is desirable on [earth]1118-earth — wealth , reputation , love — will for ever to [you]487-lad be the ripe grapes on the high trellis : [you]487-lad ’ll look up at them ; they will tantalize in [you]487-lad the lust of the eye ; but they are out of reach : [you]487-lad have not the address to fetch a ladder , and [you]487-lad ’ll go away calling [them]3258-them sour . ”[0-i] Cutting as these words might have been under some circumstances , they drew no blood now . [My]0-i life was changed ; [my]0-i experience had been varied since [I]0-i left [X]7-x — — , but [Hunsden]109-hunsden could not know this ; [he]109-hunsden had seen [me]0-i only in the character of [[Mr. Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ’s clerk]1409-mr. crimsworth ’s clerk — [a dependant amongst [wealthy strangers]1411-wealthy strangers]1410-a dependant amongst wealthy strangers , meeting disdain with a hard front , conscious of an unsocial and unattractive exterior , refusing to sue for notice which [I]0-i was sure would be withheld , declining to evince an admiration which [I]0-i knew would be scorned as worthless . [He]109-hunsden could not be aware that since then youth and loveliness had been to [me]0-i everyday objects ; that [I]0-i had studied them at leisure and closely , and had seen the plain texture of truth under the embroidery of appearance ; nor could [he]109-hunsden , keen - sighted as [he]109-hunsden was , penetrate into [my]0-i heart , search [my]0-i brain , and read [my]0-i peculiar sympathies and antipathies ; [he]109-hunsden had not known [me]0-i long enough , or well enough , to perceive how low [my]0-i feelings would ebb under some influences , powerful over most minds ; how high , how fast they would flow under other influences , that perhaps acted with the more intense force on [me]0-i , because they acted on [me]0-i alone . Neither could [he]109-hunsden suspect for an instant the history of [my]0-i communications with [Mdlle]223-mdlle . [Reuter]154-madame pelet ; secret to [him]109-hunsden and to all others was the tale of [her]154-madame pelet strange infatuation ; [her]154-madame pelet blandishments , [her]154-madame pelet wiles had been seen but by [me]0-i , and to [me]0-i only were [they]1412-they known ; but they had changed [me]0-i , for [they]1412-they had proved that [I]0-i could impress . A sweeter secret nestled deeper in [my]0-i heart ; one full of tenderness and as full of strength : it took the sting out of [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s sarcasm ; it kept [me]0-i unbent by shame , and unstirred by wrath . But of all this [I]0-i could say nothing — nothing decisive at least ; uncertainty sealed [my]0-i lips , and during the interval of silence by which alone [I]0-i replied to [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind to be for the present wholly misjudged by [him]109-hunsden , and misjudged [I]0-i was ; [he]109-hunsden thought [he]109-hunsden had been rather too hard upon [me]0-i , and that [I]0-i was crushed by the weight of [his]109-hunsden upbraidings ; so to re - assure [me]0-i [he]109-hunsden said , doubtless [I]0-i should mend some day ; [I]0-i was only at the beginning of life yet ; and since happily [I]0-i was not quite without sense , every false step [I]0-i made would be a good lesson . Just then [I]0-i turned [my]0-i face a little to the light ; the approach of twilight , and [my]0-i position in the window - seat , had , for the last ten minutes , prevented [him]109-hunsden from studying [my]0-i countenance ; as [I]0-i moved , however , [he]109-hunsden caught an expression which [he]109-hunsden thus interpreted : — “ Confound it ! How doggedly self - approving [the lad]616-the lad looks ! [I]109-hunsden thought [he]616-the lad was fit to die with shame , and there [he]616-the lad sits grinning smiles , as good as to say , ‘ Let [the world]1872-the world wag as it will , [I]109-hunsden ’ve the philosopher ’s stone in [my]109-hunsden waist - coat pocket , and the elixir of life in [my]109-hunsden cupboard ; [I]109-hunsden ’m independent of both Fate and Fortune . ’ ”[109-hunsden] “ [Hunsden]109-hunsden — [you]109-hunsden spoke of grapes ; [I]109-hunsden was thinking of a fruit [I]109-hunsden like better than [your]109-hunsden X — — hot - house grapes — an unique fruit , growing wild , which [I]109-hunsden have marked as [my]109-hunsden own , and hope one day to gather and taste . It is of no use [your]109-hunsden offering [me]109-hunsden the draught of bitterness , or threatening [me]109-hunsden with death by thirst : [I]109-hunsden have the anticipation of sweetness on [my]109-hunsden palate ; the hope of freshness on [my]109-hunsden lips ; [I]109-hunsden can reject the unsavoury , and endure the exhausting . ”[109-hunsden] “ For how long ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Till the next opportunity for effort ; and as the prize of success will be a treasure after [my]109-hunsden own heart , [I]109-hunsden ’ll bring a bull ’s strength to the struggle . ”[109-hunsden] “ Bad luck crushes bulls as easily as bullaces ; and , [I]109-hunsden believe , the fury dogs [you]109-hunsden : [you]109-hunsden were born with a wooden spoon in [your]109-hunsden mouth , depend on it . ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]109-hunsden believe [you]109-hunsden ; and [I]109-hunsden mean to make [my]109-hunsden wooden spoon do the work of [some people]3261-some people ’s silver ladles : grasped firmly , and handled nimbly , even a wooden spoon will shovel up broth . ”[109-hunsden] [Hunsden]109-hunsden rose : “ [I]109-hunsden see , ”[109-hunsden] said [he]109-hunsden ; “ [I]109-hunsden suppose [you]109-hunsden ’re one of those who develop best unwatched , and act best unaided — work [your]109-hunsden own way . Now , [I]109-hunsden ’ll go . ”[109-hunsden] And , without another word , [he]109-hunsden was going ; at the door [he]109-hunsden turned : — “ [Crimsworth Hall]6-crimsworth hall is sold , ”[109-hunsden] said [he]109-hunsden . “ Sold ! ”[109-hunsden] was [my]0-i echo . “ Yes ; [you]109-hunsden know , of course , that [[your]109-hunsden brother]3262-your brother failed three months ago ? ”[109-hunsden] “ What ! [Edward Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Precisely ; and [[his]99-mr. crimsworth wife]569-his wife went [home]1905-home to [[her]569-his wife father]2642-her father ’s ; when affairs went awry , [his]99-mr. crimsworth temper sympathized with [them]3266-them ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth used [her]569-his wife ill ; [I]109-hunsden told [you]109-hunsden [he]99-mr. crimsworth would be a tyrant to [her]569-his wife some day ; as to [him]99-mr. crimsworth — ”[109-hunsden] “ Ay , as to [him]99-mr. crimsworth — what is become of [him]99-mr. crimsworth ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Nothing extraordinary — don’t be alarmed ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth put [himself]99-mr. crimsworth under the protection of [the court]3267-the court , compounded with [[his]99-mr. crimsworth creditors]3268-his creditors — tenpence in the pound ; in six weeks set up again , coaxed back [[his]99-mr. crimsworth wife]569-his wife , and is flourishing like a green bay - tree . ”[109-hunsden] “ And [Crimsworth Hall]6-crimsworth hall — was the furniture sold too ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Everything — from the grand piano down to the rolling - pin . ”[109-hunsden] “ And the contents of [the oak dining - room]3270-the oak dining - room — were they sold ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Of course ; why should the sofas and chairs of [that room]2201-that room be held more sacred than those of any other ? ”[109-hunsden] “ And the pictures ? ”[109-hunsden] “ What pictures ? [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth had no special collection that [I]109-hunsden know of — [he]99-mr. crimsworth did not profess to be [an amateur]3272-an amateur . ”[109-hunsden] “ There were two portraits , one on each side the mantelpiece ; [you]109-hunsden can not have forgotten them , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ; [you]109-hunsden once noticed that of [the lady]361-the lady — ”[109-hunsden] “ Oh , [I]109-hunsden know ! [the thin - faced gentlewoman with a shawl put on like drapery.—Why]3274-the thin - faced gentlewoman with a shawl put on like drapery.—why , as a matter of course , it would be sold among the other things . If [you]109-hunsden had been rich , [you]109-hunsden might have bought it , for [I]109-hunsden remember [you]109-hunsden said it represented [[your]109-hunsden mother]2871-your mother : [you]109-hunsden see what it is to be without [a sou]3276-a sou . ”[109-hunsden] [I]0-i did . “ But surely , ”[0-i] [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , “ [I]0-i shall not always be so poverty - stricken ; [I]0-i may one day buy it back yet.—Who purchased it ? do [you]109-hunsden know ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked . “ How is it likely ? [I]1413-i never inquired who purchased anything ; there spoke [the unpractical man]3277-the unpractical man — to imagine all [the world]1872-the world is interested in what interests [himself]3277-the unpractical man ! Now , good night — [I’m]1413-i off for [Germany]43-germany to - morrow morning ; [I]1413-i shall be back here in six weeks , and possibly [I]1413-i may call and see [you]109-hunsden again ; [I]1413-i wonder whether [you]109-hunsden ’ll be still out of place ! ”[1413-i] [he]1413-i laughed , as mockingly , as heartlessly as [Mephistopheles]234-mephistopheles , and so laughing , vanished . [Some people]3261-some people , however indifferent [they]3261-some people may become after a considerable space of absence , always contrive to leave a pleasant impression just at parting ; not so [Hunsden]109-hunsden , a conference with [him]109-hunsden affected one like a draught of Peruvian bark ; it seemed a concentration of the specially harsh , stringent , bitter ; whether , like bark , it invigorated , [I]0-i scarcely knew . A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow ; [I]0-i slept little on the night after this interview ; towards morning [I]0-i began to doze , but hardly had [my]0-i slumber become sleep , when [I]0-i was roused from it by hearing a noise in [[my]0-i sitting room]1415-my sitting room , to which [[my]0-i bed - room]368-my bed - room adjoined — a step , and a shoving of furniture ; the movement lasted barely two minutes ; with the closing of the door it ceased . [I]0-i listened ; not a mouse stirred ; perhaps [I]0-i had dreamt it ; perhaps [a locataire]1417-a locataire had made a mistake , and entered [[my]0-i apartment]2295-my apartment instead of [his]1417-a locataire own . It was yet but five o’clock ; neither [I]0-i nor the day were wide awake ; [I]0-i turned , and was soon unconscious . When [I]0-i did rise , about two hours later , [I]0-i had forgotten the circumstance ; the first thing [I]0-i saw , however , on quitting [[my]0-i chamber]369-my chamber , recalled it ; just pushed in at the door of [[my]0-i sitting - room]2076-my sitting - room , and still standing on end , was a wooden packing - case — a rough deal affair , wide but shallow ; [a porter]1421-a porter had doubtless shoved it forward , but seeing [no occupant of]1422-no occupant of [the room]1922-the room , had left it at the entrance . “ That is none of [mine]0-i , ”[0-i] thought [I]0-i , approaching ; “ it must be meant for [somebody else]3279-somebody else . ”[0-i] [I]0-i stooped to examine the address : — “ Wm . [Crimsworth]96-edward , Esq . , No — , — St. , Brussels . ”[0-i] [I]0-i was puzzled , but concluding that the best way to obtain information was to ask within , [I]0-i cut the cords and opened the case . Green baize enveloped its contents , sewn carefully at the sides ; [I]0-i ripped the pack - thread with [my]0-i pen - knife , and still , as the seam gave way , glimpses of gilding appeared through the widening interstices . Boards and baize being at length removed , [I]0-i lifted from the case a large picture , in a magnificent frame ; leaning it against a chair , in a position where the light from the window fell favourably upon it , [I]0-i stepped back — already [I]0-i had mounted [my]0-i spectacles . [A portrait - painter]1424-a portrait - painter ’s sky ( the most sombre and threatening of welkins ) , and distant trees of a conventional depth of hue , raised in full relief a pale , pensive - looking female face , shadowed with soft dark hair , almost blending with the equally dark clouds ; large , solemn eyes looked reflectively into [mine]0-i ; a thin cheek rested on a delicate little hand ; a shawl , artistically draped , half hid , half showed a slight figure . [A listener]1425-a listener ( had there been one ) might have heard [me]0-i , after ten minutes ’ silent gazing , utter the word “ [Mother]235-mother ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i might have said more — but with [me]0-i , the first word uttered aloud in soliloquy rouses consciousness ; it reminds [me]0-i that only [crazy people]1426-crazy people talk to [themselves]1426-crazy people , and then [I]0-i think out [my]0-i monologue , instead of speaking it . [I]0-i had thought a long while , and a long while had contemplated the intelligence , the sweetness , and — alas ! the sadness also of those fine , grey eyes , the mental power of that forehead , and the rare sensibility of that serious mouth , when [my]0-i glance , travelling downwards , fell on a narrow billet , stuck in the corner of the picture , between the frame and the canvas . Then [I]0-i first asked , “ Who sent this picture ? Who thought of [me]0-i , saved it out of [the wreck of [Crimsworth Hall]6-crimsworth hall]3280-the wreck of crimsworth hall , and now commits [it]3281-it to the care of [[its]3281-it natural keeper]3282-its natural keeper ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i took the note from its niche ; thus it spoke : — “ There is a sort of stupid pleasure in giving [a child]2855-a child sweets , [a fool]304-a fool [his]2855-a child bells , a dog a bone . [You]3285-you are repaid by seeing [the child]3286-the child besmear [his]3286-the child face with sugar ; by witnessing how [the fool]1221-the fool ’s ecstasy makes a greater fool of [him]3286-the child than ever ; by watching the dog ’s nature come out over [his]3286-the child bone . In giving [William Crimsworth]103-william [[his]2855-a child mother]409-his mother ’s picture , [I]0-i give [him]2855-a child sweets , bells , and bone all in one ; what grieves [me]0-i is , that [I]0-i can not behold the result ; [I]0-i would have added five shillings more to [my]0-i bid if [the auctioneer]3289-the auctioneer could only have promised [me]0-i that pleasure . “[0-i] H. Y. H. “ P.S.—You said last night [you]0-i positively declined adding another item to [your]0-i account with [me]0-i ; do n’t [you]0-i think [I]0-i ’ve saved [you]0-i that trouble ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i muffled the picture in its green baize covering , restored it to the case , and having transported the whole concern to [[my]0-i bed - room]368-my bed - room , put it out of sight under [my]0-i bed . [My]0-i pleasure was now poisoned by pungent pain ; [I]0-i determined to look no more till [I]0-i could look at [my]0-i ease . If [Hunsden]109-hunsden had come in at that moment , [I]0-i should have said to [him]109-hunsden , “ [I]0-i owe [you]109-hunsden nothing , [Hunsden]109-hunsden — not a fraction of a farthing : [you]109-hunsden have paid [yourself]109-hunsden in taunts ! ”[0-i] Too anxious to remain any longer quiescent , [I]0-i had no sooner breakfasted , than [I]0-i repaired once more to [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten ’s , scarcely hoping to find [him]109-hunsden at [home]1905-home ; for a week had barely elapsed since [my]0-i first call : but fancying [I]0-i might be able to glean information as to the time when [his]109-hunsden return was expected . A better result awaited [me]0-i than [I]0-i had anticipated , for though [the family]1429-the family were yet at [Ostend]22-ostend , [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten had come over to [Brussels]18-brussels on business for the day . [He]228-m. vandenhuten received [me]0-i with the quiet kindness of [a sincere though not excitable man]1430-a sincere though not excitable man . [I]0-i had not sat five minutes alone with [him]228-m. vandenhuten in [[his]228-m. vandenhuten bureau]1431-his bureau , before [I]0-i became aware of a sense of ease in [his]228-m. vandenhuten presence , such as [I]0-i rarely experienced with [strangers]2964-strangers . [I]0-i was surprised at [my]0-i own composure , for , after all , [I]0-i had come on business to [me]0-i exceedingly painful — that of soliciting a favour . [I]0-i asked on what basis the calm rested — [I]0-i feared it might be deceptive . Ere long [I]0-i caught a glimpse of the ground , and at once [I]0-i felt assured of its solidity ; [I]0-i knew where it was . [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten was rich , respected , and influential ; [I]0-i , poor , despised and powerless ; so [we]1433-our stood to [the world]1872-the world at large as [members of [the world ’s society]1436-the world ’s society]1435-members of the world ’s society ; but to [each other]283-each other , as [a pair of human beings]1438-a pair of human beings , [our]1433-our positions were reversed . [The Dutchman]236-the dutchman ( [he]236-the dutchman was not [Flamand]157-flamand , but [pure Hollandais]237-pure hollandais ) was slow , cool , of rather dense intelligence , though sound and accurate judgment ; [the Englishman]238-the englishman far more nervous , active , quicker both to plan and to practise , to conceive and to realize . [The Dutchman]236-the dutchman was benevolent , [the Englishman]3106-the englishman susceptible ; in short [[our]1433-our characters]1440-our characters dovetailed , but [my]0-i mind having more fire and action than [his]236-the dutchman , instinctively assumed and kept the predominance . This point settled , and [my]0-i position well ascertained , [I]0-i addressed [him]236-the dutchman on the subject of [my]0-i affairs with that genuine frankness which full confidence can alone inspire . It was a pleasure to [him]236-the dutchman to be so appealed to ; [he]236-the dutchman thanked [me]0-i for giving [him]236-the dutchman this opportunity of using a little exertion in [my]0-i behalf . [I]0-i went on to explain to [him]236-the dutchman that [my]0-i wish was not so much to be helped , as to be put into the way of helping [myself]0-i ; of [him]236-the dutchman [I]0-i did not want exertion — that was to be [my]0-i part — but only information and recommendation . Soon after [I]0-i rose to go . [He]236-the dutchman held out [his]236-the dutchman hand at parting — an action of greater significance with [foreigners]1441-foreigners than with [Englishmen]1442-englishmen . As [I]0-i exchanged a smile with [him]236-the dutchman , [I]0-i thought the benevolence of [his]236-the dutchman truthful face was better than the intelligence of [my]0-i own . Characters of [my]0-i order experience a balm - like solace in the contact of such souls as animated the honest breast of [Victor Vandenhuten]239-victor . The next fortnight was a period of many alternations ; [my]0-i existence during its lapse resembled a sky of one of those autumnal nights which are specially haunted by meteors and falling stars . Hopes and fears , expectations and disappointments , descended in glancing showers from zenith to horizon ; but all were transient , and darkness followed swift each vanishing apparition . [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten aided [me]0-i faithfully ; [he]236-the dutchman set [me]0-i on the track of several places , and [himself]236-the dutchman made efforts to secure them for [me]0-i ; but for a long time solicitation and recommendation were vain — the door either shut in [my]0-i face when [I]0-i was about to walk in , or [another candidate , entering before [me]0-i]1443-another candidate , entering before me , rendered [my]0-i further advance useless . Feverish and roused , no disappointment arrested [me]0-i ; defeat following fast on defeat served as stimulants to will . [I]0-i forgot fastidiousness , conquered reserve , thrust pride from [me]0-i : [I]0-i asked , [I]0-i persevered , [I]0-i remonstrated , [I]0-i dunned . It is so that [openings]1444-openings are forced into the guarded circle where [Fortune]131-fortune sits dealing favours round . [My]0-i perseverance made [me]0-i known ; [my]0-i importunity made [me]0-i remarked . [I]0-i was inquired about ; [[[my]0-i former pupils]1445-my former pupils ’ parents]1446-my former pupils ’ parents , gathering the reports of [[their]1446-my former pupils ’ parents children]2862-their children , heard [me]0-i spoken of as talented , and [they]1446-my former pupils ’ parents echoed the word : the sound , bandied about at random , came at last to ears which , but for its universality , it might never have reached ; and at the very crisis when [I]0-i had tried [my]0-i last effort and knew not what to do , [Fortune]131-fortune looked in at [me]0-i one morning , as [I]0-i sat in drear and almost desperate deliberation on [[my]0-i bedstead]1448-my bedstead , nodded with the familiarity of [an old acquaintance]1449-an old acquaintance — though [God]119-god knows [I]0-i had never met [her]1449-an old acquaintance before — and threw a prize into [my]0-i lap . In the second week of October , 18 — , [I]0-i got the appointment of English professor to all the classes of — — College , [Brussels]18-brussels , with a salary of three thousand francs per annum ; and the certainty of being able , by dint of the reputation and publicity accompanying the position , to make as much more by private means . The official notice , which communicated this information , mentioned also that it was the strong recommendation of [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten , negociant , which had turned the scale of choice in [my]0-i favour . No sooner had [I]0-i read the announcement than [I]0-i hurried to [[M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten ’s bureau]1450-m. vandenhuten ’s bureau , pushed the document under [his]228-m. vandenhuten nose , and when [he]228-m. vandenhuten had perused it , took both [his]228-m. vandenhuten hands , and thanked [him]228-m. vandenhuten with unrestrained vivacity . [My]0-i vivid words and emphatic gesture moved [his]228-m. vandenhuten Dutch calm to unwonted sensation . [He]228-m. vandenhuten said [he]228-m. vandenhuten was happy — glad to have served [me]0-i ; but [he]228-m. vandenhuten had done nothing meriting such thanks . [He]228-m. vandenhuten had not laid out a centime — only scratched a few words on a sheet of paper . Again [I]0-i repeated to [him]228-m. vandenhuten — “ [You]228-m. vandenhuten have made [me]0-i quite happy , and in a way that suits [me]0-i ; [I]0-i do not feel an obligation irksome , conferred by [your]228-m. vandenhuten kind hand ; [I]0-i do not feel disposed to shun [you]228-m. vandenhuten because [you]228-m. vandenhuten have done [me]0-i a favour ; from this day [you]228-m. vandenhuten must consent to admit [me]0-i to [your]228-m. vandenhuten intimate acquaintance , for [I]0-i shall hereafter recur again and again to the pleasure of [[your]228-m. vandenhuten society]3290-your society . ”[0-i] “ Ainsi soit - il , ”[228-m. vandenhuten] was the reply , accompanied by a smile of benignant content . [I]0-i went away with its sunshine in [my]0-i heart . IT was two o’clock when [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i lodgings]2067-my lodgings ; [my]0-i dinner , just brought in from [a neighbouring hotel]1452-a neighbouring hotel , smoked on the table ; [I]0-i sat down thinking to eat — had the plate been heaped with potsherds and broken glass , instead of boiled beef and haricots , [I]0-i could not have made a more signal failure : appetite had forsaken [me]0-i . Impatient of seeing food which [I]0-i could not taste , [I]0-i put it all aside into a cupboard , and then demanded , “ What shall [I]0-i do till evening ? ”[0-i] for before six P.M. it would be vain to seek [the Rue Notre Dame aux Neiges]73-the rue notre dame aux neiges ; [its inhabitant]1453-its inhabitant ( for [me]0-i it had but one ) was detained by [her]1453-its inhabitant vocation elsewhere . [I]0-i walked in [the streets of [Brussels]18-brussels]1454-the streets of brussels , and [I]0-i walked in [[my]0-i own room]2411-my own room from two o’clock till six ; never once in that space of time did [I]0-i sit down . [I]0-i was in [[my]0-i chamber]369-my chamber when the last - named hour struck ; [I]0-i had just bathed [my]0-i face and feverish hands , and was standing near the glass ; [my]0-i cheek was crimson , [my]0-i eye was flame , still all [my]0-i features looked quite settled and calm . Descending swiftly the stair and stepping out , [I]0-i was glad to see Twilight drawing on in clouds ; such shade was to [me]0-i like a grateful screen , and the chill of latter Autumn , breathing in a fitful wind from [the north - west]1457-the north - west , met [me]0-i as a refreshing coolness . Still [I]0-i saw it was cold to [others]2056-others , for [the women [I]0-i passed]1459-the women i passed were wrapped in shawls , and [the men]3248-the men had [their]3248-the men coats buttoned close . When are [we]1461-we quite happy ? Was [I]0-i so then ? No ; an urgent and growing dread worried [my]0-i nerves , and had worried [them]1462-them since the first moment good tidings had reached [me]0-i . How was [Frances]181-frances ? It was ten weeks since [I]0-i had seen [her]181-frances , six since [I]0-i had heard from [her]181-frances , or of [her]181-frances . [I]0-i had answered [her]181-frances letter by a brief note , friendly but calm , in which no mention of continued correspondence or further visits was made . At that hour [my]0-i bark hung on the topmost curl of a wave of fate , and [I]0-i knew not on what shoal the onward rush of the billow might hurl it ; [I]0-i would not then attach [her]181-frances destiny to mine by the slightest thread ; if doomed to split on the rock , or run aground on [the sand - bank]1463-the sand - bank , [I]0-i was resolved no other vessel should share [my]0-i disaster : but six weeks was a long time ; and could it be that [she]181-frances was still well and doing well ? Were [not all sages]1464-not all sages agreed in declaring that happiness finds no climax on [earth]1118-earth ? Dared [I]0-i think that but [half a street]1466-half a street now divided [me]0-i from the full cup of contentment — the draught drawn from waters said to flow only in heaven ? [I]0-i was at the door ; [I]0-i entered [the quiet house]1467-the quiet house ; [I]0-i mounted the stairs ; [the lobby]1468-the lobby was void and still , all the doors closed ; [I]0-i looked for the neat green mat ; it lay duly in its place . “ Signal of hope ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , and advanced . “ But [I]0-i will be a little calmer ; [I]0-i am not going to rush in , and get up a scene directly . ”[0-i] Forcibly staying [my]0-i eager step , [I]0-i paused on the mat . “ What an absolute hush ! Is [she]3291-she in ? Is [anybody in]3292-anybody in ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i demanded to [myself]0-i . A little tinkle , as of cinders falling from a grate , replied ; a movement — a fire was gently stirred ; and the slight rustle of life continuing , a step paced equably backwards and forwards , backwards and forwards , in [the apartment]2410-the apartment . Fascinated , [I]0-i stood , more fixedly fascinated when a voice rewarded the attention of [my]0-i strained ear — so low , so self - addressed , [I]0-i never fancied [the speaker]2085-the speaker otherwise than alone ; solitude might speak thus in [a desert]498-a desert , or in [the hall of [a forsaken house]1473-a forsaken house]1472-the hall of a forsaken house . The old Scotch ballad was partly recited , then dropt ; a pause ensued ; then another strain followed , in French , of which the purport , translated , ran as follows : — Something stirred in [an adjoining chamber]1474-an adjoining chamber ; it would not do to be surprised eaves - dropping ; [I]0-i tapped hastily , and as hastily entered . [Frances]181-frances was just before [me]0-i ; [she]181-frances had been walking slowly in [[her]181-frances room]1146-her room , and [her]181-frances step was checked by [my]0-i advent : [Twilight]240-twilight only was with [her]181-frances , and tranquil , ruddy Firelight ; to [these sisters]1476-these sisters , the Bright and the Dark , [she]181-frances had been speaking , ere [I]0-i entered , in poetry . [Sir Walter Scott]241-sir walter scott ’s voice , to [her]181-frances a foreign , far - off sound , a mountain echo , had uttered itself in the first stanzas ; the second , [I]0-i thought , from the style and the substance , was the language of [her]181-frances own heart . [Her]181-frances face was grave , its expression concentrated ; [she]181-frances bent on [me]0-i an unsmiling eye — an eye just returning from abstraction , just awaking from dreams : well - arranged was [her]181-frances simple attire , smooth [her]181-frances dark hair , orderly [[her]181-frances tranquil room]1477-her tranquil room ; but what — with [her]181-frances thoughtful look , [her]181-frances serious self - reliance , [her]181-frances bent to meditation and haply inspiration — what had [she]181-frances to do with love ? “ Nothing , ”[181-frances] was the answer of [her]181-frances own sad , though gentle countenance ; it seemed to say , “ [I]181-frances must cultivate fortitude and cling to poetry ; one is to be [my]181-frances support and the other [my]181-frances solace through life . Human affections do not bloom , nor do human passions glow for [me]181-frances . ”[181-frances] [Other women]1478-other women have such thoughts . [Frances]181-frances , had [she]181-frances been as desolate as [she]181-frances deemed , would not have been worse off than thousands of [her]181-frances sex . Look at the rigid and formal race of [old maids]1479-old maids — the race whom all despise ; [they]1479-old maids have fed [themselves]1479-old maids , from youth upwards , on maxims of resignation and endurance . Many of [them]1479-old maids get ossified with the dry diet ; self - control is so continually [their]1479-old maids thought , so perpetually [their]1479-old maids object , that at last it absorbs the softer and more agreeable qualities of [their]1479-old maids nature ; and [they]1479-old maids die [mere models of austerity , fashioned out of a little parchment and much bone]1480-mere models of austerity , fashioned out of a little parchment and much bone . [Anatomists]1481-anatomists will tell [you]1482-you that there is a heart in [the withered old maid]1483-the withered old maid ’s carcass — the same as in that of [any cherished wife or proud mother in [the land]1485-the land]1484-any cherished wife or proud mother in the land . Can this be so ? [I]0-i really do n’t know ; but feel inclined to doubt it . [I]0-i came forward , bade [Frances]181-frances “ good evening , ”[0-i] and took [my]0-i seat . The chair [I]0-i had chosen was one [she]181-frances had probably just left ; it stood by a little table where were [her]181-frances open desk and papers . [I]0-i know not whether [she]181-frances had fully recognized [me]0-i at first , but [she]181-frances did so now ; and in a voice , soft but quiet , [she]181-frances returned [my]0-i greeting . [I]0-i had shown no eagerness ; [she]181-frances took [her]181-frances cue from [me]0-i , and evinced no surprise . [We]1486-we met as [we]1486-we had always met , as [master and pupil]1487-master and pupil — nothing more . [I]0-i proceeded to handle the papers ; [Frances]181-frances , observant and serviceable , stepped into [an inner room]1170-an inner room , brought a candle , lit it , placed it by [me]0-i ; then drew the curtain over the lattice , and having added a little fresh fuel to the already bright fire , [she]181-frances drew a second chair to the table and sat down at [my]0-i right hand , a little removed . The paper on the top was a translation of some grave French author into English , but underneath lay a sheet with stanzas ; on this [I]0-i laid hands . [Frances]181-frances half rose , made a movement to recover the captured spoil , saying , that was nothing — a mere copy of verses . [I]0-i put by resistance with the decision [I]0-i knew [she]181-frances never long opposed ; but on this occasion [her]181-frances fingers had fastened on the paper . [I]0-i had quietly to unloose them ; [their]1489-their hold dissolved to [my]0-i touch ; [her]181-frances hand shrunk away ; [my]0-i own would fain have followed it , but for the present [I]0-i forbade such impulse . The first page of the sheet was occupied with the lines [I]0-i had overheard ; the sequel was not exactly [the writer]977-the writer ’s own experience , but a composition by portions of that experience suggested . Thus while egotism was avoided , the fancy was exercised , and the heart satisfied . [I]0-i translate as before , and [my]0-i translation is nearly literal ; it continued thus : — [I]0-i read — then dreamily made marks on the margin with [my]0-i pencil ; thinking all the while of other things ; thinking that “ [Jane]209-brown ”[0-i] was now at [my]0-i side ; [no child]1491-no child , but [a girl of nineteen]1492-a girl of nineteen ; and [she]1492-a girl of nineteen might be [mine]0-i , so [my]0-i heart affirmed ; [Poverty]242-poverty ’s curse was taken off [me]0-i ; Envy and Jealousy were far away , and unapprized of this [our]1493-our quiet meeting ; the frost of [the Master]2012-the master ’s manner might melt ; [I]0-i felt the thaw coming fast , whether [I]0-i would or not ; no further need for the eye to practise a hard look , for the brow to compress its expanse into a stern fold : it was now permitted to suffer the outward revelation of the inward glow — to seek , demand , elicit an answering ardour . While musing thus , [I]0-i thought that the grass on [Hermon]74-hermon never drank the fresh dews of sunset more gratefully than [my]0-i feelings drank the bliss of this hour . [Frances]181-frances rose , as if restless ; [she]181-frances passed before [me]0-i to stir the fire , which did not want stirring ; [she]181-frances lifted and put down the little ornaments on the mantelpiece ; [her]181-frances dress waved within a yard of [me]0-i ; slight , straight , and elegant , [she]181-frances stood erect on the hearth . There are impulses [we]1493-our can control ; but there are others which control [us]1493-our , because [they]1495-they attain [us]1493-our with a tiger - leap , and are [[our]1493-our masters]282-our masters ere [we]1493-our have seen [them]1495-they . Perhaps , though , such impulses are seldom altogether bad ; perhaps Reason , by a process as brief as quiet , a process that is finished ere felt , has ascertained the sanity of the deed . Instinct meditates , and feels justified in remaining passive while it is performed . [I]0-i know [I]0-i did not reason , [I]0-i did not plan or intend , yet , whereas one moment [I]0-i was sitting solus on the chair near the table , the next , [I]0-i held [Frances]181-frances on [my]0-i knee , placed there with sharpness and decision , and retained with exceeding tenacity . “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur ! ”[181-frances] cried [Frances]181-frances , and was still : not another word escaped [her]181-frances lips ; sorely confounded [she]181-frances seemed during the lapse of the first few moments ; but the amazement soon subsided ; terror did not succeed , nor fury : after all , [she]181-frances was only a little nearer than [she]181-frances had ever been before , to one [she]181-frances habitually respected and trusted ; embarrassment might have impelled [her]181-frances to contend , but self - respect checked resistance where resistance was useless . “ [Frances]181-frances , how much regard have [you]181-frances for [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] was [my]0-i demand . No answer ; the situation was yet too new and surprising to permit speech . On this consideration , [I]0-i compelled [myself]0-i for some seconds to tolerate [her]181-frances silence , though impatient of it : presently , [I]0-i repeated the same question — probably , not in the calmest of tones ; [she]181-frances looked at [me]0-i ; [my]0-i face , doubtless , was no model of composure , [my]0-i eyes no still wells of tranquillity . “ Do speak , ”[0-i] [I]0-i urged ; and a very low , hurried , yet still arch voice said — “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , vous [me]0-i faites mal ; de grace lachez un peu ma main droite . ”[0-i] In truth [I]0-i became aware that [I]0-i was holding the said “ main droite ”[0-i] in a somewhat ruthless grasp : [I]0-i did as desired ; and , for the third time , asked more gently — “ [Frances]181-frances , how much regard have [you]181-frances for [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] “ [Mon maitre]1134-mon maitre , j’en ai beaucoup , ”[0-i] was the truthful rejoinder . “ [Frances]181-frances , have [you]181-frances enough to give [yourself]181-frances to [me]0-i as [my]0-i wife?—to accept [me]0-i as [[your]181-frances husband]3296-your husband ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i felt the agitation of the heart , [I]0-i saw “ the purple light of love ”[0-i] cast its glowing reflection on cheeks , temples , neck ; [I]0-i desired to consult the eye , but sheltering lash and lid forbade . “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[0-i] said the soft voice at last,—“Monsieur desire savoir si je consens — si — enfin , si je veux [me]0-i marier avec lui ? ”[0-i] “ Justement . ”[0-i] “ Monsieur sera - t - il aussi bon mari qu’il a ete bon maitre ? ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i will try , [Frances]181-frances . ”[0-i] A pause ; then with a new , yet still subdued inflexion of the voice — an inflexion which provoked while it pleased [me]0-i — accompanied , too , by a “ sourire a la fois fin et timide ”[0-i] in perfect harmony with the tone : — “ C’est a dire , monsieur sera toujours un peu entete exigeant , volontaire — ? ”[0-i] “ Have [I]0-i been so , [Frances]181-frances ? ”[0-i] “ Mais oui ; vous le savez bien . ”[0-i] “ Have [I]0-i been nothing else ? ”[0-i] “ Mais oui ; vous avez ete mon meilleur ami . ”[0-i] “ And what , [Frances]181-frances , are [you]181-frances to [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] “ Votre devouee eleve , qui vous aime de tout son coeur . ”[0-i] “ Will [[my]0-i pupil]1015-my pupil consent to pass [her]1015-my pupil life with [me]0-i ? Speak English now , [Frances]181-frances . ”[0-i] Some moments were taken for reflection ; the answer , pronounced slowly , ran thus : — “ [You]181-frances have always made [me]1497-i happy ; [I]1497-i like to hear [you]181-frances speak ; [I]1497-i like to see [you]181-frances ; [I]1497-i like to be near [you]181-frances ; [I]1497-i believe [you]181-frances are very good , and very superior ; [I]1497-i know [you]181-frances are stern to [those who are careless and idle]3299-those who are careless and idle , but [you]181-frances are kind , very kind to the attentive and industrious , even if [they]3299-those who are careless and idle are not clever . [Master]1013-master , [I]1497-i should be glad to live with [you]181-frances always ; ”[1497-i] and [she]1497-i made a sort of movement , as if [she]1497-i would have clung to [me]0-i , but restraining [herself]1497-i [she]1497-i only added with earnest emphasis—“Master , [I]1497-i consent to pass [my]1497-i life with [you]181-frances . ”[1497-i] “ Very well , [Frances]181-frances . ”[0-i] [I]0-i drew [her]1497-i a little nearer to [my]0-i heart ; [I]0-i took a first kiss from [her]1497-i lips , thereby sealing the compact , now framed between [us]1498-us ; afterwards [she]1497-i and [I]0-i were silent , nor was [our]1498-us silence brief . [Frances]181-frances ’ thoughts , during this interval , [I]0-i know not , nor did [I]0-i attempt to guess them ; [I]0-i was not occupied in searching [her]1497-i countenance , nor in otherwise troubling [her]1497-i composure . The peace [I]0-i felt , [I]0-i wished [her]1497-i to feel ; [my]0-i arm , it is true , still detained [her]1497-i ; but with a restraint that was gentle enough , so long as no opposition tightened it . [My]0-i gaze was on the red fire ; [my]0-i heart was measuring its own content ; it sounded and sounded , and found the depth fathomless . “ [Monsieur]3301-monsieur , ”[1499-my quiet companion] at last said [[my]0-i quiet companion]1499-my quiet companion , as stirless in [her]1499-my quiet companion happiness as a mouse in its terror . Even now in speaking [she]1499-my quiet companion scarcely lifted [her]1499-my quiet companion head . “ Well , [Frances]181-frances ? ”[1499-my quiet companion] [I]0-i like unexaggerated intercourse ; it is not [my]0-i way to overpower with amorous epithets , any more than to worry with selfishly importunate caresses . “ Monsieur est raisonnable , n’est - ce pas ? ”[1499-my quiet companion] “ Yes ; especially when [I]181-frances am requested to be so in English : but why do [you]181-frances ask [me]181-frances ? [You]181-frances see nothing vehement or obtrusive in [my]181-frances manner ; am [I]181-frances not tranquil enough ? ”[181-frances] “ Ce n’est pas cela — ”[181-frances] began [Frances]181-frances . “ English ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i reminded [her]181-frances . “ Well , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]0-i wished merely to say , that [I]0-i should like , of course , to retain [my]0-i employment of teaching . [You]638-monsieur will teach still , [I]0-i suppose , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[0-i] “ Oh , yes ! It is all [I]181-frances have to depend on . ”[181-frances] “ Bon!—I mean good . Thus [we]3304-we shall have both the same profession . [I]181-frances like that ; and [my]181-frances efforts to get on will be as unrestrained as [yours]638-monsieur — will [they]3305-they not , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[181-frances] “ [You]638-monsieur are laying plans to be independent of [me]0-i , ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i “ Yes , [monsieur]638-monsieur ; [I]181-frances must be no incumbrance to [you]638-monsieur — no burden in any way . ”[181-frances] “ But , [Frances]181-frances , [I]181-frances have not yet told [you]181-frances what [my]181-frances prospects are . [I]181-frances have left [M. Pelet ’s]146-m. pelet ; and after nearly a month ’s seeking , [I]181-frances have got another place , with a salary of three thousand francs a year , which [I]181-frances can easily double by a little additional exertion . Thus [you]181-frances see it would be useless for [you]181-frances to fag [yourself]181-frances by going out to give lessons ; on six thousand francs [you]181-frances and [I]181-frances can live , and live well . ”[181-frances] [Frances]181-frances seemed to consider . There is something flattering to [man]457-man ’s strength , something consonant to [his]457-man honourable pride , in the idea of becoming the providence of what [he]457-man loves — feeding and clothing it , as [God]119-god does the lilies of [the field]436-the field . So , to decide [her]181-frances resolution , [I]0-i went on : — “ Life has been painful and laborious enough to [you]181-frances so far , [Frances]181-frances ; [you]181-frances require complete rest ; [your]181-frances twelve hundred francs would not form a very important addition to [our]3308-our income , and what sacrifice of comfort to earn it ! Relinquish [your]181-frances labours : [you]181-frances must be weary , and let [me]0-i have the happiness of giving [you]181-frances rest . ”[0-i] [I]0-i am not sure whether [Frances]181-frances had accorded due attention to [my]0-i harangue ; instead of answering [me]0-i with [her]181-frances usual respectful promptitude , [she]181-frances only sighed and said , — “ How rich [you]0-i are , [monsieur]638-monsieur ! ”[181-frances] and then [she]181-frances stirred uneasy in [my]0-i arms . “ Three thousand francs ! ”[181-frances] [she]181-frances murmured , “ While [I]181-frances get only twelve hundred ! ”[181-frances] [She]181-frances went on faster . “ However , it must be so for the present ; and , [monsieur]638-monsieur , were [you]638-monsieur not saying something about [my]181-frances giving up [[my]181-frances place]3311-my place ? Oh no ! [I]181-frances shall hold it fast ; ”[181-frances] and [her]181-frances little fingers emphatically tightened on [mine]0-i . “ Think of [my]181-frances marrying [you]638-monsieur to be kept by [you]638-monsieur , [monsieur]638-monsieur ! [I]181-frances could not do it ; and how dull [my]181-frances days would be ! [You]638-monsieur would be away teaching in [close , noisy school - rooms]3313-close , noisy school - rooms , from morning till evening , and [I]181-frances should be lingering at [home]1905-home , unemployed and solitary ; [I]181-frances should get depressed and sullen , and [you]638-monsieur would soon tire of [me]181-frances . ”[181-frances] “ [Frances]181-frances , [you]181-frances could read and study — two things [you]181-frances like so well . ”[181-frances] “ [Monsieur]3315-monsieur , [I]1503-i could not ; [I]1503-i like a contemplative life , but [I]1503-i like an active life better ; [I]1503-i must act in some way , and act with [you]638-monsieur . [I]1503-i have taken notice , [monsieur]638-monsieur , that [people who are only in each other]3317-people who are only in each other ’s company for amusement , never really like [each other]283-each other so well , or esteem [each other]283-each other so highly , as [those who work together , and perhaps suffer together]3320-those who work together , and perhaps suffer together . ”[1503-i] “ [You]181-frances speak [God]119-god ’s truth , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i at last , “ and [you]181-frances shall have [your]181-frances own way , for it is the best way . Now , as a reward for such ready consent , give [me]0-i a voluntary kiss . ”[0-i] After some hesitation , natural to [a novice in the art of kissing]1502-a novice in the art of kissing , [she]1503-i brought [her]1503-i lips into very shy and gentle contact with [my]0-i forehead ; [I]0-i took the small gift as a loan , and repaid it promptly , and with generous interest . [I]0-i know not whether [Frances]181-frances was really much altered since the time [I]0-i first saw [her]181-frances ; but , as [I]0-i looked at [her]181-frances now , [I]0-i felt that [she]181-frances was singularly changed for [me]0-i ; the sad eye , the pale cheek , the dejected and joyless countenance [I]0-i remembered as [her]181-frances early attributes , were quite gone , and now [I]0-i saw a face dressed in graces ; smile , dimple , and rosy tint rounded its contours and brightened its hues . [I]0-i had been accustomed to nurse a flattering idea that [my]0-i strong attachment to [her]181-frances proved some particular perspicacity in [my]0-i nature ; [she]181-frances was not handsome , [she]181-frances was not rich , [she]181-frances was not even accomplished , yet was [she]181-frances [my]0-i life ’s treasure ; [I]0-i must then be [a man of peculiar discernment]1504-a man of peculiar discernment . To - night [my]0-i eyes opened on the mistake [I]0-i had made ; [I]0-i began to suspect that it was only [my]0-i tastes which were unique , not [my]0-i power of discovering and appreciating the superiority of moral worth over physical charms . For [me]0-i [Frances]181-frances had physical charms : in [her]181-frances there was no deformity to get over ; none of those prominent defects of eyes , teeth , complexion , shape , which hold at bay the admiration of [the boldest male champions of intellect]1505-the boldest male champions of intellect ( for [women]2360-women can love [a downright ugly man]1507-a downright ugly man if [he]1507-a downright ugly man be but talented ) ; had [she]181-frances been either “ edentee , [myope]3321-myope , rugueuse , ou bossue , ”[181-frances] [my]0-i feelings towards [her]181-frances might still have been kindly , but they could never have been impassioned ; [I]0-i had affection for [the poor little misshapen [Sylvie]166-sylvie]1508-the poor little misshapen sylvie , but for [her]1508-the poor little misshapen sylvie [I]0-i could never have had love . It is true [Frances]181-frances ’ mental points had been the first to interest [me]0-i , and they still retained the strongest hold on [my]0-i preference ; but [I]0-i liked the graces of [her]181-frances person too . [I]0-i derived a pleasure , purely material , from contemplating the clearness of [her]181-frances brown eyes , the fairness of [her]181-frances fine skin , the purity of [her]181-frances well - set teeth , the proportion of [her]181-frances delicate form ; and that pleasure [I]0-i could ill have dispensed with . It appeared , then , that [I]0-i too was [a sensualist]1509-a sensualist , in [my]0-i temperate and fastidious way . Now , [reader]2168-reader , during the last two pages [I]0-i have been giving [you]2168-reader honey fresh from flowers , but [you]2168-reader must not live entirely on food so luscious ; taste then a little gall — just a drop , by way of change . At a somewhat late hour [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i lodgings]2067-my lodgings : having temporarily forgotten that [man]457-man had any such coarse cares as those of eating and drinking , [I]0-i went to bed fasting . [I]0-i had been excited and in action all day , and had tasted no food since eight that morning ; besides , for a fortnight past , [I]0-i had known no rest either of body or mind ; the last few hours had been a sweet delirium , it would not subside now , and till long after midnight , broke with troubled ecstacy the rest [I]0-i so much needed . At last [I]0-i dozed , but not for long ; it was yet quite dark when [I]0-i awoke , and [my]0-i waking was like that of [Job]243-job when [a spirit]1513-a spirit passed before [his]243-job face , and like [him]243-job , “ the hair of [my]243-job flesh stood up . ”[243-job] [I]0-i might continue the parallel , for in truth , though [I]0-i saw nothing , yet “ a thing was secretly brought unto [me]0-i , and [mine]0-i ear received a little thereof ; there was silence , and [I]0-i heard a voice , ”[0-i] saying—“In the midst of life [we]3322-we are in death . ”[0-i] That sound , and the sensation of chill anguish accompanying it , [many]1996-many would have regarded as supernatural ; but [I]0-i recognized it at once as the effect of reaction . [Man]457-man is ever clogged with [his]457-man mortality , and it was [my]0-i mortal nature which now faltered and plained ; [my]0-i nerves , which jarred and gave a false sound , because the soul , of late rushing headlong to an aim , had overstrained the body ’s comparative weakness . A horror of great darkness fell upon [me]0-i ; [I]0-i felt [[my]0-i chamber]369-my chamber invaded by one [I]0-i had known formerly , but had thought for ever departed . [I]0-i was temporarily a prey to hypochondria . [She]1517-she had been [[my]0-i acquaintance]1518-my acquaintance , nay , [[my]0-i guest]1519-my guest , once before in boyhood ; [I]0-i had entertained [her]1517-she at bed and board for a year ; for that space of time [I]0-i had [her]1517-she to [myself]0-i in secret ; [she]1517-she lay with [me]0-i , [she]1517-she ate with [me]0-i , [she]1517-she walked out with [me]0-i , showing [me]0-i nooks in woods , [hollows in hills]1520-hollows in hills , where [we]1521-we could sit together , and where [she]1517-she could drop [her]1517-she drear veil over [me]0-i , and so hide sky and sun , grass and green tree ; taking [me]0-i entirely to [her]1517-she death - cold bosom , and holding [me]0-i with arms of bone . What tales [she]1517-she would tell [me]0-i at such hours ! What songs [she]1517-she would recite in [my]0-i ears ! How [she]1517-she would discourse to [me]0-i of [[her]1517-she own country]1522-her own country — the grave — and again and again promise to conduct [me]0-i there ere long ; and , drawing [me]0-i to [the very brink of [a black , sullen river]1524-a black , sullen river]1523-the very brink of a black , sullen river , show [me]0-i , on the other side , shores unequal with mound , [monument]1525-monument , and tablet , standing up in a glimmer more hoary than moonlight . “ [Necropolis]3323-necropolis ! ”[1517-she] [she]1517-she would whisper , pointing to the pale piles , and add , “ [It]3323-necropolis contains [a mansion prepared for [you]0-i]3324-a mansion prepared for you . ”[1517-she] But [[my]0-i boyhood]1526-my boyhood was lonely , parentless ; uncheered by [brother]1527-brother or [sister]1528-sister ; and there was no marvel that , just as [I]0-i rose to youth , [a sorceress]1529-a sorceress , finding [me]0-i lost in vague mental wanderings , with many affections and few objects , glowing aspirations and gloomy prospects , strong desires and slender hopes , should lift up [her]1529-a sorceress illusive lamp to [me]0-i in the distance , and lure [me]0-i to [[her]1529-a sorceress vaulted home of horrors]1530-her vaulted home of horrors . No wonder [her]1529-a sorceress spells then had power ; but now , when [my]0-i course was widening , [my]0-i prospect brightening ; when [my]0-i affections had found a rest ; when [my]0-i desires , folding wings , weary with long flight , had just alighted on the very lap of fruition , and nestled there warm , content , under the caress of a soft hand — why did hypochondria accost [me]0-i now ? [I]0-i repulsed [her]1529-a sorceress as one would [a dreaded and ghastly concubine coming to embitter [a husband]817-a husband ’s heart toward [[his]817-a husband young bride]1533-his young bride]1531-a dreaded and ghastly concubine coming to embitter a husband ’s heart toward his young bride ; in vain ; [she]1529-a sorceress kept [her]1529-a sorceress sway over [me]0-i for that night and the next day , and eight succeeding days . Afterwards , [my]0-i spirits began slowly to recover [their]1534-their tone ; [my]0-i appetite returned , and in a fortnight [I]0-i was well .
