[I]0-i had gone about as usual all the time , and had said nothing to [anybody]1535-anybody of what [I]0-i felt ; but [I]0-i was glad when the evil spirit departed from [me]0-i , and [I]0-i could again seek [Frances]181-frances , and sit at [her]181-frances side , freed from the dreadful tyranny of [my]0-i demon . ONE fine , frosty Sunday in November , [Frances]181-frances and [I]0-i took a long walk ; [we]1536-we made the tour of [the city]2190-the city by [the Boulevards]3059-the boulevards ; and , afterwards , [Frances]181-frances being a little tired , [we]1536-we sat down on one of those wayside seats placed under the trees , at intervals , for the accommodation of [the weary]1539-the weary . [Frances]181-frances was telling [me]0-i about [Switzerland]55-switzerland ; the subject animated [her]181-frances ; and [I]0-i was just thinking that [her]181-frances eyes spoke full as eloquently as [her]181-frances tongue , when [she]181-frances stopped and remarked — “ [Monsieur]3325-monsieur , there is [a gentleman who knows [you]3325-monsieur]3326-a gentleman who knows you . ”[181-frances] [I]0-i looked up ; [three fashionably dressed men]1540-three fashionably dressed men were just then passing — [Englishmen]1442-englishmen , [I]0-i knew by [their]1540-three fashionably dressed men air and gait as well as by [their]1540-three fashionably dressed men features ; in the tallest of [the trio]782-the trio [I]0-i at once recognized [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ; [he]109-hunsden was in the act of lifting [his]109-hunsden hat to [Frances]181-frances ; afterwards , [he]109-hunsden made a grimace at [me]0-i , and passed on . “ Who is [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you ? ”[109-hunsden] “ [A person [I]109-hunsden knew in [England]11-england]3327-a person i knew in england . ”[109-hunsden] “ Why did [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you bow to [me]109-hunsden ? [He]3326-a gentleman who knows you does not know [me]109-hunsden . ”[109-hunsden] “ Yes , [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you does know [you]0-i , in [his]3326-a gentleman who knows you way . ”[109-hunsden] “ How , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[109-hunsden] ( [She]181-frances still called [me]0-i “ [monsieur]638-monsieur ”[181-frances] ; [I]0-i could not persuade [her]181-frances to adopt any more familiar term . ) “ Did [you]0-i not read the expression of [his]3326-a gentleman who knows you eyes ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Of [his]3326-a gentleman who knows you eyes ? No . What did [they]3330-they say ? ”[109-hunsden] “ To [you]638-monsieur [they]3330-they said , ‘ How do [you]638-monsieur do , [Wilhelmina Crimsworth]245-wilhelmina crimsworth ? ’ To [me]109-hunsden , ‘ So [you]638-monsieur have found [[your]638-monsieur counterpart]3331-your counterpart at last ; there [she]3331-your counterpart sits , [the female of [your]638-monsieur kind]3332-the female of your kind ! ’ ”[109-hunsden] “ [Monsieur]3333-monsieur , [you]638-monsieur could not read all that in [his]3326-a gentleman who knows you eyes ; [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you was so soon gone . ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]109-hunsden read that and more , [Frances]181-frances ; [I]109-hunsden read that [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you will probably call on [me]109-hunsden this evening , or on some future occasion shortly ; and [I]109-hunsden have no doubt [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you will insist on being introduced to [you]181-frances ; shall [I]109-hunsden bring [him]3326-a gentleman who knows you to [[your]181-frances rooms]3334-your rooms ? ”[109-hunsden] “ If [you]3333-monsieur please , [monsieur]638-monsieur — [I]109-hunsden have no objection ; [I]109-hunsden think , indeed , [I]109-hunsden should rather like to see [him]3326-a gentleman who knows you nearer ; [he]3326-a gentleman who knows you looks so original . ”[109-hunsden] As [I]0-i had anticipated , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden came that evening . The first thing [he]109-hunsden said was : — “ [You]0-i need not begin boasting , [Monsieur le Professeur]246-monsieur le professeur ; [I]109-hunsden know about [your]0-i appointment to — — College , and all that ; [Brown]209-brown has told [me]109-hunsden . ”[109-hunsden] Then [he]109-hunsden intimated that [he]109-hunsden had returned from [Germany]43-germany but a day or two since ; afterwards , [he]109-hunsden abruptly demanded whether that was [Madame Pelet - Reuter]154-madame pelet with whom [he]109-hunsden had seen [me]0-i on [the Boulevards]3059-the boulevards . [I]0-i was going to utter a rather emphatic negative , but on second thoughts [I]0-i checked [myself]0-i , and , seeming to assent , asked what [he]109-hunsden thought of [her]154-madame pelet ? “ As to [her]154-madame pelet , [I]109-hunsden ’ll come to that directly ; but first [I]109-hunsden ’ve a word for [you]0-i . [I]109-hunsden see [you]0-i are [a scoundrel]553-a scoundrel ; [you]0-i ’ve no business to be promenading about with [[another man]3337-another man ’s wife]3338-another man ’s wife . [I]109-hunsden thought [you]0-i had sounder sense than to get mixed up in [foreign hodge - podge of this sort]3339-foreign hodge - podge of this sort . ”[109-hunsden] “ But [the lady]361-the lady ? ”[0-i] “ [She]361-the lady ’s too good for [you]0-i evidently ; [she]361-the lady is like [you]0-i , but something better than [you]0-i — no beauty , though ; yet when [she]361-the lady rose ( for [I]0-i looked back to see [you]0-i both walk away ) [I]0-i thought [her]361-the lady figure and carriage good . [These foreigners]3341-these foreigners understand grace . What the devil has [she]361-the lady done with [Pelet]154-madame pelet ? [She]361-the lady has not been married to [him]3342-him three months — [he]3342-him must be [a spoon]3343-a spoon ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i would not let the mistake go too far ; [I]0-i did not like it much . “ [Pelet]154-madame pelet ? How [your]154-madame pelet head runs on [Mons]247-mons . and [Madame Pelet]154-madame pelet ! [You]154-madame pelet are always talking about [them]3344-them . [I]0-i wish to the gods [you]154-madame pelet had [we]3345-we d [Mdlle]223-mdlle . [Zoraide]232-zoraide [yourself]154-madame pelet ! ”[0-i] “ Was [that young gentlewoman]3346-that young gentlewoman not [Mdlle]223-mdlle . [Zoraide]232-zoraide ? ”[0-i] “ No ; nor [Madame Zoraide]248-madame zoraide either . ”[0-i] “ Why did [you]154-madame pelet tell a lie , then ? ”[0-i] “ [I]0-i told no lie ; but [you]154-madame pelet are is such a hurry . [She]3346-that young gentlewoman is [a pupil of [mine]0-i]3347-a pupil of mine — [a Swiss girl]3348-a swiss girl . ”[0-i] “ And of course [you]154-madame pelet are going to be married to [her]3346-that young gentlewoman ? Do n’t deny that . ”[0-i] “ Married ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i shall — if [Fate]121-fate spares [us]3349-us both ten weeks longer . That is [my]0-i little wild strawberry , [Hunsden]109-hunsden , whose sweetness made [me]0-i careless of [your]154-madame pelet hothouse grapes . ”[0-i] “ Stop ! No boasting — no heroics ; [I]0-i wo n’t hear [them]3350-them . What is [she]3346-that young gentlewoman ? To what caste does [she]3346-that young gentlewoman belong ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i smiled . [Hunsden]109-hunsden unconsciously laid stress on the word caste , and , in fact , republican , lord - hater as [he]109-hunsden was , [Hunsden]109-hunsden was as proud of [his]109-hunsden old — — shire blood , of [his]109-hunsden descent and family standing , respectable and respected through long generations back , as [any peer in the realm of [his]109-hunsden Norman race]1544-any peer in the realm of his norman race and Conquest - dated title . [Hunsden]109-hunsden would as little have thought of taking [a wife]1545-a wife from [a caste inferior to [his]109-hunsden own]1546-a caste inferior to his own , as [a Stanley]1547-a stanley would think of mating with [a Cobden]249-a cobden . [I]0-i enjoyed the surprise [I]0-i should give ; [I]0-i enjoyed the triumph of [my]0-i practice over [his]109-hunsden theory ; and leaning over the table , and uttering the words slowly but with repressed glee , [I]0-i said concisely — “ [She]1545-a wife is [a lace - mender]2916-a lace - mender . ”[0-i] [Hunsden]109-hunsden examined [me]0-i . [He]109-hunsden did not say [he]109-hunsden was surprised , but surprised [he]109-hunsden was ; [he]109-hunsden had [his]109-hunsden own notions of good breeding . [I]0-i saw [he]109-hunsden suspected [I]0-i was going to take some very rash step ; but repressing declamation or remonstrance , [he]109-hunsden only answered — “ Well , [you]0-i are the best judge of [your]0-i own affairs . [A lace - mender]2916-a lace - mender may make [a good wife]3353-a good wife as well as [a lady]347-a lady ; but of course [you]0-i have taken care to ascertain thoroughly that since [she]347-a lady has not education , fortune or station , [she]347-a lady is well furnished with such natural qualities as [you]0-i think most likely to conduce to [your]0-i happiness . Has [she]347-a lady many relations ? ”[109-hunsden] “ None in [Brussels]18-brussels . ”[109-hunsden] “ That is better . Relations are often the real evil in such cases . [I]109-hunsden can not but think that a train of inferior connections would have been a bore to [you]0-i to [your]0-i life ’s end . ”[109-hunsden] After sitting in silence a little while longer , [Hunsden]109-hunsden rose , and was quietly bidding [me]0-i good evening ; the polite , considerate manner in which [he]109-hunsden offered [me]0-i [his]109-hunsden hand ( a thing [he]109-hunsden had never done before ) , convinced [me]0-i that [he]109-hunsden thought [I]0-i had made a terrible fool of [myself]0-i ; and that , ruined and thrown away as [I]0-i was , it was no time for sarcasm or cynicism , or indeed for anything but indulgence and forbearance . “ Good night , [William]103-william , ”[109-hunsden] [he]109-hunsden said , in a really soft voice , while [his]109-hunsden face looked benevolently compassionate . “ Good night , [lad]487-lad . [I]109-hunsden wish [you]487-lad and [[your]487-lad future wife]3356-your future wife much prosperity ; and [I]109-hunsden hope [she]3356-your future wife will satisfy [your]487-lad fastidious soul . ”[109-hunsden] [I]0-i had much ado to refrain from laughing as [I]0-i beheld the magnanimous pity of [[his]109-hunsden mien]1548-his mien ; maintaining , however , a grave air , [I]0-i said : — “ [I]0-i thought [you]109-hunsden would have liked to have seen [Mdlle . Henri]250-mdlle . henri ? ”[0-i] “ Oh , that is the name ! Yes — if it would be convenient , [I]109-hunsden should like to see [her]3356-your future wife — but——. ”[109-hunsden] [He]109-hunsden hesitated . “ Well ? ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]109-hunsden should on no account wish to intrude . ”[109-hunsden] “ Come , then , ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i [We]1549-we set out . [Hunsden]109-hunsden no doubt regarded [me]0-i as [a rash , imprudent man]1550-a rash , imprudent man , thus to show [[my]0-i poor little grisette sweetheart]1551-my poor little grisette sweetheart , in [her]1551-my poor little grisette sweetheart poor little unfurnished grenier ; but [he]109-hunsden prepared to act [the real gentleman]1552-the real gentleman , having , in fact , the kernel of that character , under the harsh husk it pleased [him]109-hunsden to wear by way of mental mackintosh . [He]109-hunsden talked affably , and even gently , as [we]1549-we went along [the street]2240-the street ; [he]109-hunsden had never been so civil to [me]0-i in [his]109-hunsden life . [We]1549-we reached [the house]1897-the house , entered , ascended the stair ; on gaining [the lobby]1468-the lobby , [Hunsden]109-hunsden turned to mount a narrower stair which led to [a higher story]1556-a higher story ; [I]0-i saw [his]109-hunsden mind was bent on the attics . “ Here , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i quietly , tapping at [Frances]181-frances ’ door . [He]109-hunsden turned ; in [his]109-hunsden genuine politeness [he]109-hunsden was a little disconcerted at having made the mistake ; [his]109-hunsden eye reverted to the green mat , but [he]109-hunsden said nothing . [We]1549-we walked in , and [Frances]181-frances rose from [her]181-frances seat near the table to receive [us]1549-we ; [her]181-frances mourning attire gave [her]181-frances a recluse , rather conventual , but withal very distinguished look ; its grave simplicity added nothing to beauty , but much to dignity ; the finish of the white collar and manchettes sufficed for a relief to the merino gown of solemn black ; ornament was forsworn . [Frances]181-frances curtsied with sedate grace , looking , as [she]181-frances always did , when [one]1983-one first accosted [her]181-frances , more [a woman to respect than to love]1558-a woman to respect than to love ; [I]0-i introduced [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , and [she]181-frances expressed [her]181-frances happiness at making [his]109-hunsden acquaintance in French . The pure and polished accent , the low yet sweet and rather full voice , produced their effect immediately ; [Hunsden]109-hunsden spoke French in reply ; [I]0-i had not heard [him]109-hunsden speak that language before ; [he]109-hunsden managed it very well . [I]0-i retired to the window - seat ; [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , at [[his]109-hunsden hostess]1559-his hostess ’s invitation , occupied a chair near the hearth ; from [my]0-i position [I]0-i could see [them]1560-them both , and [the room]1922-the room too , at a glance . [The room]1922-the room was so clean and bright , [it]1922-the room looked like a little polished cabinet ; a glass filled with flowers in the centre of the table , a fresh rose in each china cup on the mantelpiece gave it an air of fête . [Frances]181-frances was serious , and [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden subdued , but both mutually polite ; [they]1560-them got on at the French swimmingly : ordinary topics were discussed with great state and decorum ; [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had never seen two such models of propriety , for [Hunsden]109-hunsden ( thanks to the constraint of the foreign tongue ) was obliged to shape [his]109-hunsden phrases , and measure [his]109-hunsden sentences , with a care that forbade any eccentricity . At last [England]11-england was mentioned , and [Frances]181-frances proceeded to ask questions . Animated by degrees , [she]181-frances began to change , just as a grave night - sky changes at the approach of sunrise : first it seemed as if [her]181-frances forehead cleared , then [her]181-frances eyes glittered , [her]181-frances features relaxed , and became quite mobile ; [her]181-frances subdued complexion grew warm and transparent ; to [me]0-i , [she]181-frances now looked pretty ; before , [she]181-frances had only looked ladylike . [She]181-frances had many things to say to [the Englishman]3106-the englishman just fresh from [[his]3106-the englishman island - country]1564-his island - country , and [she]181-frances urged [him]3106-the englishman with an enthusiasm of curiosity , which ere long thawed [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s reserve as fire thaws a congealed viper . [I]0-i use this not very flattering comparison because [he]3106-the englishman vividly reminded [me]0-i of a snake waking from torpor , as [he]3106-the englishman erected [his]3106-the englishman tall form , reared [his]3106-the englishman head , before a little declined , and putting back [his]3106-the englishman hair from [his]3106-the englishman broad Saxon forehead , showed unshaded the gleam of almost savage satire which [[his]3106-the englishman interlocutor]1565-his interlocutor ’s tone of eagerness and look of ardour had sufficed at once to kindle in [his]3106-the englishman soul and elicit from [his]3106-the englishman eyes : [he]3106-the englishman was [himself]3106-the englishman ; as [Frances]181-frances was [herself]181-frances , and in none but [his]3106-the englishman own language would [he]3106-the englishman now address [her]181-frances . “ [You]181-frances understand English ? ”[3106-the englishman] was the prefatory question . “ A little . ”[3106-the englishman] “ Well , then , [you]181-frances shall have plenty of it ; and first , [I]3106-the englishman see [you]181-frances ’ve not much more sense than [some others of [my]3106-the englishman acquaintance]3357-some others of my acquaintance ”[3106-the englishman] ( indicating [me]0-i with [his]3106-the englishman thumb ) , “ or else [you]181-frances ’d never turn rabid about [that dirty little country called [England]11-england]3358-that dirty little country called england ; for rabid , [I]3106-the englishman see [you]181-frances are ; [I]3106-the englishman read Anglophobia in [your]181-frances looks , and hear it in [your]181-frances words . Why , [mademoiselle]153-zoraide , is it possible that [anybody with a grain of rationality]3359-anybody with a grain of rationality should feel enthusiasm about a mere name , and that name [England]11-england ? [I]3106-the englishman thought [you]181-frances were [a lady]347-a lady - abbess five minutes ago , and respected [you]181-frances accordingly ; and now [I]3106-the englishman see [you]181-frances are [a sort of Swiss sibyl]3361-a sort of swiss sibyl , with high Tory and high Church principles ! ”[3106-the englishman] “ [England]11-england is [[your]3106-the englishman country]3362-your country ? ”[181-frances] asked [Frances]181-frances . “ Yes . ”[181-frances] “ And [you]3106-the englishman do n’t like it ? ”[3106-the englishman] “ [I]3106-the englishman ’d be sorry to like it ! [A little corrupt , venal , lord]3363-a little corrupt , venal , lord - and - king - cursed nation , full of mucky pride ( as [they]3364-they say in — — shire ) , and helpless pauperism ; rotten with abuses , worm - eaten with prejudices ! ”[3106-the englishman] “ [You]181-frances might say so of almost [every state]3365-every state ; there are abuses and prejudices everywhere , and [I]181-frances thought fewer in [England]11-england than in [other countries]3366-other countries . ”[181-frances] “ Come to [England]11-england and see . Come to [Birmingham]75-birmingham and [Manchester]76-manchester ; come to [St. Giles ’]77-st. giles ’ in [London]19-london , and get a practical notion of how [our]3367-our system works . Examine the footprints of [[our]3367-our august aristocracy]3368-our august aristocracy ; see how [they]3368-our august aristocracy walk in blood , crushing hearts as [they]3368-our august aristocracy go . Just put [your]181-frances head in at [English cottage]3369-english cottage doors ; get a glimpse of [Famine]251-famine crouched torpid on black hearthstones ; of [Disease]252-disease lying bare on beds without coverlets , of Infamy wantoning viciously with Ignorance , though indeed [Luxury]253-luxury is [[her]253-luxury favourite paramour]3370-her favourite paramour , and [princely halls]3371-princely halls are dearer to [her]253-luxury than thatched hovels — — ”[3106-the englishman] “ [I]3106-the englishman was not thinking of the wretchedness and vice in [England]11-england ; [I]3106-the englishman was thinking of the good side — of what is elevated in [your]181-frances character as [a nation]3372-a nation . ”[3106-the englishman] “ There is no good side — none at least of which [you]181-frances can have any knowledge ; for [you]181-frances can not appreciate the efforts of industry , the achievements of enterprise , or the discoveries of science : narrowness of education and obscurity of position quite incapacitate [you]181-frances from understanding these points ; and as to historical and poetical associations , [I]181-frances will not insult [you]181-frances , [mademoiselle]719-mademoiselle , by supposing that [you]181-frances alluded to such humbug . ”[181-frances] “ But [I]3106-the englishman did partly . ”[3106-the englishman] [Hunsden]109-hunsden laughed — [his]109-hunsden laugh of unmitigated scorn . “ [I]109-hunsden did , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden . Are [you]109-hunsden of the number of those to whom such associations give no pleasure ? ”[109-hunsden] “ [Mademoiselle]153-zoraide , what is an association ? [I]109-hunsden never saw [one]1983-one . What is its length , breadth , weight , value — ay , value ? What price will it bring in the market ? ”[109-hunsden] “ [Your]181-frances portrait , to [any one who loved [you]181-frances]3375-any one who loved you , would , for the sake of association , be without price . ”[109-hunsden] That inscrutable [Hunsden]109-hunsden heard this remark and felt it rather acutely , too , somewhere ; for [he]109-hunsden coloured — a thing not unusual with [him]109-hunsden , when hit unawares on a tender point . A sort of trouble momentarily darkened [his]109-hunsden eye , and [I]0-i believe [he]109-hunsden filled up the transient pause succeeding [[his]109-hunsden antagonist]1566-his antagonist ’s home - thrust , by a wish that [some one]2038-some one did love [him]109-hunsden as [he]109-hunsden would like to be loved — [some one whose love [he]109-hunsden could unreservedly return]1568-some one whose love he could unreservedly return . [The lady]361-the lady pursued [her]361-the lady temporary advantage . “ If [[your]109-hunsden world]3376-your world is a world without associations , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , [I]361-the lady no longer wonder that [you]109-hunsden hate [England]11-england so . [I]361-the lady do n’t clearly know what Paradise is , and what angels are ; yet taking it to be [the most glorious region [I]361-the lady can conceive]3377-the most glorious region i can conceive , and angels the most elevated existences — if one of [them]3378-them — if [Abdiel the Faithful]254-abdiel the faithful [himself]254-abdiel the faithful ”[361-the lady] ( [she]361-the lady was thinking of [Milton]213-milton ) “ were suddenly stripped of the faculty of association , [I]181-frances think [he]213-milton would soon rush forth from ‘ the ever - during gates , ’ leave [heaven]504-heaven , and seek what [he]213-milton had lost in [hell]3380-hell . Yes , in the very hell from which [he]213-milton turned ‘ with retorted scorn . ’ ”[181-frances] [Frances]181-frances ’ tone in saying this was as marked as [her]181-frances language , and it was when the word “ hell ”[181-frances] twanged off from [her]181-frances lips , with a somewhat startling emphasis , that [Hunsden]109-hunsden deigned to bestow one slight glance of admiration . [He]109-hunsden liked something strong , whether in [man]457-man or [woman]3247-woman ; [he]109-hunsden liked whatever dared to clear conventional limits . [He]109-hunsden had never before heard [a lady]347-a lady say “ [hell ”]3381-hell ”[347-a lady] with that uncompromising sort of accent , and the sound pleased [him]109-hunsden from [a lady]347-a lady ’s lips ; [he]109-hunsden would fain have had [Frances]181-frances to strike the string again , but it was not in [her]181-frances way . The display of eccentric vigour never gave [her]181-frances pleasure , and it only sounded in [her]181-frances voice or flashed in [her]181-frances countenance when extraordinary circumstances — and those generally painful — forced it out of the depths where it burned latent . To [me]0-i , once or twice , [she]181-frances had in intimate conversation , uttered venturous thoughts in nervous language ; but when the hour of such manifestation was past , [I]0-i could not recall it ; it came of itself and of itself departed . [Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s excitations [she]181-frances put by soon with a smile , and recurring to the theme of disputation , said — “ Since [England]11-england is nothing , why do [the continental nations]2319-the continental nations respect [her]181-frances so ? ”[181-frances] “ [I]109-hunsden should have thought [no child]1491-no child would have asked that question , ”[109-hunsden] replied [Hunsden]109-hunsden , who never at any time gave information without reproving for [stupidity those who asked it of [him]109-hunsden]1574-stupidity those who asked it of him . “ If [you]109-hunsden had been [[my]109-hunsden pupil]1015-my pupil , as [I]109-hunsden suppose [you]109-hunsden once had the misfortune to be that of a deplorable character not a hundred miles off , [I]109-hunsden would have put [you]109-hunsden in the corner for such a confession of ignorance . Why , mademoiselle , ca n’t [you]109-hunsden see that it is [our]3385-our gold which buys [us]3385-our French politeness , German good - will , and Swiss servility ? ”[109-hunsden] And [he]109-hunsden sneered diabolically . “ [Swiss]196-the swiss ? ”[181-frances] said [Frances]181-frances , catching the word “ servility . ”[181-frances] “ Do [you]109-hunsden call [[my]181-frances countrymen]3386-my countrymen servile ? ”[181-frances] and [she]181-frances started up . [I]0-i could not suppress a low laugh ; there was ire in [her]181-frances glance and defiance in [her]181-frances attitude . “ Do [you]109-hunsden abuse [Switzerland]55-switzerland to [me]181-frances , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ? Do [you]109-hunsden think [I]181-frances have no associations ? Do [you]109-hunsden calculate that [I]181-frances am prepared to dwell only on what vice and degradation may be found in [Alpine villages]3387-alpine villages , and to leave quite out of [my]181-frances heart the social greatness of [[my]181-frances countrymen]3386-my countrymen , and [our]3389-our blood - earned freedom , and the natural glories of [[our]3389-our mountains]3390-our mountains ? [You]109-hunsden ’re mistaken — [you’re]109-hunsden mistaken . ”[181-frances] “ Social greatness ? Call it what [you]109-hunsden will , [[your]109-hunsden countrymen]3391-your countrymen are [sensible fellows]3392-sensible fellows ; [they]3391-your countrymen make a marketable article of what to [you]109-hunsden is an abstract idea ; [they]3391-your countrymen have , ere this , sold [their]3391-your countrymen social greatness and also [their]3391-your countrymen blood - earned freedom to be [the servants of [foreign kings]3394-foreign kings]3393-the servants of foreign kings . ”[181-frances] “ [You]109-hunsden never were in [Switzerland]55-switzerland ? ”[181-frances] “ Yes — [I]181-frances have been [there]1998-there twice . ”[181-frances] “ [You]109-hunsden know nothing of it . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances do . ”[181-frances] “ And [you]109-hunsden say [the Swiss]196-the swiss are [mercenary]3396-mercenary , as a parrot says ‘ Poor Poll , ’ or as [the Belgians]3397-the belgians here say [the English]224-the english are not brave , or as [the French]3398-the french accuse [them]3397-the belgians of being perfidious : there is no justice in [your]109-hunsden dictums . ”[181-frances] “ There is truth . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances tell [you]109-hunsden , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , [you]109-hunsden are [a more unpractical man]3399-a more unpractical man than [I]181-frances am [an unpractical woman]3400-an unpractical woman , for [you]109-hunsden do n’t acknowledge what really exists ; [you]109-hunsden want to annihilate individual patriotism and national greatness as [an atheist]3401-an atheist would annihilate [God]119-god and [his]3401-an atheist own soul , by denying [their]3402-their existence . ”[181-frances] “ Where are [you]109-hunsden flying to ? [You]109-hunsden are off at a tangent — [I]181-frances thought [we]3403-we were talking about the mercenary nature of [the Swiss]196-the swiss . ”[181-frances] “ [We]3403-we were — and if [you]109-hunsden proved to [me]181-frances that [the Swiss]196-the swiss are mercenary to - morrow ( which [you]109-hunsden can not do ) [I]181-frances should love [Switzerland]55-switzerland still . ”[181-frances] “ [You]109-hunsden would be mad , then — mad as [a March hare]3404-a march hare — to indulge in a passion for millions of shiploads of soil , timber , snow , and ice . ”[181-frances] “ Not so mad as [you]109-hunsden who love nothing . ”[181-frances] “ There ’s a method in [my]181-frances madness ; there ’s none in [yours]109-hunsden . ”[181-frances] “ [Your]109-hunsden method is to squeeze the sap out of creation and make manure of the refuse , by way of turning it to what [you]109-hunsden call use . ”[181-frances] “ [You]109-hunsden can not reason at all , ”[109-hunsden] said [Hunsden]109-hunsden ; “ there is no logic in [you]109-hunsden . ”[109-hunsden] “ Better to be without logic than without feeling , ”[181-frances] retorted [Frances]181-frances , who was now passing backwards and forwards from [her]181-frances cupboard to the table , intent , if not on hospitable thoughts , at least on hospitable deeds , for [she]181-frances was laying the cloth , and putting plates , knives and forks thereon . “ Is that a hit at [me]181-frances , [mademoiselle]153-zoraide ? Do [you]109-hunsden suppose [I]181-frances am without feeling ? ”[181-frances] “ [I]109-hunsden suppose [you]109-hunsden are always interfering with [your]109-hunsden own feelings , and those of [other people]591-other people , and dogmatizing about the irrationality of this , that , and the other sentiment , and then ordering it to be suppressed because [you]109-hunsden imagine it to be inconsistent with logic . ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]181-frances do right . ”[181-frances] [Frances]181-frances had stepped out of sight into a sort of little pantry ; [she]181-frances soon reappeared . “ [You]109-hunsden do right ? Indeed , no ! [You]109-hunsden are much mistaken if [you]109-hunsden think so . Just be so good as to let [me]181-frances get to the fire , [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ; [I]181-frances have something to cook . ”[181-frances] ( An interval occupied in settling a casserole on the fire ; then , while [she]181-frances stirred its contents :) “ Right ! as if it were right to crush any pleasurable sentiment that [God]119-god has given to [man]457-man , especially any sentiment that , like patriotism , spreads [man]457-man ’s selfishness in wider circles ”[181-frances] ( fire stirred , dish put down before it ) . “ Were [you]109-hunsden born in [Switzerland]55-switzerland ? ”[181-frances] “ [I]109-hunsden should think so , or else why should [I]109-hunsden call it [[my]109-hunsden country]706-my country ? ”[109-hunsden] “ And where did [you]109-hunsden get [your]109-hunsden English features and figure ? ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]181-frances am English , too ; half the blood in [my]181-frances veins is English ; thus [I]181-frances have a right to a double power of patriotism , possessing an interest in [two noble , free , and [fortunate countries]3410-fortunate countries]3409-two noble , free , and fortunate countries . ”[181-frances] “ [You]109-hunsden had [an English mother]3411-an english mother ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Yes , yes ; and [you]109-hunsden , [I]109-hunsden suppose , had [a mother from the moon]3412-a mother from the moon or from [Utopia]78-utopia , since not [a nation in [Europe]40-europe]3413-a nation in europe has a claim on [your]109-hunsden interest ? ”[109-hunsden] “ On the contrary , [I]181-frances ’m [a universal patriot]3414-a universal patriot , if [you]109-hunsden could understand [me]181-frances rightly : [[my]181-frances country]706-my country is [the world]1872-the world . ”[181-frances] “ Sympathies so widely diffused must be very shallow : will [you]109-hunsden have the goodness to come to table . [Monsieur]638-monsieur ”[109-hunsden] ( to [me]0-i who appeared to be now absorbed in reading by moonlight)—“Monsieur , supper is served . ”[181-frances] This was said in quite a different voice to that in which [she]0-i had been bandying phrases with [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden — not so short , graver and softer . “ [Frances]181-frances , what do [you]181-frances mean by preparing , supper ? [we]3418-we had no intention of staying . ”[0-i] “ Ah , [monsieur]638-monsieur , but [you]638-monsieur have stayed , and supper is prepared ; [you]638-monsieur have only the alternative of eating it . ”[0-i] The meal was a foreign one , of course ; it consisted in two small but tasty dishes of meat prepared with skill and served with nicety ; a salad and “ fromage francais , ”[0-i] completed it . The business of eating interposed a brief truce between [the belligerents]1575-the belligerents , but no sooner was supper disposed of than [they]1575-the belligerents were at it again . The fresh subject of dispute ran on the spirit of religious intolerance which [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden affirmed to exist strongly in [Switzerland]55-switzerland , notwithstanding the professed attachment of [the Swiss]1576-the swiss to freedom . Here [Frances]181-frances had greatly the worst of it , not only because [she]181-frances was unskilled to argue , but because [her]181-frances own real opinions on the point in question happened to coincide pretty nearly with [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ’s , and [she]181-frances only contradicted [him]109-hunsden out of opposition . At last [she]181-frances gave in , confessing that [she]181-frances thought as [he]109-hunsden thought , but bidding [him]109-hunsden take notice that [she]181-frances did not consider [herself]181-frances beaten . “ No more did the French at [Waterloo]79-waterloo , ”[109-hunsden] said [Hunsden]109-hunsden . “ There is no comparison between the cases , ”[181-frances] rejoined [Frances]181-frances ; “ mine was a sham fight . ”[181-frances] “ Sham or real , it ’s up with [you]109-hunsden . ”[181-frances] “ No ; though [I]181-frances have neither logic nor wealth of words , yet in a case where [my]181-frances opinion really differed from [yours]109-hunsden , [I]181-frances would adhere to it when [I]181-frances had not another word to say in its defence ; [you]109-hunsden should be baffled by dumb determination . [You]109-hunsden speak of [Waterloo]79-waterloo ; [[your]109-hunsden [Wellington]255-wellington]3420-your wellington ought to have been conquered [there]1998-there , according to [Napoleon]256-napoleon ; but [he]256-napoleon persevered in spite of the laws of war , and was victorious in defiance of military tactics . [I]181-frances would do as [he]256-napoleon did . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances ’ll be bound for it [you]109-hunsden would ; probably [you]109-hunsden have some of the same sort of stubborn stuff in [you]109-hunsden . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances should be sorry if [I]181-frances had not ; [he]256-napoleon and [Tell]257-tell were [brothers]394-brothers , and [I]181-frances ’d scorn [the Swiss]1576-the swiss , [man]457-man or [woman]3247-woman , who had none of the much - enduring nature of [our]3426-our heroic William in [his]256-napoleon soul . ”[181-frances] “ If [Tell]257-tell was like [Wellington]255-wellington , [he]257-tell was [an ass]3427-an ass . ”[181-frances] “ Does not ass mean baudet ? ”[181-frances] asked [Frances]181-frances , turning to [me]0-i . “ No , no , ”[0-i] replied [I]0-i , “ it means an esprit - fort ; and now , ”[0-i] [I]0-i continued , as [I]0-i saw that fresh occasion of strife was brewing between [these two]1577-these two , “ it is high time to go . ”[109-hunsden] [Hunsden]109-hunsden rose . “ Good bye , ”[109-hunsden] said [he]109-hunsden to [Frances]181-frances ; “ [I]109-hunsden shall be off for this glorious [England]11-england to - morrow , and it may be twelve months or more before [I]109-hunsden come to [Brussels]18-brussels again ; whenever [I]109-hunsden do come [I]109-hunsden ’ll seek [you]181-frances out , and [you]181-frances shall see if [I]109-hunsden do n’t find means to make [you]181-frances fiercer than a dragon . [You]181-frances ’ve done pretty well this evening , but next interview [you]181-frances shall challenge [me]109-hunsden outright . Meantime [you]181-frances ’re doomed to become [Mrs. William Crimsworth]103-william , [I]109-hunsden suppose ; [poor young lady]3428-poor young lady ? but [you]181-frances have a spark of spirit ; cherish it , and give [the Professor]2273-the professor the full benefit thereof . ”[109-hunsden] “ Are [you]109-hunsden married . [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden ? ”[181-frances] asked [Frances]181-frances , suddenly . “ No . [I]181-frances should have thought [you]109-hunsden might have guessed [I]181-frances was [a Benedict]3430-a benedict by [my]181-frances look . ”[181-frances] “ Well , whenever [you]109-hunsden marry do n’t take [a wife]1545-a wife out of [Switzerland]55-switzerland ; for if [you]109-hunsden begin blaspheming [Helvetia]80-helvetia , and cursing [the cantons]3432-the cantons — above all , if [you]109-hunsden mention the word ass in the same breath with the name [Tell]257-tell ( for ass is baudet , [I]109-hunsden know ; though [Monsieur]3433-monsieur is pleased to translate it esprit - fort ) [[your]109-hunsden mountain maid]3434-your mountain maid will some night smother [her]3434-your mountain maid Breton - bretonnant , even as [your]109-hunsden own Shakspeare ’s Othello smothered [Desdemona]258-desdemona . ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]109-hunsden am warned , ”[109-hunsden] said [Hunsden]109-hunsden ; “ and so are [you]0-i , [lad]487-lad , ”[109-hunsden] ( nodding to [me]0-i ) . “ [I]109-hunsden hope yet to hear of a travesty of [the Moor]3436-the moor and [[his]3436-the moor gentle lady]3437-his gentle lady , in which the parts shall be reversed according to the plan just sketched — [you]0-i , however , being in [my]109-hunsden nightcap . Farewell , mademoiselle ! ”[109-hunsden] [He]109-hunsden bowed on [her]0-i hand , absolutely like [Sir Charles Grandison]259-sir charles grandison on that of [Harriet Byron]260-harriet byron ; adding—“Death from such fingers would not be without charms . ”[109-hunsden] “ Mon Dieu ! ”[181-frances] murmured [Frances]181-frances , opening [her]181-frances large eyes and lifting [her]181-frances distinctly arched brows ; “ c’est qu’il fait des compliments ! je ne m’y suis pas attendu . ”[181-frances] [She]0-i smiled , half in ire , half in mirth , curtsied with foreign grace , and so [they]1578-they parted . No sooner had [we]1579-we got into [the street]2240-the street than [Hunsden]109-hunsden collared [me]0-i . “ And that is [your]0-i lace - mender ? ”[109-hunsden] said [he]109-hunsden ; “ and [you]0-i reckon [you]0-i have done a fine , magnanimous thing in offering to marry [her]0-i ? [You]0-i , [a scion of [Seacombe]94-seacombe]3438-a scion of seacombe , have proved [your]0-i disdain of social distinctions by taking up with an ouvriere ! And [I]109-hunsden pitied [the fellow]3439-the fellow , thinking [his]3439-the fellow feelings had misled [him]3439-the fellow , and that [he]3439-the fellow had hurt [himself]3439-the fellow by contracting a low match ! ”[109-hunsden] “ Just let go [my]109-hunsden collar , [Hunsden]109-hunsden . ”[109-hunsden] On the contrary , [he]109-hunsden swayed [me]0-i to and fro ; so [I]0-i grappled [him]109-hunsden round the waist . It was dark ; [the street]2240-the street lonely and lampless . [We]1582-we had then a tug for it ; and after [we]1582-we had both rolled on [the pavement]1583-the pavement , and with difficulty picked [ourselves]1582-we up , [we]1582-we agreed to walk on more soberly . “ Yes , that ’s [my]0-i lace - mender , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i ; “ and [she]3440-she is to be [mine]0-i for life — [God]119-god willing . ”[0-i] “ [God]119-god is not willing — [you]0-i ca n’t suppose it ; what business have [you]0-i to be suited so well with [a partner]400-a partner ? And [she]3440-she treats [you]0-i with a sort of respect , too , and says , ‘ [Monsieur]3442-monsieur ’ and modulates [her]3440-she tone in addressing [you]0-i , actually , as if [you]0-i were something superior ! [She]3440-she could not evince more deference to such a one as [I]109-hunsden , were [she]3440-she favoured by fortune to the supreme extent of being [my]109-hunsden choice instead of [yours]0-i . ”[109-hunsden] “ [Hunsden]109-hunsden , [you]109-hunsden ’re [a puppy]3443-a puppy . But [you]109-hunsden ’ve only seen the title - page of [my]109-hunsden happiness ; [you]109-hunsden do n’t know the tale that follows ; [you]109-hunsden can not conceive the interest and sweet variety and thrilling excitement of the narrative . ”[109-hunsden] [Hunsden]109-hunsden — speaking low and deep , for [we]1584-we had now entered [a busier street]1585-a busier street — desired [me]0-i to hold [my]0-i peace , threatening to do something dreadful if [I]0-i stimulated [his]109-hunsden wrath further by boasting . [I]0-i laughed till [my]0-i sides ached . [We]1584-we soon reached [[his]109-hunsden hotel]1586-his hotel ; before [he]109-hunsden entered [it]1586-his hotel , [he]109-hunsden said — “ Do n’t be vainglorious . [Your]109-hunsden lace - mender is too good for [you]109-hunsden , but not good enough for [me]109-hunsden ; neither physically nor morally does [she]3444-she come up to [my]109-hunsden ideal of [a woman]2098-a woman . No ; [I]109-hunsden dream of something far beyond that pale - faced , excitable little Helvetian ( by - the - by [she]3444-she has infinitely more of the nervous , mobile Parisienne in [her]3444-she than of the the robust ‘ jungfrau ’ ) . [Your]109-hunsden Mdlle . [Henri]181-frances is in person “[109-hunsden] chetive ” , in mind “[109-hunsden] sans caractere ” , compared with [the queen of [my]109-hunsden visions]3446-the queen of my visions . [You]109-hunsden , indeed , may put up with that “[109-hunsden] minois chiffone ” ; but when [I]109-hunsden marry [I]109-hunsden must have straighter and more harmonious features , to say nothing of a nobler and better developed shape than [that perverse , ill - thriven child]3447-that perverse , ill - thriven child can boast . ”[109-hunsden] “ Bribe [a seraph]3448-a seraph to fetch [you]109-hunsden a coal of fire from [heaven]504-heaven , if [you]109-hunsden will , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ and with it kindle life in [the tallest , fattest , most boneless , fullest - blooded of [[Ruben]261-ruben ’s painted women]3451-ruben ’s painted women]3450-the tallest , fattest , most boneless , fullest - blooded of ruben ’s painted women — leave [me]0-i only [my]0-i Alpine peri , and [I]0-i ’ll not envy [you]109-hunsden . ”[0-i] With a simultaneous movement , [each]1587-each turned [his]1587-each back on [the other]2074-the other . Neither said “ God bless [you]109-hunsden ; ”[1587-each] yet on the morrow [the sea]1195-the sea was to roll between [us]1590-us . IN two months more [Frances]181-frances had fulfilled the time of mourning for [[her]181-frances aunt]1119-her aunt . One January morning — the first of the new year holidays — [I]0-i went in a fiacre , accompanied only by [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten , to [the Rue Notre Dame aux Neiges]1391-the rue notre dame aux neiges , and having alighted alone and walked [upstairs]1160-upstairs , [I]0-i found [Frances]181-frances apparently waiting for [me]0-i , dressed in a style scarcely appropriate to that cold , bright , frosty day . Never till now had [I]0-i seen [her]181-frances attired in any other than black or sad - coloured stuff ; and there [she]181-frances stood by the window , clad all in white , and white of a most diaphanous texture ; [her]181-frances array was very simple , to be sure , but it looked imposing and festal because it was so clear , full , and floating ; a veil shadowed [her]181-frances head , and hung below [her]181-frances knee ; a little wreath of pink flowers fastened it to [her]181-frances thickly tressed Grecian plait , and thence it fell softly on each side of [her]181-frances face . Singular to state , [she]181-frances was , or had been crying ; when [I]0-i asked [her]181-frances if [she]181-frances were ready , [she]181-frances said “ Yes , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[181-frances] with something very like a checked sob ; and when [I]0-i took a shawl , which lay on the table , and folded it round [her]181-frances , not only did tear after tear course unbidden down [her]181-frances cheek , but [she]181-frances shook to [my]0-i ministration like a reed . [I]0-i said [I]0-i was sorry to see [her]181-frances in such low spirits , and requested to be allowed an insight into the origin thereof . [She]181-frances only said , “ It was impossible to help it , ”[181-frances] and then voluntarily , though hurriedly , putting [her]181-frances hand into [mine]0-i , accompanied [me]0-i out of [the room]1922-the room , and ran [downstairs]1595-downstairs with a quick , uncertain step , like [one who was eager to get some formidable piece of business]1596-one who was eager to get some formidable piece of business over . [I]0-i put [her]181-frances into [the fiacre]1597-the fiacre . [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten received [her]181-frances , and seated [her]181-frances beside [himself]228-m. vandenhuten ; [we]1598-our drove all together to [the Protestant chapel]1599-the protestant chapel , went through a certain service in the Common Prayer Book , and [she]181-frances and [I]0-i came out married . [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten had given [the bride]3235-the bride away . [We]1598-our took no bridal trip ; [our]1598-our modesty , screened by the peaceful obscurity of [our]1598-our station , and the pleasant isolation of [our]1598-our circumstances , did not exact that additional precaution . [We]1598-our repaired at once to [a small house [I]0-i had taken]1601-a small house i had taken in [the faubourg nearest to [that part of [the city]2190-the city where the scene of [our]1598-our avocations lay]1603-that part of the city where the scene of our avocations lay]1602-the faubourg nearest to that part of the city where the scene of our avocations lay . Three or four hours after the wedding ceremony , [Frances]181-frances , divested of [her]181-frances bridal snow , and attired in a pretty lilac gown of warmer materials , a piquant black silk apron , and a lace collar with some finishing decoration of lilac ribbon , was kneeling on the carpet of [a neatly furnished though not spacious parlour]1605-a neatly furnished though not spacious parlour , arranging on the shelves of a chiffoniere some books , which [I]0-i handed to [her]181-frances from the table . It was snowing fast out of doors ; the afternoon had turned out wild and cold ; the leaden sky seemed full of drifts , and [the street]2240-the street was already ankle - deep in the white downfall . [Our]1598-our fire burned bright , [[our]1598-our new habitation]1607-our new habitation looked brilliantly clean and fresh , the furniture was all arranged , and there were but some articles of glass , china , books , & c. , to put in order . [Frances]181-frances found in this business occupation till tea - time , and then , after [I]0-i had distinctly instructed [her]181-frances how to make a cup of tea in rational English style , and after [she]181-frances had got over the dismay occasioned by seeing such an extravagant amount of material put into the pot , [she]181-frances administered to [me]0-i a proper British repast , at which there wanted neither candles nor urn , firelight nor comfort . [Our]1598-our week ’s holiday glided by , and [we]1598-our readdressed [ourselves]1598-our to labour . Both [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife and [I]0-i began in good earnest with the notion that [we]1598-our were [working people]1609-working people , destined to earn [our]1598-our bread by exertion , and that of the most assiduous kind . [Our]1598-our days were thoroughly occupied ; [we]1598-our used to part every morning at eight o’clock , and not meet again till five P.M. ; but into what sweet rest did the turmoil of each busy day decline ! Looking down the vista of memory , [I]0-i see the evenings passed in [that little parlour]1610-that little parlour like a long string of rubies circling the dusky brow of the past . Unvaried were [they]1611-they as each cut gem , and like each gem brilliant and burning . A year and a half passed . One morning ( it was a fête , and [we]1598-our had the day to [ourselves]1598-our ) [Frances]181-frances said to [me]0-i , with a suddenness peculiar to [her]181-frances when [she]181-frances had been thinking long on a subject , and at last , having come to a conclusion , wished to test its soundness by the touchstone of [my]0-i judgment : — “ [I]181-frances do n’t work enough . ”[181-frances] “ What now ? ”[0-i] demanded [I]0-i , looking up from [my]0-i coffee , which [I]0-i had been deliberately stirring while enjoying , in anticipation , a walk [I]0-i proposed to take with [Frances]181-frances , that fine summer day ( it was June ) , to [a certain farmhouse in [the country]334-the country]1612-a certain farmhouse in the country , where [we]1598-our were to dine . “ What now ? ”[0-i] and [I]0-i saw at once , in the serious ardour of [her]181-frances face , a project of vital importance . “ [I]181-frances am not satisfied , ”[181-frances] returned [she]181-frances ; “ [you]0-i are now earning eight thousand francs a year ”[181-frances] ( it was true ; [my]0-i efforts , punctuality , the fame of [[my]0-i pupils]2276-my pupils ’ progress , the publicity of [my]0-i station , had so far helped [me]0-i on ) , “ while [I]181-frances am still at [my]181-frances miserable twelve hundred francs . [I]181-frances can do better , and [I]181-frances will . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances work as long and as diligently as [I]181-frances do , [Frances]181-frances . ”[181-frances] “ Yes , [monsieur]638-monsieur , but [I]181-frances am not working in the right way , and [I]181-frances am convinced of it . ”[181-frances] “ [You]181-frances wish to change — [you]181-frances have a plan for progress in [your]181-frances mind ; go and put on [your]181-frances bonnet ; and , while [we]3454-we take [our]3454-we walk , [you]181-frances shall tell [me]181-frances of it . ”[181-frances] “ Yes , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[181-frances] [She]1615-her went — as docile as [a well - trained child]1616-a well - trained child ; [she]1615-her was a curious mixture of tractability and firmness : [I]0-i sat thinking about [her]1615-her , and wondering what [her]1615-her plan could be , when [she]1615-her re - entered . “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]1618-our bonne have given [Minnie]183-minnie ”[1618-our bonne] ( [[our]1617-our bonne]1618-our bonne ) “ leave to go out too , as it is so very fine ; so will [you]638-monsieur be kind enough to lock the door , and take the key with [you]638-monsieur ? ”[1615-her] “ Kiss [me]1615-her , [Mrs. Crimsworth]103-william , ”[1615-her] was [my]0-i not very apposite reply ; but [she]1615-her looked so engaging in [her]1615-her light summer dress and little cottage bonnet , and [her]1615-her manner in speaking to [me]0-i was then , as always , so unaffectedly and suavely respectful , that [my]0-i heart expanded at the sight of [her]1615-her , and a kiss seemed necessary to content its importunity . “ There , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[1615-her] “ Why do [you]638-monsieur always call [me]1615-her ‘ [Monsieur]3458-monsieur ’ ? Say , ‘ [William]103-william . ’ ”[1615-her] “ [I]183-minnie can not pronounce [your]638-monsieur W ; besides , ‘ [Monsieur]3459-monsieur ’ belongs to [you]638-monsieur ; [I]183-minnie like it best . ”[183-minnie] [Minnie]183-minnie having departed in clean cap and smart shawl , [we]1619-we , too , set out , leaving [the house]1897-the house solitary and silent — silent , at least , but for the ticking of the clock . [We]1619-we were soon clear of [Brussels]18-brussels ; [the fields]3096-the fields received [us]1619-we , and then [the lanes]1622-the lanes , remote from carriage - resounding chaussées . Ere long [we]1619-we came upon [a nook]1623-a nook , so rural , green , and secluded , [it]1623-a nook might have been a spot in [some pastoral English province]1624-some pastoral english province ; a bank of short and mossy grass , under a hawthorn , offered a seat too tempting to be declined ; [we]1619-we took it , and when [we]1619-we had admired and examined some English - looking wild - flowers growing at [our]1619-we feet , [I]0-i recalled [Frances]181-frances ’ attention and [my]0-i own to the topic touched on at breakfast . “ What was [her]181-frances plan ? ”[181-frances] A natural one — the next step to be mounted by [us]1619-we , or , at least , by [her]181-frances , if [she]181-frances wanted to rise in [her]181-frances profession . [She]181-frances proposed to begin [a school]2924-a school . [We]1619-we already had the means for commencing on a careful scale , having lived greatly within [our]1619-we income . [We]1619-we possessed , too , by this time , an extensive and eligible connection , in the sense advantageous to [our]1619-we business ; for , though [our]1619-we circle of visiting acquaintance continued as limited as ever , [we]1619-we were now widely known in [schools]3140-schools and [families]3141-families as [teachers]2258-teachers . When [Frances]181-frances had developed [her]181-frances plan , [she]181-frances intimated , in some closing sentences , [her]181-frances hopes for the future . If [we]1619-we only had good health and tolerable success , [me]0-i might , [she]181-frances was sure , in time realize an independency ; and that , perhaps , before [we]1619-we were too old to enjoy it ; then both [she]181-frances and [I]0-i would rest ; and what was to hinder [us]1619-we from going to live in [England]11-england ? [England]11-england was still [[her]181-frances Promised Land]1629-her promised land . [I]0-i put no obstacle in [her]181-frances way ; raised no objection ; [I]0-i knew [she]181-frances was not one who could live quiescent and inactive , or even comparatively inactive . Duties [she]181-frances must have to fulfil , and important duties ; work to do — and exciting , absorbing , profitable work ; strong faculties stirred in [her]181-frances frame , and [they]1630-them demanded full nourishment , free exercise : [mine]0-i was not the hand ever to starve or cramp them ; no , [I]0-i delighted in offering [them]1630-them sustenance , and in clearing [them]1630-them wider space for action . “ [You]181-frances have conceived a plan , [Frances]181-frances , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ and a good plan ; execute it ; [you]181-frances have [my]0-i free consent , and wherever and whenever [my]0-i assistance is wanted , ask and [you]181-frances shall have . ”[0-i] [Frances]181-frances ’ eyes thanked [me]0-i almost with tears ; just a sparkle or two , soon brushed away ; [she]181-frances possessed [herself]181-frances of [my]0-i hand too , and held it for some time very close clasped in both [her]181-frances own , but [she]181-frances said no more than “ Thank [you]0-i , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[181-frances] [We]1631-we passed a divine day , and came [home]1905-home late , lighted by a full summer moon . Ten years rushed now upon [me]0-i with dusty , vibrating , unresting wings ; years of bustle , action , unslacked endeavour ; years in which [I]0-i and [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife , having launched [ourselves]1631-we in the full career of progress , as progress whirls on in [European capitals]1634-european capitals , scarcely knew repose , were [strangers to amusement]1635-strangers to amusement , never thought of indulgence , and yet , as [our]1631-we course ran side by side , as [we]1631-we marched hand in hand , [we]1631-we neither murmured , repented , nor faltered . Hope indeed cheered [us]1631-we ; health kept [us]1631-we up ; harmony of thought and deed smoothed many difficulties , and finally , success bestowed every now and then encouraging reward on diligence . [[Our]1631-we school]1636-our school became [one of the most popular in [Brussels]18-brussels]1637-one of the most popular in brussels , and as by degrees [we]1631-we raised [our]1631-we terms and elevated [our]1631-we system of education , [our]1631-we choice of [pupils]2269-pupils grew more select , and at length included [the children of [the best families in [Belgium]21-belgium]1640-the best families in belgium]1639-the children of the best families in belgium . [We]1631-we had too an excellent connection in [England]11-england , first opened by the unsolicited recommendation of [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden , who having been over , and having abused [me]0-i for [my]0-i prosperity in set terms , went back , and soon after sent a leash of [young — — shire heiresses]1641-young — — shire heiresses — [[his]109-hunsden cousins]1642-his cousins ; as [he]109-hunsden said “ to be polished off by [Mrs. Crimsworth]103-william . ”[109-hunsden] As to this same [Mrs. Crimsworth]103-william , in one sense [she]103-william was become [another woman]1643-another woman , though in another [she]103-william remained unchanged . So different was [she]103-william under different circumstances . [I]0-i seemed to possess [two wives]1644-two wives . The faculties of [her]103-william nature , already disclosed when [I]0-i married [her]103-william , remained fresh and fair ; but other faculties shot up strong , branched out broad , and quite altered the external character of the plant . Firmness , activity , and enterprise , covered with grave foliage , poetic feeling and fervour ; but these flowers were still there , preserved pure and dewy under the umbrage of later growth and hardier nature : perhaps [I]0-i only in [the world]1872-the world knew the secret of their existence , but to [me]0-i [they]1646-they were ever ready to yield an exquisite fragrance and present a beauty as chaste as radiant . In the daytime [[my]0-i house]292-my house and establishment were conducted by [Madame the directress]1648-madame the directress , [a stately and elegant woman]1649-a stately and elegant woman , bearing much anxious thought on [her]1648-madame the directress large brow ; much calculated dignity in [her]1648-madame the directress serious mien : immediately after breakfast [I]0-i used to part with [this lady]1650-this lady ; [I]0-i went to [[my]0-i college]1651-my college , [she]1650-this lady to [[her]1650-this lady schoolroom]1652-her schoolroom ; returning for an hour in the course of the day , [I]0-i found [her]1650-this lady always in class , intently occupied ; silence , industry , observance , attending on [her]1650-this lady presence . When not actually teaching , [she]1650-this lady was overlooking and guiding by eye and gesture ; [she]1650-this lady then appeared vigilant and solicitous . When communicating instruction , [her]1650-this lady aspect was more animated ; [she]1650-this lady seemed to feel a certain enjoyment in the occupation . The language in which [she]1650-this lady addressed [[her]1650-this lady pupils]777-her pupils , though simple and unpretending , was never trite or dry ; [she]1650-this lady did not speak from routine formulas — [she]1650-this lady made [her]1650-this lady own phrases as [she]1650-this lady went on , and very nervous and impressive phrases they frequently were ; often , when elucidating favourite points of history , or geography , [she]1650-this lady would wax genuinely eloquent in [her]1650-this lady earnestness . [[Her]1650-this lady pupils]777-her pupils , or at least [[the elder]1655-the elder and more intelligent amongst [them]777-her pupils]1656-the elder and more intelligent amongst them , recognized well the language of a superior mind ; [they]777-her pupils felt too , and some of [them]777-her pupils received the impression of elevated sentiments ; there was little fondling between [mistress]1657-mistress and [girls]1658-girls , but [some of [[Frances]181-frances ’ pupils]1660-frances ’ pupils]1659-some of frances ’ pupils in time learnt to love [her]1650-this lady sincerely , [all of [them]1661-all of them]1661-all of them beheld [her]1650-this lady with respect ; [her]1650-this lady general demeanour towards [them]1661-all of them was serious ; sometimes benignant when [they]1661-all of them pleased [her]1650-this lady with [their]1661-all of them progress and attention , always scrupulously refined and considerate . In cases where reproof or punishment was called for [she]1650-this lady was usually forbearing enough ; but if any took advantage of that forbearance , which sometimes happened , a sharp , sudden and lightning - like severity taught [the culprit]1662-the culprit the extent of the mistake committed . Sometimes a gleam of tenderness softened [her]1650-this lady eyes and manner , but this was rare ; only when [a pupil]957-a pupil was sick , or when [it]957-a pupil pined after [home]1905-home , or in the case of [some little motherless child]1665-some little motherless child , or of one much poorer than [its companions , whose scanty wardrobe and mean appointments]1666-its companions , whose scanty wardrobe and mean appointments brought on it the contempt of [the jewelled young countesses]1667-the jewelled young countesses and [silk - clad misses]1668-silk - clad misses . Over [such feeble fledglings]1669-such feeble fledglings [the directress]2533-the directress spread a wing of kindliest protection : it was to [their]1669-such feeble fledglings bedside [she]2533-the directress came at night to tuck [them]1669-such feeble fledglings warmly in ; it was after [them]1669-such feeble fledglings [she]2533-the directress looked in winter to see that [they]1669-such feeble fledglings always had a comfortable seat by the stove ; it was [they]1669-such feeble fledglings who by turns were summoned to [the salon]2988-the salon to receive some little dole of cake or fruit — to sit on a footstool at the fireside — to enjoy [home comforts]1672-home comforts , and almost [home]1905-home liberty , for an evening together — to be spoken to gently and softly , comforted , encouraged , cherished — and when bedtime came , dismissed with a kiss of true tenderness . As to [Julia]262-julia and [Georgiana]263-georgiana G — — , [daughters of [an English baronet]1675-an english baronet]1674-daughters of an english baronet , as to [Mdlle]250-mdlle . henri . [Mathilde de —]264-mathilde de — — , [heiress of [a Belgian count]1677-a belgian count]1676-heiress of a belgian count , and [sundry other children of patrician race]1678-sundry other children of patrician race , [the directress]2533-the directress was careful of [them]1669-such feeble fledglings as of [the others]918-the others , anxious for [their]1669-such feeble fledglings progress , as for that of [the rest]1681-the rest — but it never seemed to enter [her]2533-the directress head to distinguish [them]1669-such feeble fledglings by a mark of preference ; [one girl of noble blood [she]2533-the directress loved]1682-one girl of noble blood she loved dearly — [a young Irish baroness]1683-a young irish baroness — [lady Catherine]265-lady catherine — — ; but it was for [her]2533-the directress enthusiastic heart and clever head , for [her]2533-the directress generosity and [her]2533-the directress genius , the title and rank went for nothing . [My]0-i afternoons were spent also in college , with the exception of an hour that [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife daily exacted of [me]0-i for [her]749-my wife establishment , and with which [she]749-my wife would not dispense . [She]749-my wife said that [I]0-i must spend that time amongst [[her]749-my wife pupils]777-her pupils to learn [their]777-her pupils characters , to be au courant with everything that was passing in [the house]1897-the house , to become interested in what interested [her]749-my wife , to be able to give [her]749-my wife [my]0-i opinion on knotty points when [she]749-my wife required it , and this [she]749-my wife did constantly , never allowing [my]0-i interest in [the pupils]2333-the pupils to fall asleep , and never making any change of importance without [my]0-i cognizance and consent . [She]749-my wife delighted to sit by [me]0-i when [I]0-i gave [my]0-i lessons ( lessons in literature ) , [her]749-my wife hands folded on [her]749-my wife knee , the most fixedly attentive of any present . [She]749-my wife rarely addressed [me]0-i in class ; when [she]749-my wife did it was with an air of marked deference ; it was [her]749-my wife pleasure , [her]749-my wife joy to make [me]0-i still [the master]2012-the master in all things . At six o’clock P.M. [my]0-i daily labours ceased . [I]0-i then came [home]1905-home , for [[my]0-i home]1690-my home was [[my]0-i heaven]1691-my heaven ; ever at that hour , as [I]0-i entered [[our]1692-our private sitting - room]1693-our private sitting - room , [the lady - directress]1694-the lady - directress vanished from before [my]0-i eyes , and [Frances Henri]181-frances , [[my]0-i own little lace - mender]1695-my own little lace - mender , was magically restored to [my]0-i arms ; much disappointed [she]749-my wife would have been if [[her]749-my wife master]3168-her master had not been as constant to the tryst as [herself]749-my wife , and if [his]3168-her master truthfull kiss had not been prompt to answer [her]749-my wife soft , “ Bon soir , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[3168-her master] Talk French to [me]0-i [she]749-my wife would , and many a punishment [she]749-my wife has had for [her]749-my wife wilfulness . [I]0-i fear the choice of chastisement must have been injudicious , for instead of correcting the fault , it seemed to encourage its renewal . [Our]1692-our evenings were [our]1692-our own ; that recreation was necessary to refresh [our]1692-our strength for the due discharge of [our]1692-our duties ; sometimes [we]1692-our spent them all in conversation , and [my]0-i young Genevese , now that [she]749-my wife was thoroughly accustomed to [[her]749-my wife English professor]1697-her english professor , now that [she]749-my wife loved [him]1697-her english professor too absolutely to fear [him]1697-her english professor much , reposed in [him]1697-her english professor a confidence so unlimited that topics of conversation could no more be wanting with [him]1697-her english professor than subjects for communion with [her]749-my wife own heart . In those moments , happy as a bird with its mate , [she]749-my wife would show [me]0-i what [she]749-my wife had of vivacity , of mirth , of originality in [her]749-my wife well - dowered nature . [She]749-my wife would show , too , some stores of raillery , of “ malice , ”[749-my wife] and would vex , tease , pique [me]0-i sometimes about what [she]749-my wife called [my]0-i “ bizarreries anglaises , ”[0-i] [my]0-i “ caprices insulaires , ”[749-my wife] with a wild and witty wickedness that made a perfect white demon of [her]749-my wife while it lasted . This was rare , however , and [the elfish freak]1698-the elfish freak was always short : sometimes when driven a little hard in the war of words — for [her]749-my wife tongue did ample justice to the pith , the point , the delicacy of [her]749-my wife native French , in which language [she]749-my wife always attacked [me]0-i — [I]0-i used to turn upon [her]749-my wife with [my]0-i old decision , and arrest bodily the sprite that teased [me]0-i . Vain idea ! no sooner had [I]0-i grasped hand or arm than [the elf]1699-the elf was gone ; the provocative smile quenched in the expressive brown eyes , and a ray of gentle homage shone under the lids in its place . [I]0-i had seized [a mere vexing fairy]1700-a mere vexing fairy , and found [a submissive and supplicating little mortal woman]1701-a submissive and supplicating little mortal woman in [my]0-i arms . Then [I]0-i made [her]749-my wife get a book , and read English to [me]0-i for an hour by way of penance . [I]0-i frequently dosed [her]749-my wife with [Wordsworth]266-wordsworth in this way , and [Wordsworth]266-wordsworth steadied [her]749-my wife soon ; [she]749-my wife had a difficulty in comprehending [his]266-wordsworth deep , serene , and sober mind ; [his]266-wordsworth language , too , was not facile to [her]749-my wife ; [she]749-my wife had to ask questions , to sue for explanations , to be like [a child]2855-a child and [a novice]1703-a novice , and to acknowledge [me]0-i as [[her]749-my wife senior and [director]1705-director]1704-her senior and director . [Her]749-my wife instinct instantly penetrated and possessed the meaning of [more ardent and imaginative writers]1706-more ardent and imaginative writers . [Byron]260-harriet byron excited [her]749-my wife ; [Scott]241-sir walter scott [she]749-my wife loved ; [Wordsworth]266-wordsworth only [she]749-my wife puzzled at , wondered over , and hesitated to pronounce an opinion upon . But whether [she]749-my wife read to [me]0-i , or talked with [me]0-i ; whether [she]749-my wife teased [me]0-i in French , or entreated [me]0-i in English ; whether [she]749-my wife jested with wit , or inquired with deference ; narrated with interest , or listened with attention ; whether [she]749-my wife smiled at [me]0-i or on [me]0-i , always at nine o’clock [I]0-i was left abandoned . [She]749-my wife would extricate [herself]749-my wife from [my]0-i arms , quit [my]0-i side , take [her]749-my wife lamp , and be gone . [Her]749-my wife mission was [upstairs]1160-upstairs ; [I]0-i have followed [her]749-my wife sometimes and watched [her]749-my wife . First [she]749-my wife opened the door of [the dortoir]1708-the dortoir ( [[the pupils]2333-the pupils ’ chamber]1710-the pupils ’ chamber ) , noiselessly [she]749-my wife glided up [the long room]1711-the long room between the two rows of white beds , surveyed [all the sleepers]1712-all the sleepers ; if any were wakeful , especially if any were sad , spoke to [them]1712-all the sleepers and soothed [them]1712-all the sleepers ; stood some minutes to ascertain that all was safe and tranquil ; trimmed the watch - light which burned in [the apartment]2410-the apartment all night , then withdrew , closing the door behind [her]749-my wife without sound . Thence [she]749-my wife glided to [[our]1714-our own chamber]1715-our own chamber ; it had a little cabinet within ; this [she]749-my wife sought ; there , too , appeared a bed , but one , and that a very small one ; [her]749-my wife face ( the night [I]0-i followed and observed [her]749-my wife ) changed as [she]749-my wife approached this tiny couch ; from grave it warmed to earnest ; [she]749-my wife shaded with one hand the lamp [she]749-my wife held in the other ; [she]749-my wife bent above the pillow and hung over [a child asleep]1716-a child asleep ; [its]1716-a child asleep slumber ( that evening at least , and usually , [I]0-i believe ) was sound and calm ; no tear wet [its]1716-a child asleep dark eyelashes ; no fever heated its round cheek ; no ill dream discomposed its budding features . [Frances]181-frances gazed , [she]181-frances did not smile , and yet the deepest delight filled , flushed [her]181-frances face ; feeling pleasurable , powerful , worked in [her]181-frances whole frame , which still was motionless . [I]0-i saw , indeed , [her]749-my wife heart heave , [her]749-my wife lips were a little apart , [her]749-my wife breathing grew somewhat hurried ; [the child]3286-the child smiled ; then at last [the mother]3184-the mother smiled too , and said in low soliloquy , “ God bless [[my]3184-the mother little son]3462-my little son ! ”[3184-the mother] [She]749-my wife stooped closer over [him]3286-the child , breathed the softest of kisses on [his]3286-the child brow , covered [his]3286-the child minute hand with [hers]749-my wife , and at last started up and came away . [I]0-i regained [the parlour before [her]749-my wife]1719-the parlour before her . Entering [it]1719-the parlour before her two minutes later [she]749-my wife said quietly as [she]749-my wife put down [her]749-my wife extinguished lamp — “ [Victor]239-victor rests well : [he]239-victor smiled in [his]239-victor sleep ; [he]239-victor has [your]0-i smile , [monsieur]638-monsieur . ”[749-my wife] The said [Victor]239-victor was of course [[her]749-my wife own boy]1720-her own boy , born in the third year of [our]1721-our marriage : [his]239-victor Christian name had been given [him]239-victor in honour of [M. Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten , who continued always [[our]1721-our trusty and well - beloved friend]1722-our trusty and well - beloved friend . [Frances]181-frances was then [a good and dear wife to [me]0-i]1723-a good and dear wife to me , because [I]0-i was to [her]181-frances [a good , just , and faithful husband]1724-a good , just , and faithful husband . What [she]181-frances would have been had [she]181-frances married [a harsh , envious , careless man]1725-a harsh , envious , careless man — [a profligate]1726-a profligate , [a prodigal]1727-a prodigal , [a drunkard]1728-a drunkard , or [a tyrant]535-a tyrant — is another question , and one which [I]0-i once propounded to [her]181-frances . [Her]181-frances answer , given after some reflection , was — “ [I]181-frances should have tried to endure the evil or cure it for awhile ; and when [I]181-frances found it intolerable and incurable , [I]181-frances should have left [[my]181-frances torturer]3464-my torturer suddenly and silently . ”[181-frances] “ And if law or might had forced [you]181-frances back again ? ”[181-frances] “ What , to [a drunkard]1728-a drunkard , [a profligate]1726-a profligate , [a selfish spendthrift]3467-a selfish spendthrift , [an unjust fool]3468-an unjust fool ? ”[181-frances] “ Yes . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances would have gone back ; again assured [myself]181-frances whether or not [his]3464-my torturer vice and [my]181-frances misery were capable of remedy ; and if not , have left [him]3464-my torturer again . ”[181-frances] “ And if again forced to return , and compelled to abide ? ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances do n’t know , ”[181-frances] [she]181-frances said , hastily . “ Why do [you]0-i ask [me]181-frances , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[181-frances] [I]0-i would have an answer , because [I]0-i saw a strange kind of spirit in [her]181-frances eye , whose voice [I]0-i determined to waken . “ [Monsieur]638-monsieur , if [a wife]1545-a wife ’s nature loathes that of [the man [she]1545-a wife is wedded to]3472-the man she is wedded to , marriage must be slavery . Against slavery all right thinkers revolt , and though torture be the price of resistance , torture must be dared : though the only road to freedom lie through the gates of death , those gates must be passed ; for freedom is indispensable . Then , [monsieur]638-monsieur , [I]0-i would resist as far as [my]0-i strength permitted ; when that strength failed [I]0-i should be sure of a refuge . Death would certainly screen [me]0-i both from bad laws and their consequences . ”[0-i] “ Voluntary death , [Frances]181-frances ? ”[181-frances] “ No , [monsieur]638-monsieur . [I]181-frances ’d have courage to live out every throe of anguish fate assigned [me]181-frances , and principle to contend for justice and liberty to the last . ”[181-frances] “ [I]0-i see [you]181-frances would have made [no patient Grizzle]3475-no patient grizzle . And now , supposing fate had merely assigned [you]181-frances the lot of [an old maid]3476-an old maid , what then ? How would [you]181-frances have liked celibacy ? ”[0-i] “ Not much , certainly . [An old maid]3476-an old maid ’s life must doubtless be void and vapid — [her]3476-an old maid heart strained and empty . Had [I]1730-i been [an old maid]3476-an old maid [I]1730-i should have spent existence in efforts to fill the void and ease the aching . [I]1730-i should have probably failed , and died weary and disappointed , despised and of no account , like [other single women]3479-other single women . But [I]1730-i ’m not [an old maid]3476-an old maid , ”[1730-i] [she]1730-i added quickly . “ [I]1730-i should have been , though , but for [[my]1730-i master]1318-my master . [I]1730-i should never have suited [any man]3254-any man but [Professor Crimsworth]267-professor crimsworth — [no other gentleman]3483-no other gentleman , French , English , or [Belgian]268-belgian , would have thought [me]1730-i amiable or handsome ; and [I]1730-i doubt whether [I]1730-i should have cared for the approbation of [many others]3484-many others , if [I]1730-i could have obtained it . Now , [I]1730-i have been [[Professor Crimsworth]267-professor crimsworth ’s wife]3485-professor crimsworth ’s wife eight years , and what is [he]267-professor crimsworth in [my]1730-i eyes ? Is [he]267-professor crimsworth honourable , [beloved]3486-beloved — — ? ”[1730-i] [She]1731-her stopped , [her]1731-her voice was cut off , [her]1731-her eyes suddenly suffused . [She]1731-her and [I]0-i were standing side by side ; [she]1731-her threw [her]1731-her arms round [me]0-i , and strained [me]0-i to [her]1731-her heart with passionate earnestness : the energy of [her]1731-her whole being glowed in [her]1731-her dark and then dilated eye , and crimsoned [her]1731-her animated cheek ; [her]1731-her look and movement were like inspiration ; in one there was such a flash , in the other such a power . Half an hour afterwards , when [she]1731-her had become calm , [I]0-i asked where all that wild vigour was gone which had transformed [her]1731-her ere - while and made [her]1731-her glance so thrilling and ardent — [her]1731-her action so rapid and strong . [She]1731-her looked down , smiling softly and passively : — “ [I]1731-her can not tell where it is gone , [monsieur]638-monsieur , ”[1731-her] said [she]1731-her , “ but [I]1731-her know that , whenever it is wanted , it will come back again . ”[1731-her] Behold [us]1732-we now at the close of the ten years , and [we]1732-we have realized an independency . The rapidity with which [we]1732-we attained this end had its origin in three reasons : — Firstly , [we]1732-we worked so hard for it ; secondly , [we]1732-we had no incumbrances to delay success ; thirdly , as soon as [we]1732-we had capital to invest , [two well - skilled counsellors]1733-two well - skilled counsellors , one in [Belgium]21-belgium , one in [England]11-england , viz . [Vandenhuten]228-m. vandenhuten and [Hunsden]109-hunsden , gave [us]1732-we each a word of advice as to the sort of investment to be chosen . The suggestion made was judicious ; and , being promptly acted on , the result proved gainful — [I]0-i need not say how gainful ; [I]0-i communicated details to [Messrs. Vandenhuten]269-messrs. vandenhuten and [Hunsden]109-hunsden ; [nobody else]1734-nobody else can be interested in hearing [them]1735-them . Accounts being wound up , and [our]1732-we professional connection disposed of , [we]1732-we both agreed that , as [mammon]108-mammon was not [[our]1732-we master]1736-our master , nor [his]108-mammon service that in which [we]1732-we desired to spend [our]1732-we lives ; as [our]1732-we desires were temperate , and [our]1732-we habits unostentatious , [we]1732-we had now abundance to live on — abundance to leave [[our]1732-we boy]1737-our boy ; and should besides always have a balance on hand , which , properly managed by right sympathy and unselfish activity , might help philanthropy in [her]1738-her enterprises , and put solace into the hand of charity . To [England]11-england [we]1732-we now resolved to take wing ; [we]1732-we arrived [there]1998-there safely ; [Frances]181-frances realized the dream of [her]181-frances lifetime . [We]1732-we spent a whole summer and autumn in travelling from end to end of [the British islands]1740-the british islands , and afterwards passed a winter in [London]19-london . Then [we]1732-we thought it high time to fix [[our]1732-we residence]1741-our residence . [My]0-i heart yearned towards [[my]0-i native [county of — — shire]1743-county of — — shire]1742-my native county of — — shire ; and it is in — — [shire]1744-shire [I]0-i now live ; it is in [the library of [[my]0-i own home]1746-my own home]1745-the library of my own home [I]0-i am now writing .
