[That home]1747-that home lies amid [a sequestered and rather hilly region]1748-a sequestered and rather hilly region , thirty miles removed from [X]7-x — — ; [a region whose verdure the smoke of [mills]1970-mills has not yet sullied , whose waters still run pure , whose swells of moorland]1749-a region whose verdure the smoke of mills has not yet sullied , whose waters still run pure , whose swells of moorland preserve in [some ferny glens that lie between them the very primal wildness of nature]1751-some ferny glens that lie between them the very primal wildness of nature , [her]1752-her moss , [her]1752-her bracken , [her]1752-her blue - bells , [her]1752-her scents of reed and heather , [her]1752-her free and fresh breezes . [[My]0-i house]292-my house is [a picturesque and not too spacious dwelling , with low and long windows , a trellised and leaf - veiled porch over the front door]1754-a picturesque and not too spacious dwelling , with low and long windows , a trellised and leaf - veiled porch over the front door , just now , on this summer evening , looking like an arch of roses and ivy . [The garden]2422-the garden is chiefly laid out in lawn , formed of the sod of [the hills]1756-the hills , with herbage short and soft as moss , full of its own peculiar flowers , tiny and starlike , imbedded in the minute embroidery of their fine foliage . At the bottom of [the sloping garden]1757-the sloping garden there is a wicket , which opens upon [a lane as green as the lawn]1758-a lane as green as the lawn , very long , shady , and little frequented ; on the turf of [this lane]1759-this lane generally appear the first daisies of spring — whence [its]1759-this lane name — [Daisy Lane]81-daisy lane ; serving also as a distinction to [the house]1897-the house . It terminates ( [the lane]2473-the lane [I]0-i mean ) in [a valley full of wood]1762-a valley full of wood ; which wood — chiefly oak and beech — spreads shadowy about the vicinage of [a very old mansion]1763-a very old mansion , one of the Elizabethan structures , much larger , as well as more antique than [Daisy Lane]81-daisy lane , [the property and residence of]1764-the property and residence of [an individual familiar both to [me]0-i and to [the reader]2032-the reader]1765-an individual familiar both to me and to the reader . Yes , in [Hunsden Wood]82-hunsden wood — for so are those glades and [that grey building , with many gables and more chimneys]1767-that grey building , with many gables and more chimneys , named — abides [Yorke Hunsden]83-yorke hunsden , still unmarried ; never , [I]0-i suppose , having yet found [his]83-yorke hunsden ideal , though [I]0-i know at least a score of [young ladies within a circuit of forty miles , who would be willing to assist [him]83-yorke hunsden in the search]1768-young ladies within a circuit of forty miles , who would be willing to assist him in the search . [The estate]1769-the estate fell to [him]83-yorke hunsden by the death of [[his]83-yorke hunsden father]411-his father , five years since ; [he]83-yorke hunsden has given up trade , after having made by it sufficient to pay off some incumbrances by which the family heritage was burdened . [I]0-i say [he]83-yorke hunsden abides here , but [I]0-i do not think [he]83-yorke hunsden is resident above five months out of the twelve ; [he]83-yorke hunsden wanders from [land to land]1771-land to land , and spends some part of each winter in [town]699-town : [he]83-yorke hunsden frequently brings [visitors]1773-visitors with [him]83-yorke hunsden when [he]83-yorke hunsden comes to — — [shire]1744-shire , and [these visitors]1775-these visitors are often [foreigners]1441-foreigners ; sometimes [he]83-yorke hunsden has [a German metaphysician]1777-a german metaphysician , sometimes [a French savant]1778-a french savant ; [he]83-yorke hunsden had once [a dissatisfied and savage - looking Italian , who neither sang nor played]1779-a dissatisfied and savage - looking italian , who neither sang nor played , and of whom [Frances]181-frances affirmed that [he]83-yorke hunsden had “ tout l’air d’un conspirateur . ”[83-yorke hunsden] What [English guests]1780-english guests [Hunsden]109-hunsden invites , are all either [men of [Birmingham]75-birmingham or [Manchester]76-manchester]1781-men of birmingham or manchester — [hard men , seemingly knit up in one thought , whose talk is of free trade]1782-hard men , seemingly knit up in one thought , whose talk is of free trade . [The foreign visitors]1783-the foreign visitors , too , are [politicians]1784-politicians ; [they]1783-the foreign visitors take a wider theme — European progress — the spread of liberal sentiments over [the Continent]84-the continent ; on [their]1783-the foreign visitors mental tablets , the names of [Russia]85-russia , [Austria]86-austria , and [the Pope]1785-the pope , are inscribed in red ink . [I]0-i have heard some of [them]1783-the foreign visitors talk vigorous sense — yea , [I]0-i have been present at polyglot discussions in [the old , oak - lined dining - room at [Hunsden Wood]82-hunsden wood]1786-the old , oak - lined dining - room at hunsden wood , where a singular insight was given of the sentiments entertained by resolute minds respecting old northern despotisms , and old southern superstitions : also , [I]0-i have heard much twaddle , enounced chiefly in French and [Deutsch]87-deutsch , but let that pass . [Hunsden]109-hunsden [himself]109-hunsden tolerated [the drivelling theorists]1787-the drivelling theorists ; with [the practical men]1788-the practical men [he]109-hunsden seemed leagued hand and heart . When [Hunsden]109-hunsden is staying alone at [the Wood]1789-the wood ( which seldom happens ) [he]109-hunsden generally finds [his]109-hunsden way two or three times a week to [Daisy Lane]81-daisy lane . [He]109-hunsden has a philanthropic motive for coming to smoke [his]109-hunsden cigar in [[our]1790-we porch]1791-our porch on summer evenings ; [he]109-hunsden says [he]109-hunsden does it to kill the earwigs amongst the roses , with which insects , but for [his]109-hunsden benevolent fumigations , [he]109-hunsden intimates [we]1790-we should certainly be overrun . On wet days , too , [we]1790-we are almost sure to see [him]109-hunsden ; according to [him]109-hunsden , it gets on time to work [me]0-i into lunacy by treading on [my]0-i mental corns , or to force from [Mrs. Crimsworth]103-william revelations of the dragon within [her]103-william , by insulting the memory of [Hofer]270-hofer and [Tell]257-tell . [We]1790-we also go frequently to [Hunsden Wood]82-hunsden wood , and both [I]0-i and [Frances]181-frances relish a visit [there]1998-there highly . If there are [other guests]1793-other guests , [their]1793-other guests characters are an interesting study ; [their]1793-other guests conversation is exciting and strange ; the absence of all local narrowness both in [the host]1794-the host and [[his]109-hunsden chosen society]1795-his chosen society gives a metropolitan , almost a cosmopolitan freedom and largeness to the talk . [Hunsden]109-hunsden [himself]109-hunsden is [a polite man in [[his]109-hunsden own house]1797-his own house]1796-a polite man in his own house : [he]109-hunsden has , when [he]109-hunsden chooses to employ it , an inexhaustible power of entertaining [guests]1798-guests ; [[his]109-hunsden very mansion]1799-his very mansion too is interesting , [the rooms]1800-the rooms look storied , the passages legendary , [the low - ceiled chambers , with [their]1801-the low - ceiled chambers , with their long rows of diamond - paned lattices long rows of diamond - paned lattices]1801-the low - ceiled chambers , with their long rows of diamond - paned lattices , have an old - world , haunted air : in [his]109-hunsden travels [he]109-hunsden has collected stores of articles of vertu , which are well and tastefully disposed in [[his]109-hunsden panelled or tapestried rooms]1802-his panelled or tapestried rooms : [I]0-i have seen there one or two pictures , and one or two pieces of statuary which [many an aristocratic connoisseur]1803-many an aristocratic connoisseur might have envied . When [I]0-i and [Frances]181-frances have dined and spent an evening with [Hunsden]109-hunsden , [he]109-hunsden often walks [home]1905-home with [us]1805-us . [[His]109-hunsden wood]1806-his wood is large , and some of the timber is old and of huge growth . There are winding ways in [it]1806-his wood which , pursued through glade and brake , make the walk back to [Daisy Lane]81-daisy lane a somewhat long one . Many a time , when [we]1805-us have had the benefit of a full moon , and when the night has been mild and balmy , when , moreover , [a certain nightingale]1807-a certain nightingale has been singing , and a certain stream , hid in alders , has lent the song a soft accompaniment , the remote church - bell of [the one hamlet in [a district of ten miles]1809-a district of ten miles]1808-the one hamlet in a district of ten miles , has tolled midnight ere [the lord of the wood]1810-the lord of the wood left [us]1805-us at [[our]1805-us porch]1791-our porch . Free - flowing was [his]109-hunsden talk at such hours , and far more quiet and gentle than in the day - time and before numbers . [He]109-hunsden would then forget politics and discussion , and would dwell on the past times of [[his]109-hunsden house]2046-his house , on [his]109-hunsden family history , on [himself]109-hunsden and [his]109-hunsden own feelings — subjects each and all invested with a peculiar zest , for [they]1813-they were each and all unique . One glorious night in June , after [I]0-i had been taunting [him]109-hunsden about [[his]109-hunsden ideal bride]1814-his ideal bride and asking [him]109-hunsden when [she]1814-his ideal bride would come and graft [her]1814-his ideal bride foreign beauty on the old [Hunsden]109-hunsden oak , [he]109-hunsden answered suddenly — “ [You]0-i call [her]1814-his ideal bride ideal ; but see , here is [her]1814-his ideal bride shadow ; and there can not be a shadow without a substance . ”[109-hunsden] [He]109-hunsden had led [us]1815-us from the depth of the “ winding way ”[109-hunsden] into [a glade]1816-a glade from whence the beeches withdrew , leaving [it]1816-a glade open to the sky ; an unclouded moon poured [her]1814-his ideal bride light into [this glade]1817-this glade , and [Hunsden]109-hunsden held out under [her]1814-his ideal bride beam an ivory miniature . [Frances]181-frances , with eagerness , examined it first ; then [she]181-frances gave it to [me]0-i — still , however , pushing [her]181-frances little face close to [mine]0-i , and seeking in [my]0-i eyes what [I]0-i thought of the portrait . [I]0-i thought it represented a very handsome and very individual - looking female face , with , as [he]109-hunsden had once said , “ straight and harmonious features . ”[109-hunsden] It was dark ; the hair , raven - black , swept not only from the brow , but from the temples — seemed thrust away carelessly , as if such beauty dispensed with , nay , despised arrangement . The Italian eye looked straight into [you]1818-you , and an independent , determined eye it was ; the mouth was as firm as fine ; the chin ditto . On the back of the miniature was gilded “ [Lucia]271-lucia . ”[0-i] “ That is a real head , ”[0-i] was [my]0-i conclusion . [Hunsden]109-hunsden smiled . “ [I]109-hunsden think so , ”[109-hunsden] [he]109-hunsden replied . “ All was real in [Lucia]271-lucia . ”[109-hunsden] “ And [she]271-lucia was somebody [you]109-hunsden would have liked to marry — but could not ? ”[0-i] “ [I]109-hunsden should certainly have liked to marry [her]271-lucia , and that [I]109-hunsden have not done so is a proof that [I]109-hunsden could not . ”[109-hunsden] [He]109-hunsden repossessed [himself]109-hunsden of the miniature , now again in [Frances]181-frances ’ hand , and put it away . “ What do [you]749-my wife think of it ? ”[109-hunsden] [he]109-hunsden asked of [[my]0-i wife]749-my wife , as [he]109-hunsden buttoned [his]109-hunsden coat over it . “ [I]109-hunsden am sure [Lucia]271-lucia once wore chains and broke them , ”[109-hunsden] was the strange answer . “ [I]181-frances do not mean matrimonial chains , ”[181-frances] [she]181-frances added , correcting [herself]181-frances , as if [she]181-frances feared mis - interpretation , “ but social chains of some sort . The face is that of [one who has made an effort , and a successful and triumphant effort]3488-one who has made an effort , and a successful and triumphant effort , to wrest [some vigorous and valued faculty]3489-some vigorous and valued faculty from insupportable constraint ; and when [[Lucia]271-lucia ’s faculty]3490-lucia ’s faculty got free , [I]181-frances am certain it spread wide pinions and carried [her]271-lucia higher than — ”[181-frances] [she]181-frances hesitated . “ Than what ? ”[109-hunsden] demanded [Hunsden]109-hunsden . “ Than ‘ les convenances ’ permitted [you]109-hunsden to follow . ”[109-hunsden] “ [I]181-frances think [you]109-hunsden grow spiteful — impertinent . ”[181-frances] “ [Lucia]271-lucia has trodden the stage , ”[181-frances] continued [Frances]181-frances . “ [You]109-hunsden never seriously thought of marrying [her]271-lucia ; [you]109-hunsden admired [her]271-lucia originality , [her]271-lucia fearlessness , [her]271-lucia energy of body and mind ; [you]109-hunsden delighted in [her]271-lucia talent , whatever that was , whether song , dance , or dramatic representation ; [you]109-hunsden worshipped [her]271-lucia beauty , which was of the sort after [your]109-hunsden own heart : but [I]181-frances am sure [she]271-lucia filled a sphere from whence [you]109-hunsden would never have thought of taking [a wife]1545-a wife . ”[181-frances] “ Ingenious , ”[109-hunsden] remarked [Hunsden]109-hunsden ; “ whether true or not is another question . Meantime , do n’t [you]109-hunsden feel [your]109-hunsden little lamp of a spirit wax very pale , beside such a girandole as [Lucia]271-lucia ’s ? ”[109-hunsden] “ Yes . ”[181-frances] “ Candid , at least ; and [the Professor]2273-the professor will soon be dissatisfied with the dim light [you]109-hunsden give ? ”[181-frances] “ Will [you]109-hunsden , [monsieur]638-monsieur ? ”[181-frances] “ [My]181-frances sight was always too weak to endure a blaze , [Frances]181-frances , ”[181-frances] and [we]1820-we had now reached the wicket . [I]0-i said , a few pages back , that this is a sweet summer evening ; it is — there has been a series of lovely days , and this is the loveliest ; the hay is just carried from [[my]0-i fields]1821-my fields , its perfume still lingers in the air . [Frances]181-frances proposed to [me]0-i , an hour or two since , to take tea out on [the lawn]1898-the lawn ; [I]0-i see the round table , loaded with china , placed under a certain beech ; [Hunsden]109-hunsden is expected — nay , [I]0-i hear [he]109-hunsden is come — there is [his]109-hunsden voice , laying down the law on some point with authority ; that of [Frances]181-frances replies ; [she]181-frances opposes [him]109-hunsden of course . [They]1823-they are disputing about [Victor]239-victor , of whom [Hunsden]109-hunsden affirms that [[his]109-hunsden mother]409-his mother is making a milksop . [Mrs. Crimsworth]103-william retaliates : — “ Better a thousand times [he]239-victor should be [a milksop]3494-a milksop than what [he]239-victor , [Hunsden]109-hunsden , calls ‘ [a fine lad]3495-a fine lad ; ’ and moreover [she]103-william says that if [Hunsden]109-hunsden were to become a fixture in [the neighbourhood]3496-the neighbourhood , and were not [a mere comet , coming and going]3497-a mere comet , coming and going , [no one]757-no one knows how , when , where , or why , [she]103-william should be quite uneasy till [she]103-william had got [Victor]239-victor away to [a school at least a hundred miles off]3499-a school at least a hundred miles off ; for that with [his]109-hunsden mutinous maxims and unpractical dogmas , [he]109-hunsden would ruin a score of [children]3500-children . ”[103-william] [I]0-i have a word to say of [Victor]239-victor ere [I]0-i shut this manuscript in [my]0-i desk — but it must be a brief one , for [I]0-i hear the tinkle of silver on porcelain . [Victor]239-victor is as little of [a pretty child]1825-a pretty child as [I]0-i am of [a handsome man]1982-a handsome man , or [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother of [a fine woman]1828-a fine woman ; [he]239-victor is pale and spare , with large eyes , as dark as those of [Frances]181-frances , and as deeply set as [mine]0-i . [His]239-victor shape is symmetrical enough , but slight ; [his]239-victor health is good . [I]0-i never saw [a child]2855-a child smile less than [he]239-victor does , nor [one who knits such a formidable brow when sitting over a book that interests [him]239-victor , or while listening to tales of adventure , peril , or wonder , narrated by [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother]1830-one who knits such a formidable brow when sitting over a book that interests him , or while listening to tales of adventure , peril , or wonder , narrated by his mother , [Hunsden]109-hunsden , or [myself]0-i . But though still , [he]239-victor is not unhappy — though serious , not morose ; [he]239-victor has a susceptibility to pleasurable sensations almost too keen , for it amounts to enthusiasm . [He]239-victor learned to read in the old - fashioned way out of a spelling - book at [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother ’s knee , and as [he]239-victor got on without driving by that method , [she]409-his mother thought it unnecessary to buy [him]239-victor ivory letters , or to try any of the other inducements to learning now deemed indispensable . When [he]239-victor could read , [he]239-victor became a glutton of books , and is so still . [His]239-victor toys have been few , and [he]239-victor has never wanted more . For those [he]239-victor possesses , [he]239-victor seems to have contracted a partiality amounting to affection ; this feeling , directed towards one or two living animals of [the house]1897-the house , strengthens almost to a passion . [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden gave [him]239-victor a mastiff cub , which [he]109-hunsden called [Yorke]115-yorke , after [the donor]1834-the donor ; it grew to a superb dog , whose fierceness , however , was much modified by the companionship and caresses of [its young master]1835-its young master . [He]239-victor would go nowhere , do nothing without [Yorke]115-yorke ; [Yorke]115-yorke lay at [his]239-victor feet while [he]239-victor learned [his]239-victor lessons , played with [him]239-victor in [the garden]2422-the garden , walked with [him]239-victor in [the lane and wood]1837-the lane and wood , sat near [his]239-victor chair at meals , was fed always by [his]239-victor own hand , was the first thing [he]239-victor sought in the morning , the last [he]239-victor left at night . [Yorke]115-yorke accompanied [Mr. Hunsden]109-hunsden one day to [X]7-x — — , and was bitten in [the street]2240-the street by a dog in a rabid state . As soon as [Hunsden]109-hunsden had brought [him]115-yorke [home]1905-home , and had informed [me]0-i of the circumstance , [I]0-i went into [the yard]2127-the yard and shot [him]115-yorke where [he]115-yorke lay licking [his]115-yorke wound : [he]115-yorke was dead in an instant ; [he]115-yorke had not seen [me]0-i level the gun ; [I]0-i stood behind [him]115-yorke . [I]0-i had scarcely been ten minutes in [the house]1897-the house , when [my]0-i ear was struck with sounds of anguish : [I]0-i repaired to [the yard]2127-the yard once more , for [they]1843-they proceeded thence . [Victor]239-victor was kneeling beside [his]239-victor dead mastiff , bent over it , embracing its bull - like neck , and lost in a passion of the wildest woe : [he]239-victor saw [me]0-i . “ Oh , [papa]3501-papa , [I]239-victor ’ll never forgive [you]3501-papa ! [I]239-victor ’ll never forgive [you]3501-papa ! ”[239-victor] was [his]239-victor exclamation . “ [You]3501-papa shot [Yorke]115-yorke — [I]239-victor saw it from the window . [I]239-victor never believed [you]3501-papa could be so cruel — [I]239-victor can love [you]3501-papa no more ! ”[239-victor] [I]0-i had much ado to explain to [him]239-victor , with a steady voice , the stern necessity of the deed ; [he]239-victor still , with that inconsolable and bitter accent which [I]0-i can not render , but which pierced [my]0-i heart , repeated — “ [He]239-victor might have been cured — [you]3501-papa should have tried — [you]3501-papa should have burnt the wound with a hot iron , or covered it with caustic . [You]3501-papa gave no time ; and now it is too late — [he]239-victor is dead ! ”[239-victor] [He]239-victor sank fairly down on the senseless carcase ; [I]0-i waited patiently a long while , till [his]239-victor grief had somewhat exhausted [him]239-victor ; and then [I]0-i lifted [him]239-victor in [my]0-i arms and carried [him]239-victor to [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother , sure that [she]409-his mother would comfort [him]239-victor best . [She]409-his mother had witnessed the whole scene from a window ; [she]409-his mother would not come out for fear of increasing [my]0-i difficulties by [her]409-his mother emotion , but [she]409-his mother was ready now to receive [him]239-victor . [She]409-his mother took [him]239-victor to [her]409-his mother kind heart , and on to [her]409-his mother gentle lap ; consoled [him]239-victor but with [her]409-his mother lips , [her]409-his mother eyes , [her]409-his mother soft embrace , for some time ; and then , when [his]239-victor sobs diminished , told [him]239-victor that [Yorke]115-yorke had felt no pain in dying , and that if [he]115-yorke had been left to expire naturally , [his]115-yorke end would have been most horrible ; above all , [she]409-his mother told [him]239-victor that [I]0-i was not cruel ( for that idea seemed to give exquisite pain to [poor Victor]239-victor ) , that it was [my]0-i affection for [Yorke]115-yorke and [him]239-victor which had made [me]0-i act so , and that [I]0-i was now almost heart - broken to see [him]239-victor weep thus bitterly . [Victor]239-victor would have been [no true son of [[his]239-victor father]411-his father]1845-no true son of his father , had these considerations , these reasons , breathed in so low , so sweet a tone — married to caresses so benign , so tender — to looks so inspired with pitying sympathy — produced no effect on [him]239-victor . They did produce an effect : [he]239-victor grew calmer , rested [his]239-victor face on [her]409-his mother shoulder , and lay still in [her]409-his mother arms . Looking up , shortly , [he]239-victor asked [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother to tell [him]239-victor over again what [she]409-his mother had said about [Yorke]115-yorke having suffered no pain , and [my]0-i not being cruel ; the balmy words being repeated , [he]239-victor again pillowed [his]239-victor cheek on [her]409-his mother breast , and was again tranquil . Some hours after , [he]239-victor came to [me]0-i in [[my]0-i library]1848-my library , asked if [I]0-i forgave [him]239-victor , and desired to be reconciled . [I]0-i drew [the lad]616-the lad to [my]0-i side , and there [I]0-i kept [him]616-the lad a good while , and had much talk with [him]616-the lad , in the course of which [he]239-victor disclosed many points of feeling and thought [I]0-i approved of in [[my]0-i son]1850-my son . [I]0-i found , it is true , few elements of [the “ good fellow ”]3502-the “ good fellow ”[3502-the “ good fellow ”] or [the “ fine fellow ”]3503-the “ fine fellow ”[3503-the “ fine fellow ”] in [him]239-victor ; scant sparkles of the spirit which loves to flash over the wine cup , or which kindles the passions to a destroying fire ; but [I]0-i saw in the soil of [his]239-victor heart healthy and swelling germs of compassion , affection , fidelity . [I]0-i discovered in [the garden of [his]239-victor intellect]1851-the garden of his intellect a rich growth of wholesome principles — reason , justice , moral courage , promised , if not blighted , a fertile bearing . So [I]0-i bestowed on [his]239-victor large forehead , and on [his]239-victor cheek — still pale with tears — a proud and contented kiss , and sent [him]239-victor away comforted . Yet [I]0-i saw [him]239-victor the next day laid on [the mound under which [Yorke]115-yorke had been buried]1852-the mound under which yorke had been buried , [his]239-victor face covered with [his]239-victor hands ; [he]239-victor was melancholy for some weeks , and more than a year elapsed before [he]239-victor would listen to any proposal of having another dog . [Victor]239-victor learns fast . [He]239-victor must soon go to [Eton]1-eton , where , [I]0-i suspect , [his]239-victor first year or two will be utter wretchedness : to leave [me]0-i , [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother , and [[his]239-victor home]1854-his home , will give [his]239-victor heart an agonized wrench ; then , the fagging will not suit [him]239-victor — but emulation , thirst after knowledge , the glory of success , will stir and reward [him]239-victor in time . Meantime , [I]0-i feel in [myself]0-i a strong repugnance to fix the hour which will uproot [my]0-i sole olive branch , and transplant it far from [me]0-i ; and , when [I]0-i speak to [Frances]181-frances on the subject , [I]0-i am heard with a kind of patient pain , as though [I]0-i alluded to some fearful operation , at which [her]181-frances nature shudders , but from which [her]181-frances fortitude will not permit [her]181-frances to recoil . The step must , however , be taken , and it shall be ; for , though [Frances]181-frances will not make a milksop of [[her]181-frances son]2371-her son , [she]181-frances will accustom [him]2371-her son to a style of treatment , a forbearance , a congenial tenderness , [he]2371-her son will meet with from none else . [She]181-frances sees , as [I]0-i also see , a something in [Victor]239-victor ’s temper — a kind of electrical ardour and power — which emits , now and then , ominous sparks ; [Hunsden]115-yorke calls it [his]239-victor spirit , and says it should not be curbed . [I]0-i call it the leaven of [the offending Adam]1856-the offending adam , and consider that it should be , if not whipped out of [him]2371-her son , at least soundly disciplined ; and that [he]2371-her son will be cheap of any amount of either bodily or mental suffering which will ground [him]2371-her son radically in the art of self - control . [Frances]181-frances gives this something in [[her]181-frances son]2371-her son ’s marked character no name ; but when it appears in the grinding of [his]2371-her son teeth , in the glittering of [his]2371-her son eye , in the fierce revolt of feeling against disappointment , mischance , sudden sorrow , or supposed injustice , [she]181-frances folds [him]2371-her son to [her]181-frances breast , or takes [him]2371-her son to walk with [her]181-frances alone in [the wood]1789-the wood ; then [she]181-frances reasons with [him]2371-her son like [any philosopher]1859-any philosopher , and to reason [Victor]239-victor is ever accessible ; then [she]181-frances looks at [him]2371-her son with eyes of love , and by love [Victor]239-victor can be infallibly subjugated ; but will reason or love be the weapons with which in future [the world]1872-the world will meet [his]239-victor violence ? Oh , no ! for that flash in [his]2371-her son black eye — for that cloud on [his]2371-her son bony brow — for that compression of [his]2371-her son statuesque lips , [the lad]616-the lad will some day get blows instead of blandishments — kicks instead of kisses ; then for the fit of mute fury which will sicken [his]2371-her son body and madden [his]2371-her son soul ; then for the ordeal of merited and salutary suffering , out of which [he]2371-her son will come ( [I]0-i trust ) [a wiser and a better man]1862-a wiser and a better man . [I]0-i see [him]239-victor now ; [he]239-victor stands by [Hunsden]115-yorke , who is seated on [the lawn under the beech]1863-the lawn under the beech ; [Hunsden]115-yorke ’s hand rests on [the boy]644-the boy ’s collar , and [he]115-yorke is instilling God knows what principles into [his]644-the boy ear . [Victor]239-victor looks well just now , for [he]239-victor listens with a sort of smiling interest ; [he]239-victor never looks so like [[his]239-victor mother]409-his mother as when [he]239-victor smiles — pity the sunshine breaks out so rarely ! [Victor]239-victor has a preference for [Hunsden]115-yorke , full as strong as [I]0-i deem desirable , being considerably more potent , decided , and indiscriminating , than any [I]0-i ever entertained for that personage [myself]0-i . [Frances]181-frances , too , regards it with a sort of unexpressed anxiety ; while [[her]181-frances son]2371-her son leans on [Hunsden]115-yorke ’s knee , or rests against [his]115-yorke shoulder , [she]181-frances roves with restless movement round , like a dove guarding its young from a hovering hawk ; [she]181-frances says [she]181-frances wishes [Hunsden]115-yorke had [[children]3500-children of [his]115-yorke own]1868-children of his own , for then [he]115-yorke would better know the danger of inciting [their]3500-children pride end indulging [their]3500-children foibles . [Frances]181-frances approaches [[my]0-i library]1848-my library window ; puts aside the honeysuckle which half covers it , and tells [me]0-i tea is ready ; seeing that [I]0-i continue busy [she]181-frances enters [the room]1922-the room , comes near [me]0-i quietly , and puts [her]181-frances hand on [my]0-i shoulder . “ Monsieur est trop applique . ”[181-frances] “ [I]181-frances shall soon have done . ”[181-frances] [She]181-frances draws a chair near , and sits down to wait till [I]0-i have finished ; [her]181-frances presence is as pleasant to [my]0-i mind as the perfume of the fresh hay and spicy flowers , as the glow of the westering sun , as the repose of the midsummer eve are to [my]0-i senses . But [Hunsden]115-yorke comes ; [I]0-i hear [his]115-yorke step , and there [he]115-yorke is , bending through the lattice , from which [he]115-yorke has thrust away the woodbine with unsparing hand , disturbing two bees and a butterfly . “ [Crimsworth]103-william ! [I]115-yorke say , [Crimsworth]103-william ! take that pen out of [his]115-yorke hand , [mistress]1657-mistress , and make [him]115-yorke lift up [his]115-yorke head . ”[115-yorke] “ Well , [Hunsden]115-yorke ? [I]115-yorke hear [you]115-yorke — ”[115-yorke] “ [I]115-yorke was at [X]7-x — — yesterday ! [[your]115-yorke brother]3262-your brother [Ned]99-mr. crimsworth is getting richer than [Croesus]272-croesus by railway speculations ; [they]3506-they call [him]99-mr. crimsworth in [the Piece Hall]90-the piece hall a stag of ten ; and [I]115-yorke have heard from [Brown]209-brown . [M.]228-m. vandenhuten and [Madame Vandenhuten]227-madame vandenhuten and [Jean Baptiste]226-jean talk of coming to see [you]115-yorke next month . [He]99-mr. crimsworth mentions [the Pelets]273-the pelets too ; [he]99-mr. crimsworth says [their]273-the pelets domestic harmony is not the finest in [the world]1872-the world , but in business [they]273-the pelets are doing ‘ on ne peut mieux , ’ which circumstance [he]99-mr. crimsworth concludes will be a sufficient consolation to both for any little crosses in the affections . Why do n’t [you]115-yorke invite [the Pelets]273-the pelets to — — shire , [Crimsworth]99-mr. crimsworth ? [I]115-yorke should so like to see [your]99-mr. crimsworth first flame , [Zoraide]153-zoraide . [Mistress]1657-mistress , do n’t be jealous , but [he]99-mr. crimsworth loved [that lady]3509-that lady to distraction ; [I]115-yorke know it for a fact . [Brown]209-brown says [she]3509-that lady weighs twelve stones now ; [you]99-mr. crimsworth see what [you]99-mr. crimsworth ’ve lost , [Mr. Professor]274-mr. professor . Now , [Monsieur]3510-monsieur and [Madame]663-madame , if [you]99-mr. crimsworth do n’t come to tea , [Victor]239-victor and [I]115-yorke will begin without [you]99-mr. crimsworth . ”[115-yorke] “ [Papa]275-papa , come ! ”[115-yorke]
